I.blurb: Bard's presence causes magical chimes to appear, which grant Bard experience, mana, and a burst of speed. Additionally, lesser spirits follow Bard and aid in his attacks - collecting chimes causes these meeps to gain power over the course of the game.

Q.name: Cosmic Binding

effects.description: Active: Bard fires a burst of spirit energy in the target direction, dealing magic damage to the first enemy struck and briefly  slowing them by 60%.

After Cosmic Binding hits an enemy, the energy continues behind them for 300 units. If the burst hits a wall or a second enemy, it  stuns both targets for the same duration, dealing the same magic damage to the second target as well.

Q.notes:
For the first target hit,  Spell shield will only block the damage and slow component from Cosmic Binding. However, the ability will still consider to have hit a target and will trigger the secondary portion of the effect. If a second target is hit, the first target will still be stunned.
 For the second target hit,  Spell shield will block the damage and prevent the stun from affecting them, but they will still be considered as being hit and will cause the first target to become stunned. PENDING FOR TEST Can the first target block the stun separately?

 Cosmic Binding will take into account player-created terrain such as  Cataclysm and  Crystallize.
 The stun is still applied even if the first or second target dies to the ability itself or before the projectile can bind them.
 Base Gates may only be used as a wall if they are not for Bard's team.
 Cosmic Binding does not grant vision of enemies hit, but a hit can be seen and heard to indicate that at least one enemy is there.
Q.blurb: Bard fires a missile which will slow the first enemy struck, and continue onward. If it strikes a wall, it will stun the initial target; if it strikes another enemy, it will stun them both.

W.name: Caretaker's Shrine

effects.description: Active: Bard conjures a shrine at the target location that builds up in power over 10 seconds, up to 3 shrines active at once, which remains until consumed when a champion steps on it.
If the champion was an ally or Bard himself, they are  healed for an amount based on the shrine's power and gain  50% bonus movement speed that decays over 1.5 seconds.

W.notes:
If Bard has 3 shrines on the map and creates a new that is immediately consumed, the oldest shrine will not be destroyed. This is because the Shrine is used as an actual targeted heal on himself or someone else, and not a permanent shrine, so the other 3 stay.
 Leveling up Caretaker's Shrine will affect the healing of existing shrines.
 Placing a new Caretaker's Shrine grants vision of a small area around it for ~1.8 seconds.
 The target indicator of Caretaker's Shrine shows the area in which it can be used as a targeted heal. After a shrine has been placed on the ground its activation area becomes smaller: allies or enemies have to step directly on the shrine to use it or destroy it.
W.blurb: Reveals a healing shrine which powers up over a short time, disappearing after healing the first ally that touches it.

E.name: Magical Journey

effects.description: Active: Bard opens a one-way magical corridor through a piece of terrain in the target direction for 10 seconds. Magical Journey will not cast unless it can open a corridor.
Both allies and enemies can  pass through the corridor by right-clicking on it or its exit, with allies and Bard travelling at 33.3% increased speed.

E.notes:
Magical Journey's tunnel has a max range of 2600 units (about two screens long)[3].
 Magical Journey will score assists for Bard if an ally that uses it scores a kill or assist shortly after.
 There is no limit to how many times a given instance of Magical Journey may be used.
 Units using Magical Journey are targetable whilst en route.
 Allies are granted vision of enemies for the duration they use Magical Journey.
 Magical Journey cannot interact with player-created terrain due to its short lifespan.[4]
 Magical Journey cannot be used to exit the map.
 Any abilities that continue during normal movement, such as point blank area of effects and various forms of stealth, will continue during the travel within Magical Journey.
 Unlike  Dark Passage, Magical Journey can still be utilized if a champion is  silenced.
 Since it's considered a dash, champions travelling are affected by effects that interact with dashes (i.e  Sudden Impact,  Steadfast Presence).
E.blurb: Bard opens a portal in nearby terrain. Allies and enemies alike can take a one-way trip through that terrain by moving into the portal.

R.name: Tempered Fate

effects.description: Active: Bard sends magical energy arcing to the target location, putting all units and structures in the target area into  stasis for 2.5 seconds upon impact.
Despite normally being immune to crowd control,  epic monsters and  turrets (excluding the  Nexus Obelisk) also enter  stasis.

R.notes:
All  champions (including allies) during the  stasis are prohibited from activating  cleansing effects for its duration.
  Quicksilver Sash (or  Mercurial Scimitar) is put on cooldown during the stasis and instantly becomes available once it has ended.

 Tempered Fate triggers in-combat effects such as drawing turret aggro, applying  Elixir of Sorcery and  Sudden Impact.
  Elixir of Sorcery deals damage before the target is put into stasis.

 Tempered Fate has no effect on  untargetable turrets (those protected by another tower or the inhibitors), untargetable units, or enemy champions that are  unstoppable or immune to disables (such as  Olaf under the effects of  Ragnarok or a  Black Shielded enemy).
 If Bard dies while Tempered Fate is still casting, it will go on  cooldown but will have no effect.
 Tempered Fate cannot affect the enemy team's Nexus and inhibitors. This behavior is intended, as accidentally putting it into  stasis would be extremely punishing for Bard's team.
 Tempered Fate has a cast time of ~0.55 seconds. It's travel time varies between ~0.65 at point blank and ~1.8 at max range, resulting in an overall delay of ~1.2-2.4 seconds depending on distance covered.
 This ability can only be blocked by an enemy's  spell shield. Allies will be put in  stasis no matter what they do.
R.blurb: Bard sends spirit energy arcing to a location, putting all champions, minions, monsters, and turrets hit into stasis for a brief time.

I.name: Mana Barrier

effects.description: Innate: Periodically, when Blitzcrank receives damage that would bring him below  30% maximum health, he generates a  shield equal to  30% of his maximum mana that lasts for up to 10 seconds.

I.notes:
The official tooltip notes 20% Health as the threshold of the effect, but it actually triggers at 30% Health.
 Mana Barrier's  cooldown starts as soon as it triggers.
 The shield only activates if he's lower than or equal to 30% of his maximum health. If he's above it, and the damage received would bring him below it, he will first take a part of the damage to reach 30% of his maximum health, and then trigger the shield to block the remaining part.
 Mana Barrier will trigger after  Nullifying Orb and  Phantom Dancer if Blitzcrank's health is above 30% health, and they will trigger simultaneously when Blitzcrank takes damage while below 30% health.
 Mana Barrier will trigger simultaneously with  Hexdrinker or  Maw of Malmortius if Blitzcrank's health is above 30% health, and trigger before them when Blitzcrank takes damage while below 30% health.
I.blurb: When Blitzcrank's life is brought below 20% health, he activates Mana Barrier. This creates a mana shield equal to 30% of his mana for 10 seconds. Mana Barrier can only occur once every 90 seconds.

Q.name: Rocket Grab

effects.description: Active: Blitzcrank fires his right hand in the target direction, dealing  magic damage while  pulling the first enemy hit to him,  stunning them for 0.5 seconds.

Q.notes:
Blitzcrank is  entangled while  Rocket Grab is in flight.
 Blitzcrank will attempt to basic attack the target once the target has been pulled to him. If Rocket Grab is used beyond Blitzcrank's basic attack range, the basic attack will not grant any stack of  Electrocute,  Conqueror,  Phase Rush, or  Spellthief's Edge.
 If Blitzcrank himself moves by any means during the grab, the target will not be pulled towards his new location.
 However if Blitzcrank is displaced by other means (i.e  Fate's Call) the target will keep on following him.
Q.blurb: Blitzcrank fires his right hand to grab an opponent on its path, dealing damage and dragging it back to him.

W.name: Overdrive

effects.description: Active: Blitzcrank puts himself into overdrive, gaining  bonus attack speed for 5 seconds and  bonus movement speed that decays to 10% after 2.5 seconds.
When Overdrive ends, Blitzcrank is  slowed by 30% for 1.5 seconds.

W.notes: The self-slow is affected by Slow resist and  Tenacity.
W.blurb: Blitzcrank super charges himself to get dramatically increased Movement and Attack Speed. He is temporarily slowed after the effect ends.

E.name: Power Fist

effects.description: Active: Blitzcrank's next basic attack within 5 seconds deals 100% AD  bonus physical damage and  knocks up his target for 1 second.
Power Fist resets Blitzcrank's basic attack timer.

E.notes:
Critical strikes will not interact with Power Fist's bonus damage.
 Power Fist is not interrupted by most effects that would normally prevent basic attacks from hitting their target.
 The  knockup is applied even if the attack is  dodged or if it  misses. The attack is negated by  blocking effects.
 The attack will complete even if the target becomes  untargetable during the windup.
E.blurb: Blitzcrank charges up his fist to make his next attack deal double damage and pop his target up in the air.

R.name: Static Field

effects.description: Passive: While Static Field is available, Blitzcrank's basic attacks apply a mark that stacks up to 3 times. After every 1 second, 1 mark is consumed to deal magic damage.
Active: Blitzcrank detonates his static field, destroying damage-mitigating shields of nearby enemies before dealing magic damage and  silencing them for 0.5 seconds.

R.notes: The mark is  single target, while the detonation is area of effect.
R.blurb: Passively causes lightning bolts to damage a nearby enemy. Additionally, Blitzcrank can activate this ability to damage nearby enemies and silence them for 0.5 seconds, but doing so removes the passive lightning until Static Field becomes available again.

I.name: Blaze

effects.description: Innate: Brand's abilities set his targets  ablaze for 4 seconds, damaging them for [ 3% of their maximum health over 3.25 seconds ][ 1% of their maximum health every 1.083 seconds ] as  magic damage. Abilities used on an ablazed target are empowered and apply other stacks of blaze while also refreshing the duration of the previous ones. A target can have up to 3 blaze stacks at the same time and the damage per tick against monsters is capped at 80.
Killing an enemy that is ablazed restores  6 − 18 (based on level) mana.

After reaching 3 stacks on large monsters and enemy champions, an area is marked around them which explodes after 2 seconds, consuming all the stacks. All enemies struck are dealt 12% − 16% (based on level)[ (+ 1.5% per 100 AP) ][ (+ 1% per 66 AP) ] of their maximum health as magic damage and are applied a stack of blaze. The explosion will still trigger if the target dies to the third ability or during the delay.
Brand cannot stack Blaze more than once on enemies who have exploded in the past 4 seconds.

I.notes:
The explosion is not considered a tether effect and will not affect  untargetable targets, even if the explosion originated from them.
 Each stack deals the damage individually and will always consider the time it was applied for deciding when the ticks will be applied, even when the duration refreshes.
 At sub-optimal applied times, 2 stacks will do a minimum of 6% maximum health damage over 4 seconds, but will deal 7% maximum health at optimal applied times.
 Against small-medium units 3 stacks will do a minimum of 9% maximum health at sub-optimal times, but 11% maximum health at optimal times. If these stacks are further refreshed at optimal times they can do up to 12% maximum health over 4 seconds.

 The burn is  persistent damage and the explosion is  area damage.
I.blurb: Brand's spells light his targets ablaze, dealing 4% of their maximum Health in magic damage over 4 seconds, stacking up to 3 times. If Brand kills an enemy while it is ablaze he regains mana. When Blaze reaches max stacks on a Champion or monster, it becomes unstable. It detonates in 2 seconds, applying spell effects and dealing massive damage in an area around the victim.

Q.name: Sear

effects.description: Active: Brand launches a fireball in the target direction that deals magic damage to the first enemy it hits.
Blaze: The target is also  stunned for 1.5 seconds.

Q.notes: With about 0.53 / 0.5 / 0.46 / 0.42 / 0.38% cooldown reduction, it is possible to apply the stun without having to use other abilities. The cooldown of Sear will be lower than the duration of the applied  Blaze.
Q.blurb: Brand launches a ball of fire forward that deals magic damage. If the target is ablaze, Sear will stun the target for 1.5 seconds.

W.name: Pillar of Flame

effects.description: Active: After a 0.625-second delay, Brand erupts the target area in flames, dealing magic damage to enemies within.
Blaze: Pillar of Flame deals 25% bonus damage.

W.notes: No additional details.
W.blurb: After a short delay, Brand creates a Pillar of Flame at a target area, dealing magic damage to enemy units within the area. Units that are ablaze take an additional 25% damage.

E.name: Conflagration

effects.description: Active: Brand sets the target enemy aflame, dealing magic damage.
Blaze: Conflagration also spreads to enemies around the target.

E.notes:
Conflagration's can spread to stealthed enemies or those hidden in fog of war and/or in brush but does not grant  sight.
 Applies  spell damage to the primary target and  area damage to nearby enemies.
E.blurb: Brand conjures a powerful blast at his target, dealing magic damage to them. If the target is ablaze, Conflagration spreads to nearby enemies.

R.name: Pyroclasm

effects.description: Active: Brand launches a fireball at the target enemy that bounces between nearby enemies up to four times, dealing magic damage each time.

If Pyroclasm's current target becomes invalid, it selects a new enemy at no cost to its remaining bounces. If its initial target becomes invalid and there are no other valid targets, Pyroclasm refunds its cost and resets its  cooldown.
Pyroclasm prioritizes getting 3  Blaze stacks on an enemy.
Blaze: Pyroclasm briefly  slows enemies hit.

R.notes:
If the initial cast target uses  spell shield, Pyroclasm will not bounce. If the bounce is spell shielded it will not deal any damage, but it will keep on bouncing.
 Pyroclasm can bounce to  stealthed and hidden from view enemies but does not grant  sight of them.
 There is a recurring bug with bouncing abilities where if the target is  dashing when the missile strikes them, it will repeatedly bounce back to them inflicting multiple ticks of damage near-instantly.
R.blurb: Brand unleashes a devastating torrent of fire, dealing magic damage each time it bounces, up to 5 bounces. Bounces prioritize stacking Blaze to max on Champions. If a target is ablaze, Pyroclasm will briefly slow them.

I.name: Concussive Blows

effects.description: Innate: Braum's basic attacks and  Winter's Bite each apply Concussive Blows to his target for 4 seconds, stacking up to 4 times. Once the first stack has been applied, any allied champion's basic attack on the target generates an additional stack.
At 4 stacks, Concussive Blows is consumed to  stun the target for 1.25 − 1.75 (based on level) seconds and deal 26 − 196 (based on level) magic damage.

This effect cannot occur on the same target more than once every few seconds, but during this immunity period, affected targets instead take[ 20% of the trigger damage ][ 5.2 − 39.2 (based on level) ] as bonus magic damage from Braum's basic attacks and  Winter's Bite.

I.blurb: Braum adds stacks of Concussive Blows to enemies with basic attacks or Winter's Bite. He and his allies continue to add stacks with basic attacks, at 4 stacks their target will be stunned.

Q.name: Winter's Bite

effects.description: Active: Braum propels ice from his shield in the target direction, dealing magic damage to the first enemy hit and  slowing them by 70% decaying over 2 seconds.

Q.notes: No additional details.
Q.blurb: Braum propels freezing ice from his shield, slowing and dealing magic damage. Applies a stack of Concussive Blows.

W.name: Stand Behind Me

effects.description: Active: Braum  dashes to the target ally, positioning himself between them and the closest enemy champion, gaining  bonus armor and  bonus magic resistance for 3 seconds. If his target is a  champion, they also receive some bonus resistances.

W.notes:
If Braum casts Stand Behind Me on himself, it has no cast time and does not interrupt Braum's previous orders.
 Stand Behind Me can also be used on allied minions and pets, but cannot be used on wards.
W.blurb: Braum leaps to a target allied champion or minion. On arrival, Braum and the ally gain Armor and Magic Resist for a few seconds.

E.name: Unbreakable

effects.description: Active: Braum raises his shield in the target direction, creating a barrier that intercepts incoming non-turret enemy  projectiles and reduces the damage he takes through the shield. The first instance of damage blocked by his shield is negated completely.
While his shield is raised, Braum also gains  10% bonus movement speed and is  ghosted.

E.notes:
Definitions
 Incoming: Damage sources coming from somewhere facing the shield. Those coming from behind will not be affected.
 Projectiles: Sped up entities not classified as a unit (champions, minions, monsters, etc.)
 Intercepting: A projectile hits Braum because he stands in front of the intended target. In addition to being redirected, an intercepted projectile is also destroyed after hitting Braum (although this is only applicable to pass-through projectiles)

 Moving units are not intercepted under any circumstance, including  dashes. Champion-summoned units ( Command: Attack,  Sapling Toss, etc.) are not classified as units until they hit the ground and thus will interact with Unbreakable while en route.
 Projectiles whose effects trigger on collision will still trigger - dealing damage, applying debuffs, creating slowing fields and marking the target as 'hit' for the purposes of  Zenith Blade's dash or  Infected Cleaver's health refund.
 Abilities that deal area of effect damage on-collision will only damage Braum.
 If  Spinning Axe hits Braum, regardless if it's the first hit on the damage reduction or not, it will always bounce back and not be destroyed. This happens even if Braum intercepts the attack for an ally though the axe will bounce back from Braum and not the intended target.
 Projectile-based ground-targeted abilities that only occur upon successfully hitting the ground ( Miasma,  Aqua Prison, etc.) will apply their full effects to Braum but will be destroyed without affecting any other ally.
 Projectiles that cannot hit Braum or his allies (such as an enemy  Prismatic Barrier) will not be intercepted.[2]
  Soraka's  Starcall's Rejuvenation projectile is however blocked.

 The damage reduction will affect any source of damage whose origin is in front of the shield. This includes...
 All intercepted projectiles.
 Melee and non-projectile-based ranged attacks.
 Instantaneous skillshots ( Final Spark,  Lifeform Disintegration Ray, etc.)
 Instantaneously-placed ground-targeted abilities ( Lay Waste,  Rupture, etc.) relative to the ability's center and not the caster's
 Point-blank areas-of-effect ( Tantrum,  Time Bomb not targeted at Braum, etc.)

 Instantaneous targeted abilities ( Transfusion,  Time Bomb targeted at Braum, etc.) and  AoE DoT ( Tormented Shadow,  Poison Trail) do not interact with Unbreakable.
 The damage reduction only benefits Braum.
 If  Audacious Charge would path  Xin Zhao through Unbreakable, only Braum will take reduced damage.

  Damage over time is calculated per tick but be aware the full damage reduction will only apply to a single tick.
 If the damage mitigated by Unbreakable exceeds a minimum threshold it is represented with floating text similar to the damage mitigated by shields ('-X')
 This floating text is always shown for the single fully-reduced damage source.

 For the purposes of abilities like  Backstab Braum's facing direction is the direction he's moving in (not the direction his face or the shield are looking in)
 This is a documented game engine limitation.

 If Braum is protected by a  spell shield, both it and the one-time-use full damage reduction can be consumed by a single blockable spell.
 The one-time-use full damage reduction will not be consumed if the damage source is nothing but  true damage.

 Unbreakable will grant assist credit if the enemy who's projectile is blocked from is killed within 10 seconds.
E.blurb: Braum raises his shield in a direction for several seconds, intercepting all projectiles causing them to hit him and be destroyed. He negates the damage of the first attack completely and reduces the damage of all subsequent attacks from this direction.

R.name: Glacial Fissure

effects.description: Active: Braum leaps into the air and slams his shield into the ground, creating a fissure in the target direction that deals magic damage to enemies as well as those around him.
The first target hit is  knocked up for at least 0.3 seconds, increased if they are further away from Braum. All other enemies hit are  knocked up for 0.3 seconds.
A field of ice then remains at the fissure's location for 4 seconds,  slowing enemies within, persisting for 0.25 seconds.

R.notes: No additional details.
R.blurb: Braum slams the ground, knocking up enemies nearby and in a line in front of him. A fissure is left along the line that slows enemies.

I.name: Headshot

effects.description: Innate: Caitlyn's basic attacks generate a stack of Headshot on-attack, doubled when attacking from  brush. At 6 stacks, or 5 while in brush, Caitlyn's next basic attack deals (50 / 75 / 100% (based on level) + (125% +  15.625%) critical strike chance) AD  bonus physical damage, increased to (100% + (125% +  15.625%) critical strike chance) AD against non-champions.
Caitlyn may fire other empowered basic attacks until Headshot hits a target, which consumes all stacks.
Enemies  rooted by  Yordle Snap Trap or  slowed by  90 Caliber Net can grant an additional headshot at  1300 range for 1.8 seconds.

I.notes:
The bonus range from  Rapid Firecannon will not have any effect during  trap and  net extended Headshot attacks.
 As with most on-hit physical damage, the bonus damage from Headshot will apply  life steal.
 Attacking wards will still generate stacks towards Headshot but empowered attack will not be consumed.
 The basic attack triggering Headshot can  critically strike, but Headshot's damage remains unchanged if it does.
 Ability-granted Headshots are abilities that apply on-hit effects. They will not interact with effects that apply on-attack (including stacking Headshot).
  Energized, which normally stacks on-attack, has been special cased to stack on-hit for these empowered attacks.
I.blurb: Every few basic attacks, or against a target she has trapped or netted, Caitlyn will fire a headshot dealing bonus damage that scales with her critical strike chance. On trapped or netted targets, Caitlyn's Headshot attack range is doubled.

Q.name: Piltover Peacemaker

effects.description: Active: Caitlyn fires a projectile in the target direction that deals physical damage to the first enemy it passes through, after which it expands in width but deals only 60% damage to all enemies it passes thereafter.
Enemies  revealed by  Yordle Snap Trap always take full damage from Piltover Peacemaker.

Q.notes: Enemies hit while protected by a  spell shield will still be considered a target for calculating damage for subsequent hits.
Q.blurb: Caitlyn revs up her rifle for 1 second to unleash a penetrating shot that deals physical damage (deals less damage to subsequent targets).

W.name: Yordle Snap Trap

effects.description: Passive: Caitlyn periodically stocks a Yordle Snap Trap charge, up to a maximum amount.

Active: Caitlyn sets a visible  untargetable trap at the target location which briefly grants  sight of the area and arms after 1 second, lasting for a duration. After the maximum amount of traps is laid down, deploying another immediately destroys the oldest one.

The next enemy champion that springs the trap is  rooted for 1.5 seconds,  revealed for 3 seconds, takes additional damage from  Headshot, and becomes immune to Yordle Snap Traps for 2 seconds, increased by 1 second for each Yordle Snap Trap they're consecutively affected.

W.blurb: Caitlyn sets a trap to find sneaky yordles. When sprung, the trap reveals and immobilizes the enemy champion for 1.5 seconds.

E.name: 90 Caliber Net

effects.description: Active: Caitlyn fires a net and  recoils 400 units in the opposite direction, dealing  magic damage to the first enemy hit and  slowing them by 50% for 1 second.

E.notes:
The knockback can be used to pass through terrain.
 Unlike similar abilities ( Rocket Jump,  Arcane Shift, etc.) 90 Caliber Net has a short channel (rather than a cast time) making it interruptable.
E.blurb: Caitlyn fires a heavy net to slow her target. The recoil knocks Caitlyn back.

R.name: Ace in the Hole

effects.description: Active: After a brief delay, Caitlyn locks onto a target enemy champion and channels for 1 second, gaining  true sight of the target and  revealing herself to the enemies.
Once Caitlyn completes the channel, she fires a homing projectile toward the target that deals physical damage to the first enemy champion it hits.
If the target dies during the channel the ability is cancelled and put on a 5-second cooldown.

R.notes:
The ability will still consume mana if it's cancelled and put on reduced cooldown.
 If Caitlyn loses  sight of her target before she locks on, the ability cancels but does not go on cooldown or consume any mana.
 If the target dies after the bullet has been fired, the shot will continue towards their corpse and may still hit other enemy champions.
R.blurb: Caitlyn takes time to line up the perfect shot, dealing massive damage to a single target at a huge range. Enemy champions can intercept the bullet for their ally.

I.name: Adaptive Defenses

effects.description: Innate: Periodically, Camille's next basic attack against enemy champions is enhanced to  shield her for 20% of her maximum health for 2 seconds from either exclusively  physical damage or  magic damage, based on which type would mitigate the most damage from her target.

I.notes:
The shield-typing is determined based on the total damage the target has dealt to champions that game (as a percentage) versus Camille's current armor and magic resistance.
 For example, with little bonus resistances Camille would likely gain the most obvious shield-typing - i.e. physical versus marksmen and magical versus mages. However, with a full-armor build - she may gain a magic damage shield versus a target like  Kog'Maw, as his physical threat is already mitigated by the armor.

 What shield she will gain is displayed as an icon beneath an enemy's health bar: Orange for Physical or Blue for Magical.
I.blurb: Basic attacks on champions grant a shield equal to 20% of Camille's maximum health against their damage type (Physical or Magic) for 1.5-2.5 seconds. This effect has a 20-10 second cooldown.

Q.name: Precision Protocol

effects.description: First cast - Active: Camille's next basic attack has  50 bonus range, deals bonus physical damage and grants  bonus movement speed for 1 second.
Precision Protocol can then be recast within the next 3.5 seconds at no extra cost.
Second cast - Active: If recast at least 1.5 seconds after the first attack, Precision Protocol's damage is doubled and 40% − 100% (based on level) of the total damage is dealt as  true damage.
Both casts of Precision Protocol reset Camille's basic attack timer. The attacks' animations can be cancelled by casting other abilities, but the attacks will still land.

Q.notes:
Both enhanced attacks cannot  critically strike.
  On-hit effects do not interact with the true damage conversion, however life steal does.

 The basic attacks are  unstoppable, meaning no effect can interrupt them other than death, Camille's or the target's. Using  Flash or going into  stasis (i.e  Zhonya's Hourglass,  Guardian Angel) will cancel the animation but the attack will still land.
Q.blurb: Camille's next attack deals bonus damage and grants bonus movement speed. This spell can be recast for a short period of time, doing significantly increased bonus damage if Camille delays a period of time between the two attacks.

Q.name: Precision Protocol

effects.description: First cast - Active: Camille's next basic attack has  50 bonus range, deals bonus physical damage and grants  bonus movement speed for 1 second.
Precision Protocol can then be recast within the next 3.5 seconds at no extra cost.
Second cast - Active: If recast at least 1.5 seconds after the first attack, Precision Protocol's damage is doubled and 40% − 100% (based on level) of the total damage is dealt as  true damage.
Both casts of Precision Protocol reset Camille's basic attack timer. The attacks' animations can be cancelled by casting other abilities, but the attacks will still land.

Q.notes:

Q.blurb: Camille's next attack deals bonus damage and grants bonus movement speed. This spell can be recast for a short period of time, doing significantly increased bonus damage if Camille delays a period of time between the two attacks.

Precision Protocol can then be recast within the next 3.5 seconds at no extra cost.
Second cast - Active: If recast at least 1.5 seconds after the first attack, Precision Protocol's damage is doubled and 40% − 100% (based on level) of the total damage is dealt as  true damage.
Both casts of Precision Protocol reset Camille's basic attack timer. The attacks' animations can be cancelled by casting other abilities, but the attacks will still land.

Q.notes:
Both enhanced attacks cannot  critically strike.
  On-hit effects do not interact with the true damage conversion, however life steal does.

 The basic attacks are  unstoppable, meaning no effect can interrupt them other than death, Camille's or the target's. Using  Flash or going into  stasis (i.e  Zhonya's Hourglass,  Guardian Angel) will cancel the animation but the attack will still land.
Q.blurb: Camille's next attack deals bonus damage and grants bonus movement speed. This spell can be recast for a short period of time, doing significantly increased bonus damage if Camille delays a period of time between the two attacks.

W.name: Tactical Sweep

effects.description: Active: After a 1.1 second delay, Camille sweeps her leg to deal physical damage to all enemies in a cone in the target direction,  disarming herself for the duration.

Enemies hit by the outer half of the cone take bonus physical damage and are  slowed by 80% that decays over 2 seconds, capped at 300 damage against  monsters. Camille is  healed for the bonus damage dealt against enemy  champions.
Non-epic monsters take 50% damage from Tactical Sweep.
Other abilities can be cast during the animation without cancelling it.

W.notes:
Camille can move during the delay, but the hitbox and Camille's model are fixed to the initial target direction.
 Camille's facing-direction, for effects such as  Petrifying Gaze, is the direction she is moving, and not the direction the model is facing.

 The 50% damage reduction against non-epic monsters applies after the cap. Because of this the actual cap against non-epic monsters is 150 damage.
 Using  Tiamat will cancel the animation, but the sweep will still strike and Camille will still be unable to basic attack.
W.blurb: Camille blasts in a cone after a delay, dealing damage. Enemies in the outer half are slowed and take extra damage, while also healing Camille.

E.name: Hookshot

effects.description: Active: Camille fires a grapple toward the target location. If the grapple collides with terrain, Camille will  dash toward and bind to the terrain for 0.75 seconds. While bound, she gains the ability to cast  Wall Dive.
Other abilities can be cast during the ability. Casting  The Hextech Ultimatum will cancel the grapple.

E.notes: Hookshot can be cast while  rooted but not while  grounded.
E.blurb: Camille pulls herself to a wall, leaping off and knocking up enemies upon landing.

E.name: Wall Dive

effects.description: Active: Camille  dashes in the target direction, dealing physical damage to enemies near the landing location. The range is doubled towards enemy  champions.
She prematurely stops upon colliding with an enemy champion,  knocking back and  stunning them and all nearby enemy champions for 0.75 seconds, while also gaining  bonus attack speed for 5 seconds.
Other abilities besides  The Hextech Ultimatum can be cast while grappled or during the dash.

E.notes:
Despite what one might assume from a wall-jumping ability, Wall Dive can be used to go through terrain (including the terrain she is bound to).
  Summoner spells besides  Flash cannot be cast.
 Wall Dive is disabled while  grounded or  rooted but Camille is allowed to move if grounded while attached to a wall. She may still dash away from her current location once the grounding finishes.
 Camille will gain a range indicator for each valid champion to dash to.
E.blurb: Camille pulls herself to a wall, leaping off and knocking up enemies upon landing.

R.name: The Hextech Ultimatum

effects.description: Active: Camille becomes  untargetable and  leaps  unstoppably towards the target  enemy champion.
When she lands, she creates a hexagonal zone around the target's current location for a duration,  interrupting them and  knocking away all other nearby enemies on impact.
The target cannot escape the zone through any means. While within the zone, Camille's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage.
The Hextech Ultimatum ends automatically within 1 second if Camille leaves the area or dies.

R.notes:
Camille will attempt to basic attack the target.
 The trapped victim is  grounded from casting  Flash until Hextech Ultimatum ends.
 The ability will be cancelled and go on cooldown if the target dies or becomes untargetable during the cast time.
 Knockaway speed is 1000.
 The boundaries are not considered terrain ( exception), and enemies that try to move out of the area will be displaced back inside.
 Abilities such as  Comet of Legend and  Keeper's Verdict will cap their effect range to the boundary. Targets will stop at the boundary even after it expired.
  Ekko's  Chronobreak will still deal damage at the hologram's location.
  Tahm Kench's  Devour can carry Camille's target outside of the area, but they will be displaced back inside once  Regurgitated. 
 An active  Assault and Battery on a target outside the perimeter will cause  Vi to continue her charge until The Hextech Ultimatum ends. She can knockback and damage secondary targets multiple times.
  Shadows placed outside of the hexagonal zone by  Zed can be swapped with but he will only  blink to the nearest position towards his  Shadow while still being unable to escape in The Hextech Ultimatum.
R.blurb: Camille dashes to target champion, anchoring them to the area. She also deals bonus magic damage to the target with her basic attacks.

I.name: Serpentine Grace

effects.description: Innate: Cassiopeia cannot purchase boots and instead gains 4 − 72 (based on level)  base movement speed, for a total of 332 − 400 (based on level)  movement speed.

I.notes:
The movement speed from Serpentine Grace is worth  48 per level, up to a maximum of  864 at level 18.
 As  Predator and  Magical Footwear require boots, they will be replaced with  Electrocute and  Perfect Timing, respectively.
I.blurb: Cassiopeia gains Movement Speed per level, but she cannot purchase Boots items.

Q.name: Noxious Blast

effects.description: Active: After a 0.4-second delay, Cassiopeia blasts the target area with  Noxious Poison, dealing  magic damage every second for 3 seconds to all enemies it hits.
Cassiopeia gains  bonus movement speed that decays over 3 seconds if Noxious Blast hits an enemy  champion.

Q.notes: Noxious Blast uses quick casting by default.
Q.blurb: Cassiopeia blasts an area with Poison after a brief delay, granting her increased Movement Speed if she hits an enemy champion.

W.name: Miasma

effects.description: Active: Cassiopeia spits forth eight bolts of venom in an arc, leaving toxic clouds of  Debilitating Poison where they hit the ground for 5 seconds.
Debilitating Poison deals magic damage to enemies standing upon it every second, also  grounding them and applying a  slow that decays over the area's duration.

W.blurb: Cassiopeia releases several clouds of poison, slowing, grounding, and lightly damaging enemies that pass through them. Grounded enemies cannot use Movement abilities.

E.name: Twin Fang

effects.description: Active: Cassiopeia launches her fangs at the target enemy, dealing 52 − 120 (based on level) (+ 10% AP) magic damage. If Twin Fang kills its target, or the target is killed mid-flight, its  mana cost is refunded.
If the target is  poisoned, Twin Fang deals bonus magic damage and  heals Cassiopeia. The heal is only 25% as effective against minions and small monsters.

E.notes:
Twin Fang's bonus damage and healing will also trigger on the following  poisons.
  Poison Trail
  Noxious Trap
  Toxic Shot
  Deadly Venom
E.blurb: Cassiopeia lets loose an attack that deals increased damage to Poisoned targets and heals her for a percentage of the damage dealt. If the target dies from this attack, Cassiopeia regains Mana.

R.name: Petrifying Gaze

effects.description: Active: After a brief delay, Cassiopeia blasts enemies in a cone in the target direction, dealing magic damage to all enemies hit.
Enemies facing Cassiopeia are  stunned for 2 seconds upon being hit by Petrifying Gaze, and all other affected enemies are instead  slowed by 40% for the same duration.

R.notes:
Petrifying Gaze's target direction will change if Cassiopeia's facing direction changes during the cast time (i.e. through  knockbacks).
 The facing direction of champions whose abilities/animations cause them to lock their facing or spin is always the direction they are moving in. For abilities that cause the champion to spin in place (e.g.  Death Lotus) it will factor the direction they were facing on cast.
  Lucian's  The Culling is an exception and his facing direction is actually considered to be the direction he is facing.
R.blurb: Cassiopeia releases a swirl of magical energy from her eyes, stunning any enemies in front of her that are facing her and slowing any others with their back turned.

I.name: Carnivore

effects.description: Innate: Whenever Cho'Gath kills an enemy or destroys an enemy structure, he restores  20 − 71 (based on level) health and  3.5 − 7.75 (based on level) mana.

I.notes: No additional details.
I.blurb: Whenever Cho'Gath kills a unit, he recovers Health and Mana. The values restored increase with Cho'Gath's level.

Q.name: Rupture

effects.description: Active: Cho'Gath gains  sight of the target area which, after a 0.625 seconds delay, he ruptures dealing  magic damage and  knocking up enemies hit for 1 second,  slowing them by 60% for 1.5 seconds afterwards.

Q.notes: The animation is visible in brush and in fog of war.
Q.blurb: Ruptures the ground at target location, popping enemy units into the air, dealing damage and slowing them.

W.name: Feral Scream

effects.description: Active: Cho'Gath roars in the target direction, dealing magic damage to enemies in a cone and  silencing them for a duration.

W.notes: No additional details.
W.blurb: Cho'Gath unleashes a terrible scream at enemies in a cone, dealing magic damage and Silencing enemies for a few seconds.

E.name: Vorpal Spikes

effects.description: Active: Cho'Gath's next 3 basic attacks within 6 seconds have  50 bonus range and launch a volley of spikes in a line, dealing magic damage and applying a decaying  slow over the next 1.5 seconds to enemies hit.

units: % (+ 0.5% per Feast stack) of target's maximum health

effects.description: Vorpal Spikes resets Cho'Gath's basic attack timer.

E.notes:
Rylai's Crystal Scepter and  Liandry's Torment's passives apply to every target hit by the spikes.
 Cho'Gath's size factors into how wide of a hitbox Vorpal Spikes has. External size modifiers ( Wild Growth) contribute.
E.blurb: Cho'Gath's attacks release deadly spikes, dealing damage and slowing all enemy units in front of him.

R.name: Feast

effects.description: Active: Cho'Gath attempts to eat the target enemy, dealing  true damage. Against non-champions, the base damage is increased to 1000.
If Feast kills its target, Cho'Gath gains a Feast stack. Only 6 stacks can be gained from non-epic monsters or minions.

Each stack grants  bonus health, which can stack up to 255 times, as well as  bonus attack range and increased size that stack up to 17 / 13 / 10 (based on Rank) times, for a maximum  75 bonus attack range.

R.notes:
The health and attack range bonuses from collected stacks will increase as Cho'Gath ranks up the ability.
 If an enemy's health is low enough that they will die from Feast a glowing red ring appears underneath them.
 Nineteen stacks of max rank Feast with no other HP items (3040 bonus hp) is the point when  Cinderhulk will give more health than  Warmog's Armor or any other item.
 Each stack of Feast increases the damage by 8 / 12 / 16.
 If Cho'Gath loses sight of his target during the cast time, Feast will not go on cooldown. It will go on cooldown if the target dies during the cast time.
R.blurb: Devours an enemy unit, dealing a high amount of true damage. If the target is killed, Cho'Gath grows, gaining maximum Health.

I.name: Hextech Munitions

effects.description: Innate - Hextech Shrapnel Shells: Corki's basic attacks are permanently modified to deal 20% AD  physical damage and 80% AD  magic damage.

Innate - The Package: After 8 minutes elapse,  The Package is delivered to both corners of Corki's fountain, which he can pick up after channeling for 1 second. Doing so grants him one cast of  Special Delivery which must be cast before  Valkyrie within the next 60 seconds, as well as  40% bonus movement speed out of combat prior to the ability being cast, after which  The Package goes on  cooldown before being delivered again.

I.notes:
All players are alerted by Corki emitting a global siren/alarm sound upon picking up The Package.
 Triggering attacks will apply on-hit effects normally.
 Spellblade damage is converted to magic damage. This effect will not be consumed if Hextech Munitions' magic damage is enough to kill the target.
 The damage from  Runaan's Hurricane's Wind's Fury is not affected by Hextech Munitions.
 Both components apply  life steal even though on-hit magic damage does not usually interact with it.
  Critical strikes amplify both components' damage.
I.blurb: Corki's basic attack deals a percentage of their damage as magic instead of physical. Every once in a while, The Package arrives in Corki's base to be picked up, temporarily granting him out of combat Movement Speed and upgrading Valkyrie into Special Delivery.

I.name: Hextech Munitions

effects.description: Innate - Hextech Shrapnel Shells: Corki's basic attacks are permanently modified to deal 20% AD  physical damage and 80% AD  magic damage.

Innate - The Package: After 8 minutes elapse,  The Package is delivered to both corners of Corki's fountain, which he can pick up after channeling for 1 second. Doing so grants him one cast of  Special Delivery which must be cast before  Valkyrie within the next 60 seconds, as well as  40% bonus movement speed out of combat prior to the ability being cast, after which  The Package goes on  cooldown before being delivered again.

I.notes:
All players are alerted by Corki emitting a global siren/alarm sound upon picking up The Package.
 Triggering attacks will apply on-hit effects normally.
 Spellblade damage is converted to magic damage. This effect will not be consumed if Hextech Munitions' magic damage is enough to kill the target.
 The damage from  Runaan's Hurricane's Wind's Fury is not affected by Hextech Munitions.
 Both components apply  life steal even though on-hit magic damage does not usually interact with it.
  Critical strikes amplify both components' damage.
I.blurb: Corki's basic attack deals a percentage of their damage as magic instead of physical. Every once in a while, The Package arrives in Corki's base to be picked up, temporarily granting him out of combat Movement Speed and upgrading Valkyrie into Special Delivery.

Q.name: Phosphorus Bomb

effects.description: Active: Corki launches a bomb at the target area, dealing magic damage to enemies hit.
The bomb  reveals the area as it travels and for 6 seconds afterwards, as well as all affected enemies.

Q.notes: No additional details.
Q.blurb: Corki fires a flash bomb at a target location, dealing magic damage to enemies in the area. This attack additionally reveals units in the area for a duration.

W.name: Valkyrie

effects.description: Active: Corki  dashes to the target location, dropping bombs that leave up to 3 blazing patches along his path, depending on the distance traveled, lasting for 2 seconds.
These patches deal magic damage every 0.25 seconds to enemies within.

W.notes: Applies  persistent damage in an  area of effect range.
W.blurb: Corki flies a short distance, dropping bombs that create a trail of fire that damages opponents who remain in it.

W.name: Special Delivery

effects.description: Active: Corki  dashes  unstoppably to the target location with extreme speed,  knocking aside all enemies hit 500 units and leaving behind a fire trail for 5 seconds.

Enemies knocked aside or within the trail are burned for 1.5 seconds, refreshing while inside the trail,  slowing them by 90% and dealing 7.5 −  25 (based on level) (+ 50% bonus AD) (+ 6% AP) magic damage every 0.25 seconds, for a maximum of 150 −  500 (based on level) (+ 1000% bonus AD) (+ 120% AP) magic damage.
Casting Special Delivery instantly resets Valkyrie's  cooldown.

W.notes: Applies  persistent damage in an  area of effect range.
W.blurb: Corki hurtles forward a long distance, knocking aside enemies and creating a trail of scorched earth that damages opponents who remain in it.

E.name: Gatling Gun

effects.description: Active: Corki sprays bullets in a frontal cone for 4 seconds, dealing equal parts physical and magic damage every 0.25 seconds to all enemies hit, and reducing the target's  armor and  magic resistance each tick, stacking up to 8 times, lingering for 2 seconds.

E.notes:
Applies  persistent damage in an  area of effect range.
 The direction of the gun firing changes depending on where Corki is facing.
E.blurb: Corki's gatling gun rapidly fires in a cone in front of him, dealing damage and reducing enemy Armor and Magic Resist.

R.name: Missile Barrage

effects.description: Passive: Corki periodically stocks a missile, up to a maximum of 7, and starts with 7 missiles every time he respawns.
Active: Corki fires a missile in the target direction that explodes upon the first enemy hit, dealing magic damage in an area.
Every third missile Corki fires is a  Big One, dealing 100% increased damage with increased range and explosion radius.

R.notes:
Once Corki has learned the ability, he receives a buff that automatically tracks the number of times he's used his ultimate since the last Big One.
 Since this information is represented as a buff, This information is available to both allies and enemies.

 Corki retains progress towards The Big One when he dies
 Once Corki has his ultimate, he has an indicator below his health bar that is only visible to him that shows when a Big One will be fired, how many missiles he has in reserve, and how many more missiles he can store.
R.blurb: Corki fires a missile toward his target location that explodes on impact, dealing damage to enemies in an area. Corki stores missiles over time, up to a maximum. Every 3rd missile fired will be a Big One, dealing extra damage.

R.name: Missile Barrage

effects.description: Passive: Corki periodically stocks a missile, up to a maximum of 7, and starts with 7 missiles every time he respawns.
Active: Corki fires a missile in the target direction that explodes upon the first enemy hit, dealing magic damage in an area.
Every third missile Corki fires is a  Big One, dealing 100% increased damage with increased range and explosion radius.

R.notes:
Once Corki has learned the ability, he receives a buff that automatically tracks the number of times he's used his ultimate since the last Big One.
 Since this information is represented as a buff, This information is available to both allies and enemies.

 Corki retains progress towards The Big One when he dies
 Once Corki has his ultimate, he has an indicator below his health bar that is only visible to him that shows when a Big One will be fired, how many missiles he has in reserve, and how many more missiles he can store.
R.blurb: Corki fires a missile toward his target location that explodes on impact, dealing damage to enemies in an area. Corki stores missiles over time, up to a maximum. Every 3rd missile fired will be a Big One, dealing extra damage.

I.name: Hemorrhage

effects.description: Innate: Dealing damage to non- structure targets with basic attacks on-attack or abilities, causes them to bleed every 1.25 seconds for 5 seconds, dealing 13 − 30 (based on level) (+ 30% bonus AD)  physical damage over the duration. This can stack up to 5 times for a maximum of 65 − 150 (based on level) (+ 150% bonus AD) physical damage over the duration. The total damage is increased by 20% against monsters.
Upon applying full Hemorrhage stacks to an enemy  champion or killing one with  Noxian Guillotine, Darius gains Noxian Might for 5 seconds.
Noxian Might: Darius gains 30 − 230 (based on level) bonus attack damage and instantly applies full Hemorrhage stacks through his usual means.

I.notes:
Hemorrhage will not be applied if the basic attack is  dodged or if it  misses.
 Hemorrhage will still be applied if the basic attack is  blocked.
I.blurb: Darius aims his attacks strategically, causing his target to bleed. This effect stacks up to five times. Enemies that reach max Hemorrhage cause Darius to gain Noxian Might, greatly increasing his damage.

Q.name: Decimate

effects.description: Active: Darius hefts his axe,  disarming himself for 0.75 seconds. He then swings it around himself, dealing physical damage to nearby enemies, reduced to 35% against enemies hit by the handle.
Against champions and large monsters, Darius  heals for  15% − 45% (based on enemies hit by the blade) missing health. The handle of Darius' axe will not apply  hemorrhage or heal him.

Q.blurb: Darius winds up and swings his axe in a wide circle. Enemies struck by the blade take more damage than those struck by the handle. Darius heals based on enemy champions hit by the blade.

W.name: Crippling Strike

effects.description: Active: Darius' next basic attack within 4 seconds gains  25 bonus range, dealing bonus physical damage and  slowing the target by 90% for 1 second.
If Crippling Strike kills the target, it refunds its  mana cost and half of its  cooldown.
Crippling Strike resets Darius's basic attack timer, and is affected by  critical strike modifiers.
The attack's animation can be cancelled by casting  Decimate, but the attack will still land.

W.notes:
Spell shield will block the entire attack (including the base attack damage).
 The empowered basic attack is  unstoppable, meaning no effect can interrupt it other than death, Darius' or the target's. Using  Flash or going into  stasis (i.e  Zhonya's Hourglass,  Guardian Angel) will cancel the animation but the attack will still land.
 Despite its name, Crippling Strike does not induce  cripples.
W.blurb: Darius's next attack strikes an enemy's crucial artery. As they bleed out, their Movement Speed is slowed.

E.name: Apprehend

effects.description: Passive: Darius gains  armor penetration.
Active: Darius  pulls in all enemies in front of him,  slowing them by 40% for 1 second, and briefly gains  sight of the area around the pull.

E.notes:
After the pull, Darius will attempt to basic attack the closest pulled target.
 The armor penetration stacks multiplicatively with other forms of percentage armor reduction.
E.blurb: Darius hones his axe, passively causing his physical damage to ignore a percentage of his target's Armor. When activated, Darius sweeps up his enemies with his axe's hook and pulls them to him.

R.name: Noxian Guillotine

effects.description: Active: Darius attempts to execute the targeted enemy champion,  leaping towards them over 0.366 seconds to deal  true damage, increased by 0% −  100% (based on  Hemorrhage stacks).

If the target dies within 0.15 seconds after being hit by Noxian Guillotine, Darius causes all nearby  minions and  monsters to  flee for 3 seconds during which they are rapidly  slowed by up to 99% over the duration, and is able to recast the ability within 20 seconds at no cost.
At rank 3, Noxian Guillotine instead completely resets its  cooldown.

R.notes:
The ability does not go on  cooldown or consume  mana if it's interrupted during the leap. This may only happen if:
 Darius or his target dies during the leap.
 Darius loses  sight of his target.
 The target becomes  untargetable.

 Noxian Guillotine's cooldown after the recast or recast window is calculated by taking the values at the end, and using this formula: (Noxian Guillotine's Cooldown - time since first cast) × (1 -  cdr).
 Noxian Guillotine applies  Hemorrhage after the damage.
 Darius will only leap if the target is too far away.
 This leap can pass very thin terrain and will otherwise not be able to. In any case, Darius will still hit the target.
R.blurb: Darius leaps to an enemy champion and strikes a lethal blow, dealing true damage. This damage is increased for each stack of Hemorrhage on the target. If Noxian Guillotine is a killing blow, its cooldown is refreshed for a brief duration.

I.name: Moonsilver Blade

effects.description: Innate: Diana permanently has  10% −  40% (based on level) bonus attack speed. After casting an ability, this bonus is tripled to 30% −  120% (based on level) for 3 seconds.

Diana's basic attacks on-hit grant a stack for 3.5 seconds. At 2 stacks, Diana's next basic attack on-hit additionally cleaves nearby enemies for 20 −  250 (based on level) (+ 40% AP)  magic damage, consuming all stacks. This damage is increased by 50% against non-epic monsters.

I.notes:
Moonsilver Blade will affect structures.
 Each attack has a distinct animation and she will glow when the empowered attack is ready.
I.blurb: Every third strike cleaves nearby enemies for additional magic damage. Every spell cast grants attack speed for the next 3 attacks.

Q.name: Crescent Strike

effects.description: Active: Diana unleashes a bolt of lunar energy that travels in a counter-clockwise arc before exploding at the target location, dealing magic damage to enemies hit and afflicting them with Moonlight for 3 seconds,  revealing them for the duration.
Moonlight has interactions with  Lunar Rush.

Q.notes:
The tip of the arc reveals Fog of War for a short duration.
 If the  spell shield blocks the bolt, it will not be able to block the explosion.
Q.blurb: Diana swings her blade to unleash a bolt of lunar energy that deals damage in an arc before exploding. Afflicts enemies struck with the Moonlight debuff, revealing them if they are not stealthed.

W.name: Pale Cascade

effects.description: Active: Diana  shields herself for up to 5 seconds and creates three spheres that orbit her for the duration, detonating upon contact with an enemy and dealing magic damage to nearby enemies upon detonation.
If all three spheres detonate, Pale Cascade's shield is reapplied, stacking with its original shield, and its duration is refreshed.

W.notes:
On the second application of Pale Cascade's shield,  Shield Power will apply to both the new shield amount and the shield amount remaining from the first shield, which already benefitted from shield power.
 Because of this, shield power effectively applies to the second shield twice, but with reduced efficiency, for up to an increase of 50% of shield power (maximum benefit if no damage was mitigated by the first shield). With 10% shield power, the second shield's total amount will be increased by up to an additional 5%, for a total of 15.5% bonus shield. 
 The formula for the total amount of shield Diana will receive from both shield applications is:



Total Shield = (((Shield Amount * (1 + Shield Power)) - Damage Blocked by Shield) + Shield Amount) * (1 + Shield Power)
W.blurb: Diana creates three orbiting spheres that detonate on contact with enemies to deal damage in an area. She also gains a temporary shield that absorbs damage. If her third sphere detonates, the shield gains additional strength.

R.name: Moonfall

effects.description: Active:  Reveals,  draws in, and successively  slows all nearby enemies for 2 seconds.
If Diana pulls in one or more enemy champions, the moonlight crashes down onto her after 1 second, dealing magic damage in an area around her, increased for each champion pulled beyond the first.

R.notes: Enemies stay in the area for a maximum of approximately 0.5 seconds while being pulled.
R.blurb: Diana draws in and slows all nearby enemies.

E.name: Lunar Rush

effects.description: Active: Diana  dashes to an enemy, dealing magic damage to the target and consuming  Moonlight from all enemies. If the target is within 400 range, Diana will dash through them.
If Moonlight is consumed from the target or the target dies mid-dash while being afflicted by Moonlight, Lunar Rush's  cooldown is reset.
Other abilities can be used during the dash.

E.notes:
Diana will attempt to basic attack the target. This will not grant a stack of  Conqueror,  Electrocute,  Phase Rush or  Spellthief's Edge.
 Lunar Rush consumes Moonlight upon ending the dash (even if  interrupted).
 If Lunar Rush is  spell shielded the Moonlight debuff is still consumed and therefore Lunar Rush's cooldown is still reset.
E.blurb: Diana dashes to an enemy and deals magic damage. Lunar Rush has no cooldown when used to teleport to a target afflicted with Moonlight.

I.name: Adrenaline Rush

effects.description: Innate: Dr. Mundo passively regenerates[  1.5% of his maximum health every 5 seconds ][  0.3% of his maximum health each second ].

I.notes: Adrenaline Rush is not affected by  Revitalize as it is considered as health regeneration.
I.blurb: Dr. Mundo regenerates 0.3% of his maximum Health each second.

Q.name: Infected Cleaver

effects.description: Active: Dr. Mundo hurls a cleaver in the target direction, dealing  magic damage to the first enemy it hits and  slowing it by 40% for 2 seconds.
Infected Cleaver has a minimum damage threshold, and is capped against  minions and  monsters.
If Infected Cleaver hits an enemy, 40% of the  health cost is refunded, and if it kills it, 80% of the health cost is refunded.

Q.notes:
As with all abilities with health costs Infected Cleaver will not reduce Dr. Mundo's health below 1, effectively making it free-to-cast at that threshold.
 Health cost refund on the ability is affected by increased healing from  Spirit Visage,  Revitalize and  Heal power.
 Dr. Mundo will still heal if Infected Cleaver is blocked.
Q.blurb: Dr. Mundo hurls his cleaver, dealing damage equal to a portion of his target's current Health and slowing them for a short time. Dr. Mundo delights in the suffering of others, so he is returned half of the Health cost when he successfully lands a cleaver (increased to the full Health cost on killing blows).

W.name: Burning Agony

effects.description: Toggle: Dr. Mundo sets himself on fire, dealing magic damage every 0.25 seconds to nearby enemies and gaining  30% Tenacity.

W.notes:
As with all abilities with health costs, Burning Agony will not reduce Dr. Mundo's health below 1.
 However this only happens once per ability cast. The ability will be put on a 1 second cooldown the next time his health is lower than the cost.
W.blurb: Dr. Mundo drains his Health to reduce the duration of disables and deal continual damage to nearby enemies.

E.name: Masochism

effects.description: Passive: Taking magic damage or paying a  health cost increases Dr. Mundo's  magic resistance by 3% for 2 seconds, stacking up to an amount.
Active: Dr. Mundo gains bonus attack damage for 5 seconds, increased by 0% − 100% (based on missing health).
Additionally, Dr. Mundo's next basic attack within the duration will cost health, but gains  25 bonus range and deals  bonus physical damage.
Masochism resets Dr. Mundo's basic attack timer.

E.notes:
As with all abilities with health costs Masochism will not reduce Dr. Mundo's health below 1, effectively making it free-to-cast at that threshold.
 Health cost is paid upon basic attacking once after activating Masochism, not upon activating Masochism.
 The health cost will be paid whether or not the basic attack deals damage (e.g.  blind).

 The attack damage bonus adjusts dynamically to Dr. Mundo's health.
 Masochism's bonus AD is the highest basic-ability-steroid in the game.
 Masochism's bonus physical damage does not affect structures. However, the bonus AD gained on activation will increase Dr. Mundo's damage against structures like any other AD source would.
E.blurb: Dr. Mundo gains bonus attack damage based on his missing health, and his next basic attack headbutts his target for additional damage. Passively increases magic resist whenever Dr. Mundo is dealt magic damage or pays a health cost.

R.name: Sadism

effects.description: Active: Dr. Mundo regenerates  health over 12 seconds and gains  bonus movement speed for the duration.

R.notes:
Sadism adjusts dynamically to Dr. Mundos maximum health.
 Sadism will continue its healing effect through pseudo-death effects and while in stasis ( Chronoshift,  Fate's Call,  Zhonya's Hourglass,  Guardian Angel).
 Sadism is not affected by  Revitalize as it is considered as health regeneration.
R.blurb: Dr. Mundo sacrifices a portion of his Health for increased Movement Speed and drastically increased Health Regeneration.

I.name: League of Draven

effects.description: Innate: When Draven catches a  Spinning Axe, kills a non-champion or destroys a turret, he gains a stack of Adoration.

In addition, killing a minion or champion summoned unit grants a  Strike stack for 10 seconds, up to a maximum of 6. If he drops an  axe he loses all Strike stacks. At 6 stacks, he consumes all of his Strike stacks and gains 2 Adoration stacks.
When Draven kills an enemy champion, he consumes all of his Adoration stacks and gains  25 + (2 × stacks) bonus gold.
Draven loses 75% of his Adoration stacks upon death.

I.notes:
Draven will gain  Adoration on ward, trap and summoned units kills.
 Assists from  Death from Below will trigger League of Draven.
 Upon reaching 150  Adoration stacks, and every 100 stacks thereafter, as well as when he cashes at least 150 stacks in, Draven automatically sends a chat message notifying his team.
 A chat message will display to all players how much gold Draven has gained whenever League of Draven grants over  300 gold.
 A chat message will display to the enemy how much gold Draven could've gained whenever League of Draven gets reduced.

 None of the parts of League of Draven require actually using a  Spinning Axe for a kill to get  Strike or  Adoration stacks, as well as to cash  Adoration stacks.
I.blurb: Draven gains his fans' Adoration when he catches a Spinning Axe or kills a minion, monster, or tower. Killing enemy champions grants Draven bonus gold based on how much Adoration he has.

Q.name: Spinning Axe

effects.description: Active: Draven starts spinning his axe, causing his next basic attack within 5.8 seconds to deal  bonus physical damage.

The spinning axe ricochets off the target high up into the air, landing 2 seconds later at a location determined by Draven's current movement. If Draven catches an axe, Spinning Axe is reapplied for no additional cost on his next basic attack.
Draven can hold up to two Spinning Axes in his hands at once.

Q.notes:
The landing location is determined by Draven's movement speed and direction at the time Spinning Axe hits the target. If Draven is actually moving, it will bounce directly into his path. Otherwise, it will bounce back towards his current location, either landing directly onto him or to his sides.
 Spinning Axe will place a visual cue on the ground where it will land. This visual cue is visible to both player teams, although Draven himself will see a more prominent marker.
 Recasting Spinning Axe will refresh the buff and add another axe if possible.
 There is no limit to how many axes can be juggled at once, as long as two are carried at a time.

 Draven can catch an enemy Draven's axe.
 Spinning Axes may optically bypass  Wind Wall but will be destroyed upon impact.
  Unbreakable will block the attack, but the axe will bounce off normally.
  Critical strike will not interact with Spinning Axe's bonus damage.
 Attacks against structures will refresh the timer on active Spinning Axes, no other effects.
 The damage will be negated if the attack is  dodged,  blocked, or if it  misses. The axe will still bounce off.
  Runaan's Hurricane's Wind's Fury will not trigger the bonus damage or spawn extra axes.
 If a Spinning Axe is readied (either caught or casted) during an attack wind-up, the effects will be applied to that attack once it fires.
Q.blurb: Draven's next attack will deal bonus physical damage. This axe will ricochet off the target high up into the air. If Draven catches it, he automatically readies another Spinning Axe. Draven can have two Spinning Axes at once.

W.name: Blood Rush

effects.description: Active: Draven becomes  ghosted for 1.5 seconds, gaining  bonus attack speed for 3 seconds and  bonus movement speed which decays over 1.5 seconds.
Catching a  Spinning Axe resets Blood Rush's  cooldown.

W.notes: Activating Blood Rush while the effect is already active will refresh the bonus stats.
W.blurb: Draven gains increased Movement Speed and Attack Speed. The Movement Speed bonus decreases rapidly over its duration. Catching a Spinning Axe will refresh the cooldown of Blood Rush.

E.name: Stand Aside

effects.description: Active: Draven throws his axes in a line, dealing physical damage to all enemies hit,  knocking them aside and  slowing them for 2 seconds.

E.blurb: Draven throws his axes, dealing physical damage to targets hit and knocking them aside. Targets hit are slowed.

R.name: Whirling Death

effects.description: Active: Draven hurls two  massive axes in the target direction, dealing physical damage to all enemies struck.

Upon reaching the edge of the map, striking an enemy champion, or upon reactivation, the axes slowly come to a stop before homing back to Draven, dealing the same damage to every enemy struck on the way back.
Whirling Death deals 100% − 40% (based on enemy hit) damage, this reduction resets when the axes reverse direction.

R.notes:
Whirling Death grants  sight along its path.
 If Draven dies while the axes are cast, they will fizzle upon the next interaction.
  Spell shield will block one instance of damage.
R.blurb: Draven hurls two massive axes to deal physical damage to each unit struck. Whirling Death slowly reverses direction and returns to Draven after striking an enemy champion. Draven may also activate this ability while the axes are in flight to cause it to return early. Deals less damage for each unit hit and resets when the axes reverse direction.

R.name: Whirling Death

effects.description: Active: Draven hurls two  massive axes in the target direction, dealing physical damage to all enemies struck.

Upon reaching the edge of the map, striking an enemy champion, or upon reactivation, the axes slowly come to a stop before homing back to Draven, dealing the same damage to every enemy struck on the way back.
Whirling Death deals 100% − 40% (based on enemy hit) damage, this reduction resets when the axes reverse direction.

R.notes:
Whirling Death grants  sight along its path.
 If Draven dies while the axes are cast, they will fizzle upon the next interaction.
  Spell shield will block one instance of damage.
R.blurb: Draven hurls two massive axes to deal physical damage to each unit struck. Whirling Death slowly reverses direction and returns to Draven after striking an enemy champion. Draven may also activate this ability while the axes are in flight to cause it to return early. Deals less damage for each unit hit and resets when the axes reverse direction.

I.name: Z-Drive Resonance

effects.description: Innate - Resonance: Ekko's basic attacks and damaging abilities apply a Resonance stack for 4 seconds.
At 3 stacks, Resonance is consumed to deal 30 −  140 (based on level) (+ 80% AP)  magic damage, increased by 50% against  monsters, dealing 45 −  210 (based on level) (+ 120% AP), but capped at 600.
Resonance cannot affect the same target more than once every few seconds.
Innate - Stolen Time: Triggering Resonance against a  champion grants 50 / 60 / 70 / 80% (based on level)  bonus movement speed for 2 / 2.5 / 3 (based on level) seconds.

I.notes: No additional details.
I.blurb: Ekko's Zero-Drive charges his spells and attacks with temporal energy. The third hit deals bonus damage and, if the target is a champion, Ekko gains accelerated movement speed.

Q.name: Timewinder

effects.description: Active: Ekko throws a grenade in the target direction, dealing magic damage to enemies along its path.

After traveling 700 units or upon hitting an enemy champion, the grenade slows down for 1.75 seconds, expanding and creating a Temporal Sickness field that  slows nearby enemies, while continuing to travel in its direction for another 190 units and expanding for another 50 units.
After finishing its path, the grenade contracts and returns to Ekko at a higher speed, dealing magic damage to enemies along its path.
The traveling and returning pass each cannot damage the same enemy more than once.

Q.notes: Spell shield will block only a single instance of damage.
Q.blurb: Ekko throws a temporal grenade that expands into a time-distortion field upon hitting an enemy champion, slowing and damaging anyone caught inside. After a delay, the grenade rewinds back to Ekko, dealing damage on its return.

W.name: Parallel Convergence

effects.description: Passive: Ekko's basic attacks deal 3% (+ 3% per 100 AP) of the target's missing health bonus magic damage to targets below  30% of their maximum health. The damage has a minimum threshold of 15 and is capped at 150 against  minions and  monsters.

Active: Ekko calls upon an afterimage that bats a device to the target location. After traveling over 3 seconds, the device expands to  slow enemies by 40%, only revealing itself to enemies in the last 1 second.
If Ekko enters the expansion within the next 1.5 seconds after it lands, it detonates to  shield him for 2 seconds and  stun any enemies within for 2.25 seconds.

W.notes:
Parallel Convergence's active provides  sight in its radius 2 seconds after cast and for as long as the  slowing field is active.
 Ekko can detonate the expansion even while  untargetable (i.e.  Chronobreak's dash).
 Ekko's shield buff reads Seen It All Before: "Ekko has already seen this timeline and is able to avoid some incoming damage".
 Enemies affected by the stun receive the debuff Temporal Suspension: "The unit is frozen in time. WARNING: Avoid the detonation radius of temporal anomalies."
 The passive applies  proc damage.
W.blurb: Ekko splits the timeline, creating an anomaly after a few seconds that slows enemies caught inside. If Ekko enters the anomaly, he gains shielding and triggers a detonation, stunning enemies by suspending them in time.

E.name: Phase Dive

effects.description: Active: Ekko  dashes towards the target location. The next basic attack thereafter has  300 bonus range, deals bonus magic damage, and causes him to  blink within 125  range of the target.
Phase Dive resets Ekko's basic attack timer.

E.blurb: Ekko rolls evasively while charging up his Z-Drive. His next attack deals bonus damage and warps reality, teleporting him to his target.

R.name: Chronobreak

effects.description: Passive: Upon learning Chronobreak or if its current cooldown is lower than 4 seconds, Ekko spawns a time-delayed afterimage of himself that tracks where he was 4 seconds ago.
Active: Ekko  traces back to his afterimage, entering  stasis during the transportation, dealing magic damage to surrounding enemies on arrival and  healing himself.

modifiers: increased by 3% per 1% of health lost in the past 4 seconds

R.notes: Ekko will attempt to basic attack the closest target, but can do so quicker if he manually attack commands after the dash.
R.blurb: Ekko shatters his timeline, becoming untargetable and rewinding to a more favorable point in time. He returns to whenever he was a few seconds ago, and heals for a percentage of the damage received in that duration. Enemies near his arrival zone take massive damage.

I.name: Spider Queen

effects.description: Innate - Human Form: When Elise's abilities hits a target she gains one dormant Spiderling, up to 2 / 3 / 4 / 5 (based on  Human Form's Rank).

Innate - Spider Form: Elise's basic attacks against non- structures deal 10 / 20 / 30 / 40 (based on  Spider Form's Rank) (+ 30% AP)  bonus magic damage and  heal her for  4 / 6 / 8 / 10 (based on  Spider Form's Rank) (+ 10% AP) health on-hit.

I.notes:
Elise will always begin the game and respawn with maximum available Spiderlings stored.
 Elise's  Human Form ability casts can only store one Spiderling each.
 Spider Form's basic attacks will apply other on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal (the bonus damage does not).
 PENDING FOR TEST: Spider Form's relationship with  dodge,  block, and  blind.

 Elise in spider form deals  proc damage on her basic attacks.
 The Spiderlings apply  pet damage.
I.blurb: Human Form: When Elise's abilities hit an enemy, she gains a dormant Spiderling. Spider Form: Basic attacks deal bonus magic damage and restore health to Elise.

Q.name: Neurotoxin

effects.description: Active: Elise fires toxin at the target enemy unit, dealing magic damage, capped against  monsters.

units: % (+ 3% per 100 AP) of target's current health
% (+ 3% per 100 AP) of target's current health
% (+ 3% per 100 AP) of target's current health
% (+ 3% per 100 AP) of target's current health
% (+ 3% per 100 AP) of target's current health

Q.notes: No additional details.
Q.blurb: Human Form: Deals damage based upon how high the target's Health is.

Q.name: Venomous Bite

effects.description: Active: Elise  lunges at the target enemy with her fangs and bites them, dealing magic damage, capped against  monsters.

units: % (+ 3% per 100 AP) of target's missing health
% (+ 3% per 100 AP) of target's missing health
% (+ 3% per 100 AP) of target's missing health
% (+ 3% per 100 AP) of target's missing health
% (+ 3% per 100 AP) of target's missing health

effects.description: If there are active  Spiderlings or a  Volatile Spiderling nearby, they will  dash alongside Elise towards Venomous Bite's target and reprioritize them.

Q.notes:
Venomous Bite cannot be used to cross walls or impassable terrain.
 The target will be damaged regardless.
  Spiderlings can cross walls and terrain to reach Venomous Bite's target and will attack provided Elise stays within their leash range.
Q.blurb: Spider Form: Lunges at an enemy and deals damage based upon how low their Health is.

W.name: Volatile Spiderling

effects.description: Active: Elise summons an  untargetable venom-gorged spider for 3 seconds, which moves in the target direction.
The spider explodes upon contact with an enemy unit or at the end of its lifespan, dealing magic damage to nearby enemies.

If the spider does not hit an enemy before reaching the target location, it chases down a nearby enemy, prioritizing  champions. The spider gains  bonus movement speed, based on its proximity to its target.

W.notes: If Volatile Spiderling dashes to a target due to  Venomous Bite, it will not expire before finishing its jump.
W.blurb: Human Form: Releases a venom-gorged Spiderling that explodes when it nears a target.

W.name: Skittering Frenzy

effects.description: Passive: Elise's  Spiderlings gain  bonus attack speed.
Active: Elise and her  Spiderlings gain  bonus attack speed for 3 seconds.
Skittering Frenzy resets Elise's autoattack timer.

W.notes:
Skittering Frenzy has no cast time and does not interrupt Elise's previous orders.
 Elise loses the attack speed bonus immediately when turning back to  Human Form.
 But if she is able to transform back in less than 3 seconds (only via sufficient cooldown reduction) she gets the bonus back for its remaining duration.
W.blurb: Spider Form: Elise and her Spiderlings gain Attack Speed.

E.name: Cocoon

effects.description: Active: Elise fires a web in the target direction, granting  sight of the first enemy hit for 1 second and  stunning them.

E.notes: No additional details.
E.blurb: Human Form: Stuns the first enemy unit hit and reveals them if they are not stealthed.

E.name: Rappel

effects.description: Active: Elise lifts up into the air, becoming  untargetable for up to 2 seconds and  revealing the area for the duration. While she is in the air she can select a target to instantly descend upon.
If cast directly on an enemy, Elise automatically descends upon them after 1 second. Upon landing, Elise's  Spider Queen bonuses are increased for 5 seconds.

E.notes:
When Elise casts Rappel, a circle outlines the area in which a target or location can be selected.
Elise only gains an increase in her passive bonuses if she directly targets an enemy with Rappel.
 She cannot descend outside the bounds of this circle.

 Rappel can be cast on any targetable enemy unit ( minions,  monsters,  champions,  pets,  wards, and  revealed traps).
 Elise will attempt to position behind her target if she descends closer than Rappel's max range.
E.blurb: Spider Form: Elise and her Spiderlings ascend into the air and then descend upon target enemy.

R.name: Spider Form / Human Form

effects.description: Passive:  Spider Queen's bonuses are increased.

Human Form - Active: Elise transforms into a menacing spider, gaining  25 bonus movement speed,  melee basic attacks with 125  range, and access to her arachnid abilities. Additionally, Elise unleashes all stored Spiderlings.
Spider Form - Active: Elise transforms into her human form, gaining  ranged basic attacks, and access to her human abilities. Additionally, Elise stores all unleashed Spiderlings.
Elise begins with one rank in Spider Form / Human Form and can increase it at levels 6, 11, and 16.

R.notes:
Both Spider Form and Human Form have no cast time and do not interrupt Elise's previous orders.
 Spider Form and Human Form have separate cooldowns.
