 Neither transformation counts as an activation for the purposes of items such as  Tear of the Goddess, Spellblade, and  Force Pulse.
R.blurb: Transforms into a menacing spider, reducing her attack range in exchange for movement speed, new abilities, and a Spiderling swarm that will attack her foes.

R.name: Spider Form / Human Form

effects.description: Passive:  Spider Queen's bonuses are increased.

Human Form - Active: Elise transforms into a menacing spider, gaining  25 bonus movement speed,  melee basic attacks with 125  range, and access to her arachnid abilities. Additionally, Elise unleashes all stored Spiderlings.
Spider Form - Active: Elise transforms into her human form, gaining  ranged basic attacks, and access to her human abilities. Additionally, Elise stores all unleashed Spiderlings.
Elise begins with one rank in Spider Form / Human Form and can increase it at levels 6, 11, and 16.

R.notes:
Both Spider Form and Human Form have no cast time and do not interrupt Elise's previous orders.
 Spider Form and Human Form have separate cooldowns.

 Neither transformation counts as an activation for the purposes of items such as  Tear of the Goddess, Spellblade, and  Force Pulse.
R.blurb: Transforms into a menacing spider, reducing her attack range in exchange for movement speed, new abilities, and a Spiderling swarm that will attack her foes.

I.name: Demon Shade

effects.description: Innate: Evelynn gains Demon Shade after not basic attacking or casting an ability for 4 seconds. Taking damage from enemy champions or turrets puts Demon Shade on a 1.5 second static cooldown.
Demon Shade: While below  250 − 590 (based on level) (+ 250% AP) health, Evelynn  restores  15 − 75 (based on level) health every second. From level 6 onward, Demon Shade also grants  camouflage.

I.notes:
Whenever Demon Shade activates, a puff of purple smoke will briefly appear around her.
 She will be spotted by an enemy she has no vision of but Demon Shade's stealth will not break.


    Evelynn being  revealed in Demon Shade (post 6).
I.blurb: When out of combat, Evelynn enters Demon Shade. Demon Shade heals Evelynn when she is low on health and grants Camouflage after level 6.

Q.name: Hate Spike

effects.description: Active: Evelynn launches a dart in the target direction, dealing  magic damage to the first enemy hit. Hitting a  monster refunds  50% of the cooldown.
For the next 4 seconds, the enemy hit takes bonus magic damage from her next 3 basic attacks and abilities.
Hate Spike may be re-activated up to 3 times at no cost until the ability comes off cooldown.

Recast: Evelynn unleashes a line of spikes in the direction of her attack target, dealing magic damage to all enemies struck. Hate Spike will first prioritize Evelynn's attack target, then the nearest enemy champion.

Q.notes:
Hate Spike prioritizes:
 The last champion Evelynn hit
 The last non-champion Evelynn hit
 The lowest-health champion
 The lowest-health non-champion

 The dart applies  spell damage and the spikes deal  area damage.
 Recasts can be buffered up to 0.5 seconds before becoming castable.
 Evelynn has a minimum of 4 seconds to use the second casts regardless of the ability's cooldown, which is mainly only applicable versus monsters, on  Ultra Rapid Fire and in Practice Tool.
 In  URF game mode, the spikes can be reactivated 10 times instead.
Q.blurb: Evelynn strikes out with her Lasher, dealing damage to the first unit hit. Then, Evelynn can shoot a line of spikes at nearby foes up to 3 times.

W.name: Allure

effects.description: Active: Evelynn curses the target champion or monster for 5 seconds.
Evelynn's next basic attack or ability against the accursed expunges them,  slowing them by 65%.
Expunging a target will refund Allure's  mana cost. If the target is cursed for at least 2.5 seconds she also  charms them, as well as applying additional effects based on the target type.
Against  champions, the expunge also reduces their magic resistance for 4 seconds.Against  monsters, the expunge deals bonus magic damage and the  charm lasts for 2 more seconds.

W.notes:
Allure does not break Demon Shade's  stealth.
 An enemy champion affected by Allure is alerted by her presence and after 2.5 seconds, an arrow will appear near them pointing towards Evelynn's current position (regardless of distance).
 The  magic resistance shred will be applied to the attack or ability that triggers it.
 Allure's initial cast on a target cannot be resisted by  spell shields.
W.blurb: Evelynn curses her target, causing her next attack or spell after a delay to charm her target and reduce their magic resist.

E.name: Whiplash

effects.description: Active: Evelynn whips the target enemy with her lashers, applying on-hit effects and dealing magic damage.

units: % (+ 1.5% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 1.5% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 1.5% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 1.5% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 1.5% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health

effects.description: Evelynn also gains  30% bonus movement speed for 2 seconds.
Gaining  Demon Shade resets Whiplash's  cooldown and  empowers the next cast.

E.notes: Whiplash can be  dodged and  blocked but may not  miss.
E.blurb: Evelynn whips her target with her Lasher, dealing damage. She then gains movement speed for a short duration.

E.name: Empowered Whiplash

effects.description: Active: Evelynn  dashes toward the target enemy, dealing increased damage as well as damaging all enemies she passes through. On-hit effects are only applied to her target.

units: % (+ 2.5% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 2.5% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 2.5% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 2.5% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 2.5% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health

effects.description: The percentile health damage deals a minimum of 25 and is capped at 450 against  monsters.

E.notes:
There is no time-out period on Empowered Whiplash.
 Empowered Whiplash can be  blocked but may not  miss or be  dodged.

R.name: Last Caress

effects.description: Active: Evelynn becomes  untargetable as she reveals her true form to all enemies in front of her, before  blinking back 700 units.
Enemies caught in her reveal are devastated, taking magic damage, with enemies below  30% of their maximum health receiving 140% bonus damage.

R.notes:
Last Caress can be buffered during  Empowered Whiplash.
 The casting input controls the direction the damage is dealt, with the movement automatically happening in the reverse direction. This is comparable to  90 Caliber Net.
 Enemy  champions below the maximum health threshold are marked for Evelynn, indicating the bonus damage opportunity.

    As shown in-game.
R.blurb: Evelynn briefly goes untargetable and decimates the area in front of her before warping backwards a long distance.

I.name: Rising Spell Force

effects.description: Innate: Every time Ezreal hits an enemy unit with one of his abilities, he gains  10% bonus attack speed for 6 seconds, stacking up to 5 times for a maximum of 50%.

I.notes: Rising Spell Force will stack even if the abilities used were  spell shielded.
I.blurb: Ezreal gains increasing Attack Speed each time he successfully hits a spell, stacking up to 5 times.

Q.name: Mystic Shot

effects.description: Active: Ezreal fires a bolt of energy in a line, dealing  physical damage to the first enemy hit, applying on-hit effects and healing off  life steal instead of  spell vamp.
If Mystic Shot successfully hits an enemy, Ezreal's abilities'  cooldowns are reduced by 1.5 seconds (including Mystic Shot's).

Q.notes:
Even if the ability is  spell shielded it will still trigger the cooldown reduction.
 Mystic Shot triggers  Runaan's Hurricane's Wind's Fury.
Q.blurb: Ezreal fires a damaging bolt of energy which reduces all of his cooldowns by 1.5 seconds if it strikes an enemy unit.

W.name: Essence Flux

effects.description: Active: Ezreal fires an orb that sticks to first enemy  champion,  epic monster, or structure hit for 4 seconds.
Hitting the target with a damaging ability or basic attack detonates the orb, dealing  magic damage.
Detonating with an ability fully refunds the cost of that ability and restores  60 mana.

W.notes: The detonation counts as a  single target ability for effects such as  Muramana's shock.

E.name: Arcane Shift

effects.description: Active: Ezreal  blinks to the target location, firing a homing bolt that deals magic damage to the nearest enemy.
Arcane Shift  prioritizes target hit by  Essence Flux.

E.notes:
Arcane Shift's cast time cannot be interrupted by anything other than Ezreal's own death. He will still suffer any crowd control effects, duration permitting, after it ends.
 Arcane Shift's homing projectile can target and hit  stealthed units or those hidden in the fog of war.
 It will also grant  vision of the targeted unit hidden in the fog of war for a brief duration.

 The homing projectile does not prioritize enemy champions.
E.blurb: Ezreal teleports to a target nearby location and fires a homing bolt which strikes the nearest enemy unit.

R.name: Trueshot Barrage

effects.description: Active: Ezreal fires an  energy projectile in the target direction, briefly  revealing the area it flies through and dealing magic damage to enemies it passes through.
Minions and non-epic  monsters take 50% reduced damage.

R.notes: If Ezreal  flashes or is  displaced mid-cast (i.e  Rocket Grab), the projectile will still fire from his position at the time of casting.
R.blurb: Ezreal winds up for 1 second to fire a powerful barrage of energy missiles which do massive damage to each unit they pass through (deals 10% less damage to each unit it passes through).

I.name: Dread

effects.description: Innate: Standing still or  channeling abilities for 1.5 seconds grants Fiddlesticks  25 / 30 / 35 / 40% (based on level) bonus movement speed, that lasts for 1.5 seconds once he starts moving. Being  immobilized will not trigger Dread, and will reset the timer.
After 5 seconds of not moving, Fiddlesticks will stand completely still.

I.notes:
Standing still and basic attacking will not reset Dread's timer.
 Unlike  Guerrilla Warfare Fiddlesticks can perform other actions so long as he does not move.
I.blurb: Standing still or channeling abilities for 1.5 seconds empowers Fiddlesticks with Dread. Immobilizing crowd control resets this timer. Dread grants Movement Speed, but only lasts for 1.5s after Fiddlesticks starts moving.

Q.name: Terrify

effects.description: Active: Fiddlesticks causes the target enemy to  flee as well as  slowing them by 90%.

Q.notes: No additional details.
Q.blurb: Strikes a target unit with fear, causing it to flee in terror for a duration.

W.name: Drain

effects.description: Active: Fiddlesticks tethers himself to the target enemy and  channels for up to 5 seconds. While channeling, he deals  magic damage each second, and  heals himself for a percentage of the damage done.
If the target breaks the tether by moving out of range, Drain ends immediately. If the target dies before the channel completes, the  cooldown is reduced by its remaining duration.

W.notes:
Drain deals damage every 0.25 seconds.
 Drain has a brief channel time (0.1 seconds) on cast before activation.
 Drain's channel will be interrupted if Fiddlesticks performs any other action, uses item actives, or is disabled.
 Using summoner spells (except  Flash and  Teleport) will not interrupt the channel.

 Drain will not continue channeling through  Death Defied or  Icathian Surprise.
 Drain will continue channeling through untargetable abilities ( Playful,  Sanguine Pool) so long as the target remains in tether range.
  Spell shield will block applying the tether but will not block damage from one already applied.
W.blurb: Fiddlesticks saps the life force of an enemy, dealing damage to a target over time and healing himself.

E.name: Dark Wind

effects.description: Active: Fiddlesticks sends a crow to the target enemy that bounces to nearby enemies up to 5 times, prioritizing targets not yet hit or targets affected by  Drain, dealing magic damage with each bounce and  silencing them for 1.25 seconds once.
Monsters take twice as much damage.

E.notes:
Applies  spell damage in a  area of effect range.
 The crow will vanish if the target becomes  untargetable but will keep on bouncing if the target has died.
E.blurb: A wisp of wind strikes an enemy unit and then bounces to nearby enemy units, dealing damage and silencing the victims.

R.name: Crowstorm

effects.description: Active: After  channeling for 1.5 seconds, Fiddlesticks  blinks to the target location with a murder of crows flying wildly around him for 5 seconds, dealing magic damage to nearby enemies each second.

R.notes:
Crowstorm applies a tick of damage every 0.5 seconds.
  Grounding effects instantly  interrupt the channel and place the ability on full  cooldown.
  Roots do not cancel the channel and allows Crowstorm to cast normally.

  -  Surprise Party Fiddlesticks has this special icon for this ability.
R.blurb: A murder of crows flock wildly around Fiddlesticks, dealing damage per second to all enemy units in the area.

I.name: Duelist's Dance

effects.description: Innate: Fiora identifies the Vitals of nearby  visible enemy champions, marked as an arc around themselves. Vitals take 1.75 seconds to become targetable and linger for 13.25 seconds while Fiora remains near the target. After a Vital is triggered or times out, Fiora identifies a new one on her target.

Successful basic attacks and damaging abilities against a Vital trigger it to deal 2.5% (+ 4.5% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health  bonus true damage,  heal Fiora for  40 − 115 (based on level) and grant her 20 / 30 / 40 / 50% (based on  Grand Challenge's Rank)  bonus movement speed that decays over 1.5 seconds.

I.notes:
A Vital's angle is fixed to the champion's model and doesn't interact with its orientation.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Vital's interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects via basic attack.
I.blurb: Fiora challenges nearby enemy Champions to dodge her. She calls out a direction from which she will try to strike. If she can complete her own challenge, she receives a small bonus and calls out a new direction.

I.name: Duelist's Dance

effects.description: Innate: Fiora identifies the Vitals of nearby  visible enemy champions, marked as an arc around themselves. Vitals take 1.75 seconds to become targetable and linger for 13.25 seconds while Fiora remains near the target. After a Vital is triggered or times out, Fiora identifies a new one on her target.

Successful basic attacks and damaging abilities against a Vital trigger it to deal 2.5% (+ 4.5% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health  bonus true damage,  heal Fiora for  40 − 115 (based on level) and grant her 20 / 30 / 40 / 50% (based on  Grand Challenge's Rank)  bonus movement speed that decays over 1.5 seconds.

I.notes:
A Vital's angle is fixed to the champion's model and doesn't interact with its orientation.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Vital's interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects via basic attack.
I.blurb: Fiora challenges nearby enemy Champions to dodge her. She calls out a direction from which she will try to strike. If she can complete her own challenge, she receives a small bonus and calls out a new direction.

Q.name: Lunge

effects.description: Active: Fiora  dashes a short distance in the target direction then stabs a nearby enemy if one is present. Lunge can damage structures and  wards. Stabbing an enemy reduces Lunge's  cooldown by 60%.
The stab deals  physical damage and applies on-hit effects.
Other abilities can be cast during the dash without cancelling it.

Q.notes:
The stab prioritizes in order of:
 Enemy champion affected by  Grand Challenge.
 Vitals facing Fiora.
 Champions who would die to the strike.
 The nearest champion.
 Enemies that would die to the strike.
 The closest enemy.
 Structures.
 Wards.

 Lunge can target stealthed units and those hidden in the fog of war.
 The dash can pass through walls.
 Cannot be cancelled by  stasis or  displacement effects.
 Will land (priority order unchanged) even if Fiora dies.
 Will be disabled if Fiora is  grounded.
 Lunges dash speed is affected by movement speed.
Q.blurb: Fiora lunges in a direction and stabs a nearby enemy, dealing physical damage and applying on-hit effects.

W.name: Riposte

effects.description: Active: Fiora poises to strike in the target direction, becoming  invulnerable to non-turret damage as well as gaining  crowd control and debuff immunity for the next 0.75 seconds. Fiora is in cast time while poised.
After the duration, Fiora stabs her sword forward, dealing  magic damage to enemies in a line.
The first enemy champion struck is also  slowed and  crippled by 50% for 2 seconds. If Fiora parries at least one  immobilizing effect, Riposte  stuns the target for the same duration instead.

W.notes:
While the in-game tooltip mentions "parrying", and many players refer to the effect as a parry, the functionality of the ability is identical to invulnerability. It will even prevent the damage being dealt by applied damage over times that were already active.
 Crowd control effects from epic monsters will be blocked and still count toward the  stun effect against champions.
 Debuff immunity includes summoner spells, such as  Exhaust, as well as damage over times and other effects.
  Spell shielding the ability will not prevent Vitals from being triggered.
W.blurb: Fiora parries all incoming damage and disables for a short time, then stabs in a direction. This stab slows the first enemy champion hit, or stuns them if Fiora blocked an immobilizing effect with this ability.

E.name: Bladework

effects.description: Active: Fiora's next two basic attacks on-attack within 4 seconds gain  25 bonus range and  bonus attack speed.
The first attack  slows the target by 30% for 1 second but cannot critically strike. The second attack will  critically strike for  reduced critical damage (including to  structures).
Bladework resets Fiora's basic attack timer.

E.notes:
Infinity Edge is not affected by the critical damage reduction and will increase the damage as normally.
 Bladework will go on cooldown after either its buff wears off or both basic attacks are consumed.
  Spell shield will only block the slow from the first hit.
E.blurb: Fiora has increased attack speed for the next two attacks. The first attack slows the target, and the second attack will critically strike.

R.name: Grand Challenge

effects.description: Passive:  Duelist's Dance's  bonus movement speed is increased.

Active: Fiora challenges the target enemy champion for 8 seconds, highlighting their four Vitals after a 0.5 second delay. While in effect,  Duelist's Dance does not identify new Vitals on Fiora's target.
While near the target, Fiora gains  Duelist's Dance's  bonus movement speed.
If she triggers at least one Vital before her target dies, or triggers all four, she creates a  Victory Zone that  heals all allied champions within it for 2 − 5 (based on Vitals hit) seconds.
Unlike  Duelist's Dance, the Vitals will keep on lingering even if Fiora is not nearby.

R.notes:
Grand Challenge is dispelled instantly if targeting a decoy.
 The damage of this ability scales with  Duelist's Dance.
 Even if Fiora dies, the  Victory Zone will trigger so long as she hit at least one Vital and they die before the Vitals wear off.
 When triggering the  Victory Zone the target is considered dead even if they are being revived (for example:  Guardian Angel,  Chronoshift).

 Ally units in  stasis will not be  healed by the  Victory Zone.
 The  Victory Zone can  heal the summoned  Rift Herald.
R.blurb: Fiora reveals all four Vitals on an enemy champion and gains movement speed while near them. If Fiora hits all 4 Vitals or if the target dies after she has hit at least one, Fiora and her allies in the area are healed over the next few seconds.

R.name: Grand Challenge

effects.description: Passive:  Duelist's Dance's  bonus movement speed is increased.

Active: Fiora challenges the target enemy champion for 8 seconds, highlighting their four Vitals after a 0.5 second delay. While in effect,  Duelist's Dance does not identify new Vitals on Fiora's target.
While near the target, Fiora gains  Duelist's Dance's  bonus movement speed.
If she triggers at least one Vital before her target dies, or triggers all four, she creates a  Victory Zone that  heals all allied champions within it for 2 − 5 (based on Vitals hit) seconds.
Unlike  Duelist's Dance, the Vitals will keep on lingering even if Fiora is not nearby.

R.notes:
Grand Challenge is dispelled instantly if targeting a decoy.
 The damage of this ability scales with  Duelist's Dance.
 Even if Fiora dies, the  Victory Zone will trigger so long as she hit at least one Vital and they die before the Vitals wear off.
 When triggering the  Victory Zone the target is considered dead even if they are being revived (for example:  Guardian Angel,  Chronoshift).

 Ally units in  stasis will not be  healed by the  Victory Zone.
 The  Victory Zone can  heal the summoned  Rift Herald.
R.blurb: Fiora reveals all four Vitals on an enemy champion and gains movement speed while near them. If Fiora hits all 4 Vitals or if the target dies after she has hit at least one, Fiora and her allies in the area are healed over the next few seconds.

effects.description: Innate: Fizz is permanently  ghosted, and takes 4 (+ 1% AP) reduced pre-mitigation damage from each tick of damage, up to a maximum of 50% reduction.

Q.name: Urchin Strike

effects.description: Active: Fizz  dashes a fixed distance towards the target enemy, dealing them  magic damage plus 100% AD physical damage.
Urchin Strike applies on-hit effects.

Q.notes:
Once Fizz has used it, Urchin Strike can be dodged with sufficiently fast displacement, resulting in no damage dealt.
  Life steal applies only on the physical damage component while  spell vamp applies to both the physical damage and bonus magic damage.
Q.blurb: Fizz dashes through his target, dealing magic damage and applying on hit effects.

W.name: Seastone Trident

effects.description: Passive: Fizz's basic attacks rend enemies on-hit, dealing magic damage every 0.5 seconds for 3 seconds, refreshing on-hit.
Active: Fizz's next basic attack is empowered, dealing bonus magic damage and gaining  50 bonus range.

If Seastone Trident kills its target, its  cooldown is reduced to 1 second and refunds  mana. Otherwise, if Seastone Trident doesn't kill its target, Fizz's basic attacks gain bonus on-hit magic damage for 5 seconds.
Seastone Trident resets Fizz's autoattack timer.

W.notes: PENDING FOR TEST: Seastone Trident's  interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects.
W.blurb: Fizz's attacks bleed his enemies, dealing magic damage over several seconds. Fizz can empower his next attack to deal bonus damage, increased by how long the bleed was active on his target.

E.name: Playful

effects.description: Active: Fizz  vaults towards the target location, becoming  untargetable for up to 0.75 seconds while balancing on his trident. While balancing, Fizz gains the ability to cast  Trickster.
Fizz then splashes onto the ground below him, dealing magic damage to nearby enemies and  slowing them for 2 seconds.

E.notes:
After Playful is used (without activating Trickster) Fizz can orientate his landing by right-clicking before/as he drops for a longer reach (but same radius) on the slow/damage.
 Playful cannot be used for approximately 0.5 seconds after using  Urchin Strike.
  Flash can be used during both dashes.
 The untargetability partially cancels if  Fizz is  disabled during it (because of effects such as  Power Fist), allowing non on-target effects to hit him.
E.blurb: Fizz hops into the air, landing gracefully upon his spear and becoming untargetable. From this position, Fizz can either slam the ground or choose to jump again before smashing back down.

E.name: Trickster

effects.description: Active: Fizz dismounts from his trident toward the target location in quick succession. Upon landing, he deals magic damage to nearby enemies. The damage dealt is the same as  Playful's, but in a smaller radius, and without applying the  slow.
Both  dashes may be directed separately.

E.notes: Flash can be used during both dashes.
E.blurb: Fizz hops into the air, landing gracefully upon his spear and becoming untargetable. From this position, Fizz can either slam the ground or choose to jump again before smashing back down.

R.name: Chum the Waters

effects.description: Active: Fizz throws down a lure at the target location that attracts a shark,  revealing the affected area before emerging after 2 seconds, dealing magic damage,  knocking aside surrounding enemies and  slowing them for 2 seconds. The further the lure travels in its initial flight, the larger the shark that is attracted, increasing its slow, eruption radius and knockback distance.
Guppy (<455): 40% slow, 200 eruption radius and 150 unit knockback distance.
Chomper (455-910): 60% slow, 325 eruption radius and 250 unit knockback distance.
Gigalodon (>910): 80% slow, 450 eruption radius and 350 unit knockback distance.

Enemy  champions can intercept the lure, which attaches to them and causes the shark to emerge at their position. The lure's holder is  slowed and  revealed for the duration and  knocked up for 1 second instead of away.

R.notes:
Chum the Waters will stop its movement if  spell shielded (does not attach) or upon colliding with  Yasuo's  Wind Wall (does not get destroyed).
 Only the slow may be removed by  cleansing effects.
R.blurb: Fizz tosses a fish in a direction that attaches to any champion that touches it, slowing the target. After a short delay, a shark erupts from the ground, knocking up the target and knocking any nearby enemies aside. All enemies hit are dealt magic damage and slowed.

I.name: Colossal Smash

effects.description: Innate: Galio's next basic attack deals 15 − 200 (based on level) (+ 100% AD) (+ 50% AP) (+ 60% bonus magic resistance)  total magic damage to its target and all enemies around it.
Colossal Smash can  critically strike, dealing (100% +  25%) AD bonus magic damage to all targets hit.

I.notes: Spellblade will also get converted to magic damage but will deal its damage only to the primary target.
I.blurb: Every few seconds, Galio's next basic attack deals bonus magic damage in an area. Colossal Smash's cooldown is reduced when Galio hits champions with his spells.

Q.name: Winds of War

effects.description: Active: Galio fires two windblasts that arc to either side before converging to the target area, dealing magic damage to all enemies they pass through.

When the blasts meet, the gusts form a tornado that advances for 2 seconds, dealing magic damage every 0.5 seconds to every enemy within, with the target's health ratio capped at 150 damage against  monsters.

Q.notes:
Spell shields will block the gusts damage but not the tornado's.
  Yasuo's  Wind Wall and  Braum's  Unbreakable can block each windblast individually.
 The tornado will not form if only one windblast reaches the target location.
Q.blurb: Galio fires two windblasts that converge into a large tornado.

W.name: Shield of Durand

effects.description: Passive: Upon learning Shield of Durand or after not taking damage for 12 seconds, Galio gains Anti-Magic Bulwark.
Anti-Magic Bulwark: Galio gains a  shield that exclusively blocks magic damage.

First Cast: Galio charges for up to 3 seconds,  grounding and  slowing himself by 15%, and gaining magic damage reduction and half of that amount as physical damage reduction. Charging increases Shield of Durand's radius, damage and  taunt duration.
Second Cast: Galio refreshes the damage reduction for 2 seconds,  taunts nearby enemies and sets their  movement speed to a static 60 for 0.5 − 1.5 (based on charge time) seconds.
Affected enemies take magic damage, increased by 0% − 200% (based on charge time).

W.notes:
Static movement speed means that the target is unable to modify it anymore (ex: with slow resist /  On the Hunt).
 This effect is negated only if the target is slow immune (ex:  Highlander).

 After the second cast, there is a brief period where other spells can only be buffered.
 Possible Bug: The ability key does not need to be held down when buffered in other abilities except from  Winds of War.
W.blurb: Galio charges a defensive stance, moving slowly. Upon releasing the charge, Galio will taunt nearby enemies.

W.name: Shield of Durand

effects.description: Passive: Upon learning Shield of Durand or after not taking damage for 12 seconds, Galio gains Anti-Magic Bulwark.
Anti-Magic Bulwark: Galio gains a  shield that exclusively blocks magic damage.

First Cast: Galio charges for up to 3 seconds,  grounding and  slowing himself by 15%, and gaining magic damage reduction and half of that amount as physical damage reduction. Charging increases Shield of Durand's radius, damage and  taunt duration.
Second Cast: Galio refreshes the damage reduction for 2 seconds,  taunts nearby enemies and sets their  movement speed to a static 60 for 0.5 − 1.5 (based on charge time) seconds.
Affected enemies take magic damage, increased by 0% − 200% (based on charge time).

W.notes:
Static movement speed means that the target is unable to modify it anymore (ex: with slow resist /  On the Hunt).
 This effect is negated only if the target is slow immune (ex:  Highlander).

 After the second cast, there is a brief period where other spells can only be buffered.
 Possible Bug: The ability key does not need to be held down when buffered in other abilities except from  Winds of War.
W.blurb: Galio charges a defensive stance, moving slowly. Upon releasing the charge, Galio will taunt nearby enemies.

E.name: Justice Punch

effects.description: Active: Galio steps backwards, and after 0.4 seconds he  dashes forward, though not through terrain.
He stops upon hitting an enemy champion, dealing them and all enemies along the way magic damage, while also  knocking them up for 0.75 seconds. Non-champions receive 50% reduced damage.

E.notes: Galio can cast movement effects during the ability, and buffers all other active effects.
E.blurb: Galio will briefly step back and charge, knocking up the first enemy champion he encounters.

R.name: Hero's Entrance

effects.description: Active: Galio designates the target allied champion's location at the time of cast as his landing spot,  channels for 1.25 seconds, and then  dashes to them, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies on impact and  knocking them up for 0.75 seconds.

R.notes:
Galio becomes completely  untargetable while in the air.
Galio cannot cast Hero's Entrance on allies at long distances while  nearsighted.
R.blurb: Galio grants damage reduction to an ally. After a delay Galio smashes down on the ally's original location, knocking up nearby enemies.

I.name: Trial by Fire

effects.description: Innate: Gangplank periodically empowers his next basic attack to burn the target, dealing 55 − 225 (based on level) (+ 100% bonus AD)  bonus true damage over 2.5 seconds, ticking every 0.25 seconds.  Turrets receive 50% reduced damage.

If Gangplank successfully hits a target with Trial by Fire, he gains  30% bonus movement speed for 2 seconds. Destroying a  Powder Keg resets the  cooldown for Trial by Fire and grants its  bonus movement speed.
Trial by Fire cannot be applied with  Parrrley or  Powder Keg.

I.notes: Unlike most damage over time debuffs, reapplying Trial by Fire before a previous application has run out will stack the full damage, instead of just refreshing the duration.
I.blurb: Every few seconds, Gangplank's melee strike will set his opponent on fire.

I.name: Trial by Fire

effects.description: Innate: Gangplank periodically empowers his next basic attack to burn the target, dealing 55 − 225 (based on level) (+ 100% bonus AD)  bonus true damage over 2.5 seconds, ticking every 0.25 seconds.  Turrets receive 50% reduced damage.

If Gangplank successfully hits a target with Trial by Fire, he gains  30% bonus movement speed for 2 seconds. Destroying a  Powder Keg resets the  cooldown for Trial by Fire and grants its  bonus movement speed.
Trial by Fire cannot be applied with  Parrrley or  Powder Keg.

I.notes: Unlike most damage over time debuffs, reapplying Trial by Fire before a previous application has run out will stack the full damage, instead of just refreshing the duration.
I.blurb: Every few seconds, Gangplank's melee strike will set his opponent on fire.

Q.name: Parrrley

effects.description: Active: Gangplank shoots the target enemy with his pistol, dealing  physical damage and applying on-hit effects.
Parrrley can  critically strike for (100% +  25%) AD bonus physical damage.
If Parrrley kills the target, Gangplank plunders  gold and  Silver Serpents, the latter of which can be spent to upgrade  Cannon Barrage.

Q.notes:
On-hit effects that deal area of effect damage will allow Parrrley to plunder from every enemy killed. This includes enemies killed by Gangplank's  Powder Keg's when activated by Parrrley.
 Parrrley doesn't count as a basic attack for  Guinsoo's Rageblade.
Q.blurb: Shoots target, plundering Gold for each enemy unit killed.

W.name: Remove Scurvy

effects.description: Active: Gangplank consumes a large quantity of citrus fruit,  cleansing himself from all  crowd control and  healing himself.

W.notes:
Remove Scurvy only removes crowd control debuffs (with the exception of  nearsight), so it cannot remove:
  Ignite's damage over time
  Exhaust's damage reduction
  Airborne crowd control effects (pull, knockback, knockup...)
  Malefic Visions
 Yet it is one of the few abilities that can remove  suppression.
  Nether Grasp and  Infinite Duress will still damage Gangplank even if he moves away.
W.blurb: Eats citrus to cure crowd control effects and restore Health.

E.name: Powder Keg

effects.description: Passive: Gangplank periodically stocks a Powder Keg, up to a maximum of 3.
Active: Gangplank places a Powder Keg at the target location for 25 seconds, which connects to other nearby Powder Kegs with overlapping explosion radii.

Gangplank and his enemies can attack the Powder Keg with basic attacks, dealing 1 damage per hit. Gangplank may also shoot the barrel with Parrrley. If Gangplank scores the killing blow, it explodes, also triggering a chain reaction that explodes nearby connected kegs. If killed by an enemy, the keg is safely dismantled.

An exploding keg deals the attack's damage to all nearby enemies, plus bonus physical damage against  champions, ignoring 40% of their armor, as well as  slowing them for 2 seconds. Enemies can only be damaged once per chain.

E.notes:
Placed barrels do not grant  vision.
 An exploding Powder Keg will splash  Parrrley bonus damage, and will also be modified if the attack critically strikes.
 An exploding Powder Keg's damage is not increased by most attack effects from runes or items, such as  Blade of the Ruined King or  Wit's End. There is a notable exception, however: the bonus damage from  Sheen (and its upgrades) will be splashed to all targets.
 The Powder Keg is classified as being hit for the purposes of triggering effects such as  Tiamat with the effects centered on the keg.
 Powder Keg applies spell effects.
E.blurb: Gangplank uncovers a powder keg at target location. If he attacks it, it explodes, spreading the attack's damage to enemies in the area, slowing them.

R.name: Cannon Barrage

effects.description: Active: Gangplank signals his ship off-shore to fire upon the target area for 8 seconds, calling down 12 waves of cannonballs in clusters of 3 every 2 seconds, and  revealing it for the duration. Each wave deals  magic damage to all enemies within the area and  slows them by 30% for 0.5 seconds.
Gangplank can purchase upgrades for his ship in the store at the cost of 500  Silver Serpents each, which improve Cannon Barrage:
Death's Daughter: An initial cannonball lands in the center of the barrage, dealing a cluster's worth of true damage to all enemies it hits and  slowing them by 60% for 1.5 seconds.

leveling.attribute: Total Magic Damage withFire at Will
Maximum Mixed Total Damage withFire at Will and Death's Daughter

effects.description: Raise Morale: The barrage grants allies  30% bonus movement speed while they are inside the area, persisting for 2 seconds after leaving it.
Fire at Will: Cannon Barrage fires[ 6 additional waves ][ 2 additional clusters ] over its duration.

R.notes: Cannon Barrage's slow lingers for 0.25 seconds after affected enemies leave the target area.
R.blurb: Gangplank signals his ship to bombard an area, slowing and damaging enemies.

I.name: Perseverance

effects.description: Innate: Garen  restores[ 1.5% −  10.1% (based on level) of his maximum health every 5 seconds ][ 0.15% −  1.01% (based on level) of his maximum health every 0.5 seconds ].
Perseverance is  interrupted for 7 seconds if Garen takes damage from epic  monsters,  turrets, or  champions, or if he is hit by an enemy ability.

I.notes: No additional details.
I.blurb: If Garen has not recently been struck by damage or enemy abilities, he regenerates a percentage of his total health each second. Minion damage does not stop Perseverance.

Q.name: Decisive Strike

effects.description: Active: Garen  cleanses himself of all  slows and gains  30% bonus movement speed for a few seconds.
Additionally, Garen's next basic attack within 4.5 seconds  lunges him towards the target, dealing  bonus physical damage and  silencing the target for 1.5 seconds.
Decisive Strike resets Garen's basic attack timer.

Q.notes:
Decisive Strike does not interrupt Garen's previous orders.
 The enhanced attack will apply other on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal (the bonus damage does not).
 The bonus damage will also apply  life steal.
 The bonus damage is applied to structures.

 If the  slow has a  cripple effect within it, it will also be removed together with the slow.
 For example, it will remove  cripple from  Nasus'  Wither, but not from  Malphite's  Ground Slam.
 Decisive Strike will remove  slow from  Exhaust, but not the damage reduction, for it being two separate effects within one summoner spell.
 It will remove the slow from  Red Buff, but not the damage over time.

 Decisive Strike does not protect Garen from re-application of  slows on him.
 Area of effect  slows (like  Trundle's  Pillar of Ice) are re-applied immediately after removing if Garen stays in the corresponding area.

 Garen can  lunge over very thin terrain if he attacks with a fully charged  Rapid Firecannon.
 PENDING FOR TEST : Can he go through very thin terrain without it?
Q.blurb: Garen gains a burst of movement speed, breaking free of all slows affecting him. His next attack strikes a vital area of his foe, dealing bonus damage and silencing them.

W.name: Courage

effects.description: Passive: Garen permanently gains  0.25 bonus armor and  0.25 bonus magic resistance every time he kills an enemy, up to a maximum of 30 bonus resistances at 120 unit kills.
After reaching maximum stacks, gains an additional 10% bonus armor and 10% bonus magic resistance.
Active: Garen reduces incoming damage by 30% for a few seconds. For the first 0.75 seconds, Garen is additionally  shielded and gains 60%  tenacity.

W.notes:
Courage does not interrupt Garen's previous orders.
 Courage's bonus resistances are only gained when it is ranked up at least once, but Courage's passive is retroactive.
 Any enemy unit counts towards Courage's bonus resistances: champions, minions, monsters (including epic ones), summoned units and turrets. The bonus is equal in all these cases.
 Courage will only grant bonus resistances from units killed by Garen himself.  Eye of the Herald and  Spoils of War of allies do not count.
W.blurb: Garen passively increases his armor and magic resist by killing enemies. He may also activate this ability to give him a huge burst of Tenacity and damage reduction for a brief moment followed by a lesser amount of damage reduction for a longer duration.

E.name: Judgment

effects.description: Active: Garen becomes  ghosted and rapidly spins his sword around his body 7 −  ∞ (based on bonus attack speed) times over 3 seconds, dealing physical damage with each spin to nearby enemies. Judgment can  critically strike for (50% +  25%) bonus physical damage. The total damage is increased by 50% against non-epic monsters.
The nearest enemy is dealt 25% bonus damage per spin. Enemy champions hit 6 times have their  armor reduced by 25% for 6 seconds. Hits after the 6th refresh the duration of the debuff.
After 1 second, Garen can reactivate to cancel it immediately, reducing its  cooldown by its remaining duration.

E.notes:
Each spin triggers a stack of  Conqueror.
 Silencing Garen will prevent him from deactivating the ability early.
 Judgment cancels Garen's last movement command upon ending.
 Each spin deals damage simultaneously to all enemies within its range when the spin is completed.
 The spin animation is capped at once per 0.2 seconds, but the amount of ticks will keep on scaling.
 The armor reduction stacks multiplicatively with other percentage armor penetration effects.
E.blurb: Garen performs a dance of death with his sword, dealing damage around him for the duration and shredding the armor of enemy champions hit.

E.name: Judgment

effects.description: Active: Garen becomes  ghosted and rapidly spins his sword around his body 7 −  ∞ (based on bonus attack speed) times over 3 seconds, dealing physical damage with each spin to nearby enemies. Judgment can  critically strike for (50% +  25%) bonus physical damage. The total damage is increased by 50% against non-epic monsters.
The nearest enemy is dealt 25% bonus damage per spin. Enemy champions hit 6 times have their  armor reduced by 25% for 6 seconds. Hits after the 6th refresh the duration of the debuff.
After 1 second, Garen can reactivate to cancel it immediately, reducing its  cooldown by its remaining duration.

E.notes:
Each spin triggers a stack of  Conqueror.
 Silencing Garen will prevent him from deactivating the ability early.
 Judgment cancels Garen's last movement command upon ending.
 Each spin deals damage simultaneously to all enemies within its range when the spin is completed.
 The spin animation is capped at once per 0.2 seconds, but the amount of ticks will keep on scaling.
 The armor reduction stacks multiplicatively with other percentage armor penetration effects.
E.blurb: Garen performs a dance of death with his sword, dealing damage around him for the duration and shredding the armor of enemy champions hit.

R.name: Demacian Justice

effects.description: Active: Garen gains  true sight of the target champion for 1 second, dealing them  true damage after a 0.5 second delay.

R.notes:
Demacian Justice is cancelled and does not go on  cooldown under the following circumstances:
 The target becomes  untargetable.
 The target leaves  sight range while Garen is  nearsighted.
 The target is killed.

 Garen can  Flash during the cast time without cancelling the ability.
R.blurb: The enemy champion with the most recent kills is the Villain. Garen's attacks deal additional true damage to that champion. Garen can call upon the might of Demacia to deal a finishing blow to an enemy champion that deals damage based upon how much health his target has missing. This damage is true damage against the Villain.

I.name: Rage Gene

effects.description: Innate - Mini Gnar: While in Mini Gnar form, he gains bonus  movement speed,  attack range, attack speed growth and  attack speed.

Innate - Rage Gene: Mini Gnar generates 4 / 7 / 11 (based on level)  Rage over 2 seconds upon dealing or receiving damage. Against non-champions, basic attacks and  Boomerang Throw instantly generate [ 0.5 / 0.875 / 1.375 (based on level) Rage ][ 12.5% of the amount ]. Against champions,  Boomerang Throw instantly generates [ 1 / 1.75 / 2.75 (based on level) Rage ][ 25% of the amount ], and basic attacks instantly generate [ 2 / 3.5 / 5.5 (based on level) ][ 50% of the amount ].  Boomerang Throw can only generate Rage once per cast, and grants Rage based on the first enemy hit. Gnar's Rage decays if he has not dealt or taken damage in the last 13 seconds.

At maximum  Rage, casting an ability or after 4 seconds will  transform him into  Mega Gnar for 15 seconds, during which Gnar's Rage depletes. Afterwards Gnar returns to Mini Gnar and is too  tired to generate Rage for 15 seconds. Gnar retains his  current percentage health when he returns to Mini Gnar.

Innate - Mega Gnar: Mega Gnar has different abilities, although they share Mini Gnar's ability cooldowns. While in Mega Gnar form, he loses all Mini Gnar's buffs and instead has increased  base AD,  base health,  base armor, and  base magic resistance. Gnar restores  health equal to the increase.

I.notes:
The Rage generated upon dealing or receiving damage occurs over 2 seconds with 4 ticks every 0.5 seconds. It also does not stack but instead refreshes with subsequent applications (of dealing or receiving damage).
 The bonus rage generation on basic attacks counts as an on-hit effect, and is triggered by  Runaan's Hurricane and  Guinsoo's Rageblade.
 In-game, the value on the Rage bar always displays rounded down to the nearest integer.
  Mega Gnar's gained health is not affected by  Grievous Wounds or increased healing from items and runes.
 When returning to  Mini Gnar, Gnar will only retain his current health percentage, not current health total.
 This is intentional to prevent Gnar from simply triggering Rage Gene in order to heal himself over time.

  tired is treated as a self-cast buff. As such, the 15 seconds that it lasts for can not be reduced by cooldown reduction or  cleansed.
 Gnar's abilities share cooldowns across forms.
 The final stats, after Rage Gene being applied, can be seen on Gnar and Mega Gnar respective data template, in the front page.
 Mini Gnar gains 5.5% − 99% (based on level) bonus attack speed.
 Mega Gnar gains 100 − 831 (based on level) base health, 3.5 − 54.5 (based on level) base armor, 3.5 − 63 (based on level) base magic resistance, and 6 − 48.5 (based on level) base attack damage.
I.blurb: While in combat Gnar generates Rage. At maximum Rage his next ability will transform him into Mega Gnar, granting increased survivability and access to new spells.

Q.name: Boomerang Throw

effects.description: Active: Gnar throws a boomerang forward in a line that deals  physical damage and  slows enemies for 2 seconds. The boomerang returns towards Gnar in a fixed line after reaching its maximum range or hitting an enemy, dealing 50% damage to subsequent targets.
Each enemy can only be hit once. Catching the boomerang while in mid-air refunds 40% of its  maximum cooldown.

Q.notes:
The boomerang return direction is determined by which direction Gnar is heading, similar to  Draven's  Spinning Axe, and is calculated at the apex of its flight.
 Since the cooldown between the two is shared Mini Gnar may pick up a boulder and/or Mega Gnar may catch a boomerang.
 The boomerang can only be caught on its return trajectory.
 If Gnar is dashing, is displaced, or casts flash during the cast time, the boomerang will be launched from the position where he was at the start of the cast time.
Q.blurb: Gnar throws a boomerang that damages and slows enemies it hits before returning to him. If he catches the boomerang its cooldown is reduced.

Q.name: Boulder Toss

effects.description: Active: Gnar throws a boulder that stops when it hits an enemy, applying  Boomerang Throw's  slow to all nearby enemies and dealing physical damage.
Gnar can pick up the boulder by moving within 90 units of it, refunding 60% of its  maximum cooldown.

Q.notes:
Since the cooldown between the two is shared Mini Gnar may pick up a boulder and/or Mega Gnar may catch a boomerang.
 Gnar is locked out of picking up his boulder for 0.3 seconds after throwing it.
 The  Boulder will stop if colliding with  Wind Wall or  Unbreakable.
Q.blurb: Mega Gnar instead throws a boulder that stops on the first unit hit, damaging and slowing everything nearby. It can then be picked up to reduce the cooldown.

W.name: Hyper

effects.description: Passive: Every  third attack or ability on the same target within 3.5 seconds deals  bonus magic damage and grants Gnar 30 / 45 / 60 / 75% (based on  GNAR!'s rank)  bonus movement speed that decays over 3 seconds. The damage is capped at 300 (+ 100% AP) against  monsters.
Gnar gains Hyper's  bonus movement speed when he leaves  Mega form.

W.notes: PENDING FOR TEST: Hyper's  interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects via basic attack.
W.blurb: Gnar's attacks and spells hype him up, dealing bonus damage and granting him Movement Speed.

W.name: Wallop

effects.description: Active: Gnar slams in the target direction, dealing physical damage to all enemies struck and  stunning them for 1.25 seconds.

W.notes: No additional details.
W.blurb: Mega Gnar is too enraged to be hyper and instead can rear up on his hind legs and smash down on the area in front of him, stunning enemies in an area.

E.name: Hop

effects.description: Active: Gnar  leaps to a target location, gaining  bonus attack speed for 3 seconds.
If Gnar lands on a unit he will  bounce 525 units further in the same direction.
Landing on an enemy deals physical damage and  slows it by 80% for 0.5 seconds.

E.notes: Hop does not allow Gnar to bounce off wards.
E.blurb: Gnar leaps to a location and bounces off the head of any unit he lands on, traveling further.

E.name: Crunch

effects.description: Active: Gnar  leaps to a target location and deals Hop's damage to nearby enemies on landing.
If Crunch is used to transform, Gnar will still be able to  bounce as per  Hop. Crunch's area of effect is dealt in both areas, though enemies can only be damaged once.
Enemies Gnar lands directly on top of are dealt Hop's  slow.

E.notes: Gnar is locked out of using any other abilities during Crunch, but he can still transform mid-air if he reaches 100 Rage during the jump of Hop.
E.blurb: Mega Gnar is too large to bounce and instead lands with earth-shattering force, dealing damage in an area around him.

E.name: Crunch

effects.description: Active: Gnar  leaps to a target location and deals Hop's damage to nearby enemies on landing.
If Crunch is used to transform, Gnar will still be able to  bounce as per  Hop. Crunch's area of effect is dealt in both areas, though enemies can only be damaged once.
Enemies Gnar lands directly on top of are dealt Hop's  slow.

E.notes: Gnar is locked out of using any other abilities during Crunch, but he can still transform mid-air if he reaches 100 Rage during the jump of Hop.
E.blurb: Mega Gnar is too large to bounce and instead lands with earth-shattering force, dealing damage in an area around him.

R.name: GNAR!

effects.description: Mini Gnar - Passive: Increases  Hyper's  bonus movement speed.
Mega Gnar - Active: After 0.4-seconds, Gnar  knocks nearby enemies up to 590 units in the target direction, dealing physical damage and  slowing them by 45%.
Enemies that hit a wall take 50% bonus damage and are  stunned instead of  slowed.

R.notes: GNAR!'s active also stuns enemies hitting impassable player-created terrain ( Crystallize,  Emperor's Divide,  Cataclysm,  Pillar of Ice).
R.blurb: Mega Gnar throws everything around him in a chosen direction, dealing damage and slowing them. Any enemy that hits a wall is stunned and takes bonus damage.
