 With  Runaan's Hurricane  Pow-Pow generates one stack per enemy hit.
 Both weapons apply on-hit effects (the splash damage of  Fishbones does not) and can  critically strike.  Fishbones's bonus damage also applies  life steal.
 Each of  Runaan's Hurricane's additional bolts apply  Fishbones' splash damage, which stacks with each other.
 Damage for  Fishbones: 110% AD (100% + 10%).
 Critical strike damage for  Fishbones: 220% AD ((100% + 10%) × 2).
 Critical strike damage for  Fishbones with  Infinity Edge: 247.5% AD ((100% + 10%) × 2.25).
 Damage per  Fishbones  bolt: 44% AD ((100% + 10%) ×  0.4).
 Critical strike damage per  Fishbones  bolt: 88% AD (((100% + 10%) ×  0.4) × 2).
 Critical strike damage per  Fishbones  bolt with  Infinity Edge: 99% AD (((100% + 10%) ×  0.4) × 2.25).
 Potential damage on stacked enemies with  Fishbones and  Runaan's Hurricane: 198% AD (110% + 44% + 44%).
 Potential critical strike damage on stacked enemies with  Fishbones and  Runaan's Hurricane: 396% AD (220% + 88% + 88%).
 Potential critical strike damage on stacked enemies with  Fishbones,  Runaan's Hurricane, and  Infinity Edge: 445.5% AD ((247.5% + 99% + 99%)).
Q.blurb: Jinx modifies her basic attacks by swapping between Pow-Pow, her minigun and Fishbones, her rocket launcher. Attacks with Pow-Pow grant Attack Speed, while attacks with Fishbones deal area of effect damage, gain increased range, and drain Mana.

W.name: Zap!

effects.description: Active: After 0.6 − 0.4 (based on bonus attack speed) seconds, Jinx fires a shock blast that deals physical damage to the first enemy it hits,  revealing and  slowing them for 2 seconds.

W.blurb: Jinx uses Zapper, her shock pistol, to fire a blast that deals damage to the first enemy hit, slowing and revealing it.

E.name: Flame Chompers!

effects.description: Active: Jinx tosses out 3 Chompers that arm after 0.7 seconds and explode after 5 seconds, dealing magic damage over 1.5 seconds to all enemies within a small area.
Chompers prematurely explode on  enemy champion contact,  knocking down and  rooting them for the same duration. A champion can set off only a single Chomper and be damaged by one.

E.notes:
Casting Flame Chompers! will not interrupt Jinx's orders.
 Chompers will halt when encountering  Wind Wall and  Unbreakable.
E.blurb: Jinx throws out a line of snare grenades that explode after 5 seconds, lighting enemies on fire. Flame Chompers will bite enemy champions who walk over them, rooting them in place.

E.name: Flame Chompers!

effects.description: Active: Jinx tosses out 3 Chompers that arm after 0.7 seconds and explode after 5 seconds, dealing magic damage over 1.5 seconds to all enemies within a small area.
Chompers prematurely explode on  enemy champion contact,  knocking down and  rooting them for the same duration. A champion can set off only a single Chomper and be damaged by one.

E.notes:
Casting Flame Chompers! will not interrupt Jinx's orders.
 Chompers will halt when encountering  Wind Wall and  Unbreakable.
E.blurb: Jinx throws out a line of snare grenades that explode after 5 seconds, lighting enemies on fire. Flame Chompers will bite enemy champions who walk over them, rooting them in place.

R.name: Super Mega Death Rocket!

effects.description: Active: Jinx fires a  rocket in the target direction, briefly  revealing the area it flies through. The rocket explodes upon enemy champion contact, dealing physical damage and briefly revealing the area around them.
The rocket deals 10% − 100% (based on distance traveled) of its flat damage.
Enemies surrounding the main target also take 80% damage.

R.notes: Spell Shield will block the impact damage, but will not prevent the explosion.
R.blurb: Jinx fires a super rocket across the map that gains damage as it travels. The rocket will explode upon colliding with an enemy champion, dealing damage to it and surrounding enemies based on their missing Health.

I.name: Second Skin

effects.description: Innate: Kai'Sa's basic attacks deal 4 − 10 (based on level) (+ 1 − 5 (based on level) per Plasma stack) (+ 10% − 20% (based on Plasma stacks) AP)  bonus magic damage.

Innate - Caustic Wounds: Kai'Sa's basic attacks,  Void Seeker, and nearby allies'  immobilizing effects mark enemies with Plasma for 4 seconds, stacking up to 4 times. Kai'Sa's attacks or  Void Seeker can then rupture enemies with 4 Plasma, consuming them to deal 15% (+ 2.5% per 100 AP) of the target's missing health magic damage, capped at 400 against monsters.

Innate - Living Weapon: Upon gaining a set amount of permanent stats from items and stat growth, Kai'Sa can evolve the related basic ability. This has a channel time of 2 seconds, and the upgrade is lost if the stat requirement is no longer met.

I.notes:
Allied  immobilizing effects cannot rupture the Plasma.
 Plasma which exceed the 5th stack are applied normally.
 Stats from runes do not count toward the minimum requirement to upgrade a basic ability.

Q.name: Icathian Rain

effects.description: Active: Kai'Sa releases a swarm of 6 missiles that evenly distributes among nearby  visible enemies, each dealing  physical damage.  Minions below  35% health take double damage.
Non-minions take 25% damage from missiles beyond their first.
Living Weapon: Requires  100 − 72 (based on level) bonus attack damage to upgrade – Icathian Rain fires 10 missiles.

Q.notes:
Spell shields only block the damage from a single missile.
 Icathian Rain has no cast time and does not interrupt Kai'Sa's previous orders.
 Icathian Rain acquires its targets upon cast. Moving will not change its targets.

 Charging  Supercharge will not stop the missiles from firing.

Q.name: Icathian Rain

effects.description: Active: Kai'Sa releases a swarm of 6 missiles that evenly distributes among nearby  visible enemies, each dealing  physical damage.  Minions below  35% health take double damage.
Non-minions take 25% damage from missiles beyond their first.
Living Weapon: Requires  100 − 72 (based on level) bonus attack damage to upgrade – Icathian Rain fires 10 missiles.

Q.notes:
Spell shields only block the damage from a single missile.
 Icathian Rain has no cast time and does not interrupt Kai'Sa's previous orders.
 Icathian Rain acquires its targets upon cast. Moving will not change its targets.

 Charging  Supercharge will not stop the missiles from firing.

W.name: Void Seeker

effects.description: Active: Kai'Sa fires a Void blast in the target direction, stopping at the first enemy hit, dealing magic damage, gaining  true sight of them for 4 seconds and applying 2 Plasma.
Living Weapon: Requires  100 ability power to upgrade – Void Seeker applies 3 Plasma and refunds 50% of the  cooldown against  champions.

W.notes:
If the stacks detonate Plasma, any remaining stacks are reapplied afterwards.
 Void Seeker also deals Second Skin's damage based on Plasma stacks on the target.
 This increases the base damage by Second Skin's base damage, and further increased by at least 22.5% AP (10% + 12.5%), and up to 37.5% AP (17.5% + 20%).
 When evolved, the AP ratio increases by at least 37.5% AP (10% + 12.5% + 15%), and up to 52.5% AP (15% + 17.5% + 20%).

W.name: Void Seeker

effects.description: Active: Kai'Sa fires a Void blast in the target direction, stopping at the first enemy hit, dealing magic damage, gaining  true sight of them for 4 seconds and applying 2 Plasma.
Living Weapon: Requires  100 ability power to upgrade – Void Seeker applies 3 Plasma and refunds 50% of the  cooldown against  champions.

W.notes:
If the stacks detonate Plasma, any remaining stacks are reapplied afterwards.
 Void Seeker also deals Second Skin's damage based on Plasma stacks on the target.
 This increases the base damage by Second Skin's base damage, and further increased by at least 22.5% AP (10% + 12.5%), and up to 37.5% AP (17.5% + 20%).
 When evolved, the AP ratio increases by at least 37.5% AP (10% + 12.5% + 15%), and up to 52.5% AP (15% + 17.5% + 20%).

E.name: Supercharge

effects.description: Active: Kai'Sa  charges for 1.2 − 0.6 (based on bonus attack speed) seconds, gaining  bonus movement speed, increased by 0% − 100% (based on bonus attack speed).
After charging up, Kai'Sa gains  bonus attack speed and her windup percentage is reduced to 6.44% for 4 seconds.
Supercharge's  cooldown is reduced by 0.5 seconds on-attack.
Living Weapon: Requires  100% − 70% (based on level) bonus attack speed to upgrade – Supercharge grants  invisibility for 0.5 seconds.

E.notes: No additional details.

E.name: Supercharge

effects.description: Active: Kai'Sa  charges for 1.2 − 0.6 (based on bonus attack speed) seconds, gaining  bonus movement speed, increased by 0% − 100% (based on bonus attack speed).
After charging up, Kai'Sa gains  bonus attack speed and her windup percentage is reduced to 6.44% for 4 seconds.
Supercharge's  cooldown is reduced by 0.5 seconds on-attack.
Living Weapon: Requires  100% − 70% (based on level) bonus attack speed to upgrade – Supercharge grants  invisibility for 0.5 seconds.

E.notes: No additional details.

R.name: Killer Instinct

effects.description: Active: Kai'Sa  shields herself and  dashes to a target location near an enemy champion recently affected by Plasma. The shield holds for 2 seconds upon arrival.

R.notes:
Kai'Sa will issue a movement command to the targeted location regardless of whether the target location is valid. The dash is not buffered during this movement command. Kai'Sa will not dash if the targeted location becomes valid by walking in range or a nearby enemy champion becomes affected by plasma.
 If the targeted location is not valid, the range indicator will glow.
 The enemy champion recently affected by plasma must be in range of Kai'Sa for the targeted location to be valid, and not the targeted location itself.

I.name: Martial Poise

effects.description:
Innate: Kalista's basic attacks have unique properties:
 Deals 90% AD physical damage.
  Miss if she loses  sight of her target before they hit.
 Cannot cancel their wind-up, but can select a new target within range.
 Makes her  dash in the target direction after issuing a movement command during a wind-up or right after casting  Pierce.
 The distance scales with her boots tier. The wind-up while dashing is only reduced by 0.66% per  1% bonus attack speed.
Innate - Oathsworn Bond: Kalista begins the game with  Black Spear, a unique item.

I.notes:
Black Spear can not be used on decoys. Targeting those will put the item on a 10 seconds cooldown.
 The dash speed is affected by movement speed modifiers and so it will be reduced by  Slow.
I.blurb: Enter a movement command while winding up Kalista's basic attack or Pierce to lunge a short distance when she launches her attack.

Q.name: Pierce

effects.description: Active: Kalista hurls a fast and narrow spear, dealing  physical damage to the first enemy hit.

If Pierce kills its target, the spear continues onward, transferring all of the dead victim's  Rend stacks to the next enemy it hits. This can repeat indefinitely until the spear reaches its maximum distance.

Q.notes: No additional details.
Q.blurb: Throw a fast moving spear that passes through enemies it kills.

W.name: Sentinel

effects.description: Passive - Soul-Marked: While Kalista and her  Oathsworn are linked, their basic attacks and  Pierce apply a Soul-Mark to their targets.

If both Soul-Marks are applied within 4 seconds, the target takes  bonus magic damage (capped against non-champions), and cannot be Soul-Marked for 10 seconds. Soul-Mark deals 75 minimum damage to  minions and executes them if they're below  125 health.
Passive: Kalista periodically stocks a Sentinel charge, up to a maximum of 2.
Active: Kalista summons a Sentinel to  patrol along the target area.

W.notes:
Soul-Marked's bonus damage is credited to Kalista and will benefit from both her  magic penetration and spell effects.
 If her  Oathsworn ally scores a kill using Soul-Marked's bonus damage they will get a message stating 'Kill Secured' in place of the usual gold pop-up (the gold itself is credited to Kalista).

 The Sentinel's  sight reveal on  enemy champions is accredited for assists and potentially kills (if they die shortly after being spotted).
W.blurb: Passively gain Attack Speed when near her Oathsworn ally, and deal bonus damage when striking the same target. Activate to send a soul to scout out the path, revealing the area in front of it.

E.name: Rend

effects.description: Passive: Kalista's basic attacks and  Pierce each lodge a spear in the target for 4 seconds, stacking up to 254 times.

Active: Kalista rips all lodged spears from nearby enemies, dealing physical damage and  slowing them for 2 seconds. The damage is increased with additional spears, but with reduced efficiency. Rend deals 50% reduced damage against epic  monsters.
Rend resets its  cooldown and refunds  mana if it kills at least one target.

There must be at least one lodged spear nearby for Rend to be cast. In-flight spears at time of cast will empower to apply Rend's damage to their targets. If an empowered spear kills a target, Rend's refunds will still apply.

E.notes:
Rend at maximum stacks will deal a total of 2550 / 3572 / 4847 / 6375 / 8156 (+ 5069.4 / 6068.244 / 7016.994 / 7965.744 / 8914.494% AD) physical damage.
 The cooldown will not reset if the target is protected by  resurrection effects.
 If Rend is used against  Sion under the effects of  Glory in Death, the cooldown will reset even if it does not kill him.
E.blurb: Attacks impale their targets with spears. Activate to rip the spears out, slowing and dealing escalating damage.

R.name: Fate's Call

effects.description: Active: Kalista invokes her  link, retrieving her Oathsworn and carrying them in  stasis for 4 seconds.

Kalista's Oathsworn can emerge to a target location, stopping at the first enemy hit,  knocking up all surrounding enemies and landing themselves at their basic attack range relative to the target hit.

R.notes:
Fate's Call will wait for the Oathsworn ally to finish their channels before holding them.
 The Oathsworn ally is  untargetable and  invisible so long as they remain held by Fate's Call, represented by a light over Kalista's head until they dash.
 Kalista's death does not  cancel Fate's Call.
R.blurb: Kalista teleports the Oathsworn ally to herself. They gain the ability to Launch toward a position, knocking enemy champions back.

I.name: Gathering Fire

effects.description: Innate: Karma reduces  Mantra's  cooldown by 2 / 3 / 4 (based on level) seconds every time she damages an enemy  champion with an ability, or by 1 / 1.5 / 2 (based on level) with her basic attacks on-hit.

I.notes:
Inner Flame /  Soulflare reduces  Mantra's cooldown per target hit (for a total of 10 / 15 / 20 (based on level) seconds if 5 enemy champions are hit at once).
  Focused Resolve /  Renewal reduces  Mantra's cooldown per tick (for a total of 4 / 6 / 8 (based on level) seconds for the entire duration).
  Inspire /  Defiance does not reduce  Mantra's cooldown (it has no damage component).
I.blurb: Reduces Mantra's cooldown each time Karma damages an enemy champion with one of her abilities (Half-effect for Karma's basic attacks)

Q.name: Inner Flame

effects.description: Active: Karma fires a burst of spiritual energy in the target direction, detonating with the first enemy hit, dealing  magic damage and  slowing all enemies around the target by 35% for 1.5 seconds.

Q.notes: Spell shield will block the initial impact from Inner Flame.
Q.blurb: Karma sends forth a ball of spirit energy that explodes and deals damage upon hitting an enemy unit. Mantra Bonus: In addition to the explosion, Mantra increases the destructive power of her Inner Flame, creating a cataclysm which deals damage after a short delay.

Q.name: Soulflare

effects.description: Mantra - Active: Inner Flame detonates upon hitting an enemy or reaching maximum range, dealing bonus magic damage in an increased  area.
A field lingers around the detonation for 1.5 seconds,  slowing enemies by 50%, after which it explodes, dealing magic damage to all enemies inside.
Soulflare scales with  Mantra's rank.

Q.notes:
Spell shield will block the initial impact from either ability but will not block Soulflare's field damage.
 The lingering field will place under the impacted enemy, rather than the impact point.

W.name: Focused Resolve

effects.description: Active: Karma exerts her will over a target enemy champion or monster, dealing magic damage and forming a tether between them for up to 2 seconds, during which the target is  revealed.
If the tether holds for the duration, the target is dealt the same magic damage and is  revealed and  rooted for a duration.

W.notes: Spell shield will only block the tether's application, not the rooting from an already-applied one.
W.blurb: Karma creates a tether between herself and a targeted enemy, dealing damage and revealing them. If the tether is not broken, the enemy will be rooted and damaged again. Mantra Bonus: Karma strengthens the link, healing herself and extending the root duration.

W.name: Renewal

effects.description: Mantra - Active: Focused Resolve's  root duration is increased, and  heals Karma for  20% (+ 1% per 100 AP) of missing health on-cast and once more when the target is  rooted, or if the target  dies while tethered.
Renewal scales with  Mantra's rank.

W.notes: Spell shield will only block the tether's application, not the rooting from an already-applied one.

E.name: Inspire

effects.description: Active: Karma  shields the target allied champion or herself for 2.5 seconds, granting them  bonus movement speed for 1.5 seconds.

E.notes: Inspire has no cast time and does not interrupt Karma's previous orders.
E.blurb: Karma summons a protective shield that absorbs incoming damage and increases the Movement Speed of the protected ally. Mantra Bonus: Energy radiates out from her target, strengthening the initial shield and applying Inspire to nearby allied champions.

effects.description: Mantra - Active: Inspire's target receives bonus shield, and the effects are extended to allied champions near it, except they only gain 30% of the shield amount.
Defiance scales with  Mantra's rank.

R.name: Mantra

effects.description: Active: Karma empowers her next basic ability within 8 seconds for an additional effect.
Karma begins the game with one rank in Mantra.

R.notes:
Mantra has no cast time, does not interrupt Karma's previous orders and can be used while crowd controlled.
 Mantra's bonus effects are added on top of Karma's basic abilities.
 Mantra's cooldown begins on-cast, not when its effect is consumed.
R.blurb: Karma empowers her next ability to do an additional effect. Mantra is available at level 1 and does not require a skill point.

I.name: Death Defied

effects.description: Innate: Upon taking fatal damage, Karthus remains active for 7 seconds, rendering himself unable to move, attack, or use active items, but becoming  untargetable and  invulnerable for the duration as well as being able to use abilities at no cost.
If  Defile has been learned, it will remain toggled on for Death Defied's entire duration at no mana cost.

I.notes:
Death Defied will always trigger after revival effects ( Guardian Angel,  Chronoshift).
 Death Defied will still trigger if Karthus is killed by the Nexus Obelisk.

 At the start of Death Defied, Karthus is set to  1 health.
 Karthus can still regenerate his health over the duration, but he will always die at the end of it.
 Due to this fact, Karthus gains large benefit from  Last Stand for most of his passive.

 Karthus will still benefit from  cooldown reduction during Death Defied.
 After Death Defied ends, the corpse of Karthus will retain unit collision despite being dead on the ground.
I.blurb: Upon dying, Karthus enters a spirit form that allows him to continue casting spells for 7 seconds.

Q.name: Lay Waste

effects.description: Active: Karthus briefly  reveals the target area which he detonates after a 0.5-second delay, dealing  magic damage to all enemies within, doubled when hitting only one target.

Q.notes:
Applies  spell damage if it hits a single target and  area damage if it hits multiple targets.
 Lay Waste plays a different sound effect and uses a cosmetic critical strike when it only hits one target.
Q.blurb: Karthus unleashes a delayed blast at a location, dealing damage to nearby enemies.

W.name: Wall of Pain

effects.description: Active: Karthus creates a passable wall of energy at the target location for 5 seconds, granting  sight around its pillars.
For the duration, any enemy unit who crosses it is both  slowed for 4 seconds, decaying over its duration, and  loses 15% magic resistance for the same duration.
Each unit can only be affected once per cast.

W.notes: The wall casts perpendicular to Karthus'  location.
W.blurb: Karthus creates a passable screen of leeching energy. Any enemy units that walk through the screen have their Movement Speed and Magic Resist reduced for a period.

E.name: Defile

effects.description: Toggle Off: Karthus restores  mana whenever he kills a unit.
Toggle On: Karthus deals magic damage per second to all nearby units.

E.notes:
Defile also restores  mana if Karthus destroys an enemy structure.
 Defile will automatically toggle on during  Death Defied.
E.blurb: Karthus passively steals energy from his victims, gaining Mana on each kill. Alternatively, Karthus can surround himself in the souls of his prey, dealing damage to nearby enemies, but quickly draining his own Mana.

R.name: Requiem

effects.description: Active: Karthus channels for 3 seconds and deals magic damage to all targetable enemy  champions upon its completion.

R.notes:
Requiem's channel is telegraphed to all enemy champions by a beam of light that descends on all targets.
 There is no visible beam if the enemy champion respawns during Requiem's channel, yet damage is applied normally.

 Karthus cannot cast Requiem if  Death Defied's duration is less than 3 seconds.
R.blurb: After channeling for 3 seconds, Karthus deals damage to all enemy champions.

I.name: Void Stone

effects.description: Innate: Kassadin is permanently  ghosted and takes 15% reduced  magic damage.

I.notes: No additional details.
I.blurb: Kassadin takes 15% reduced magic damage and ignores unit collision.

Q.name: Null Sphere

effects.description: Active: Kassadin fires an orb of void energy at the target enemy, dealing magic damage and  disrupting ongoing  channels on them.
The excess energy forms around Kassadin, granting him a  shield that exclusively absorbs magic damage for 1.5 seconds.

Q.notes: No additional details.
Q.blurb: Kassadin fires an orb of void energy at a target, dealing damage and interrupting channels. The excess energy forms around himself, granting a temporary shield that absorbs magic damage.

W.name: Nether Blade

effects.description: Passive: Kassadin's basic attacks deal 20 (+ 10% AP) bonus magic damage.
Active: Kassadin's next basic attack against non- structures gains  50 bonus range, deals increased bonus magic damage and restores  mana, with the amount quintupled against  champions.
Nether Blade resets Kassadin's autoattack timer.

W.notes:
The enhanced attack will apply other on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal.
 Nether Blade will not grant mana if the attack is  dodged or if it  misses, but will do so if the attack is  blocked. In all cases the damage is parried.
 The passive damage will affect structures but the active one will not.
  Spell shield will block the active damage but not the passive one.
W.blurb: Passive: Kassadin's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage. Active: Kassadin's next basic attack deals significant bonus magic damage and restores Mana.

E.name: Force Pulse

effects.description: Passive: Kassadin gains a Void Energy stack each time a nearby champion, including himself, uses an ability, up to 6. At 6 stacks, Kassadin gains the ability to cast Force Pulse.
Active: Kassadin emits a pulse of void energy, dealing magic damage to all enemies in a cone in the target direction and  slowing them for 1 second.

E.notes: Toggle abilities do not grant any Void Energy stacks for Force Pulse.
E.blurb: Kassadin draws energy from spells cast in his vicinity. Upon charging up, Kassadin can use Force Pulse to damage and slow enemies in a cone in front of him.

R.name: Riftwalk

effects.description: Active: After a small delay, Kassadin  blinks to the target location, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies on arrival.
Each subsequent Riftwalk within 15 seconds doubles its mana cost and increases its damage, stacking up to 4 times.

R.notes: No additional details.
R.blurb: Kassadin teleports to a nearby location dealing damage to nearby enemy units. Multiple Riftwalks in a short period of time cost additional Mana but also deal additional damage.

I.name: Voracity

effects.description: Innate: Whenever an enemy champion dies within 3 seconds of Katarina damaging them, her abilities'  cooldowns are reduced by 15 seconds.

Innate - Sinister Steel: Whenever Katarina retrieves a Dagger, she uses it to slash through all nearby enemies, dealing 68 − 240 (based on level) (+ 100% bonus AD) (+ 55 / 70 / 85 / 100% (based on level) AP)  magic damage and reducing  Shunpo's  cooldown by 78 / 84 / 90 / 96% (based on level).
Daggers last 4 seconds before disappearing.

I.notes:
Voracity's cooldown reduction will still take effect even after Katarina dies.
 Decoys count as champions for the takedown effect.
 Katarina can use Shunpo on Daggers in mid-air.
 However, the damage will not apply until it lands.
I.blurb: Whenever an enemy champion dies that Katarina has damaged in the last 3 seconds, her ability cooldowns are reduced by 15 seconds. If Katarina picks up a Dagger, she uses it to slash through all nearby enemies, dealing magic damage.

I.name: Voracity

effects.description: Innate: Whenever an enemy champion dies within 3 seconds of Katarina damaging them, her abilities'  cooldowns are reduced by 15 seconds.

Innate - Sinister Steel: Whenever Katarina retrieves a Dagger, she uses it to slash through all nearby enemies, dealing 68 − 240 (based on level) (+ 100% bonus AD) (+ 55 / 70 / 85 / 100% (based on level) AP)  magic damage and reducing  Shunpo's  cooldown by 78 / 84 / 90 / 96% (based on level).
Daggers last 4 seconds before disappearing.

I.notes:
Voracity's cooldown reduction will still take effect even after Katarina dies.
 Decoys count as champions for the takedown effect.
 Katarina can use Shunpo on Daggers in mid-air.
 However, the damage will not apply until it lands.
I.blurb: Whenever an enemy champion dies that Katarina has damaged in the last 3 seconds, her ability cooldowns are reduced by 15 seconds. If Katarina picks up a Dagger, she uses it to slash through all nearby enemies, dealing magic damage.

Q.name: Bouncing Blade

effects.description: Active: Katarina throws a Dagger to the target enemy that bounces to up to 2 nearby enemies, dealing magic damage to each target.
The Dagger then lands on the ground 350 units opposite from where it struck the target. The time to land from striking the target is the same regardless of distance traveled.

Q.notes:
Bouncing Blades can hit targets in fog of war as well as stealthed ones.
 Bouncing Blade will not stop if the target dies before hitting it but it will vanish mid-air if it targeted a vanishing decoy.
Q.blurb: Katarina throws a Dagger at the target that then bounces to nearby enemies before ricocheting onto the ground.

W.name: Preparation

effects.description: Active: Katarina tosses a Dagger into the air above her current location, gaining  ghost and a decaying  bonus movement speed until it lands after 1.25 seconds.

W.notes: No additional details.
W.blurb: Katarina gains a burst of movement speed, tossing a Dagger into the air directly above herself.

E.name: Shunpo

effects.description: Active: After a short delay, Katarina  blinks to the target location around the target unit or Dagger, dealing magic damage to the nearest enemy in range.
Shunpo resets Katarina's basic attack timer.
Upon blinking, Katarina remains in cast time for 0.15 seconds. Movement command buffering is also delayed by 0.85 seconds.

E.notes:
Shunpo should be an instant ability but it has extra logic to consider which makes it have a short cast time before blinking.
 Katarina cannot target  wards, but she can target objects such as allied  Jarvan IV's  Demacian Standard,  Thresh's  Dark Passage or jungle plants.
  Flash can be used during cast time but it will not cancel the blink.
 If the target is very close to a wall and Katarina targets Shunpo behind the target, she can blink over the wall.
E.blurb: Katarina blinks to the target, striking it if its an enemy, or striking the nearest enemy otherwise.

R.name: Death Lotus

effects.description: Active: Katarina rapidly channels for 2.5 seconds, throwing a dagger every 0.166 seconds to up to 3 nearby enemy champions, dealing magic damage and applying  Grievous Wounds for 3 seconds, reducing healing on the target by 60%.
Katarina does not need to have  vision of the targets to hit them, and she will prioritize the closest ones.

R.notes:
Death Lotus cannot be activated unless there is at least one enemy champion in range, and the ability will brighten up when one is nearby.
 Leaving Death Lotus radius while Katarina is channeling will not cause her to stop prematurely.

Death Lotus cannot be cancelled by movement and basic attack commands in the first and last 0.25 seconds of channelling.
  Spell shield will block and be consumed by only one dagger.
R.blurb: Katarina becomes a flurry of blades, dealing massive magic damage while she channels to the 3 nearest enemy champions.

I.name: Divine Ascent

effects.description: Innate: Upon reaching levels 1, 6, 11, and 16, along with spending another skill point, Kayle ascends into a new form, gaining additional bonuses.

Innate - Zealous: At level 1, Kayle's basic attacks on-attack grant  6% bonus attack speed for 5 seconds, stacking up to 5 times for a maximum of 30% bonus attack speed. At maximum stacks, Kayle becomes Exalted, gaining  8% bonus movement speed.
Innate - Arisen: At level 6, Kayle becomes a  ranged champion with  525 attack range.

Innate - Aflame: At level 11, while Exalted, Kayle's basic attacks on-attack against non- structures additionally launch a wave of fire in the target's direction, dealing 15 − 35 (based on  Starfire Spellblade's Rank) (+ 10% bonus AD) (+ 25% AP)  magic damage to enemies hit. The waves are affected by  critical strike modifiers.
Innate - Transcendent: At level 16, Zealous is permanently set to maximum stacks and Kayle gains  50 bonus attack range, for a total of 575 attack range.

I.notes:
If Kayle is in her attack animation after the stacks finish she gains another 0.5 seconds to refresh / stack Zealous.
 Because Kayle is both a melee and ranged champion, she can buy both ranged and melee only items at anytime. However, melee only items will only work until she becomes ranged, while ranged only items will only work after.
 While in melee range after she becomes Arisen, she will still attack with her sword, bypassing  Yasuo's  Wind Wall.
 This will not negate the activation of ranged effects (i.e  Runaan's Hurricane).
 This will still not trigger the activation of melee effects (i.e  Ravenous Hydra).

 Upon becoming Aflame, Kayle's portrait changes:
 On the original skin  becomes .
 On the Silver skin  becomes .
 On the Viridian skin  becomes .
 On the Battleborn skin  becomes .
 On the Aether Wing skin  becomes .
 On the Riot skin  becomes .
 On the Pentakill skin  becomes .
  Transcended Kayle,  Judgment Kayle, and  Iron Inquisitor Kayle do not change portrait.

Q.name: Radiant Blast

effects.description: Active: Kayle plants a portal at her initial location that faces the target direction. After a 0.25-second delay, a celestial sword launches forward from the portal.
The sword explodes into a cross upon collision with an enemy, dealing magic damage and  slowing targets struck, while reducing their  armor and  magic resistance by 15% for 4 seconds.
Radiant Blast refunds  50% of its mana cost for each enemy champion hit.

Q.notes:
The VFX of the cross that spreads upon hitting its initial target shows the blade and guard of a sword.
 Despite the VFX suggesting otherwise, the two sides of the guard are each as long as the blade in terms of collision: approximately 295 units. PENDING FOR TEST

W.name: Celestial Blessing

effects.description: Active: Kayle and target allied champion are  healed and gain bonus movement speed for 2 seconds.
If cast without a valid target, or self-cast, Celestial Blessing will automatically target the closest ally in range, prioritizing the most wounded one.

W.notes: The ability's effects apply instantly but Kayle will remain in cast time for 0.25 seconds.

E.name: Starfire Spellblade

effects.description: Passive: Kayle's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage. Additionally,  Aflame's base damage is increased.
Active: Kayle's next basic attack within 6 seconds deals bonus magic damage. After unlocking  Aflame, the attack explodes, damaging and applying on-hit effects to all enemies around the target.
Prior to becoming  Arisen, Starfire Spellblade also causes Kayle to temporarily become a  ranged champion with 525 attack range on the empowered attack.
Starfire Spellblade resets Kayle's basic attack timer.

E.notes:
Before becoming  Arisen, when attacking below 175 range, Starfire Spellblade's active is considered a  melee attack (i.e. it will trigger  Tiamat).
 After unlocking Aflame, the exploding attack will only trigger the  Cleave and Crescent passives on the primary target, unlike all other on-hit effects.

R.name: Divine Judgment

effects.description: Active: Kayle refreshes  Zealous and grants the target allied champion or herself  invulnerability for a few seconds.

Kayle also begins conjuring swords around herself and highlights an area around her target for 1.5 seconds. At the end of the channel, the swords rain down and deal magic damage to all enemies within the area around her target.
Divine Judgment will prioritize casting on allies over Kayle.

R.notes:
The aura around the target does not appear if the target is not  visible to the enemies' point of view.
 The  mana expenditure only occurs after the cast time, though Kayle requires at least 100 mana to begin the cast. 
 The ability will still go off if Kayle has less than the required mana at the time of expenditure (for effects such as  Seraph's Embrace's).

 Once cast has begun, the second part of the ability will go off regardless of whether or not Kayle or her target are alive.
 The prioritization will also cause Divine Judgement to be able to target allied decoys, which are otherwise  untargetable by allies.
 The ending of other invulnerability effects (i.e  Kindred's  Lamb's Respite) will cause Divine Judgement's invulnerability to shortly have no effect.

I.name: The Darkin Scythe

effects.description: Innate:  Kayn wields an ancient, sentient weapon, that battles with him for control. Each instance of damage Kayn deals against champions (excluding damage over time) and  takedowns causes them to drop orbs, red by  melee champions and blue by  ranged champions, that are automatically collected upon leaving combat, filling a bar around Kayn's portrait.

Once the bar is filled, Kayn can return to the summoning platform to interact with his portrait to either be overwhelmed by  Rhaast or expel him to become the  Shadow Assassin, or wait 4 minutes until the other form becomes available, reduced by 5 seconds for each collected orb of their type after that.

The transformation type is decided based on the highest amount of damage dealt to the respective range type. If the two forms are within 8% of each other, the last champion range type hit will determine the transformation. If both types are hit at the same time the trasformation will default to  Rhaast. The transformation will permanently change Kayn's abilities and grant him Homeguard.

Shadow Assassin: If Kayn has been out of champion combat for over 8 seconds, or he casts  Umbral Trespass, he deals 12% − 44% (based on level) of post-mitigation damage dealt against champions as  bonus magic damage, lasting for 3 seconds upon entering combat and also applying on the first instance of damage dealt.
Rhaast: Rhaast  heals for 34.5% − 43% (based on level) of the post-mitigation  physical damage that he deals with abilities against enemy champions.

I.notes:
The bar gets filled up completely at 500 points.
 Melee orbs grant 2 points per hit and 6 points per takedown.
 Ranged orbs grant 3 points per hit and 7 points per takedown.
 Each bar has a bucket system.
 The bucket starts at 60 points.
 Each time an orb is taken the system checks if there's an amount of points in the bucket equal to or higher than the amount received from the orb.If there is, Kayn is given an additional orb of the same type he received, while also subtracting that amount of points from the bucket.
 The bucket fills by 0.8 points per second if out of champion combat for 70 seconds.

 The amount of points received per orb is then multiplied by 3 / 6 / 10 (based on minutes).

 The orbs will be collected even if Kayn dies.
I.blurb: At one point in the game, Kayn will permanently transform into either a Shadow Assassin or a Darkin.

Q.name: Reaping Slash

effects.description: Active: Kayn  dashes forward, dealing physical damage to enemies he passes through, before swinging his scythe, dealing the same damage to surrounding enemies.
Both instances of Reaping Slash deal 40 bonus damage against monsters.
Rhaast: Reaping Slash's damage is modified to deal 55% AD (+ 5% (+ 4% per 100 bonus AD) of the target's maximum health) physical damage for both instances. This damage is capped against monsters.
The dash's speed scales with Kayn's  total movement speed.

Q.notes:
Spell shields will block only a single instance of damage - either the dash or the slash.
 As  Shadow Assassin, an alternate icon for  Reaping Slash is used but has no modified effect.
 Other abilities can be queued while casting Reaping Slash.
Q.blurb: Kayn dashes, then slashes. Both deal damage.

W.name: Blade's Reach

effects.description: Active: Kayn performs an upwards sweep with his scythe, dealing physical damage to all enemies in a line in the target direction and  slowing them by 60% decaying over 1.5 seconds.

Shadow Assassin: Blade's Reach's range is increased by 200. Additionally, Kayn conjures a living shadow at the casting position to perform Blade's Reach in his stead, reducing the ability's cast time to 0.
Rhaast: Blade's Reach  knocks up enemies for 1 second.

W.notes: The shadow created by the Shadow Assassin is considered a champion for  Turret Plating's  gold sharing.
W.blurb: Kayn damages and slows targets in a line.

W.name: Blade's Reach

effects.description: Active: Kayn performs an upwards sweep with his scythe, dealing physical damage to all enemies in a line in the target direction and  slowing them by 60% decaying over 1.5 seconds.

Shadow Assassin: Blade's Reach's range is increased by 200. Additionally, Kayn conjures a living shadow at the casting position to perform Blade's Reach in his stead, reducing the ability's cast time to 0.
Rhaast: Blade's Reach  knocks up enemies for 1 second.

E.name: Shadow Step

effects.description: Active: Kayn gains  40% bonus movement speed, is  ghosted and can ignore terrain collision for 1.5 seconds.  Immobilizing effects will interrupt Shadow Step.

Kayn  heals himself upon moving through terrain for the first time and, if he's not in combat with enemy champions, Shadow Step's duration is increased. While inside terrain, Kayn has  unobstructed vision.

Receiving damage from an enemy  champion or dealing ability damage to them after the effect is enhanced reduces the remaining duration to 1.5 seconds. The effect also cannot remain active out of terrain for longer than 1.5 seconds and will cancel completely if Kayn uses a basic attack.

Shadow Assassin: Shadow Step's cooldown is  reduced to 8 seconds at all ranks. Casting Shadow Step  cleanses Kayn from all  slows and makes him immune to them for the duration. Additionally, entering terrain will increase the  bonus movement speed to 80% for the remaining duration.

E.notes:
As  Rhaast, an alternate icon for  Shadow Step is used but has no modified effect.
 Effects such as  Vayne's  Condemn and  Poppy's  Heroic Charge apply an  immobilizing effect and so  interrupt Shadow Step.
 Enemies cannot see Kayn while he is inside of terrain unless they have terrain-piercing vision, such as  Heightened Senses,  Hawkshot or  Comet of Legend.
 However, enemies will be notified if nearby terrain is infested if Kayn is within 1000 units - with an indicator being placed on the terrain with a direct line between Kayn and the enemy champion. Slightly less than standard sight radius, but more than the  camouflage detection radius.

 Kayn can move up to 550 units beyond the outer-edge of the battlefield.
 While in terrain, Kayn will not be considered unseen for the sake of  Duskblade of Draktharr.
 Kayn's  sight radius is not extended beyond merged terrain while  nearsighted.
E.blurb: Kayn can walk through terrain.

R.name: Umbral Trespass

effects.description: Passive: Kayn marks enemy champions he damaged in the last 3.15 seconds.
Active: Kayn becomes  untargetable and  infests a marked enemy  champion for up to 2.5 seconds, gaining  true sight of them for the duration. Reactivating Umbral Trespass ends it earlier.
Upon reactivation or at the end of the duration, Kayn  dashes out from their body 300-units away in the target direction, dealing physical damage to the target.
Shadow Assassin: Umbral Trespass gains up to 200 bonus cast range and emerge range. Additionally, emerging will reset  The Darkin Scythe's  cooldown.

Rhaast: Umbral Trespass is modified to deal 10% (+ 13% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health physical damage, and  heals him for[ 70% of the pre-mitigation damage. ][ 7% (+ 9.1% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health. ]

R.notes:
As  Rhaast, an alternate icon is used for the initial activation of  Umbral Trespass.
 Until the second cast, the ability will have had no effect on the target for the purposes of  Electrocute or the 'in-combat' status.
  Spell shields will prevent Kayn from infesting the target, but will do nothing to mitigate the damage once he has already infested them.
 If Kayn targets an enemy with a spell shield, the ability will simply go on cooldown without making him dash to his target.
 This is also true for  Fiora's  Riposte.

 The damage is not blocked if the target is  untargetable.
 Kayn can only be  knocked down upon  emerging from the target.
R.blurb: Kayn hides in an enemy's body, dealing massive damage when he bursts out.

Upon reactivation or at the end of the duration, Kayn  dashes out from their body 300-units away in the target direction, dealing physical damage to the target.
Shadow Assassin: Umbral Trespass gains up to 200 bonus cast range and emerge range. Additionally, emerging will reset  The Darkin Scythe's  cooldown.

Rhaast: Umbral Trespass is modified to deal 10% (+ 13% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health physical damage, and  heals him for[ 70% of the pre-mitigation damage. ][ 7% (+ 9.1% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health. ]

R.notes:
As  Rhaast, an alternate icon is used for the initial activation of  Umbral Trespass.
 Until the second cast, the ability will have had no effect on the target for the purposes of  Electrocute or the 'in-combat' status.
  Spell shields will prevent Kayn from infesting the target, but will do nothing to mitigate the damage once he has already infested them.
 If Kayn targets an enemy with a spell shield, the ability will simply go on cooldown without making him dash to his target.
 This is also true for  Fiora's  Riposte.

 The damage is not blocked if the target is  untargetable.
 Kayn can only be  knocked down upon  emerging from the target.
R.blurb: Kayn hides in an enemy's body, dealing massive damage when he bursts out.

I.name: Mark of the Storm

effects.description: Innate: Enemies hit by Kennen's abilities receive a Mark of the Storm for 6 seconds, stacking up to 3 times. At three stacks, the marks consume themselves to  stun the target for 1.25 seconds and restore  25 energy.
If the  stun is applied more than once within 6 seconds, its duration is reduced to 0.5 seconds.

I.notes: Kennen will still restore energy if the target dies from a third Mark of the Storm.
I.blurb: Kennen's abilities add one stack of Mark of the Storm to their target for 6 seconds. If the target reaches 3 stacks, it is stunned for 1.25 seconds and Kennen gains 25 Energy. The stun will be a diminished duration of 0.5 seconds if it occurs again within 6 seconds.

Q.name: Thundering Shuriken

effects.description: Active: Kennen throws a charged shuriken in a line in front of him, dealing  magic damage to the first enemy it hits.

Q.notes: No additional details.
Q.blurb: Kennen throws a fast moving shuriken towards a location, causing damage and adding a Mark of the Storm to any opponent that it hits.

W.name: Electrical Surge

effects.description: Passive: Basic attacks grant a stack of Electrical Surge on-attack. Upon reaching 4 stacks Kennen's next basic attack is empowered to deal bonus magic damage, apply a Mark of the Storm and consume all stacks on-hit.
Active: Kennen sends out a surge of electricity to all nearby enemies afflicted by Mark of the Storm or caught in  Slicing Maelstrom, dealing magic damage.

W.notes:
Basic attacks against structures will stack the counter but will not consume the enhanced attack.
 Electrical Surge's active will still hit stealthed champions as well as those hidden in fog of war (revealing their position but not granting  sight of them).
 The enhanced attack applies other  on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal (the bonus damage does not).
 It also applies  spell damage.

 Electrical Surge's enhanced attack will be consumed and the bonus damage will not be applied if Kennen is  blinded.
 Electrical Surge's passive cannot be  dodged or  blocked.

  Wind Wall will destroy the enhanced attack but not consume it.
W.blurb: Kennen passively deals extra damage and adds a Mark of the Storm to his target every few attacks, and he can activate this ability to damage and add another Mark of the Storm to targets who are already marked.

E.name: Lightning Rush

effects.description: Active: Kennen transforms into a ball of electricity,  disarming himself but becoming  ghosted and gaining  100% bonus movement speed for 2 seconds.
Kennen deals magic damage to all enemies he passes through, halved against non-champions and restores  40 energy the first time Lightning Rush damages an enemy.
Kennen gains  bonus attack speed for 4 seconds upon exiting Lightning Rush.
Kennen can reactivate Lightning Rush to prematurely cancel it, allowing him to use basic attacks again.

E.notes:
Lightning Rush will only damage any particular enemy once per cast.
 Lightning Rush can grant Kennen an effective 230 bonus movement speed (assuming there are no modifiers involved).
E.blurb: Kennen morphs into a lightning form, enabling him to pass through units. Each enemy unit he touches takes damage and receives a Mark of the Storm.

R.name: Slicing Maelstrom

effects.description: Active: Kennen summons Shuriken Storm, a magical storm around himself for 3 seconds, gaining  bonus armor and  bonus magic resistance and dealing magic damage to all enemies within range every 0.5 seconds.
Each maelstrom hit applies a Mark of the Storm, up to a maximum of 3.
Slicing Maelstrom deals 10% increased damage with each successive strike against a target, up to a maximum of 150% damage with one strike.

R.notes: Not being a  channeled ability means Slicing Maelstrom will persist even if Kennen is  disabled, goes into  stasis, or is being  revived.
R.blurb: Kennen summons a storm that strikes at nearby enemy champions for magical damage.

I.name: Unseen Threat

effects.description: Innate - Isolation: Kha'Zix marks all enemy units who do not have any of their allies nearby as Isolated.  Taste Their Fear and  Void Spike have special interactions against Isolated targets.

Innate: Kha'Zix gains Unseen Threat while out of enemy  sight, causing his next basic attack against an enemy champion to deal 14 − 150 (based on level) (+ 40% bonus AD)  bonus magic damage and  slow them by 25% for 2 seconds.

I.notes:
All enemy units (including  monsters) are considered for the targeting of Isolated.
 Unseen Threat's damage will cause  Muramana's Shock damage to trigger twice with a single basic attack.
 The enhanced attack can apply  on-hit effects and  critically strike (magic damage is not modified).
I.blurb: When Kha'Zix is not visible to the enemy team, he gains Unseen Threat, causing his next basic attack against an enemy Champion to deal bonus magic damage and slow.

Q.name: Taste Their Fear

effects.description: Active: Kha'Zix slashes the target enemy, dealing  physical damage, increased by 100% against Isolated targets.

Q.notes: No additional details.
Q.blurb: Deals physical damage to the target. Damage increased on Isolated targets. If he chooses to Evolve Reaper Claws, this refunds a percent of it's cooldown against Isolated targets. Kha'Zix also gains increased range on his basic attacks and Taste Their Fear.

Q.name: Evolved Reaper Claws

effects.description: Passive - Evolved Reaper Claws: Kha'Zix gains  50 bonus range on his basic attacks and Taste Their Fear.
If the target is Isolated,  45% of the cooldown is refunded.

Q.notes: No additional details.

W.name: Void Spike

effects.description: Active: Kha'Zix fires a cluster of spikes in a line that detonates upon hitting an enemy dealing them physical damage.
Kha'Zix  heals himself if he is within detonation radius.

W.blurb: Kha'Zix fires exploding spikes that deal physical damage to enemies hit. Kha'Zix is healed if he is also within the explosion radius. If he chooses to Evolve Spike Racks, Void Spike now fires three spikes in a cone, slow enemies hit, and reveals enemy champions hit for 2 seconds. Isolated targets are slowed for extra.

effects.description: Passive - Evolved Spike Racks: Void Spike fires three clusters in a cone,  slows by 60% and grants  sight of enemy champions hit for 2 seconds. Multiple explosions do not deal extra damage to the same target or provide Kha'Zix with additional healing.
Isolated targets hit by Evolved Void Spike are  slowed by 90% instead.

E.name: Leap

effects.description: Active: Kha'Zix  leaps to the target location, dealing physical damage to nearby enemies upon landing.

E.notes:
Kha'Zix can cast  Taste Their Fear on a target during the jump.
 He can also use summoner spells and active items.
  Flash will  cancel the leap as it is considered a movement spell.
E.blurb: Kha'Zix leaps to an area, dealing physical damage upon landing. If he chooses to Evolve Wings, Leap's range increases by 200 and the cooldown resets on champion kill or assist.

E.name: Evolved Wings

effects.description: Passive - Evolved Wings: Leap gains increased range and its  cooldown is reset on enemy champion  takedowns.

E.notes: Decoys count as champions for the takedown effect.

R.name: Void Assault

effects.description: Passive: Each rank in Void Assault allows Kha'Zix to evolve one of his abilities, granting it additional effects.
Active: Kha'Zix enters  invisibility for 1.25 seconds, gaining  40% bonus movement speed, and  ghosting while stealthed.
After 2 seconds of leaving  stealth, and for the next 10 seconds, Void Assault can be cast a second time at no additional cost.

R.notes:
Void Assault has no cast time and does not interrupt Kha'Zix's previous orders.
 Every time Void Assault is ranked, a secondary menu will pop up for Kha'Zix to select an ability to evolve, this can only be done once per ability.
 Selecting one will cause Kha'Zix to begin  channeling, receiving the evolution when it ends ( immobilizes or death during the evolve do not stop him from gaining the evolution).
 The only way for Kha'Zix to evolve all of his abilities is to gain the fourth evolution point by being victorious in The Hunt is On! (by scoring a  takedown on  Rengar).
R.blurb: Each rank allows Kha'Zix to evolve one of his abilities, giving it a unique additional effect. When activated, Kha'Zix becomes Invisible, triggering Unseen Threat and increasing Movement Speed. If he chooses to Evolve Adaptive Cloaking, while out of combat Kha'Zix also passively gains Void Assault upon entering a new brush.

R.name: Evolved Adaptive Cloaking

effects.description: Passive - Evolved Adaptive Cloaking: Increases the  invisibility duration to 2 seconds, and can be cast up to 3 times.

R.notes: No additional details.

R.name: Void Assault

effects.description: Passive: Each rank in Void Assault allows Kha'Zix to evolve one of his abilities, granting it additional effects.
Active: Kha'Zix enters  invisibility for 1.25 seconds, gaining  40% bonus movement speed, and  ghosting while stealthed.
After 2 seconds of leaving  stealth, and for the next 10 seconds, Void Assault can be cast a second time at no additional cost.

R.notes:
Void Assault has no cast time and does not interrupt Kha'Zix's previous orders.
 Every time Void Assault is ranked, a secondary menu will pop up for Kha'Zix to select an ability to evolve, this can only be done once per ability.
 Selecting one will cause Kha'Zix to begin  channeling, receiving the evolution when it ends ( immobilizes or death during the evolve do not stop him from gaining the evolution).
 The only way for Kha'Zix to evolve all of his abilities is to gain the fourth evolution point by being victorious in The Hunt is On! (by scoring a  takedown on  Rengar).
R.blurb: Each rank allows Kha'Zix to evolve one of his abilities, giving it a unique additional effect. When activated, Kha'Zix becomes Invisible, triggering Unseen Threat and increasing Movement Speed. If he chooses to Evolve Adaptive Cloaking, while out of combat Kha'Zix also passively gains Void Assault upon entering a new brush.

I.name: Mark of the Kindred

effects.description: Innate: Both Lamb and Wolf mark targets to hunt. Scoring a  takedown on a marked target permanently empowers Kindred's abilities, as well as granting Lamb 75 − 250 (based on Marks)  bonus range on her basic attacks and abilities.

Innate - Lamb: Lamb is offered a selection of  champions to take down, which is hidden while in combat with an enemy champion. Once selected, there's an 8 seconds delay before the Mark can be collected, and Lamb can change her target if the target hasn't died during a period of time. Targets successfully hunted cannot be targeted again for a few minutes.

Innate - Wolf: Starting at 3:15, Wolf periodically selects a  monster camp within the enemy's jungle based on Lamb's current Marks for 180 seconds:
 0 :  Rift Scuttler
 1 – 3:  Rift Scuttler,  Crimson Raptor,  Gromp
 4 – 7:  Ancient Krug,  Blue Sentinel,  Greater Murk Wolf, or  Red Brambleback
 8 + :  Rift Herald or  Baron Nashor,  Dragon or  Elder Dragon

Wolf will select another monster camp 40 seconds after killing a marked monster. If an ally kills a hunted jungle monster within 6 seconds of Kindred damaging it, Kindred will still acquire the stack.
The marked camp is highlighted on the minimap to both teams. The mark is removed when the camp is cleared even if Kindred are not involved.

I.blurb: Kindred can mark targets to Hunt. Successfully completing a Hunt permanently empowers Kindred's basic abilities. Every 4 hunts completed also increases Kindred's basic attack range.

Q.name: Dance of Arrows

effects.description: Active: Lamb  dashes in the target direction, gaining 25% (+ 5% per  Mark) bonus attack speed for 4 seconds while firing up to three arrows to nearby  visible targets, dealing physical damage. Lamb's current attack target at any proximity will be prioritized by one of the arrows.
Casting  Wolf's Frenzy or dashing while inside the area will change Dance of Arrows'  cooldown into a static cooldown.
Dance of Arrows resets Lamb's basic attack timer.

Q.notes: No additional details.
Q.blurb: Kindred tumbles and shoots up to three arrows at nearby targets.

W.name: Wolf's Frenzy

effects.description: Passive: As Kindred move and attack, they build up to 100 stacks of Hunter's Vigor. At full stacks, Lamb's next basic attack  restores up to  32 − 100 (based on level) health, based on Kindred's missing health.

Active: Wolf  dashes to the target location and claims the surrounding area as his territory for the next 8.5 seconds, separating from Lamb. Wolf autonomously attacks enemies within the area, prioritizing Lamb's attack target.
Wolf's basic attacks deal magic damage and scale with 25% of Kindred's bonus attack speed. Against monsters, Wolf deals 50% increased damage and his attacks  slow his target by 50% for 2 seconds.

units: % (+ 1% per Mark) of target's current health
% (+ 1% per Mark) of target's current health
% (+ 1% per Mark) of target's current health
% (+ 1% per Mark) of target's current health
% (+ 1% per Mark) of target's current health

effects.description: Wolf's Frenzy ends immediately if Lamb leaves the area.

W.notes:
Applies  persistent damage in an  area of effect range.
 Wolf is  untargetable,  invulnerable and  ghosted, but cannot move through terrain other than the initial dash on activation. 
 Wolf is not able to re-target  Rift Scuttler if he loses  sight of it while he's attacking it.
W.blurb: Wolf enrages and attacks enemies around him.

E.name: Mounting Dread

effects.description: Active: Lamb cripples the target unit,  slowing them by 50% for 1 second.

If Lamb manages to basic attack the target twice with no longer than 4 seconds between each attack after casting Mounting Dread, her third attack within the following 4 seconds directs Wolf to pounce the target, dealing bonus physical damage, capped against  monsters at 300 bonus damage.

units: % (+ 0.5% per Mark) of target's missing health
% (+ 0.5% per Mark) of target's missing health
% (+ 0.5% per Mark) of target's missing health
% (+ 0.5% per Mark) of target's missing health
% (+ 0.5% per Mark) of target's missing health

effects.description: Wolf's pounce will  critically strike for (50% +  37.5%)  bonus physical damage against targets below 15% − 65% (based on critical strike chance) maximum health.

E.notes:
Wolf's pounce's bonus damage calculates after he reach the target.
 Wolf's pounce applies other 'on-hit' effects and can  critically strike as normal.
 Wolf's pounce's bonus damage , however , doesn't interact with 'critical strike' unless of reaching the target's percentage HP condition.
E.blurb: Lamb fires a carefully placed shot, slowing the target. If Lamb attacks the target two more times, her third attack instead directs Wolf to pounce on the enemy, savaging them for massive damage.

R.name: Lamb's Respite

effects.description: Active: Lamb blesses the ground under herself for 4 seconds. While inside the area, all units  cannot be reduced below  10% their maximum health. Units in the area who reach the threshold cannot be healed for the remaining duration.
All units within the zone are  healed immediately when the blessing ends.

R.notes: Any given unit's  health regeneration will still be active while inside Lamb's Respite.
R.blurb: Lamb grants all living things inside a zone a respite from death. Until the effect ends, nothing can die. At the end, units are healed.

I.name: Dismounted Skaarl the Cowardly Lizard

effects.description: Innate: Kled is only vulnerable to death while dismounted. Kled has  340 − 1530 (based on level) base health, which is not improved by sources of bonus health, as well as reduced base movement speed and increased attack range. Percent-health effects consider Kled & Skaarl's combined maximum health, meaning that an unmounted Kled is always considered to be low health.
Kled gains 100 − 185 (based on level)  bonus movement speed when moving towards enemy  champions within 900 range, as well as the ability to generate  Courage.

Innate - Courage: Kled gains 15 Courage when basic attacking an enemy champion, 20 Courage whenever a champion he damaged dies within 3 seconds, 4 Courage for minion kills, and 5 Courage when basic attacking a structure or epic monster. At 100 Courage, Skaarl returns to the fight with  50 / 60 / 70 / 80% (based on level) of Skaarl's maximum health.  Mounting up resets the cooldown of  Beartrap on a Rope and  Jousting.

While at the allied fountain, 25 Courage is generated every 0.25 seconds.  Recalling fully restores Skaarl's Courage and  health. If reuniting outside of base, Skaarl gets Frayed Nerves, which prevents him from gaining Courage for 30 seconds.

The current status of Kled's own health is preserved between subsequent dismounts. While mounted, healing will first affect Skaarl's health and will only restore Kled's health while Skaarl is at full health.

I.notes:
Decoys are counted as champions for all of this ability's effects, other than the takedown one.
 Kled's health is rounded up while Skaarl's is rounded down.
  Gargoyle Stoneplate can increase Kled's base health.
 It is possible to get the Courage from base but have Kled and Skaarl reunite out of base.
 It is possible for the Nexus Obelisk to not be able to bring Kled down from Skaarl for a few seconds, even if Skaarl has no health.
 PENDING FOR TEST  Wild Growth and  Elixir of Iron

Q.name: Pocket Pistol

effects.description: Passive: Kled periodically stocks an ammo charge, up to a maximum of 2. Kled will store ammo even while  mounted.
Active: Kled sprays a cone of five pellets in the target direction, dealing physical damage while  recoiling 250 units in the opposite direction.
Pellets collide into the first enemy they hit, and deal 20% damage per pellet beyond the first. Each pellet that hits an enemy champion or epic monster restores  Courage, by 5 and 2.5 respectively.

Q.notes:
The knockback from Pocket Pistol can be used to pass through terrain.
 Casting Q during Kled's dismounting animation will buffer Pocket Pistol to cast when Kled lands. Casting Q during Kled's remounting animation will fire Pocket Pistol normally.
Q.blurb: When dismounted, this ability is replaced by Pocket Pistol, a ranged gun blast that knocks back Kled and restores courage.

W.name: Violent Tendencies

effects.description: Passive: Kled periodically enters a frenzy that grants him  150% bonus attack speed on his next 4 basic attacks within 4 seconds after the first, with the final attack dealing bonus physical damage, capped against  monsters.

units: % (+ 5% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 5% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 5% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 5% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 5% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health

W.notes:
The enhanced attack will apply other on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal but the damage from Violent Tendencies is unaffected.
 The bonus damage will apply  life steal and affects structures.
W.blurb: Kled gains massive attack speed for four attacks. The fourth attack deals more damage.

effects.description: This ability is unusable while unmounted.
This ability is unusable while unmounted.

I.name: Skaarl the Cowardly Lizard

effects.description: Innate: Kled rides his semi-trusty mount, Skaarl. While mounted, all damage dealt to the duo is suffered by Skaarl, who has  400 − 1505 (based on level) base health (+100% bonus health). Percent-health effects consider Kled & Skaarl's combined maximum health.

Being reduced to  0 health causes Skaarl to flee, forcing Kled to  dismount, with all damage in excess of Skaarl's  health being ignored. Dismounting  cleanses Kled of all  crowd control and briefly makes him  untargetable, as well as modifying his base stats and abilities.

I.notes:
Decoys are counted as champions for all of this ability's effects, other than the takedown one.
 Kled's health is rounded up while Skaarl's is rounded down.
  Gargoyle Stoneplate can increase Kled's base health.
 It is possible to get the Courage from base but have Kled and Skaarl reunite out of base.
 It is possible for the Nexus Obelisk to not be able to bring Kled down from Skaarl for a few seconds, even if Skaarl has no health.
 Health regeneration only regenerates Kled's or Skaarl's health, and not both's.
I.blurb: Kled rides his trusty steed, Skaarl, who takes damage for him. When Skaarl's health depletes, Kled dismounts. While dismounted, Kled's abilities change and he deals less damage to champions. Kled can restore Skaarl's courage by fighting enemies. At maximum courage, Kled remounts with a portion of Skaarl's health.

Q.name: Beartrap on a Rope

effects.description: Active: Kled hurls a beartrap tied to a piece of rope in the target direction, dealing physical damage to all enemies it passes through.
Minions and small  monsters take 50% increased damage. The bear trap stops at the first enemy  champion or large monster hit, attaching to them. While attached, they are  revealed.

If Kled remains for 1.75 seconds within a slowly decreasing radius of his target, he  pulls them 100-units towards him, dealing physical damage,  grievously wounding them by 60% for 5 seconds, and  slowing them for 1.5 seconds.
Can be cast while  Jousting.

Q.notes: No additional details.
Q.blurb: Kled throws a bear trap that damages and hooks an enemy champion. If shackled for a short duration, the target takes additional physical damage and is yanked toward Kled.

W.name: Violent Tendencies

effects.description: Passive: Kled periodically enters a frenzy that grants him  150% bonus attack speed on his next 4 basic attacks within 4 seconds after the first, with the final attack dealing bonus physical damage, capped against  monsters.

units: % (+ 5% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 5% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 5% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 5% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 5% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health

W.notes:
The enhanced attack will apply other on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal but the damage from Violent Tendencies is unaffected.
 The bonus damage will apply  life steal and affects structures.
W.blurb: Kled gains massive attack speed for four attacks. The fourth attack deals more damage.

E.name: Jousting

effects.description: Active: Kled and Skaarl  dash in the target direction, dealing physical damage to all enemies struck and  pulling  minions and small  monsters towards him. This cannot cross terrain.

Upon hitting an enemy  champion or large monster Kled and Skaarl  dash a fixed 200-units through them, marking them for 3 seconds and gaining  true sight of them. At the end of the  dash Kled gains  50% bonus movement speed for 1 second and the ability to  joust through the marked target again. This subsequent pass can cross terrain.
The mark will remain even if the target dies.

E.notes:
Applies  spell damage to champions and deals  area damage to  minions and small monsters.
 Jousting's second dash will end prematurely if Kled leaves the dash range or is dismounted.
 If Kled re-casts the ability at its maximum range, it will go on cooldown without activating.
E.blurb: Kled dashes, dealing physical damage and gaining a short burst of speed. Kled can cast this ability again to dash back through his initial target, dealing the same damage.

E.name: Jousting

effects.description: Active: Kled and Skaarl  dash in the target direction, dealing physical damage to all enemies struck and  pulling  minions and small  monsters towards him. This cannot cross terrain.

Upon hitting an enemy  champion or large monster Kled and Skaarl  dash a fixed 200-units through them, marking them for 3 seconds and gaining  true sight of them. At the end of the  dash Kled gains  50% bonus movement speed for 1 second and the ability to  joust through the marked target again. This subsequent pass can cross terrain.
The mark will remain even if the target dies.

E.notes:
Applies  spell damage to champions and deals  area damage to  minions and small monsters.
 Jousting's second dash will end prematurely if Kled leaves the dash range or is dismounted.
 If Kled re-casts the ability at its maximum range, it will go on cooldown without activating.
E.blurb: Kled dashes, dealing physical damage and gaining a short burst of speed. Kled can cast this ability again to dash back through his initial target, dealing the same damage.

R.name: Chaaaaaaaarge!!!

effects.description: Active: Kled and Skaarl charge towards the target location, automatically navigating terrain along the way, during which they're  pacified and immune to crowd control.

While charging, the duo gain  bonus movement speed and a  shield for every 0.25 seconds of traveling, up to 950 total movement speed over 3 seconds and 10% − 100% (based on time traveling) of the maximum shield amount over 2.25 seconds respectively. The shield lasts for 2 seconds upon finishing the charge. The duo trails a directional draft in their wake, lasting 9 seconds. Allied champions following the draft gain Mr. Kled's Wild Ride.
Mr. Kled's Wild Ride: The target gains 650 total movement speed.
Skaarl  homes in on the first enemy champion encountered,  knocking them back 100 units and dealing physical damage, increased by 0% − 200% (based on time traveling).

R.notes:
During the charge the duo gain:
 (950 − (current movement speed)) ÷ 12 × (time ÷ 0.25) bonus movement speed

 The bonus movement speed is not affected by movement speed caps.
 The charge will not give any movement speed to Kled if he has more than 1440 movement speed.
 The trail will not give Kled and his allies any movement speed if they have more than 840 movement speed.
 Movement speed is granted merely by facing the direction of the draft and rapidly decays if the target leaves the path or moves in the opposite direction.
 Damaging Kled into dismount will cancel Chaaaaaaaarge!!! instantly.
 Enemies gain partial vision of Kled when he charges nearby.
 If Kled encounters terrain that suddenly blocks his path towards the target location (e.g,  Weaver's Wall,  Crystallize,  Pillar of Ice) he will simply walk around it or find an alternate direction if it is not possible.
R.blurb: Kled and Skaarl charge to a location, leaving a speed-granting trail behind them and gaining a shield. Skaarl locks onto and rams the first enemy champion encountered.

R.name: Chaaaaaaaarge!!!

effects.description: Active: Kled and Skaarl charge towards the target location, automatically navigating terrain along the way, during which they're  pacified and immune to crowd control.

While charging, the duo gain  bonus movement speed and a  shield for every 0.25 seconds of traveling, up to 950 total movement speed over 3 seconds and 10% − 100% (based on time traveling) of the maximum shield amount over 2.25 seconds respectively. The shield lasts for 2 seconds upon finishing the charge. The duo trails a directional draft in their wake, lasting 9 seconds. Allied champions following the draft gain Mr. Kled's Wild Ride.
Mr. Kled's Wild Ride: The target gains 650 total movement speed.
Skaarl  homes in on the first enemy champion encountered,  knocking them back 100 units and dealing physical damage, increased by 0% − 200% (based on time traveling).

R.notes:
During the charge the duo gain:
 (950 − (current movement speed)) ÷ 12 × (time ÷ 0.25) bonus movement speed

 The bonus movement speed is not affected by movement speed caps.
 The charge will not give any movement speed to Kled if he has more than 1440 movement speed.
 The trail will not give Kled and his allies any movement speed if they have more than 840 movement speed.
 Movement speed is granted merely by facing the direction of the draft and rapidly decays if the target leaves the path or moves in the opposite direction.
 Damaging Kled into dismount will cancel Chaaaaaaaarge!!! instantly.
 Enemies gain partial vision of Kled when he charges nearby.
 If Kled encounters terrain that suddenly blocks his path towards the target location (e.g,  Weaver's Wall,  Crystallize,  Pillar of Ice) he will simply walk around it or find an alternate direction if it is not possible.
R.blurb: Kled and Skaarl charge to a location, leaving a speed-granting trail behind them and gaining a shield. Skaarl locks onto and rams the first enemy champion encountered.

I.name: Icathian Surprise

effects.description: Innate: Upon taking fatal damage, Kog'Maw remains active for 4 seconds, becoming  pacified,  invulnerable,  untargetable and gaining up to  40% bonus movement speed over the duration. He then explodes, dealing 125 − 550 (based on level)  true damage to all nearby enemies.

I.notes:
Upon triggering Icathian Surprise, Kog'Maw is cleansed of all debuffs and effects that do not inherently persist through death.
 An example for a debuff that does persist through death is  Brand's  Blaze.

  Guardian Angel and  Chronoshift will take precedence over Icathian Surprise.
 Possible Bug: Dying while affected by  Chronoshift allows Kog'Maw to trigger Icathian Surprise immediately and then a second time right after he revives.

 After Icathian Surprise ends, the corpse of Kog'Maw will retain body block for the duration of his death animation.
 If Kog'Maw has an auto attack in the air at the same time that he's moving while he dies, as long as the auto hits the target after Icathian Surprise has started Kog'Maw will be able to auto once during Icathian Surprise.
I.blurb: Upon dying, Kog'Maw starts a chain reaction in his body which causes him to move faster and detonate after 4 seconds; dealing 100 + (25 x lvl) true damage to surrounding enemies.

Q.name: Caustic Spittle

effects.description: Passive: Kog'Maw gains  bonus attack speed.
Active: Kog'Maw launches a corrosive  projectile in a target direction, dealing  magic damage to the first enemy it hits and   reducing their  armor and  magic resistance for 4 seconds.

Q.blurb: Kog'Maw launches a corrosive projectile which deals magic damage and corrodes the target's armor and magic resist for a short time. Kog'Maw also gains additional attack speed.

W.name: Bio-Arcane Barrage

effects.description: Active: For the next 8 seconds, Kog'Maw's basic attacks gain  bonus range and deal bonus magic damage on-hit against non- structures, capped at 100 against  minions and  monsters.

W.blurb: Kog'Maw's attacks gain range and deal a percent of the target's maximum health as magic damage.

E.name: Void Ooze

effects.description: Active: Kog'Maw spews a ball of ooze in the target direction, dealing magic damage and  slowing enemies for 1 second.
The ooze lingers for 4 seconds,  slowing all enemies within the area for an additional 0.25 seconds.

E.notes: No additional details.
E.blurb: Kog'Maw launches a peculiar ooze which damages all enemies it passes through and leaves a trail which slows enemies who stand on it.

R.name: Living Artillery

effects.description: Active: Kog'Maw launches a ball of acid into the air that drops after 0.6 seconds at the target location, dealing magic damage, increased by 0% − 50% (based on target's missing health), and  revealing enemies hit for 2 seconds.
Living Artillery's damage is doubled against enemies below  40% maximum health. Each subsequent Living Artillery within the next 8 seconds costs an additional  40 mana, capping at  400 per cast.

R.notes:
On cast Living Artillery grants slight  sight of the target area.
 Living Artillery will not reveal stealthed champions (can still damage them).
R.blurb: Kog'Maw fires an artillery shell at a great distance dealing magic damage (increased significantly on low health enemies) and revealing non-stealthed targets. Additionally, multiple Living Artilleries in a short period of time cause them to cost additional Mana.

I.name: Mirror Image

effects.description: Innate: When LeBlanc reaches  below 40% maximum health, she creates a controllable clone of herself with the same items, statistics, health and mana, after which they both instantly become  invisible for 1 second.
The clone can basic attack but deals no damage, lasts for 8 seconds, and starts running 1900 units towards a random place in front of LeBlanc decided the moment it spawns.
Schism: Mirror Image can only occur once every few seconds.

I.notes: No additional details.
I.blurb: When LeBlanc damages an enemy with a spell, she marks the target for 4 seconds. After 1.5 seconds, LeBlanc's next spell shatters the Sigil to deal magic damage. Sigil of Malice cannot occur again on the same unit for 5 seconds.

Q.name: Sigil of Malice

effects.description: Active: LeBlanc projects an orb towards the target enemy, dealing  magic damage and marking them for 3.5 seconds.
The mark will be consumed once LeBlanc damages the marked target with an ability, dealing the same magic damage again.

Q.notes: Sigil of Malice and  Mimic Sigil of Malice can detonate each other's marks.

W.name: Distortion

effects.description: First Cast: LeBlanc  dashes to the target location, damaging all nearby enemies upon arrival and leaving a return pad at the cast location for 4 seconds. After 0.2 seconds she can recast  Distortion at no additional cost.
Second Cast: LeBlanc  blinks to Distortion's return pad.

W.notes:
The second cast has no range limit; it is global.
 Distortion and  Mimic Distortion have independent return pads and LeBlanc can travel to both while they are active.
W.blurb: LeBlanc rapidly dashes to a target location, dealing magic damage to nearby units. In the following 4 seconds, she can activate Distortion again to return to her starting location.

W.name: Distortion

effects.description: First Cast: LeBlanc  dashes to the target location, damaging all nearby enemies upon arrival and leaving a return pad at the cast location for 4 seconds. After 0.2 seconds she can recast  Distortion at no additional cost.
Second Cast: LeBlanc  blinks to Distortion's return pad.

W.notes:
The second cast has no range limit; it is global.
 Distortion and  Mimic Distortion have independent return pads and LeBlanc can travel to both while they are active.
W.blurb: LeBlanc rapidly dashes to a target location, dealing magic damage to nearby units. In the following 4 seconds, she can activate Distortion again to return to her starting location.

E.name: Ethereal Chains

effects.description: Active: LeBlanc flings an illusory chain in the target direction, dealing magic damage to the first enemy it hits and tethering herself to them for 1.5 seconds.
The target is  revealed while the tether is attached, and if it is not broken the target will be  revealed and  rooted for 1.5 seconds and dealt additional magic damage.

E.notes:
The tether can be removed by  Quicksilver Sash.
 Both the initial and the delayed damage can detonate  Sigil of Malice.
 The  root from both Ethereal Chains and  Mimic Ethereal Chains will occur concurrently if they are tethered to the same target.
E.blurb: LeBlanc flings illusionary chains towards a target location. If it hits an enemy unit, it will deal initial magic damage and shackle them. If the target remains shackled for 1.5 seconds, the target takes additional magic damage and is unable to move.

R.name: Mimic

effects.description: Active: LeBlanc casts a mimicked version of her most recently used basic ability, applying the same effects and dealing modified magic damage.
