Mimic Sigil of Malice: Deals modified damage and double damage upon triggering the mark.
Mimic Distortion: Deals modified damage.
Mimic Ethereal Chains: Deals modified damage and double damage upon rooting.

R.notes:
Mimic will default to  Mimic Sigil of Malice if LeBlanc ranks up Mimic without having used any abilities beforehand (even if she has not yet learned  Sigil of Malice).
 Both  Mimic Ethereal Chains and  Mimic Sigil of Malice will apply damage twice if the original ability's condition to do so is met.

R.name: Mimic

effects.description: Active: LeBlanc casts a mimicked version of her most recently used basic ability, applying the same effects and dealing modified magic damage.
Mimic Sigil of Malice: Deals modified damage and double damage upon triggering the mark.
Mimic Distortion: Deals modified damage.
Mimic Ethereal Chains: Deals modified damage and double damage upon rooting.

R.notes:
Mimic will default to  Mimic Sigil of Malice if LeBlanc ranks up Mimic without having used any abilities beforehand (even if she has not yet learned  Sigil of Malice).
 Both  Mimic Ethereal Chains and  Mimic Sigil of Malice will apply damage twice if the original ability's condition to do so is met.

R.name: Mimic

effects.description: Active: LeBlanc casts a mimicked version of her most recently used basic ability, applying the same effects and dealing modified magic damage.
Mimic Sigil of Malice: Deals modified damage and double damage upon triggering the mark.
Mimic Distortion: Deals modified damage.
Mimic Ethereal Chains: Deals modified damage and double damage upon rooting.

R.notes:
Mimic will default to  Mimic Sigil of Malice if LeBlanc ranks up Mimic without having used any abilities beforehand (even if she has not yet learned  Sigil of Malice).
 Both  Mimic Ethereal Chains and  Mimic Sigil of Malice will apply damage twice if the original ability's condition to do so is met.

R.name: Mimic

effects.description: Active: LeBlanc casts a mimicked version of her most recently used basic ability, applying the same effects and dealing modified magic damage.
Mimic Sigil of Malice: Deals modified damage and double damage upon triggering the mark.
Mimic Distortion: Deals modified damage.
Mimic Ethereal Chains: Deals modified damage and double damage upon rooting.

R.notes:
Mimic will default to  Mimic Sigil of Malice if LeBlanc ranks up Mimic without having used any abilities beforehand (even if she has not yet learned  Sigil of Malice).
 Both  Mimic Ethereal Chains and  Mimic Sigil of Malice will apply damage twice if the original ability's condition to do so is met.

I.name: Flurry

effects.description: Innate: After using an ability, Lee Sin's next 2 basic attacks within 3 seconds gain  40% bonus attack speed, returning  20 / 30 / 40 (based on level) energy on the first attack and [ half of that ][  10 / 15 / 20 (based on level) energy ] on the second.

I.notes: Flurry will still restore energy even if the attacks are  dodged,  blocked, or  missed.
I.blurb: After Lee Sin uses an ability, his next 2 basic attacks gain 40% Attack Speed and return 20/10 Energy.

Q.name: Sonic Wave

effects.description: Active: Lee Sin fires a sonic blast in the target direction, dealing  physical damage to the first enemy it hits and granting  true sight of them for 3 seconds.
If Sonic Wave hits, Lee Sin can cast  Resonating Strike within the next 3 seconds.

Q.notes: Sonic Wave's  true sight is consumed when Lee Sin casts Resonating Strike.
Q.blurb: Lee Sin projects a discordant wave of sound to locate his enemies, dealing physical damage to the first enemy it encounters. If Sonic Wave hits, Lee Sin can cast Resonating Strike for the next 3 seconds.

Q.name: Resonating Strike

effects.description: Active: Lee Sin  dashes to the enemy marked by  Sonic Wave, placing himself on top of the target and dealing physical damage, increased by 0% − 100% (based on target's missing health).

Q.notes:
Lee Sin will travel to the target's last location if they die during his  dash.
 The target may escape the damage if they  blink the instant they're hit.
Q.blurb: Lee Sin dashes to the enemy hit by Sonic Wave, dealing physical damage.

W.name: Safeguard

effects.description: Active: Lee Sin  dashes to the target ally or friendly  ward. If the ally is a  champion, both they and Lee Sin are  shielded for 2 seconds and Safeguard's  cooldown is reduced by 50%. Lee Sin can self-cast Safeguard to shield himself.
If Safeguard is used, Lee Sin can cast  Iron Will within 3 seconds.

W.notes:
Lee Sin cannot self-cast Safeguard if he is  immobilized.
 Safeguard can be used on any targetable allied unit (e.g,  champions,  minions,  wards,  pets) with the exception of structures.
 Casting Safeguard will  interrupt  Resonating Strike's  dash, preventing any potential damage.
W.blurb: Lee Sin rushes to target ally, shielding himself from damage. If the ally is a champion, they are also shielded. After using Safeguard, Lee Sin can cast Iron Will for the next 3 seconds.

W.name: Iron Will

effects.description: Active: For 4 seconds, Lee Sin gains  bonus life steal and  bonus spell vamp.

W.notes: No additional details.
W.blurb: Lee Sin's intense training allows him to thrive in battle. For 4 seconds, Lee Sin gains Life Steal and Spell Vamp.

E.name: Tempest

effects.description: Active: Lee Sin smashes the ground, dealing magic damage to nearby enemies and granting  sight of them for 4 seconds.
If Tempest hits an enemy, Lee Sin can cast  Cripple within the next 3 seconds.

E.notes: Tempest's  sight is not removed when Lee Sin casts Cripple (unlike  Sonic Wave's).
E.blurb: Lee Sin smashes the ground, sending out a shockwave that deals magic damage and reveals enemy units hit. If Tempest hits an enemy, Lee Sin can cast cripple for the next 3 seconds.

E.name: Cripple

effects.description: Active: Lee Sin  slows all enemies marked by  Tempest in range for 4 seconds, decaying over the duration.

E.notes: Tempest's  sight reveal is not removed when Lee Sin casts Cripple.
E.blurb: Lee Sin cripples nearby enemies damaged by Tempest, reducing their Movement Speed for 4 seconds. Movement Speed recovers gradually over the duration.

R.name: Dragon's Rage

effects.description: Active: Lee Sin instantly  roots the target enemy champion for 0.25 seconds after which he roundhouse kicks them dealing physical damage and  knocking them back 1200 units over 1 second.
Enemies hit by the displaced enemy receive bonus physical damage and are  knocked up for 1 second.

R.notes:
Applies  spell damage to the primary target and  area damage to secondary targets.
 If Dragon's Rage's target dies when first hit there will be no displacement of any kind.
 The  displacement's direction is decided at the moment of impact and not by Lee Sin and his target's relative locations on-cast (the only way for Lee Sin to control where his target is displaced is by using  Flash before Dragon's Rage's cast time ends).
 The collision damage buff of the target remains for the normal duration even if its trajectory is  displaced by another source (i.e  Headbutt).


 The ability will go on  cooldown after dealing its damage.
 Because of this, if  Electrocute procs from the  root and kills the enemy, the ability will not go on cooldown. 
 Dragon's Rage is cancelled if Lee Sin loses  sight of the target.
 However, the  root will still occur.


 If the  knock back ends normally and is not  interrupted early, the target may still knock other enemies for a brief period after they reach their destination.
R.blurb: Lee Sin performs a powerful roundhouse kick launching his target back, dealing physical damage to the target and any enemies they collide with. Enemies the target collides with are knocked into the air for a short duration. This technique was taught to him by Jesse Perring, although Lee Sin does not kick players off the map.

I.name: Sunlight

effects.description: Innate: Leona's abilities mark enemies hit with Sunlight for 1.5 seconds.
Any damage dealt by allies (other than herself) consumes Sunlight, dealing  25 − 144 (based on level) bonus magic damage.

I.notes:
Leona can reapply Sunlight to refresh its duration.
 Sunlight's mark damage is credited to the allied champion and not to Leona.
 The damage will benefit from allies'  magic penetration and will apply any spell effects they have (including  spell vamp.
I.blurb: Damaging spells afflict enemies with Sunlight for 1.5 seconds. When allied Champions deal damage to those targets, they consume the Sunlight to deal additional magic damage.

Q.name: Shield of Daybreak

effects.description: Active: Leona's next basic attack gains  50 bonus range, deals bonus magic damage and  stuns her target for 1 second.
Shield of Daybreak resets Leona's basic attack timer.

Q.notes:
Shield of Daybreak will cause  Muramana's Shock damage to trigger twice with a single basic attack.
 The enhanced attack will apply other  on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal.
  Critical strikes do not interact with Shield of Daybreak's bonus damage.
 Shield of Daybreak's bonus damage will affect  turrets, but not inhibitors or the Nexus.
Q.blurb: Leona uses her shield to perform her next basic attack, dealing bonus magic damage and stunning the target.

W.name: Eclipse

effects.description: Active: For 3 seconds, Leona takes reduced pre-mitigation damage from each tick of damage, up to a maximum of 50% reduction. Leona also gains  bonus armor and  bonus magic resistance.
She then explodes, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies and retains Eclipse's reduced damage and bonus resistances for an additional 3 seconds if she hits an enemy.

W.notes:
Eclipse will interrupt Leona's previous orders if she is in the beginning of a basic attack, in which case the attack itself and its animation will get canceled.
 The resistance scaling will factor from all other sources, including Eclipse's flat bonus. This will recalculate over the duration.
W.blurb: Leona raises her shield to gain Armor and Magic Resist. When the duration first ends, if there are nearby enemies, she will deal magic damage to them and prolong the duration of the effect.

E.name: Zenith Blade

effects.description: Active: Leona projects a solar image of her sword, dealing magic damage to all enemies struck.
If she damages an enemy champion, she will  dash to the last one struck and  root them for 0.5 seconds.
Leona is unable to move or attack while Zenith Blade is in flight.

E.notes:
Leona will attempt to basic attack the target.
  Spell shield will block the damage but not the dash if being the last target hit.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Leona does not  dash if she is  grounded.
E.blurb: Leona projects a solar image of her sword, dealing magic damage to all enemies in a line. When the image fades, the last enemy champion struck will be briefly immobilized and Leona will dash to them.

R.name: Solar Flare

effects.description: Active: Leona calls down a beam of solar energy to the target location, dealing magic damage to all enemies it hits and  slowing them by 80% for 1.5 seconds.
Enemies hit by the flare's center are instead  stunned for the same duration.

R.notes:
Solar Flare grants  sight in a 350 radius for the duration.
 Casting it to a location the enemy has no vision of (i.e bush) will not show any visual effect, but enemies around the area will still be affected.
R.blurb: Leona calls down a beam of solar energy, dealing damage to enemies in an area. Enemies in the center of the area are stunned, while enemies on the outside are slowed. Afterward, Leona's sword is charged with the power of the sun and deals bonus magic damage for a few attacks.

I.name: Iceborn Subjugation

effects.description: Innate: Whenever an enemy champion dies while Lissandra is near, she spawns a Frozen Thrall from their corpse.

Frozen Thralls chase nearby enemies, prioritizing champions,  slowing nearby enemies by 25% and shattering after 4 seconds, dealing 120 − 520 (based on level) (+ 50% AP)  magic damage. Frozen Thralls initially have a slow movement speed, which increases over the duration.

I.notes: Thralls are considered champions for  Turret Plating's  gold sharing.

Q.name: Ice Shard

effects.description: Active: Lissandra hurls a spear of ice in a line which deals magic damage to the first enemy it hits and  slows them for 1.5 seconds.
If the spear damages an enemy, it then shatters, gaining increased range and dealing the same damage to other enemies hit, but applying no slow.

Q.notes:
The shattering projectiles travel the remaining distance Ice Shard would plus an extra 100 units.
 Ice Shard sounds like breaking glass when shattering (the projectiles do not produce any sound on contact).
 Ice Shard's slow has particles resembling cold air.
  Spell shield will block the damage and the slow but will not stop the projectile from shattering.
Q.blurb: Throws a spear of ice that shatters when it hits an enemy, dealing magic damage and slowing Movement Speed. Shards pass through the target, dealing the same damage to other enemies hit.

W.name: Ring of Frost

effects.description: Active: Lissandra freezes all nearby enemies, dealing them magic damage and briefly  rooting them.

W.notes: Ring of Frost has no cast time and does not interrupt Lissandra's previous orders or animations (meaning she can overlap it with any of her other abilities or even basic attacks).
W.blurb: Freezes nearby enemies in ice, dealing magic damage and rooting them.

E.name: Glacial Path

effects.description: Active: Lissandra casts a claw of ice that moves forward in a line, decelerating over 1.25 seconds, dealing magic damage to all enemies it passes through.
Reactivating Glacial Path consumes the claw and  blinks Lissandra to its current location.

E.notes:
Lissandra can reactivate Glacial Path for the duration (plus another 0.2-0.3 after the claw 'skins' into the ground).
 Glacial Path allows Lissandra to surpass through every single wall in all maps, so long as the claw is at least halfway through them.
 Glacial Path cannot be reactivated if Lissandra is  immobilized.
 Glacial Path's endpoint shows through terrain, fog of war and  brush to enemies within 600 range of it.
E.blurb: Lissandra creates an ice claw that deals magic damage. Reactivating this ability transports Lissandra to the claw's current location.

R.name: Frozen Tomb

effects.description: Enemy Cast: After a 0.5-second delay, Lissandra freezes the target enemy champion,  knocking down and  stunning the target for 1.5 seconds.

Self Cast: Lissandra instantly entombs herself, placing herself in  stasis for 2.5 seconds while  healing herself over the duration, with the heal increased by 0% − 100% (based on missing health) at time of cast.

Upon cast, after a 0.5-second delay, Black Ice spreads from Frozen Tomb's target and lasts for 3 seconds, dealing magic damage to all unique enemies entering the area, and  slowing them while they remain within.

R.notes:
It takes ~0.4 for Frozen Tomb to stun and damage the enemy target (they may become untargetable during this window to avoid the effects but the ice field will still be formed) and any movement abilities will be immediately canceled if enemies use them to try to get away from Lissandra when she targets them.
 It takes ~1 second for Frozen Tomb's slow field to fully form.

 Enemies who come in contact with Frozen Tomb's slow field will be damaged and a small visual and sound effect will play.
 Enemies can only be damaged by the ice field once per cast (if they come in contact with it with an active  spell shield they will consume it to become immune to any damage from that particular cast).

  Spell shield will block the single-targeted portion and the radiating ice damage but will not stop it from spreading.
R.blurb: If cast on an enemy champion, the target is frozen solid, stunning it. If cast on Lissandra, she encases herself in dark ice, healing herself while becoming untargetable and invulnerable. Dark ice then emanates from the target dealing magic damage to enemies and slowing Movement Speed.

I.name: Lightslinger

effects.description: Innate: After using an ability, Lucian's next basic attack within 3 seconds shoots twice, the second shot dealing 50 / 55 / 60% (based on level) AD  physical damage, increased to 100% AD against minions.
The second shot applies  on-hits at full effect and can  critically strike for (75% +  18.75%) bonus physical damage, increased to (100% +  25%) against minions.
If Lucian's primary target is killed before the second shot can go off, he automatically shoots another enemy.

I.notes:
Lightslinger is triggered and consumed by the first attack.
 The second attack will prioritize enemy champions (even if hidden in fog of war or in  brush) and enemy  minions with  low health.
 Lightslinger will still be consumed if no second target is found when Lucian fires.

 Lucian can move freely while firing Lightslinger since the second attack is integrated into the first one (like  Double Strike) and has special movement animations depending on the direction he is moving while firing.
 The second shot will not proc on-attack effects like  Runaan's Hurricane or  Guinsoo's Rageblade.
I.blurb: Whenever Lucian uses an ability, his next attack becomes a double-shot.

Q.name: Piercing Light

effects.description: Active: After a 0.4 − 0.25 (based on level)-second delay, Lucian fires a laser in the direction of the target enemy, dealing physical damage to all enemies in a line.

Q.notes: Piercing Light will attempt to lead the target if it is moving but does not adjust further during cast time (enemies can dodge the laser if they change their velocity by a sufficient amount during the delay).
Q.blurb: Lucian shoots a bolt of piercing light through a target.

W.name: Ardent Blaze

effects.description: Active: After a 0.25-second delay, Lucian fires a shot that explodes in a cross pattern upon hitting an enemy or reaching the end of its path, dealing  magic damage and  revealing the area for 1 second.
Enemies hit are marked for 6 seconds.
Lucian gains  bonus movement speed for 1 second if he or allied champions damage a marked target.

W.notes:
Lucian will not gain Ardent Blaze's bonus movement speed if attacks on marked targets are  dodged,  blocked, or if he is  blinded.
  Persistent damage dealt by his allies will proc Ardent Blaze only once.
W.blurb: Lucian shoots a missile that explodes in a star shape, marking enemies. Lucian gains Movement Speed for attacking marked enemies.

W.name: Ardent Blaze

effects.description: Active: After a 0.25-second delay, Lucian fires a shot that explodes in a cross pattern upon hitting an enemy or reaching the end of its path, dealing  magic damage and  revealing the area for 1 second.
Enemies hit are marked for 6 seconds.
Lucian gains  bonus movement speed for 1 second if he or allied champions damage a marked target.

W.notes:
Lucian will not gain Ardent Blaze's bonus movement speed if attacks on marked targets are  dodged,  blocked, or if he is  blinded.
  Persistent damage dealt by his allies will proc Ardent Blaze only once.
W.blurb: Lucian shoots a missile that explodes in a star shape, marking enemies. Lucian gains Movement Speed for attacking marked enemies.

W.name: Ardent Blaze

effects.description: Active: After a 0.25-second delay, Lucian fires a shot that explodes in a cross pattern upon hitting an enemy or reaching the end of its path, dealing  magic damage and  revealing the area for 1 second.
Enemies hit are marked for 6 seconds.
Lucian gains  bonus movement speed for 1 second if he or allied champions damage a marked target.

W.notes:
Lucian will not gain Ardent Blaze's bonus movement speed if attacks on marked targets are  dodged,  blocked, or if he is  blinded.
  Persistent damage dealt by his allies will proc Ardent Blaze only once.
W.blurb: Lucian shoots a missile that explodes in a star shape, marking enemies. Lucian gains Movement Speed for attacking marked enemies.

E.name: Relentless Pursuit

effects.description: Passive: Relentless Pursuit's  cooldown is reduced by 1 second for each  Lightslinger shot landed, doubled to 2 seconds against enemy  champions.
Active: Lucian  dashes in the target direction.
Relentless Pursuit resets Lucian's basic attack timer.
Relentless Pursuit can be cast during  The Culling as well Lucian's other abilities.

E.notes: Additional on-hits during Lightslinger are not considered for the cooldown reduction (i.e  Runaan's Hurricane,  Guinsoo's Rageblade).
E.blurb: Lucian quickly dashes a short distance. Lightslinger attacks reduce Relentless Pursuit's cooldown.

R.name: The Culling

effects.description: Active: Lucian rapidly fires shots in the target direction for 3 seconds, dealing physical damage to the first enemy they collide with. The damage is doubled against enemy  minions.
While using The Culling, Lucian always faces in the casted direction and is  ghosted.
The Culling can be reactivated to end its effects prematurely.

R.notes:
Lucian can interact with  Dark Passage or  Devour without  interrupting The Culling.
 Since The Culling is made up of two parallel skillshots it is possible for enemies to take only half the damage (half of Lucian's shots) if they stand on the edge of The Culling's fire line.
 Even though each bullet can only hit one target, it will not proc  Muramana since The Culling applies spell effects as a direction-targeted  area of effect.
 The damage dealt by each bullet of The Culling is calculated when the bullet reaches the target.
  Spell shield only blocks one instance of damage.
R.blurb: Lucian unleashes a torrent of shots from his weapons.

I.name: Pix, Faerie Companion

effects.description: Innate: Lulu is assisted by Pix, a faerie, who fires a barrage of 3 bolts to her target every time she uses a basic attack against an enemy, dealing 5 − 39 (based on level) (+ 5% AP)  bonus magic damage with each bolt for a total of 15 − 117 (based on level) (+ 15% AP) bonus magic damage per basic attack. The bolts can be blocked by units in the way of Lulu's target.
Casting  Help, Pix! on an ally champion transfers Pix's help to them for 6 seconds.

I.notes:
Pix's bolts do not fire alongside abilities that apply on-hit effects ( Mystic Shot,  Parrrley,  Infinite Duress,  Runaan's Hurricane).
 Each of Pix's attacks consume a stack of  Tribute.
 Pix fires from his own location and not from the one the unit he's following is.
 Pix's damage is counted towards the champion he is currently helping.
I.blurb: Pix is a wild Faerie that accompanies Lulu. Pix will fire a barrage of magical energy at targets that Lulu attacks.

Q.name: Glitterlance

effects.description: Active: Lulu and  Pix each fire a magic bolt towards the target point, dealing magic damage to the first enemy they pass through, reduced to 70% against enemies thereafter, and  slowing them by 80%, decaying over 2 seconds.

If an enemy is hit by both bolts, the second bolt will deal no damage if the first bolt dealt full damage to them, or 30% damage if the first bolt hit another unit before them. The second hit will refresh the  slow.

Q.notes:
Pix fires his bolt from wherever he is when Lulu cast Glitterlance.
 Depending on cursor position both bolts can either crossfire, fire in parallel, or in opposite directions.

 Multiple hits on the same target will refresh the slow.
Q.blurb: Pix and Lulu each fire a bolt of magical energy that heavily slows all enemies it hits. An enemy can only be damaged by one bolt.

W.name: Whimsy

effects.description: On Ally Cast: Lulu casts erratic magic upon an ally champion, giving them  bonus attack speed and  30% (+ 5% per 100 AP) bonus movement speed for the next few seconds.
On Enemy Cast: Lulu launches a spell on the target enemy champion  polymorphing them into a harmless critter, reducing their base movement speed by 60 for a short duration.

W.notes:
Whimsy can  interrupt channeled abilities when used on enemy champions.
 Whimsy's movement speed reduction is not affected by  slow resist.
 Whimsy has no  cast time on ally-cast. It can be cast while moving and will not interrupt previous commands.
W.blurb: If cast on an ally, grants them Attack Speed and Movement Speed for a short time. If cast on an enemy, turns them into an adorable critter that can't attack or cast spells.

E.name: Help, Pix!

effects.description: On Ally Cast: Lulu sends  Pix to the target ally,  shielding them for 2.5 seconds if they are a champion.
On Enemy Cast: Lulu sends  Pix to the target enemy, dealing magic damage and granting  true sight of them for 4 seconds.

E.notes:
Applies  spell damage on enemy-cast and provides a  shield on ally-cast.
 Pix will return to Lulu if the one he's following exceeds his leash range (2000 units).
 Help, Pix! has no cast time. It can be cast while moving and will not interrupt previous commands.
 Pix will continue to assist the target ally for the full duration even if the shield breaks (the same applies for the shield if the target ally leaves Pix's leash range).
 Pix's  Glitterlance bolt can be fired while he is away from Lulu from his location and towards the cursor (effectively extending  Glitterlance's range).
E.blurb: If cast on an ally, commands Pix to jump to an ally and shield them. He then follows them and aids their attacks. If cast on an enemy, commands Pix to jump to an enemy and damage them. He then follows them and grants you vision of that enemy.

R.name: Wild Growth

effects.description: Active: Lulu enlarges the target allied champion,  knocking up units around them for 0.75 seconds, increasing their  bonus health and causing them to  slow nearby units for 7 seconds.

R.notes:
Wild Growth has no cast time. It can be cast while moving and will not interrupt previous commands.
 Wild Growth has a size limit ( Cho'Gath with 10  Feast stacks will not grow significantly but will gain extended range on  Vorpal Spikes).
 Wild Growth's  bonus health is not affected by  Grievous Wounds and its resulting health restoration will persist after the duration ends.
 The  slow persists while enemy units remain in range and for 0.25 seconds after leaving the marked area.
 The  knock up will affect  untargetable units.
 POSSIBLE BUG:  Fizz, while in  Playful, will also become targetable by everything other than  unit-targeted effects.
R.blurb: Lulu enlarges an ally, knocking nearby enemies into the air and granting the ally a large amount of bonus health. For the next few seconds, that ally gains an aura that slows nearby enemies.

I.name: Illumination

effects.description: Innate: Damaging enemies with abilities marks them with light energy for 6 seconds.
Her basic attacks and  Final Spark consume the mark, dealing 20 − 190 (based on level) (+ 20% AP)  bonus magic damage.

I.notes: No additional effects.
I.blurb: Lux's damaging spells charge the target with energy for 6 seconds. Lux's next attack ignites the energy, dealing bonus magic damage (depending on Lux's level) to the target.

Q.name: Light Binding

effects.description: Active: Lux releases a sphere of light in a line that deals magic damage to the first two enemies hit and  roots them for 2 seconds.

Q.notes: Targets affected by a  spell shield or by  Black Shield count towards Light Binding's two-target limit.
Q.blurb: Lux releases a sphere of light that binds and deals damage to up to two enemy units.

W.name: Prismatic Barrier

effects.description: Active: Lux launches her wand in the target direction which returns to her after reaching maximum range.
The outgoing wand  shields Lux and all allied champions it touches for 2.5 seconds.
The returning wand shields for the same amount and for the same duration, while also stacking with the outgoing shield and resetting its duration.
The shields can only stack up to 2 times. Additional shields will neither reset the duration nor strengthen it.

W.notes:
Prismatic Barrier is intercepted only by  Wind Wall.
 If Lux dies before her wand returns it will fizzle upon reaching maximum range.
 The wand decelerates on the way out and accelerates on the way back.
W.blurb: Lux throws her wand and bends the light around any friendly target it touches, protecting them from enemy damage.

E.name: Lucent Singularity

effects.description: Active: Lux sends an anomaly of twisted light to the target area for up to 5 seconds,  slowing enemies inside and granting a 600 radius  vision around it.
At the end of the duration or if Lucent Singularity is reactivated, the area detonates, dealing magic damage.
The slow lingers for 0.25 seconds after leaving the area.

E.notes:
Lux can re-cast Lucent Singularity in flight to detonate on arrival.
 Lucent Singularity grants  sight while also in flight.
E.blurb: Fires an anomaly of twisted light to an area, which slows nearby enemies. Lux can detonate it to damage enemies in the area of effect.

R.name: Final Spark

effects.description: Active: Lux fires a giant laser in a line that deals magic damage, briefly  revealing enemies as well as the surrounding area.

R.notes:
Lux cannot use any ability, summoner spell, or item while casting, but she can reactivate  Lucent Singularity.
 If Lux  Flashes or is  displaced while casting, Final Spark will fire from her original location.
 Final Spark only goes on cooldown when it fires and not when Lux starts casting. If she dies while casting, Final Spark will not go on cooldown.
R.blurb: After gathering energy, Lux fires a beam of light that deals damage to all targets in the area. If Final Spark kills a champion, part of its cooldown is refunded. In addition, triggers Lux's passive ability and refreshes the Illumination debuff duration.

I.name: Granite Shield

effects.description: Shard of the Monolith: Malphite's size scales with  his maximum armor (before applying  Thunderclap's bonus armor), capped at around 850 maximum armor.

Innate: Malphite  shields himself for  10% maximum health.
The shield lasts until it is broken, and refreshes if he has not taken damage in the last few seconds.

I.notes: No additional details.
I.blurb: Malphite is shielded by a layer of rock which absorbs damage up to 10% of his maximum Health. If Malphite has not been hit for 10 seconds, this effect recharges.

Q.name: Seismic Shard

effects.description: Active: Malphite sends a rock rolling to the target enemy, dealing  magic damage to them upon impact,  slowing them for 3 seconds and gaining  bonus movement speed equal to the raw amount the target lost.

Q.notes:
The rock spawns 100 units in front of Malphite.
 Malphite will gain the bonus movement speed for the full duration as long as Seismic Shard impacts the target.
  Spell shield will block the damage and the slow but not the bonus movement speed gain.
Q.blurb: Using his primal elemental magic, Malphite sends a shard of the earth through the ground at his foe, dealing damage upon impact and stealing Movement Speed for 3 seconds.

W.name: Thunderclap

effects.description: Passive: Malphite gains  bonus armor, tripled while  Granite Shield is active.

Active: Malphite's next basic attack within 6 seconds gains 50  bonus range and deals bonus physical damage on-hit. Additionally, for 5 seconds, Malphite's basic attacks also deal physical damage in a cone to units behind his target.
Thunderclap resets Malphite's basic attack timer.

W.notes:
Thunderclap has no cast time and does not interrupt Malphite's previous orders.
 The cone damage cannot be  intercepted.
W.blurb: Malphite starts to hit with such force that his attacks deal damage to all units in front of him. Passively increases his Armor (this amount is tripled while Granite Shield is active).

E.name: Ground Slam

effects.description: Active: Malphite slams the ground, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies and  crippling them for 3 seconds.

E.notes: No additional details.
E.blurb: Malphite slams the ground, sending out a shockwave that deals magic damage based on his Armor as damage and reduces the Attack Speed of enemies for a short duration.

R.name: Unstoppable Force

effects.description: Active: Malphite  dashes  unstoppably to the target location and, upon impact, deals magic damage to all nearby enemies and  knocks them up for 1.5 seconds.

R.blurb: Malphite ferociously charges to a location, damaging enemies and knocking them into the air.

I.name: Void Shift

effects.description: Innate: Malzahar receives Void Shift if he hasn't taken damage nor been affected by  crowd control in the last 30 / 24 / 18 / 12 (based on level) seconds. Damage from  minions does not interact with Void Shift.
Void Shift phases out Malzahar, making him immune to crowd control and taking 90% reduced damage, lingering for 0.25 seconds after taking damage or blocking a crowd control effect.

I.notes: Void Shift will not mitigate  true damage but the buff will be still consumed.
I.blurb: When he hasn't recently taken damage or been crowd controlled, Malzahar gains massive damage reduction and crowd control immunity, lingering for a short period after taking damage. Damage from lane minions is unaffected.

Q.name: Call of the Void

effects.description: Active: Malzahar opens two portals that are each 200 units perpendicular from the target location. After a 0.4-seconds delay, all enemies between the portals take  magic damage and are  silenced.

Q.notes: Call of the Void provides  sight of a small area around it.
Q.blurb: Malzahar opens up two portals to the Void. After a short delay, they fire projectiles that deal Magic Damage and silence enemy champions.

W.name: Void Swarm

effects.description: Passive: Malzahar gains a stack of Zz'Rot Swarm when he casts another spell, up to a maximum of 2.

Active: Malzahar consumes all Zz'Rot Swarm stacks and, after a 0.5-second delay, summons a Voidling at the target location. Additional Voidlings are then summoned for each Zz'Rot Swarm stack consumed.
Voidlings deal magic damage with their attacks. Voidlings deal 50% damage to epic monsters, and 300% damage against lane minions affected by  Malefic Visions.

W.notes:
Malzahar loses all stacks upon death.
 Zz'Rot Swarm stacks are gained per cast and not per ability activation. I.e if  Malefic Visions is casted but loses its target during its cast time the ability will not activate nor go on cooldown, but a Zz'Rot Swarm stack will still be granted.
W.blurb: Malzahar summons Voidlings to attack nearby enemies.

E.name: Malefic Visions

effects.description: Active: Malzahar infects the target enemy's mind, dealing them magic damage every half second over 4 seconds. Damaging a target with  Call of the Void or  Nether Grasp will refresh the duration of Malefic Visions.
If the target dies during this time, they pass Malefic Visions onto the closest enemy, refreshing the duration and restoring  2% of Malzahar's maximum mana.

E.notes:
Voidlings will automatically attack the nearest target affected by Malefic Visions (prioritizing champions) if no target is affected by  Nether Grasp.
 Malefic Visions cannot be removed by any  cleansing effects.
E.blurb: Malzahar infects his target's mind with cruel visions of their demise, dealing damage over time. Using Malzahar's other spells on the target will refresh the visions. If the target dies while afflicted by the visions, they pass on to a nearby enemy unit and Malzahar gains Mana. Malzahar's Voidlings are attracted to affected units.

R.name: Nether Grasp

effects.description: Active: Malzahar forms a tether between him and the target enemy  champion, channeling for 2.5 seconds, during which the target is  knocked down,  suppressed, and dealt magic damage every 0.25 seconds.
A Null Zone is opened beneath the target that lasts 5 seconds, dealing magic damage every half-second to all enemies within.
Nether Grasp and Null Zone will continue to deal damage even if the ability is  interrupted or is  cleansed.

R.notes:
Applies  persistent damage for the tether and  persistent area damage to enemies within the Null Zone.
 Nether Grasp and Null Zone count as two different abilities for effects such as  Electrocute.
R.blurb: Malzahar channels the essence of the Void to suppress an enemy champion over a zone of damaging negative energy.

I.name: Sap Magic

effects.description: Innate: Periodically, Maokai's next basic attack, after a 0.25-seconds delay, against a non-structure  heals him for 5 − 65 (based on level) (+ 6% − 13% (based on level) maximum health).
Each time Maokai casts an ability or is struck by an enemy's ability, Sap Magic's  cooldown is reduced by 4 seconds.
Sap Magic will not activate if Maokai is above 95% maximum  health.

I.notes:
Maokai can gain stacks from nearby enemy  champions he has no  sight of.
 Sap Magic can be  dodged and/or miss if Maokai is  blinded (but will not be consumed) but cannot be  blocked (the damage will be).
 The empowered attack cannot be  cancelled.
 Sap Magic cannot be used against  turrets,  wards, inhibitors or the Nexus.
 If Maokai possesses a  spell shield and it consumes an enemy ability, he will still receive the cooldown reduction.
I.blurb: Maokai's basic attack also heal him on a moderate cooldown. Each time Maokai casts a spell or is struck by an enemy's spell, this cooldown is reduced.

I.name: Sap Magic

effects.description: Innate: Periodically, Maokai's next basic attack, after a 0.25-seconds delay, against a non-structure  heals him for 5 − 65 (based on level) (+ 6% − 13% (based on level) maximum health).
Each time Maokai casts an ability or is struck by an enemy's ability, Sap Magic's  cooldown is reduced by 4 seconds.
Sap Magic will not activate if Maokai is above 95% maximum  health.

I.notes:
Maokai can gain stacks from nearby enemy  champions he has no  sight of.
 Sap Magic can be  dodged and/or miss if Maokai is  blinded (but will not be consumed) but cannot be  blocked (the damage will be).
 The empowered attack cannot be  cancelled.
 Sap Magic cannot be used against  turrets,  wards, inhibitors or the Nexus.
 If Maokai possesses a  spell shield and it consumes an enemy ability, he will still receive the cooldown reduction.
I.blurb: Maokai's basic attack also heal him on a moderate cooldown. Each time Maokai casts a spell or is struck by an enemy's spell, this cooldown is reduced.

Q.name: Bramble Smash

effects.description: Active: After a 0.35-seconds delay, Maokai releases an arcane shockwave that travels forth in a line, dealing  magic damage to all enemies it passes through and  slowing them by 99% for 0.25 seconds.
Enemies near Maokai are also  knocked back up to 300 units based on their proximity to him.

Q.notes: No additional effect.
Q.blurb: Maokai knocks back nearby enemies with a shockwave, dealing magic damage and slowing them.

W.name: Twisted Advance

effects.description: Active: Maokai  dashes to the target enemy, becoming  untargetable for the duration, dealing magic damage on arrival and briefly  rooting them.

W.notes:
Twisted Advance will cancel mid-dash if Maokai's target dies or becomes  untargetable themself.
 Maokai will follow any  dashes or  blinks the target performs.
 He will dash to their original location if they travel from a very far distance (e.g,  Recall,  Teleport,  Gate,  Stand United).
W.blurb: Maokai contorts into a mass of moving roots, becoming untargetable and dashing to the target. Upon arrival, he roots the target.

E.name: Sapling Toss

effects.description: Active: Maokai flings a Sapling to the target location, remaining there for 30 seconds and granting  sight around itself.

Saplings tether to nearby enemies, chasing them for up to 2.5 seconds, exploding upon impact or at the end of its duration, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies upon detonation, capped at 300 against non-champions, and  slowing them by 35% for 2 seconds.

units: % (+ 1% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 1% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 1% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 1% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 1% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health

effects.description: Saplings placed in a  brush instead have 30 (+ 2.5% bonus health) duration and deal double damage over 2 seconds to all enemies hit, capped at 600 against non-champions.

units: % (+ 2% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 2% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 2% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 2% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 2% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health

E.notes:
Applies  area damage from a normal Sapling and deals  persistent damage to enemies hit by an empowered Sapling.
 Saplings have a base movement speed of 400, increased based on Maokai's boots:
  Boots of Speed: 425
  Berserker's Greaves,  Ionian Boots of Lucidity,  Mercury's Treads,  Ninja Tabi and  Sorcerer's Shoes: 445
  Boots of Swiftness and  Boots of Mobility: 460

 Sapling Toss grants  sight of the target location even while the Sapling is in flight.
 The Saplings will continue to chase their target even if they lose  sight of them (but they do not prioritize champions so they will chase the first target they encounter).
 Saplings will appear on the map as minions despite being untargetable and invulnerable.
 Saplings will stop before colliding with  Wind Wall and  Unbreakable while they are in the air.
 Saplings cannot stack on top of each other (they will move a short distance away from one another if they are aimed at the same location).
  Spell shield does not negate the damage from an empowered Sapling.
 Saplings attack  Baron Nashor always at the same two points, no matter where they were placed.
E.blurb: Maokai flings a sapling to the target area to stand guard. More effective in brush.

R.name: Nature's Grasp

effects.description: Active: Maokai summons a colossal wall of 5 thorny brambles that slowly advances forward, each stopping at the first enemy champion they collide with.
Each thorny bramble deals magic damage and  roots for 0.8 −  2.6 (based on distance traveled) seconds.

R.notes:
The brambles can go through terrain.
 Starts off very slow but accelerates, and close the max range becomes very fast.
R.blurb: Maokai summons a colossal wall of brambles and thorns that slowly advances forwards, damaging and rooting any enemies in the path.

I.name: Double Strike

effects.description: Innate: Master Yi gains a stack of Double Strike for every basic attack on-hit within 4 seconds of each other. At 3 stacks, Master Yi's next basic attack on-attack within 4 seconds consumes the stacks to strike twice, the second strike dealing 50% AD  physical damage.
The second strike applies on-attack and on-hit effects at full effect and is affected by  critical strike modifiers.
If Master Yi's primary target is killed before the second strike, he automatically attacks another enemy within 300 range.
The second strike can  critically strike  structures.

I.notes: Since Double Strike resets the counter on-attack and the second strike applies on-hit effects, the second strike is able to add a stack for the next Double Strike activation.
I.blurb: Every few strikes, Master Yi strikes twice.

Q.name: Alpha Strike

effects.description: Active: Master Yi  vanishes and, after 0.225 seconds, marks his target and then moves to mark the nearest  visible un-marked enemy within 600 units, recurring up to 3 times, once every 0.225 seconds.

Upon finishing marking, or if there're no other enemies in range, he  re-appears after a 0.15 second delay in front of his target and deals physical damage to all marked enemies, increased against monsters. If his target dies during the delay, he will reappear at the cast location instead.
If there are no other un-marked enemies in range, he may strike the same enemies again, dealing 25% damage instantly.
Alpha Strike's primary and lesser damage can  critically strike for (60% +  15%) AD bonus physical damage and (15% +  3.75%) AD bonus physical damage respectively.
Basic attacks reduce Alpha Strike's  cooldown by 1 second.

Q.notes:
Alpha Strike's cooldown reduction applies on structures but not when Master Yi is  blinded.
 Master Yi can use summoner spells during Alpha Strike.
 When Master Yi bounces from a unit it will grant  vision around it. It will always grant vision around the primary target even if he doesn't bounce off it. This vision will not reveal brushes.
 Alpha Strike's damage is calculated the moment the mark is placed. Because of this it is possible to inflict differing amounts of damage if Master Yi changes his AD in the middle of Alpha Strike.
 If the target becomes  untargetable during Alpha Strike's cast, Alpha Strike will not end, but will instead last as if it had kept bouncing around targets.
 Master Yi will follow his primary target's movement even if it  vanishes or becomes  invisible.
 Alpha Strike's primary damage applies after Master Yi leaves  untargetability and thus can attract turret aggro.
 Alpha Strike counts as movement for the purposes of Energized Strike, Dreadnought and Echo.
 If the primary target is a champion, Master Yi will basic attack that champion when Alpha Strike finishes, but he cannot buffer  Highlander or  Wuju Style.
 If the primary target is a minon or monster, Master Yi can buffer either  Highlander or  Wuju Style, but he will not automatically basic attack the target.
Q.blurb: Master Yi teleports across the battlefield with blinding speed, dealing physical damage to multiple units in his path, while simultaneously becoming untargetable. Alpha Strike can critically strike and deals bonus physical damage to minions and monsters. Basic attacks reduce Alpha Strike's cooldown.

W.name: Meditate

effects.description: Active: Master Yi  channels for up to 4 seconds,  healing himself every 0.5 seconds, increased by 0% − 100% (based on missing health).
While channeling, Master Yi reduces incoming damage, halved against turrets, pauses  Wuju Style's and  Highlander's duration, and grants one stack of  Double Strike per second.
Meditate resets Master Yi's autoattack timer.

W.notes: Meditate's healing amount updates dynamically as he heals himself, making Master Yi heal for less as his current health increases.
W.blurb: Master Yi rejuvenates his body by focus of mind, restoring Health and taking reduced damage for a short time. In addition, Master Yi will gain stacks of Double Strike and pause the remaining duration on Wuju Style and Highlander for each second he channels.

E.name: Wuju Style

effects.description: Active: Master Yi's basic attacks deal  bonus true damage for 5 seconds.

E.notes:
Wuju Style has no cast time and does not interrupt Master Yi's previous orders.
 Wuju Style's bonus true damage does not interact with  critical strikes nor does it affect structures.
 Wuju Style's bonus true damage cannot be  blocked but can be  dodged and/or miss if Master Yi is  blinded.
E.blurb: Master Yi becomes skilled in the art of Wuju, passively increasing his Attack Damage. Activating Wuju Style grants bonus true damage on basic attacks, but the passive bonus is then lost while on cooldown.

R.name: Highlander

effects.description: Passive: Champion  takedowns reduce the current  cooldown of Master Yi's basic abilities by 70%.
Active: For 7 seconds, Master Yi is  ghosted, gains  bonus attack speed and  bonus movement speed, and becomes immune to  slows and  cripples.
While active, champion  takedowns extend the duration of Highlander by 7 seconds.

R.notes:
Decoys count as champions for the takedown effect.
 Highlander has no cast time and does not interrupt Master Yi's previous orders.
 Highlander's slow immunity extends to all slows including abilities with multiple effects (e.g  fear,  charm) and attack speed slows. The abilities themselves won't be negated, but the slows will.
 There're two situations that can happen if Master Yi uses Highlander while Highlander's buff is active.
 If the buff's duration is under 7 seconds, the buff refreshes to 7 seconds.
 If the buff's duration is above 7 seconds nothing happens.
R.blurb: Master Yi moves with unparalleled agility, temporarily increasing his Movement and Attack Speeds as well as making him immune to all slowing effects. While active, Champion kills or assists extend Highlander's duration. Passively reduces cooldown for his other abilities on a kill or assist.

I.name: Love Tap

effects.description: Innate: Miss Fortune's next basic attack against an enemy unit ( turrets included) that was not the target of her previous basic attack, will deal 50% − 100% (based on level) AD  bonus physical damage, halved to 25% − 50% (based on level) AD against  minions.

I.notes:
With  Runaan's Hurricane, Love Tap only applies to the primary target.
 The bonus damage applies  life steal.
I.blurb: Miss Fortune deals bonus physical damage whenever she attacks a new target.

Q.name: Double Up

effects.description: Active: Miss Fortune fires a shot at a target enemy that deals physical damage, which then bounces to hit another unit behind it. The shot applies  on-hit effects, including  Love Tap.
Double Up's bounce prioritizes units directly behind the primary target.
Double Up's bounce is affected by  critical strike modifiers. If Double Up kills its primary target, the bounce will critically strike.

Q.notes:
Spell shields can be used by either target. If it is on the primary target, the spell shield will not prevent the shot from bouncing.
 The second shot follows a priority order on targets within 500 units of the primary one:
 Enemy or neutral units within a 20° cone.
 Enemy or neutral units within a 40° cone.
 Enemy or neutral units within a 110° cone.
 Enemy or neutral units within 150 units in a 160° cone.

 Double Up's cast range adjusts based on Miss Fortune's attack range.
 Double Up can bounce to units who are hidden if they are in range of the primary target.
 The damage of a  critically striking second shot is 40 / 80 / 120 / 160 / 200 (+ 200% AD) (+ 70% AP) physical damage.
 Double Up triggers  Runaan's Hurricane's Wind's Fury.
Q.blurb: Miss Fortune fires a bullet at an enemy, damaging them and a target behind them. Both strikes can also apply Love Tap.

W.name: Strut

effects.description: Passive - Strut: Miss Fortune gains  25 bonus movement speed if she has not taken damage in the last 5 seconds, excluding damage over time. This bonus is increased to a greater amount after another 5 seconds.
Active - Guns Blazing: Miss Fortune gains  bonus attack speed for 4 seconds and brings Strut's passive effect to full power.
Marking a new target with  Love Tap reduces Strut's  cooldown by 2 seconds.

W.notes: No additional details.
W.blurb: Miss Fortune passively gains Movement Speed when not attacked. This ability can be activated to grant bonus Attack Speed for a short duration. While it's on cooldown, Love Taps reduce the remaining cooldown of Strut.

W.name: Strut

effects.description: Passive - Strut: Miss Fortune gains  25 bonus movement speed if she has not taken damage in the last 5 seconds, excluding damage over time. This bonus is increased to a greater amount after another 5 seconds.
Active - Guns Blazing: Miss Fortune gains  bonus attack speed for 4 seconds and brings Strut's passive effect to full power.
Marking a new target with  Love Tap reduces Strut's  cooldown by 2 seconds.

W.notes: No additional details.
W.blurb: Miss Fortune passively gains Movement Speed when not attacked. This ability can be activated to grant bonus Attack Speed for a short duration. While it's on cooldown, Love Taps reduce the remaining cooldown of Strut.

E.name: Make It Rain

effects.description: Active: Miss Fortune rains down hundreds of bullets onto the target area for 2 seconds,  slowing and dealing  magic damage every 0.25 seconds to units within the area.

E.notes: Make It Rain grants  sight of the area.
E.blurb: Miss Fortune reveals an area with a flurry of bullets, dealing waves of damage to opponents and slowing them.

R.name: Bullet Time

effects.description: Active: Miss Fortune channels for 3 seconds while firing several waves of bullets in a cone towards the target location, with each wave dealing 75% AD (+ 20% AP) physical damage.
Each wave can  critically strike, dealing (20% +  5%) bonus physical damage.

R.notes:
Bullet Time fires a wave of bullets each 0.25 / 0.2308 / 0.2143 / 0.2 / 0.1875 seconds.
 The damage dealt by each wave of Bullet Time is calculated when the wave reaches the target.
R.blurb: Miss Fortune channels a flurry of bullets into a cone in front of her, dealing large amounts of damage to enemies. Each wave of Bullet Time can critically strike.

I.name: Darkness Rise

effects.description: Innate: Mordekaiser's basic attacks deal 40% AP  bonus magic damage on-hit.

Damaging abilities or basic attacks grant 1 stack per enemy champion or large monster hit, up to a maximum of 3. At 3 stacks, Mordekaiser gains Darkness Rise for 4 seconds. Further basic attacks and abilities against enemy champions and large monsters refresh the duration.

Darkness Rise: Mordekaiser deals [ 5 − 15.2 (based on level) (+ 30% AP) (+ 1% − 5% (based on level) of target's maximum health) magic damage per second ][ 0.63 − 1.9 (based on level) (+ 3.75% AP) (+ 0.13% − 0.63% (based on level) of target's maximum health) magic damage every 0.125 seconds ] to all nearby enemies and gains 3% bonus movement speed. Damage is capped against  monsters at 25 − 120 (based on level).

I.notes:
Mordekaiser has a stack counter under his health-bar that is not visible to other champions.
 Darkness Rise's damage doesn't refresh Darkness Rise's buff.
  Dead Man's Plate's bonus damage gives one bonus stack for Darkness Rise, even at 0 Momentum stacks.

Q.name: Obliterate

effects.description: Active: Mordekaiser smashes the area in the target direction, dealing magic damage to all enemies hit, increased if it hits only one enemy.

Q.notes:
Applies  spell damage if it hits one target and  area damage to multiple targets.
 When Obliterate hits a single unit, it is considered a  single target ability and uses a different metallic sound effect.

W.name: Indestructible

effects.description: Passive: Mordekaiser stores 35% of damage he deals and 15% of damage he takes, reduced by 75% against non-champion sources, as Potential Shield on his secondary resource bar, up to  30% of his maximum health. The Potential Shield decays by 8 − 25 (based on level) every second after not dealing or taking damage for 1 second, down to a minimum of 5% of his maximum health.

Active - First Cast: Mordekaiser consumes all his current Potential Shield to  shield himself for 4 seconds for the same amount. At start the shield decays very slowly but exponentially increases near the end. After 0.25 seconds he can re-cast the ability.
Active - Second Cast: Mordekaiser consumes the remaining shield,  healing for a percentage of the amount.

W.notes: No additional details.

effects.description: Passive: Mordekaiser gains  magic penetration.
Active: After 0.5 seconds, Mordekaiser  pulls enemies in the targeted area for 250 units, dealing magic damage.

R.name: Realm of Death

effects.description: Active: Mordekaiser  slows the targeted enemy champion by 75% for 0.5 seconds. If the target is still in range and targetable by the end of the duration they're  banished together with Mordekaiser to the Death Realm for 7 seconds.

Units between realms see each other as spirits, considering each other dead and negating any interactions between the two. Only the target and Mordekaiser will enter the realm; other champions cannot follow them. Everything that occurs inside the Death Realm is hidden, and all non-champion pets still inside are destroyed at the end.

For the same duration, Mordekaiser also reduces the target's current  attack damage,  ability power,  total attack speed,  maximum health,  armor,  magic resist, and size by 10%, in addition to gaining them for himself. If Mordekaiser kills his target while inside, he keeps their partial stats until they respawn.
If one of the two affected champions leave the Death Realm, because of having died or having it dispelled, the other will do so as well, but the stats will remain stolen for the full duration.

R.notes:
The ability will cancel and go on cooldown after the cast time if:
 The target is  unstoppable, cc-immune or  spell shielded.
 He targets a decoy,  Vessel, or  Sion's  Glory in Death.

 The ability will cancel but will not go on cooldown if:
 He loses  sight of his target.
 The target is too far away.
 The target becomes  untargetable.
 The target dies.

 If the target's health is lower than the amount that should be stolen, they will be brought down to 1 health. Mordekaiser will still get the usual amount of maximum health.
 The boundaries are not considered terrain ( exception), but enemies that try to move out of the area will be displaced back inside. 
 Abilities such as  Comet of Legend and  Keeper's Verdict will cap their effect range to the boundary. Targets will stop at the boundary even after it expired.

 Multiple Death Realms spawned will exist in the same dimension, allowing champions to see and interact with champions bound to other circles. Champions are only affected by their boundaries and are not able to see the others.
  Tahm Kench's  Devour can carry a target outside of their circle, but they will be displaced back inside once  Regurgitated. 
 An active  Assault and Battery on a target outside the perimeter will cause  Vi to continue her charge until her circle ends. She can knockback and damage secondary targets multiple times.

 The transition in and out of the Death Realm doesn't interrupt channels and doesn't affect the target's commands. Being in Death Realm can be dispelled if:
 The target uses  Quicksilver Sash or abilities with cc-removals.
 Mordekaiser or the target cast another Realm of Death. The affected champions will remain stuck for the duration of the new circle.

 Tether effects will break upon entering the dimension, unless it is between the two champions entering the dimension.
 Structures exist in all realms at the same time, and  turrets will target normally as if all units were in the same realm.
 Effects interactions:
  The Hextech Ultimatum, catching a  Spinning Axe,  Timewinder,  Null Zone,  Twisted Advance,  Worked Grounds,  Gravity Field,  Satchel Charge,  Rift Scuttler's  Speed Shrine,  Statikk Shiv and gaining  Zeke's Convergence  area of effect are exceptions and may still take effect between dimensions.
 Effects such as  Requiem,  Absolute Zero,  Grand Starfall and  Final Spark will only deal damage to enemies of the dimension they're in at time of cast. Ending the channel or cast time while inside another dimension will not do damage to nearby enemies.
  Shuriken Flip may be re-cast inside the Death Realm even if its target is outside it, but  Akali will stop dashing upon colliding with the boundary.
  Fear Beyond Death may not be re-cast while his victim is not in the same realm as him, but an already chained foe will still continue to be reeled in and executed. The  fear is cast in the realm Urgot is in.
  Void Shift dispels from Realm of Death's slow, making it vulnerable to the Death Realm.
  Ball will instantly return back to her if she's in another dimension.
 Controllable pets and decoys are still controllable between realms.

 PENDING FOR TEST:
  Tahm Kench  Devours the target affected by Death Realm before it ends.

 The  nearsight from  Nocturne's  Paranoia does not affect a target’s  sight radius while in the Death Realm.
 Unless Mordekaiser and  Nocturne are in the same dimension.

I.name: Soul Siphon

effects.description: Innate: Morgana  heals herself equal to 20% of ability damage dealt to  champions, large  minions, and large  monsters.

I.notes: No additional details.
I.blurb: Morgana has Spell Vamp, healing herself whenever she deals damage with her spells.

Q.name: Dark Binding

effects.description: Active: Morgana releases a sphere of dark magic that travels in a line, dealing  magic damage to the first enemy hit and  rooting them.

Q.notes: No additional details.
Q.blurb: Morgana releases a sphere of dark magic. Upon contact with an enemy unit, the sphere will deal magic damage and force the unit to the ground for a period of time.

W.name: Tormented Soil

effects.description: Active: Morgana infects the target area for 5 seconds, causing enemies who stand on the location to take magic damage every half second, increased by 0% − 50% (based on target's missing health).
Tormented Soil's cooldown is reduced by 5% whenever  Soul Siphon triggers.

W.notes:
Tormented Soil's first tick occurs as soon as Morgana casts.
 Damage from multiple Tormented Soils do not stack.
W.blurb: Infects an area with desecrated soil, causing enemy units who stand on the location to take continual damage.

E.name: Black Shield

effects.description: Active: Morgana  shields the target allied champion for up to 5 seconds, which absorbs magic damage and dispels  crowd control effects while the shield holds.

E.notes:
Black Shield has no cast time and does not interrupt Morgana's previous orders.
 Unlike  spell shields, Black Shield will only negate crowd control effects ( Wall of Pain's  slow but not its magic resistance reduction) before any magic damage is absorbed (even if Black Shield is broken by an enemy spell its associated  disables will not apply). As such, an ability like  Death Sentence will not inherently  stun nor  displace the shielded target, but will allow  Thresh to cast  Death Leap, which involves  dashing by recasting the ability.
 Although not considered a crowd control effect, the Black Shield may also block  Illaoi's  Test of Spirit, spirit pull. 

 Black Shield will always take priority over regular shields but, if used in conjunction with  Hexdrinker's or  Sterak's Gage's Lifeline, the most recently-applied one will do so.
 Black Shield will not negate self  pacification.
E.blurb: Places a protective barrier around an allied champion, absorbing magical damage and disables until penetrated or the shield dissipates.

R.name: Soul Shackles

effects.description: Active: After a 0.5-second delay, Morgana latches chains of energy onto nearby enemy champions, dealing magic damage.
The tethers maintain at range for 3 seconds,  revealing affected enemies and  slowing them by 20%. Additionally, Morgana gains bonus movement speed towards them.
When the duration ends, tethered targets are  revealed and  stunned for 1.5 seconds and dealt the same magic damage again.

R.notes:
Soul Shackles cannot be interrupted by crowd control and will persist throughout  Zhonya's Hourglass'  stasis,  Guardian Angel's passive, and  Chronoshift's revival, but can be stopped with Morgana's death.
  Spell shield will only block the initial damage, not the damage that occurs if the target didn't leave the tether range.
R.blurb: Latches chains of energy onto nearby enemy champions, dealing initial damage to them and slowing their Movement Speed, and then echoing the pain a few seconds later and stunning them if they remain close to Morgana.

I.name: Surging Tides

effects.description: Innate: All allied champions touched by any of Nami's abilities gain  60 (+ 20% AP) bonus movement speed for 1.5 seconds,[ doubled ][ 120 (+ 40% AP) ] when touched by  Tidal Wave.

I.notes: Surging Tides will apply when an ally champion is targeted by  Ebb and Flow /  Tidecaller's Blessing or when within  Aqua Prison /  Tidal Wave's impact area.
I.blurb: When Nami's abilities hit allied champions they gain Movement Speed for a short duration.

Q.name: Aqua Prison

effects.description: Active: Nami sends a bubble towards the targeted area, dealing  magic damage to all enemies hit,  revealing them, and  suspending them for 1.5 seconds.

Q.notes:
Aqua Prison counts as a knockup for enabling  Last Breath.[2]
 Cast time makes Aqua Prison take ~0.875 seconds from casting to landing regardless of distance. 
 Since the  area of effect has a ~162 units radius, an enemy unit with 185.14 or less movement speed (325 affected by a 53.8% slow, due to the low-end movement speed soft cap) would find it impossible to escape.
 As a result it might be necessary to have another source of crowd control in order for Aqua Prison to land. A fully-ranked  Tidecaller's Blessing powered by 376 AP would be able to slow for the amount above, although it is unlikely an enemy has not purchased movement speed by that time.
Q.blurb: Sends a bubble to a target area, dealing damage and stunning all enemies on impact.

W.name: Ebb and Flow

effects.description: Active: Nami unleashes a stream of water onto the target champion or herself, which then bounces to nearby unaffected champions up to twice, alternating between enemies, allies and herself.
Ebb and Flow  heals allies and deals magic damage to enemies, with each bounce being 85% (+ 7.5% per 100 AP) as effective as the previous one.

W.notes:
Applies  spell damage in a  area of effect range.
  Spell shield will block only one bounce. Ebb and Flow will continue to bounce and the target who blocked the ability may be targeted again by a later bounce.
 Additional ability power will modify the damage/healing of Ebb and Flow by a percentage, based on the number of bounces.
 At Rank 5 with 0 AP (-15% per bounce) the first heal/damage will be 185/230, the second 157/196, and the third 130/161.
 At Rank 5 with 200 AP (no change per bounce) the heal/damage will be will remain at 245/330 throughout.
 At Rank 5 with 600 AP (+30% per bounce) the first heal/damage will be 365/530, the second 475/689, and the third 584/848.
W.blurb: Unleashes a stream of water that bounces back and forth between allied and enemy champions, healing allies and damaging enemies.

E.name: Tidecaller's Blessing

effects.description: Active: Nami blesses the target allied champion or herself for 6 seconds, causing her target's next three basic attacks or abilities to each deal bonus magic damage and  slow their target for 1 second.
Empowered abilities that apply  area damage or  persistent area damage only deal 33% − 66% (based on level) of the bonus damage to non-champions.

E.notes:
Applies  proc damage on empowered basic attacks and  spell damage for empowered abilities.
 Tidecaller's Blessing has no cast time and does not interrupt Nami's previous orders.
 The enhanced attacks will apply other  on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal (the bonus damage does not).
 Tidecaller's Blessing has no effect against structures.

 Tidecaller's Blessing will not proc  Muramana's shock more than once per basic attack.
 The bonus magic damage benefits from the allied target's  magic penetration, not Nami's.
E.blurb: Empowers an allied champion for a short duration. The ally's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage and slow the target.

R.name: Tidal Wave

effects.description: Active: Nami summons a tidal wave that surges forth, dealing magic damage to all units it hits,  knocking them up for 0.5 seconds and then  slowing them for 2 − 4 (based on distance traveled) seconds.

R.notes:
There is a brief  delay during which Nami performs the animation.
  Surging Tides will trigger immediately on Nami on-cast.
 The wave travels for ~3.2 seconds at ~859 speed and the projectile is ~562 units wide.
 It is undodgeable by foot at 325 movement speed and 742 range.

 The wave places you slightly closer to Nami's cast position.
R.blurb: Summons a massive Tidal Wave that knocks up, slows, and damages enemies. Allies hit gain double the effect of Surging Tides.

I.name: Soul Eater

effects.description: Innate: Nasus permanently has  12 / 18 / 24% (based on level) bonus life steal.

I.notes: No additional details.
I.blurb: Nasus drains his foe's spiritual energy, giving him bonus Life Steal.

Q.name: Siphoning Strike

effects.description: Active: Nasus's next basic attack within 10 seconds gains  25 bonus range and deals  bonus physical damage.
If Siphoning Strike kills its target, Nasus permanently gains 3 stacks, increased to 12 if its target is a  champion, large  minion, or large  monster.
Siphoning Strike resets Nasus' autoattack timer.

Q.notes:
Siphoning Strike's cooldown will not start until the enhanced attack is used or it expires.
 Siphoning Strike's bonus range stacks with  Fury of the Sands', granting 200 total range.
 Nasus can gain Siphoning Strike stacks by last-hitting any targetable enemy units (wards, structures,  Tibbers,  Powder Keg,  Tentacles,  Voidlings,  Jack in the Box,  Noxious Trap,  Mist Walkers,  Maiden of the Mist)
 Siphoning Strike will not generate stacks from secondary units killed by  area damage buffs influenced by basic attacks ( Tiamat's Cleave and Crescent or  Iceborn Gauntlet's Icy Zone).
 Siphoning Strike will not generate stacks from jungle plants.
 The enhanced attack will apply other  on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal.
 Only Siphoning Strike's base damage interacts with  critical strikes but the bonus damage will still apply  life steal as well as affect structures.
 If Siphoning Strike is  missed, the enhanced attack will not be consumed.
Q.blurb: Nasus strikes his foe, dealing damage and increasing the power of his future Siphoning Strikes if he slays his target.

W.name: Wither

effects.description: Active: Nasus ages the target enemy champion for 5 seconds,  slowing them by 35% and  crippling them by[ half that amount, ][ 17.5%, ]both increasing over the duration.

W.notes: If Wither's duration is reduced by  Tenacity the effects will apply faster so the maximum values are reached when the shortened duration ends.
W.blurb: Nasus ages an enemy champion, decelerating their Movement and Attack Speeds over time.

E.name: Spirit Fire

effects.description: Active: Nasus unleashes a spirit flame at the target location, dealing  magic damage to enemies in the area.
The flame then remains for 5 seconds, dealing magic damage each second to all enemies within and reducing their armor while they remain, lingering for 1 second.

E.notes:
Applies  spell damage on initial cast and deals  persistent area damage afterwards.
 Spirit Fire grants  sight of the target area (is smaller than the damage area) for a short duration on-cast.
E.blurb: Nasus unleashes a spirit flame at a location, dealing damage and reducing the Armor of enemies who stand on it.

R.name: Fury of the Sands

effects.description: Active: Nasus empowers himself for 15 seconds, gaining bonus  health,  armor and  magic resistance, increased size, and  50 bonus range on his basic attacks for the duration.

While Nasus is empowered, he deals magic damage to all enemies around him each second, capped at 240, gains bonus  armor and  magic resistance each second, and  Siphoning Strike's  cooldown is reduced by 50%.

R.notes: Fury of the Sands'  bonus health is not affected by  Grievous Wounds and Nasus retains it once the duration ends.
R.blurb: Nasus unleashes a mighty sandstorm that batters nearby enemies. While the storm rages, he gains increased Health, Attack Range, damages nearby enemies, has a reduced cooldown on Siphoning Strike, and gains bonus Armor and Magic Resistance for the duration.

I.name: Staggering Blow

effects.description: Innate: Nautilus's basic attacks deal 8 − 110 (based on level)  bonus physical damage and  root his target for 0.75 − 1.5 (based on level) seconds.
This effect cannot occur on the same target more than once every few seconds.

I.notes:
Spell shield will block the  root but not the bonus damage.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Staggering Blow's interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects.
I.blurb: Nautilus' basic attacks deal bonus physical damage and immobilize his targets. This effect cannot happen more than once every few seconds on the same target.

Q.name: Dredge Line

effects.description: Active: Nautilus hurls his anchor forward in a line, simultaneously  dragging the enemy hit towards him while  dashing towards them within 0.9 seconds, dealing  magic damage and  rooting them for 0.1 seconds.
If the anchor hits terrain, Nautilus dashes to the very end of its path, Dredge Line's  cooldown is reduced by 50% and refunds  half its mana cost.
Nautilus becomes  entangled while Dredge Line is in flight.

Q.notes:
Dredge Line can interact with player-created terrain ( Cataclysm,  Crystallize,  Pillar of Ice).
 Nautilus will  dash all the way to the target's location if Dredge Line executes them.
 Dredge Line will not  interrupt any movement commands Nautilus was issued pre-cast so long as their directions somewhat correlate (this is intentional to smooth out traveling/escaping).
  Spell shield will block the ability but Nautilus will still dash partway to the target.
 The anchor projectile will not act if Nautilus dies while the projectile is traveling.
 Nautilus will attempt to basic attack his target at the end of the dash. This attack will not grant a stack of  Conqueror,  Electrocute,  Phase Rush or  Spellthief's Edge.
Q.blurb: Nautilus hurls his anchor forward. If it hits a champion, he drags both himself and the opponent close together. If it hits terrain, Nautilus instead pulls himself to the anchor, the cooldown of Dredge Line is reduced by half, and half the Mana cost is refunded.

W.name: Titan's Wrath

effects.description: Active: Nautilus  shields himself for up to 6 seconds.
While the shield holds, his basic attacks deal bonus magic damage over 2 seconds to his target and all enemies around them.
Titan's Wrath resets Nautilus'  basic attack timer.

W.notes:
Applies  proc damage to primary target and  area damage to secondary targets.
 Titan's Wrath has no cast time and does not interrupt Nautilus' previous orders.
 The first half of Titan's Wrath's damage is dealt on-hit (so long as the shield remains) while the rest is applied over the next second (regardless of Nautilus' attack speed).
 Nautilus'  basic attacks use different animations while Titan's Wrath is active.
 The damage over time will always apply when this animation plays (even if the shield fades during a basic attack).

 Titan's Wrath does not deal bonus damage to structures.
 PENDING FOR TEST Interaction with  Counter Strike,  Spirit's Refuge and  blind.
  Spell shield will block the ability (but only a single application).
W.blurb: Nautilus surrounds himself with dark energies, gaining a shield that blocks incoming damage. While the shield persists, his attacks apply a damage over time effect to enemies around his target.

E.name: Riptide

effects.description: Active: Nautilus creates 3 waves of explosions that radiate from him, each dealing magic damage to all enemies hit and  slowing them by an amount that decays over 1.5 seconds.
Enemies hit by subsequent waves beyond the first are dealt half damage.

E.notes:
Riptide's waves radiate only from the cast location rather than from Nautlius.
  Spell shield will block a single wave.
E.blurb: Nautilus slams the ground, causing the earth to explode around him in a set of three explosions. Each explosion damages and slows enemies.

R.name: Depth Charge

effects.description: Active: Nautilus sends out a  Depth Charge that chases the target enemy champion, dealing magic damage while  knocking them up for 1 second and  stunning them on arrival.
All enemies hit along the way are dealt less damage,  knocked up for 1 second, and are also  stunned.

R.notes:
Depth Charge is cancelled (does not go on  cooldown) if:
 The target becomes  untargetable.
 Nautilus loses  sight of the target (during initial cast).
 The target dies.

 Depth Charge permeates through terrain, and will accelerate over time to ensure it cannot be outran (only extreme movement speed could potentially make it so).
 Moving away from a location at a far distance ( Recall,  Teleport) before Depth Charge hits will make the shockwaves disappear.

  Spell shield will only block the shockwave for the primary target, while still affecting secondary ones.
R.blurb: Nautilus fires a shockwave into the earth that chases an opponent. This shockwave rips up the earth above it, knocking enemies into the air. When it reaches the opponent, the shockwave erupts, knocking his target into the air and stunning them.

R.name: Depth Charge

effects.description: Active: Nautilus sends out a  Depth Charge that chases the target enemy champion, dealing magic damage while  knocking them up for 1 second and  stunning them on arrival.
All enemies hit along the way are dealt less damage,  knocked up for 1 second, and are also  stunned.

R.notes:
Depth Charge is cancelled (does not go on  cooldown) if:
 The target becomes  untargetable.
 Nautilus loses  sight of the target (during initial cast).
 The target dies.

 Depth Charge permeates through terrain, and will accelerate over time to ensure it cannot be outran (only extreme movement speed could potentially make it so).
 Moving away from a location at a far distance ( Recall,  Teleport) before Depth Charge hits will make the shockwaves disappear.

  Spell shield will only block the shockwave for the primary target, while still affecting secondary ones.
R.blurb: Nautilus fires a shockwave into the earth that chases an opponent. This shockwave rips up the earth above it, knocking enemies into the air. When it reaches the opponent, the shockwave erupts, knocking his target into the air and stunning them.

I.name: Inherent Glamour

effects.description: Innate: Neeko is offered a selection of  allied champions to take their appearance. Once selected, there's a 2.5 seconds delay before another champion can be selected.

While disguised, Neeko can use basic attacks while keeping her form. Taking damage from enemy champions, or casting either  Blooming Burst or  Tangle-Barbs breaks the illusion and puts Inherent Glamour on  cooldown.
When disguised, Neeko can select herself to deactivate her disguise, putting Inherent Glamour on a 2-second  cooldown.

I.notes:
Neeko will copy aesthetics as well as superficial mechanical Statistics. She will fake a number of readings:
 Health bar (original's current amount becomes her apparent maximum)
 Secondary resource - e.g. mana, energy or none at all (original's current amount becomes her apparent maximum)
 Statistics
 Buffs and debuffs with their respective icons and VFX
 Kill feed icon

A number of attributes she actually adopts are:
 Default transformation toggle (non-innate)
 Voice lines
 Character interactions (Jokes, taunts, dances, laughs, toggle effects), as well as their  Recall animation
 Base movement speed
 Attack range (will not adopt longer attack range)
I.blurb: Neeko can look like an ally champion. Champion combat or casting damaging spells breaks the disguise.

Q.name: Blooming Burst

effects.description: Active: Neeko propels a seed into a target area dealing  magic damage to enemies within.
If the seed kills an enemy unit or damages a champion or large  monster, it will bloom again after a short delay to deal magic damage. This cannot happen more than twice per Blooming Burst.

Q.notes: Spell shield blocks only one instance of damage.
Q.blurb: Neeko throws a seed dealing magic damage. The seed blooms again on hitting champions or killing units.

W.name: Shapesplitter

effects.description: Passive: Basic attacks on-hit grant Neeko a stack of Shapesplitter, up to a maximum of two. At 2 stacks, Neeko's next basic attack on-attack consumes the stacks to turn her attack into a  non-projectile, dealing bonus magic damage and granting her  bonus movement speed for 1 second.

Active: Neeko becomes  invisible for 0.5 seconds, sending a temporary clone of her  current form sprinting in the target direction for 3 seconds and up to 900 units away. The clone is  untargetable for the first 0.5 seconds.
Both Neeko and the clone gain bonus movement speed for 3 seconds.

W.notes: The clone travels in the target direction until it runs into terrain.

E.name: Tangle-Barbs
