effects.description: Active: Neeko slings a magical spiral in a target direction, dealing magic damage and  rooting enemies it passes through.
If Tangle-Barbs hits at least one enemy, it grows in size and speed, and the root duration is increased.

E.notes: No additional details.

R.name: Pop Blossom

effects.description: Active: Neeko winds up over 1.25 seconds, creating a zone around her. The zone is invisible to enemies while she is  disguised.
Neeko then  shields herself for 2 seconds, increased for each enemy champion nearby, as she leaps into the air for 0.6 seconds.
Upon landing, Neeko bursts with spiritual energy, dealing magic damage and  stunning nearby enemies for 1.25 seconds.

R.notes:
Stasis will not cancel Pop Blossom and can be activated during the wind up but not during the leap.
 If Neeko is moved during the leap under any circumstances ( knock back,  dash,  blink), she will strike down from the new location.

I.name: Prowl

effects.description: Innate - Prowl: Being in  brush grants Nidalee  10% bonus movement speed for 2 seconds, increased to 30% when facing a nearby  visible enemy  champion.

Innate - Hunt: Hitting nearby  monsters or enemy champions with  Javelin Toss or  Bushwhack marks them as Hunted,  revealing them for 4 seconds and granting Nidalee  10% bonus movement speed for the same duration, increased to 30% when facing a nearby Hunted target. Additionally, Nidalee's first use of  Takedown and  Pounce against Hunted targets are empowered.
The bonus movement speed from Prowl and Hunt can stack, but cannot exceed 30%.

I.blurb: Moving through brush increases Nidalee's Movement Speed by 10% for 2 seconds, increased to 30% toward visible enemy champions within 1400 range. Hitting champions or monsters with Javelin Toss or Bushwhack triggers a Hunt, granting True Sight of them for 4 seconds. During this time, Nidalee gains 10% Movement Speed (increased to 30% toward the Hunted target) and her Takedown and Pounce are enhanced against them.

Q.name: Javelin Toss

effects.description: Active: Nidalee hurls a javelin forward in a line, dealing  magic damage to the first enemy it hits, which is increased by 0% − 200% (based on distance traveled).

Q.notes: No additional details.
Q.blurb: In human form, Nidalee throws a spiked javelin at her target that gains damage as it flies.

Q.name: Takedown

effects.description: Active: Nidalee's next basic attack gains  75 bonus range and is modified to deal magic damage, increased by an amount for every 1% of target's missing health.
Hunt Bonus: Takedown deals 40% increased damage to Hunted targets.
Takedown resets Nidalee's autoattack timer. Other damage converted to magic damage by Takedown are not increased by Takedown's respective effects.

Q.notes:
Takedown has no cast time and does not interrupt Nidalee's previous orders.
 The attack enhanced by Takedown will apply other on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal (damage not increased by Takedown) (magic damage to  Hunted targets is displayed as such only for clarity reasons) as well as affect structures (will not deal bonus damage based on their missing health).
 Basic attacks enhanced by Takedown convert Spellblade damage from  Sheen,  Iceborn Gauntlet, and/or  Trinity Force from physical to magic. Their damage is however not increased by Takedown.
 Takedown's damage will apply  life steal.
 Takedown's enhanced attack cannot be  dodged, but it can be  blocked or missed if Nidalee is  blinded.
Q.blurb: As a cougar, her next attack will attempt to fatally wound her target, dealing more damage the less life they have.

W.name: Bushwhack

effects.description: Active: Nidalee lays a  trap at the target location, which  stealths and arms after a brief delay and lasts for up to 2 minutes. The next enemy who springs the trap takes magic damage over 4 seconds and are  revealed for the duration.

Traps have  6 maximum health and can only be damaged by champion basic attacks (2 hit points from  ranged and 3 hit points from  melee). Up to a maximum of 4 / 6 / 8 / 10 (based on level) traps may be active at once.

W.blurb: In human form, Nidalee lays a trap for unwary opponents that, when sprung, damages and reveals its target.

W.name: Pounce

effects.description: Active: Nidalee  dashes a fixed distance in the direction of the cursor, dealing magic damage to enemies around her landing point.
Hunt Bonus: Nidalee can cursor-over Hunted enemies to Pounce on them from increased range.
Killing a unit while in Cougar Form or using Pounce's Hunt bonus reduces Pounce's remaining  cooldown to a value. This has no effect if the remaining cooldown is already lower than that value.

W.notes:
Pounce goes on cooldown on cast, and will not receive the reduced cooldown if the target becomes Hunted mid-air.
 PENDING FOR TEST  Akali can still be affected by an enhanced  Pounce during her  Twilight Shroud.
W.blurb: As a cougar, she jumps in a direction, dealing damage in an area where she lands.

E.name: Primal Surge

effects.description: Active: Nidalee evokes the spirit of the cougar,  healing the target allied champion or herself, increased by 0% − 100% (based on target's missing health), and granting them  bonus attack speed for 7 seconds.

E.notes: The bonus attack speed will persist through  Cougar Form if Nidalee uses  Primal Surge on herself.
E.blurb: In human form, Nidalee channels the spirit of the cougar to heal her allies and imbue them with Attack Speed for a short duration.

E.name: Swipe

effects.description: Active: Nidalee claws at enemies in an arc in the direction of the cursor, dealing magic damage to all enemies hit.

E.notes: No additional details.
E.blurb: As a cougar, she claws in a direction, dealing damage to enemies in front of her.

R.name: Aspect of the Cougar

effects.description: Active: Nidalee transforms herself into a cougar, gaining  melee attacks with  125 range as well as new abilities.
Active: Nidalee transforms herself into a human, gaining  ranged attacks with 525  range as well as new abilities.
Triggering  Hunt resets Aspect of the Cougar's  cooldown if Nidalee is in human form.
Nidalee begins with one rank in Aspect of the Cougar and can increase it at levels 6, 11, and 16.

R.notes: No additional details.
R.blurb: Nidalee transforms into a cougar, gaining new abilities.

I.name: Umbra Blades

effects.description: Innate: Nocturne's basic attack is periodically enhanced, dealing  20% AD  bonus physical damage to his target and  120% AD  physical damage to surrounding enemies, while also  healing himself for 15 − 40 (based on level) ( + 15% AP) per enemy hit.
Umbra Blades's damage to the primary target can  critically strike for  2.5%  AD  bonus physical damage.
Basic attacks reduce Umbra Blades'  cooldown by 1 second, increased to 2 seconds against enemy champions.

I.notes:
Basic attacks against structures will reduce Umbra Blades' cooldown but will not trigger the  splash damage.
 The enhanced attack will apply other on-hit effects (only to main target) and can  critically strike as normal.
I.blurb: Every 10 seconds, Nocturne's next attack strikes surrounding enemies for 120% physical damage and heals himself. Nocturne's basic attacks reduce this cooldown by 1 second.

Q.name: Duskbringer

effects.description: Active: Nocturne sends out a shadow blade in a line that leaves a Dusk Trail on its path, dealing  physical damage to enemies it passes through and causing enemy  champions hit to also leave a Dusk Trail behind their  movement for 5 seconds.
While on the Dusk Trail, Nocturne is  ghosted and gains  bonus movement speed and  bonus attack damage.

Q.notes:
Duskbringer's Dusk Trail will 'reveal' the path of affected units until its duration ends. This means it can indirectly show the location of any affected units without  vision on them, including those in  stealth.
  Spell shield will block the damage and also prevents the Dusk Trail from following the target.
 The formed Dusk Trail does not disappear if Duskbringer is  destroyed.
Q.blurb: Nocturne throws a shadow blade that deals damage, leaves a Dusk Trail, and causes champions to leave a Dusk Trail. While on the trail, Nocturne can move through units and has increased Movement Speed and Attack Damage.

W.name: Shroud of Darkness

effects.description: Passive: Nocturne empowers his blades, permanently gaining  bonus attack speed.
Active: Nocturne gains a  spell shield for 1.5 seconds.
Blocking an ability will double Shroud of Darkness' passive  bonus attack speed for 5 seconds.

W.notes:
Shroud of Darkness has no cast time and does not interrupt Nocturne's previous orders.
 If Shroud of Darkness is active when Nocturne re-casts  Paranoia to dash to a target, it'll stay active until Nocturne reaches his target.
W.blurb: Nocturne empowers his blades, passively gaining Attack Speed. Activating Shroud of Darkness allows Nocturne to fade into the shadows, creating a magical barrier which blocks a single enemy ability and doubles his passive Attack Speed if successful.

E.name: Unspeakable Horror

effects.description: Passive: Nocturne gains  335 bonus movement speed when moving toward  fleeing targets.
Active: Nocturne plants nightmares into his target's mind, dealing  magic damage over 2 seconds and forming a tether between him and his target.
If the target does not break the tether by moving out of range, they are made to  flee from Nocturne for a short duration while  slowed by 90%.

E.notes:
Unspeakable Horror has no cast time and does not interrupt Nocturne's previous orders.
 Unspeakable Horror's tether will not break if the target enters  stealth or becomes  untargetable.
  Spell shield will block the tether but not the  fear from one already present.
E.blurb: Nocturne plants a nightmare into his target's mind, dealing damage each second and terrifying the target if they do not get out of range by the end of the duration.

R.name: Paranoia

effects.description: First Active: After a brief delay, Nocturne applies  nearsight to all enemy champions for 6 seconds.
Second Active: While Paranoia is active, Nocturne can reactivate it to  dash  unstoppably to the target enemy  champion, dealing them  physical damage.

R.notes:
Paranoia has no cast time and does not interrupt Nocturne's previous orders.
 Nocturne can cast his abilities, summoner spells, and active items during flight.
 Self-based movement spells such as  Flash will  interrupt Paranoia while he is flying to his target.


  Spell shield does not block the  nearsight of Paranoia but it will absorb the damage dealt from the second active.
 Nocturne will track targets that change locations (moving,  dashing,  blinking) but not those that cover great distances ( recalling,  teleporting) in which case he will travel to their most previous location.
 Paranoia's  nearsight will prevent an enemy  Shen or  Galio from using their ultimate abilities ( Stand United and  Hero's Entrance) on allies from afar.
 Enemy  champions affected by Paranoia cannot cast  Teleport globally.
  Untargetability does not invalidate the targeting of the nearsight.
 However,  vanishing effects negate it at the time of cast.
R.blurb: Nocturne reduces the sight radius of all enemy champions and removes their ally vision in the process. He can then launch himself at a nearby enemy champion.

I.name: Call of the Freljord

effects.description: Innate: Nunu's and Willump's next instance of damage dealt to an enemy  champion, large  monster or  structure grants both Willump and the nearest allied champion Call of the Freljord for 4 seconds, prioritizing the ally with  highest attack speed.

Call of the Freljord: Targets gain  20% bonus attack speed and  10% bonus movement speed. Additionally, Willump gains  splash damage on his basic attacks, dealing 30% AD physical damage in a cone to enemies behind the target.
Nunu and Willump cannot trigger Call of the Freljord from the same enemy again for a time. Successive triggers of Call of the Freljord will stack the duration.

I.notes: The splash damage will critically strike when the basic attack does, but will not deal any bonus damage.

Q.name: Consume

effects.description: Active: Willump takes a bite of a target enemy after 0.25 seconds, dealing  magic damage and  healing himself. The heal is increased by 50% when below  50% of maximum health.
Against  minions and  monsters he deals  true damage instead, and restores 25% more health.

Q.notes:
Icon border glows when he is within the maximum healing threshold.
 If the ability would deal lethal damage and the target is a minion or small-medium monster, it will instead perform an unique animation,  stunning and  pulling them, and then deal the true damage.
  Spell shields will block the damage and the heal.

W.name: Biggest Snowball Ever!

effects.description: Active: Willump breaks free of active  slowing effects and conjures a  snowball that he begins rolling in the target direction for up to 10 seconds, increasing in power over 5 seconds. Its size radius also increases to 75 − 200 (based on charge time) units. He can steer with a slow turn rate that increases over time; changing direction resets the turn rate.

The duo is slowed by 50% for the first 1 second, but is  immune to other  slows and keeps all movement speed buffs at time of cast for the duration of the charge. After a delay, the duo gains  14 movement speed every 0.25 seconds, up to the greater value between [ Total MS + 85 − 255 (based on level) ][ Total Uncapped Flat MS + 85 − 255 (based on level) ]. The bonus movement speed from Biggest Snowball Ever! ignores the movement speed cap.

The snowball explodes upon colliding with an enemy  champion,  large pet, medium-large  monster or terrain, dealing magic damage to surrounding enemies, increased by 0% − 400% (based on charge time),  knocking them up for 0.5 − 0.75 (based on charge time) seconds and subsequently  stunning them for 0 − 0.5 (based on charge time) seconds.
The snowball rolls over  minions and small monsters in its path dealing 33.3% of the damage as magic damage.

After 10 seconds, upon re-activation after 0.5 seconds, or if the duo is  interrupted, they will let loose the snowball, sending it rolling forward for an additional 750 − 1750 (based on charge time) units during which it will not grow any larger and will explode upon colliding with an enemy unit.

W.notes:
There are 3 stages where the turn rate increases from the original one:
 After turning for 1 second, the turn rate is increased to 175%.
 After turning for 3 seconds, the turn rate is increased to 250%.
 After turning for 6 seconds, the turn rate is increased to 325% where it caps.

 The time threshold to begin gaining bonus movement speed may be bugged, as Flat Bonus MS increases the time while % Bonus MS decreases the time.
 The formula appears to be (X / 100) - Y, where:
 X = Total Flat MS after caps
 Y = 0.1 per 1% %MS 


 The delay is not modified from its initially calculated value on-cast, even if additional movement speed is gained.
 Nunu and Willump's movement speed always increases in increments of ~14, regardless of which total value he will reach. This takes 6 increments to reach the Total MS + 85, but may take more to reach the Uncapped Flat + 85. Due to flat bonuses increasing the time threshold, it is possible for the ability's effects to end before reaching the total uncapped movement speed. 
 If Nunu turns continuously he will create a 600 unit circle, increased with bonus movement speed, striking the same point up to 3 times, for a maximum of 180 / 225 / 270 / 315 / 360 (+ 300% AP) magic damage. The damage can be further increased by detonating the snowball, for a total of 360 / 450 / 540 / 630 / 720 (+450% AP) magic damage.
  Ryze's  Realm Warp will only teleport Nunu and Willump, leaving the  snowball behind.
 Hovering the cursor on the HUD (e.g minimap / champion portraits) does not affect the cast and steering of Biggest Snowball Ever!.

E.name: Snowball Barrage

effects.description: Active: Nunu swiftly throws a volley of 3 snowballs in the target direction over 0.4 seconds, each snowball shattering upon hitting an enemy, dealing magic damage to enemies in a cone.
Enemies hit 3 times are  slowed for 1 second. Champions and large monsters hit once are also Snowbound for 4 seconds, resetting on each hit.
Snowball Barrage can be re-activated up to 2 times at no cost for 3 seconds. An enemy cannot be  slowed more than once. After 3 seconds, it is Willump's Turn.
Willump's Turn: Snowbound enemies around Willump take magic damage and are  rooted for 0.5 − 1.5 (based on level) seconds.

E.notes:
Because of snowballs' cast time and travel time it is possible for Willump's Turn to come in while Nunu is still launching his snowballs.
 Nunu can move while casting Snowball Barrage.

R.name: Absolute Zero

effects.description: Active: Nunu and Willump sap heat from the surrounding  area for 3 seconds,  slowing affected enemies by 0% − 95% (based on channel time), as well as gaining a  shield. The affected area is hidden if the duo is not  visible to the enemy team.

At the end of the duration or if the channel is  interrupted, surrounding enemies take magic damage, reduced by 100% − 0% (based on channel time). Once the channel ends, affected enemies will remain  slowed for 0 − 3 (based on channel time) seconds and any remaining shield will decay over 3 seconds.

R.notes: No additional details.

I.name: Berserker Rage

effects.description: Innate: Olaf gains 0% − 100% (based on missing health)  bonus attack speed.

I.notes: No additional details.
I.blurb: Olaf's Attack Speed is increased by 1% for each 1% of his Health he is missing.

Q.name: Undertow

effects.description: Active: Olaf throws an axe to the target location, dealing  physical damage to all enemies it passes through and  slowing them for 1.5 − 2.5 (based on distance traveled) seconds.
The axe remains at the target location for a duration equal to the  cooldown. Olaf reduces the cooldown of Undertow by 4.5 seconds upon retrieving an axe.

Q.notes:
Undertow briefly grants  sight upon landing.
 The timer for how long an axe stays on the ground starts upon landing, so it is possible to throw another axe before grabbing the one from the ground.
 Olaf cannot pick up an enemy twin's Undertow (unlike  Draven with  Spinning Axe).
Q.blurb: Olaf throws an axe into the ground at a target location, dealing damage to enemies it passes through and slowing their Movement Speed. If Olaf picks up the axe, the ability's  cooldown is reduced by 4.5 seconds.

W.name: Vicious Strikes

effects.description: Active: For 6 seconds, Olaf gains  bonus attack speed, bonus  life steal, and 0% − 50% (based on missing health) enhanced  healing from all sources.
Life steal and  spell vamp bonuses are calculated on-cast and remain static for the full duration. If the ability is re-casted the duration refreshes without re-calculating the bonuses.

W.notes: No additional details.
W.blurb: Olaf's Attack Speed is increased, he gains Life Steal and has increased healing from all sources based on how much Health he is missing.

E.name: Reckless Swing

effects.description: Active: Olaf strikes thunder onto the target enemy, dealing them  true damage.
Reckless Swing  heals Olaf for  its health cost if it kills its target and its  cooldown is reduced by 1 second every time Olaf lands a basic attack.

E.notes:
Olaf will pay Reckless Swing's cost (30% total damage) even if the target is not damaged.
 Reckless Swing can be cast at any health amount but Olaf will never drop below 1 current health (effectively being able to cast for free at that value).
 Reckless Swing's health refund is considered  healing therefore it is affected by  Vicious Strikes and  Spirit Visage.
 Reckless Swing will cancel if Olaf loses sight of his target during cast time.
E.blurb: Olaf attacks with such force that it deals true damage to his target and himself, refunding the Health cost if he destroys the target.

R.name: Ragnarok

effects.description: Passive: Olaf gains  bonus armor and  bonus magic resistance while Ragnarok is inactive.

Active: Olaf  cleanses himself of all  crowd control. For the next 6 seconds, he becomes immune to crowd controls and gains bonus attack damage. For the first second of Ragnarok, he also gains  bonus movement speed when moving towards nearby  visible nearby enemy  champions.

R.notes:
Ragnarok can be cast while Olaf is disabled by enemies but will not remove any active  displacement or  Tempered Fate's  stasis (only future applications).
 Ragnarok will not bypass any allied disables ( Zhonya's Hourglass'  stasis,  Fate's Call).
 Abilities with debuff components ( Permafrost,  Chomp,  Mocking Shout) will not be negated by Ragnarok (only their crowd control ones).
 If caught in  The Hextech Ultimatum, Olaf cannot escape the area unless he has a  blink during which Ragnarok is active, as he is immune to  grounding effects. This interaction occurs because the border of the hexagon is considered to be terrain for the affected target.
 Ragnarok upon activation will not  cleanse  nearsight.
R.blurb: Olaf temporarily becomes immune to disables.

I.name: Clockwork Windup

effects.description: Innate - The Ball: Orianna is accompanied by The Ball, which she commands with her abilities. The Ball has a 0.15 seconds global cooldown between casts. Additionally, The Ball attaches to Orianna if she is near it, and blinks back to Orianna if she is too far away from it.

Clockwork Winding: Orianna's basic attacks deal 10 − 50 (based on level) (+ 15% AP)  bonus magic damage  on-hit and gain Clockwork Winding for 4 seconds, stacking up to twice. Clockwork Windup deals[ 20% bonus damage ][ 2 − 10 (based on level) (+ 3% AP) bonus damage ] per stack, up to 14 − 70 (based on level) (+ 21% AP) total bonus magic damage.
Orianna loses all stacks of Clockwork Winding when she attacks a new target.

I.notes:
;The Ball
 An arrow will appear near Orianna whenever The Ball is not attached to her, pointing towards its location.
 The arrow will change colors depending on how far away they are from each other. From nearest to farthest: green/blue (whether colorblind mode is off or on, respectively) yellow, red (at which point The Ball will blink back to Orianna if she moves just a bit further away).
 Orianna's abilities go on a 0.5 seconds global cooldown (0.75 for  Command: Shockwave) each time The Ball blinks back to her (to prevent sudden mistargeting).


 The Ball is  untargetable, ignores terrain collision, and grants  sight around its current location.

Clockwork Winding

 Clockwork Winding's stack count can be seen in Orianna's buff bar.
 Clockwork Winding doesn't increase any on-hit magic damage other than its own.
 Orianna's basic attacks will not apply Clockwork Winding if she purchases  Runaan's Hurricane.
I.blurb: Orianna's autoattack deals additional magic damage. This damage increases the more Orianna attacks the same target.

I.name: Clockwork Windup

effects.description: Innate - The Ball: Orianna is accompanied by The Ball, which she commands with her abilities. The Ball has a 0.15 seconds global cooldown between casts. Additionally, The Ball attaches to Orianna if she is near it, and blinks back to Orianna if she is too far away from it.

Clockwork Winding: Orianna's basic attacks deal 10 − 50 (based on level) (+ 15% AP)  bonus magic damage  on-hit and gain Clockwork Winding for 4 seconds, stacking up to twice. Clockwork Windup deals[ 20% bonus damage ][ 2 − 10 (based on level) (+ 3% AP) bonus damage ] per stack, up to 14 − 70 (based on level) (+ 21% AP) total bonus magic damage.
Orianna loses all stacks of Clockwork Winding when she attacks a new target.

I.notes:
;The Ball
 An arrow will appear near Orianna whenever The Ball is not attached to her, pointing towards its location.
 The arrow will change colors depending on how far away they are from each other. From nearest to farthest: green/blue (whether colorblind mode is off or on, respectively) yellow, red (at which point The Ball will blink back to Orianna if she moves just a bit further away).
 Orianna's abilities go on a 0.5 seconds global cooldown (0.75 for  Command: Shockwave) each time The Ball blinks back to her (to prevent sudden mistargeting).


 The Ball is  untargetable, ignores terrain collision, and grants  sight around its current location.

Clockwork Winding

 Clockwork Winding's stack count can be seen in Orianna's buff bar.
 Clockwork Winding doesn't increase any on-hit magic damage other than its own.
 Orianna's basic attacks will not apply Clockwork Winding if she purchases  Runaan's Hurricane.
I.blurb: Orianna's autoattack deals additional magic damage. This damage increases the more Orianna attacks the same target.

Q.name: Command: Attack

effects.description: Active: Orianna commands  The Ball to fly to the target location and remain there, dealing magic damage to all enemies it passes through, reduced to 100% − 40% (based on enemies hit).

Q.notes:
Command Attack has no cast time and does not interrupt Orianna's movement if The Ball is not attached to her (otherwise an animation will play and interrupt any movement commands).
 Orianna cannot use other abilities while The Ball is in transit but she may still perform other actions.

 The Ball will remain in the target location until Orianna retrieves it or if she goes beyond its leash range.
 Orianna will attempt to walk to Command Attack's cast point if it lies outside cast range (The Ball will never exceed its leash range regardless of target direction).

 The Ball will be  knocked down upon colliding with  Yasuo's  Wind Wall.
Q.blurb: Orianna commands her Ball to fire toward a target location, dealing magic damage to targets along the way (deals less damage to subsequent targets). Her Ball remains at the target location after.

W.name: Command: Dissonance

effects.description: Active: Orianna commands  The Ball to emit an electric pulse around its current location, dealing magic damage to all enemies around it and leaving an electric field on the area for 3 seconds.
Orianna and her allies gain  bonus movement speed upon stepping on the field. Enemies, in turn, are  slowed for the same amount, decaying over 2 seconds after leaving the field.

W.notes:
Command Dissonance has no cast time and does not interrupt any of Orianna's actions.
 Command Dissonance, if buffered while  Command: Attack, will be immediately casted at the destination when the ball has stopped moving.
W.blurb: Orianna commands the Ball to release a pulse of energy, dealing magic damage around it. This leaves a field behind that speeds up allies and slows enemies.

E.name: Command: Protect

effects.description: Passive:  The Ball grants whomever it is attached to bonus  armor and  magic resistance.

Active: Orianna commands The Ball to fly to the targeted allied  champion or herself and attach itself to her target, dealing magic damage to all enemies it passes through and  shielding her target on arrival for 2.5 seconds.

E.notes:
Applies  area damage to enemies along the way and provides a  shield to allies.
 Command Protect has no cast time and does not interrupt Orianna's previous orders.
 Orianna gains Command Protect's bonus resistances whenever The Ball is attached to her (even if she didn't self-cast).
 The Ball will remain where Command Protect's target ally died or, if instead they die or become  untargetable while it is mid-flight, snap back to Orianna.
 The Ball will return to Orianna if Command Protect's target ally moves too far away from her (The Ball will always respect its leash range, which is increased by 100 when attached to allied champions).

 The Ball will join Command Protect's target ally in  stealth if they are affected by it when Orianna targets them.
E.blurb: Orianna commands her Ball to attach to an allied champion, shielding them and dealing magic damage to any enemies it passes through on the way. Additionally, the Ball grants additional Armor and Magic Resist to the champion it is attached to.

R.name: Command: Shockwave

effects.description: Active: Orianna commands  The Ball to unleash a shockwave after a 0.75 seconds delay, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies and  pulling them 350 units towards The Ball.

R.notes:
PENDING FOR TEST: Enemies are disabled for a total 1.25 seconds.
 Command Shockwave tosses enemies a set distance (those on the edge of the flinging area will be tossed to the center while those close to the middle will go over The Ball towards the edge) and can send them through walls.
 Command Shockwave, if buffered while  Command: Attack, will be immediately casted at the target location when the ball has stopped moving.
 Orianna can  Flash during the delay while The Ball is attached to her and Command Shockwave will update its  area of effect location.
R.blurb: Orianna commands her Ball to unleash a shockwave, dealing magic damage and launching nearby enemies towards the Ball after a short delay.

I.name: Living Forge

effects.description: Innate: Ornn gains an additional  10% bonus armor and  10% bonus magic resistance from all sources.

Living Forge: Ornn can purchase non-consumable items from anywhere on the field by forging them himself, and is also presented a Forge Menu with his recommended items to select to be forged.  Forging takes 4 seconds and the process is  interrupted if Ornn enters combat, disabling Living Forge.

Master Craftman: When Ornn reaches level 12, any upgradable (Masterwork) item Ornn owns or purchases for the rest of the game is upgraded for free, up to a maximum of 2. Additionally, for each level after 12 (level 13, 14, 15 and 16), Ornn can upgrade one of his ally's upgradable items (Masterwork) by getting within 600 range of them and clicking on them, up to a maximum of 1 per ally.
 Masterwork items: 
 Attack Damage Items:  Might of the Ruined King,  Molten Edge,  Obsidian Cleaver,  Trinity Fusion,  Youmuu's Wraithblade.
 Ability Power Items:  Luden's Pulse,  Rabadon's Deathcrown,  Zhonya's Paradox.
 Tank Items:  Forgefire Cape,  Frozen Fist,  Infernal Mask.
 Support Items:  Circlet of the Iron Solari,  Salvation.
Temper: Ornn's basic attacks against  Brittle enemies briefly  knocks them back.
Enemies made  Brittle by Ornn take 12% − 20.5% (based on Ornn's level) of their maximum health as  bonus magic damage the next time they are  immobilized by Ornn or his allies, consuming Brittle.

I.notes:
Gold is only deducted upon completing the channel.
 The reduction in Tenacity will benefit all applicable types of crowd control, not just immobilizes. Effects such as slows, blinds and silences will be empowered without consuming the debuff.
 Despite the in-game tooltip attribute Brittle to  Bellows Breath, it is not required to rank Bellows Breath in order to benefit from the effect. 
 PENDING FOR TEST: The bonus magic damage inflicted by Brittle is credited to Ornn.
 Mastercraft items and their components are not the same item and so in theory any unnamed passives would stack and any unnamed actives would only put themselves on cooldown upon activated. This is however not true. Actives will always place their counterpart on cooldown, and passives are inconsistent: 
 The  Heal and Shield Power from  Redemption and  Salvation stack, granting 20% when having them together.
  The Black Cleaver and  The Obsidian Cleaver each apply 1 stack (for a total of 2) per instance of  physical damage.
 The bonus on-hit damage from  Blade of the Ruined King and  Might of the Ruined King do not stack.
 The auras of  Abyssal Mask and  Infernal Mask do not stack.
 The passive of  Infinity Edge and  Molten Edge do not stack.
 Both passives of  Youmuu's Ghostblade and  Youmuu's Wraithblade do not stack.
 The passive of  Rabadon's Deathcap and  Rabadon's Deathcrown do not stack.

 PENDING FOR TEST:  Brittle's interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects via basic attack.
I.blurb: Ornn can spend gold to forge non-consumable items anywhere. Additionally, when Ornn reaches level 12 masterwork upgrades for some items become available for Ornn and his team to purchase. Ornn can smith items directly from his forge menu or the shop.

Living Forge: Ornn can purchase non-consumable items from anywhere on the field by forging them himself, and is also presented a Forge Menu with his recommended items to select to be forged.  Forging takes 4 seconds and the process is  interrupted if Ornn enters combat, disabling Living Forge.

I.blurb: Ornn can spend gold to forge non-consumable items anywhere. Additionally, when Ornn reaches level 12 masterwork upgrades for some items become available for Ornn and his team to purchase. Ornn can smith items directly from his forge menu or the shop.

Q.name: Volcanic Rupture

effects.description: Active: Ornn slams the ground, sending a fissure in the target direction that stops at maximum range or 200 units behind a hit enemy champion, dealing  physical damage and  slowing enemies hit by 40% for 2 seconds.
After a 1.125-second delay, a  magma pillar erupts at maximum range,  knocking aside enemies hit and lingering as impassible terrain for 4 seconds.
The pillar will not expire while Ornn is  charging.

Q.notes:
The fissure will move an 200 units beyond the first champion it hits, not exceeding the maximum range of the ability. It can still damage additional targets.
 The pillar's  formation applies brief displacement. Doing so consumes all stacks of  Brittle on the displaced targets.
 Volcanic Rupture is  knocked down upon colliding with  Wind Wall.
 If launched in a wall, pillar will try to appear on the other side of the wall, if it cannot the pillar will be destroyed.
Q.blurb: Ornn slams the ground, sending out a fissure dealing damage and slowing enemies hit. After a small delay, a magma pillar forms at the end location.

W.name: Bellows Breath

effects.description: Active: Ornn marches  unstoppably in the target direction with 35% reduced  movement speed for 0.75 seconds.
Over the march he belches fire over a cone in front of him, dealing magic damage every 0.15 seconds to enemies hit. The final bout of flame will apply  Brittle for 3 seconds.
Bellows Breath has a minimum damage threshold, which is also the damage dealt to  minions.  Monsters take modified damage in addition.

W.notes:
The belch deals 5 instances of damage.
  Spell shield will negate the final instance of damage and prevents  Brittle from being applied.
W.blurb: Ornn advances unstoppably, breathing fire and shielding himself. Enemies hit by the final gout of flame become Brittle.

E.name: Searing Charge

effects.description: Active: Ornn  charges forward, dealing physical damage to enemies he passes through, stopping upon colliding with terrain.
If Ornn collides with terrain while charging he creates a shockwave that deals the same damage and  knocks up enemies within for 1 second. Enemies can only be damaged once by Searing Charge.
The shockwave destroys  Magma pillars and partially destroys terrain created by enemy champions.

E.notes: Spell shield blocks either instance of damage dealt by Searing Charge.
E.blurb: Ornn charges, dealing damage to enemies he passes through. If Ornn collides with terrain while charging, the impact creates a shockwave around him which deals damage and knocks up enemies.

R.name: Call of the Forge God

effects.description: First Cast: Ornn summons an elemental at maximum range in the target direction that stampedes toward him, dealing magic damage and  slowing enemies hit for 2 seconds, as well as applying  Brittle for 3 seconds. The  slow scales with the distance traveled by the elemental, with a minimum of 10%.
While stampeding, Ornn can re-activate Call of the Forge God.

Second Cast: Ornn  dashes 300 units in the target direction. If Ornn collides with the elemental, he headbutts it, sending it stampeding again in the new direction and empowering it to  knock up enemies hit for 1 second, reduced to 0.5 seconds after the first enemy champion hit. Call of the Forge God can affect enemies twice and applies  Brittle on each hit.

R.notes:
The  dash on the second cast cannot be used to pass through terrain.
 If Ornn does not use or misses the elemental on the second cast, the elemental will continue ~500 units behind the cast location. 
  Spell shields will block only one instance of damage dealt by the elemental.
R.blurb: Ornn summons a massive elemental at a location which travels toward him with increasing speed. Enemies run over by the elemental take damage, are slowed and are made Brittle. Ornn can recast the ability to charge into the elemental, redirecting it in the direction he hits it, causing the elemental to affect any enemies it runs over to be knocked up for 1 second, dealing the same damage and re-applying Brittle.

I.name: Mortal Will

effects.description: Innate: Pantheon gains a stack of Mortal Will when he lands a basic attack  on-hit or casts an ability, up to a maximum of 5. At 5 stacks, Pantheon's next basic ability consume the stacks to grant additional effects.
Pantheon gains full stacks upon starting the game and upon respawning.

I.notes: No additional details.
I.blurb: After five basic attacks or ability cast, Pantheon's next basic ability (Q, W, or E) is empowered.

Q.name: Comet Spear

effects.description: First Cast: Pantheon winds up for up to 4 seconds, increasing Comet Spear's range while being  slowed by 10%.

Second Cast: Pantheon hurls his spear, dealing  physical damage to all enemies hit, increased against enemies below 20% of their maximum health but reduced by 30% against  minions and by 50% against enemies beyond the first.

Releasing the ability within 0.35 seconds causes Pantheon to instead thrust his spear forward, dealing the same physical damage to all enemies hit and refunding 50% of Comet Spear's  cooldown. The thrust's damage is not reduced against enemies beyond the first.
If Pantheon is  interrupted during the charge, or the charge completes without reactivation, Comet Spear is cancelled and the ability is put on full cooldown but refunds  half the mana cost.
Mortal Will: Deals an additional 20 − 240 (based on level) (+ 100% bonus AD) bonus physical damage, affected by the previous damage reductions, to all enemies hit and  slows them for 2.5 seconds.

Q.notes: No additional details.
Q.blurb: Tap: Pantheon strikes in a direction, damaging all enemies in a line. Hold: Pantheon throws his spear in a line. Empowered: Enemies take extra damage and are slowed.

W.name: Shield Vault

effects.description: Active: Pantheon  dashes to the target enemy unit, dealing them physical damage and  stunning them for 1 second.

Mortal Will: Pantheon's next basic attack within 4 seconds strikes his target 3 times, dealing 45% − 55% (based on level) AD physical damage per hit, up to 135% − 165% (based on level) AD. Each hit is affected by  critical strike modifiers and applies on-hit effects.
The Empowered Shield Vault resets Pantheon's basic attack timer.
The ability can be dodged if the target moves 800 units away.
Pantheon will attempt to automatically basic attack his target at the end of the dash.

W.notes:
Applies  spell damage on the initial vault. Deals  default damage on the additional attacks from the empowered ability.
 The 3 strikes that occurs after Empowered Shield Vault each apply a stack of  Mortal Will.
 If Shield Vault is used without Mortal Will beyond Pantheon's basic attack range, the auto attack following will not grant any stack of  Conqueror,  Electrocute,  Phase Rush or  Spellthief's Edge.
 PENDING FOR TEST:  Enhanced Shield Vault's interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects.
W.blurb: Pantheon leaps to a target enemy, dealing damage and stunning them. Empowered: Pantheon's next basic attack hits three times, each at reduced damage.

E.name: Aegis Assault

effects.description: Active: Pantheon braces his shield in the target direction for 1.5 seconds, during which he is  slowed for between 0% − 50% (based on his movement direction). Aegis Assault can't be  interrupted.

For the duration, Pantheon is  invulnerable against damage dealt by enemies ( turrets included) from the target direction, and deals[ up to 100% AD physical damage over the duration ][ 8.3% AD physical damage every 0.125 seconds ] in a cone to all enemies struck, reduced by 50% against  minions.
At the end of the duration or upon reactivation after 0.3 seconds, Pantheon slams with his shield after a 0.25-second delay, dealing physical damage.
Mortal Will: Aegis Assault's duration is increased to 2.5 seconds, dealing[ up to 166.6% AD physical damage over the duration ][ 8.3% AD physical damage every 0.125 seconds ].

E.notes:
Blink ability damage is calculated before the displacement.
 The self-slow is affected by  slow resist.
  Spell shield will only block the slam's damage.
E.blurb: Pantheon sets his shield in a direction, gaining invulnerability to damage from enemies in that direction and dealing damage continuously. The last hit is extra powerful and still activates if E is canceled early. Empowered: Aegis Assault lasts longer.

R.name: Grand Starfall

effects.description: Active: Pantheon channels for 2 seconds to leap high into the air, then marks and  reveals his destination before crashing down along the target area 2.7 seconds later. He remains  vanished until the landing is complete.
The landing deals  magic damage, decreased by up to 50% at the edges of the area.
Grand Starfall instantly readies  Mortal Will.
Grand Starfall's  cooldown is reduced to 30 seconds if the channel is  interrupted.

R.notes:
PENDING FOR TEST: Grand Starfall's  interactions with  The Hextech Ultimatum, buff and debuff retention, and  untargetability bypasses (e.g,  Tempered Fate,  Realm Warp,  Nexus Obelisk's turret laser).
 Abilities that target Pantheon will redirect to the last location.
  Umbral Trespass will damage Pantheon during the travel, but will stay at the previous location.

 Pinging the ability will inform allies in chat which  visible  enemy champions are in range of Grand Starfall.
R.blurb: Pantheon leaps into the air and then hurtles back toward a target location, damaging enemies as he passes through. Mortal Will activates immediately when he lands.

I.name: Iron Ambassador

effects.description: Innate: Poppy periodically  throws her buckler as her next basic attack, gaining  350 bonus range and dealing 20 − 180 (based on level)  bonus magic damage. The buckler then falls near her target, where it remains for up to 4 seconds.

When Poppy picks up the buckler, she  shields herself for  15 / 17.5 / 20% (based on level) maximum health for 3 seconds. If the buckler kills its target, it bounces back to Poppy automatically. Enemy  champions can step on the buckler to destroy it.

I.notes:
Iron Ambassador's enhanced attack applies on-hit effects as well as  life steal and can  critically strike (the bonus damage cannot).
 Iron Ambassador is considered a  melee attack.
 Iron Ambassador does not trigger on-attack effects nor does it interact with  Help, Pix!.

 PENDING FOR TEST: Iron Ambassador's  interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects.
I.blurb: Poppy throws her buckler, gaining range and bonus magic damage. The buckler lands at a nearby location and Poppy can pick it up to gain a shield. Enemies can step on the buckler to destroy it.

I.name: Iron Ambassador

effects.description: Innate: Poppy periodically  throws her buckler as her next basic attack, gaining  350 bonus range and dealing 20 − 180 (based on level)  bonus magic damage. The buckler then falls near her target, where it remains for up to 4 seconds.

When Poppy picks up the buckler, she  shields herself for  15 / 17.5 / 20% (based on level) maximum health for 3 seconds. If the buckler kills its target, it bounces back to Poppy automatically. Enemy  champions can step on the buckler to destroy it.

I.notes:
Iron Ambassador's enhanced attack applies on-hit effects as well as  life steal and can  critically strike (the bonus damage cannot).
 Iron Ambassador is considered a  melee attack.
 Iron Ambassador does not trigger on-attack effects nor does it interact with  Help, Pix!.

 PENDING FOR TEST: Iron Ambassador's  interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects.
I.blurb: Poppy throws her buckler, gaining range and bonus magic damage. The buckler lands at a nearby location and Poppy can pick it up to gain a shield. Enemies can step on the buckler to destroy it.

Q.name: Hammer Shock

effects.description: Active: Poppy smashes the ground in front of her, dealing  physical damage to all enemies hit. Against  monsters, the damage based on their maximum health is capped at the base damage value.
The impacted ground becomes unstable,  slowing enemies standing on it before erupting after 1 second, dealing the same physical damage to all enemies hit.

Q.notes: Spell shields will block only a single instance of damage.
Q.blurb: Poppy swings her hammer, dealing damage and creating a zone that will slow enemies and explode after a delay.

W.name: Steadfast Presence

effects.description: Passive - Stubborn to a Fault: Poppy's  total armor and  total magic resistance are both increased by 10%, doubled to 20% when she falls  below 40% maximum health.

Active: Poppy gains  40% bonus movement speed for 2 seconds and generates a barrier around herself for the duration, causing all enemies who  dash within to be  knocked down, dealt magic damage, and are both  grounded and  slowed by 25% for 2 seconds.
Steadfast Presence can only block a single dash per enemy per cast.

W.notes:
Steadfast Presence has no cast time and does not interrupt Poppy's previous orders.
 Steadfast Presence does not stop  dashes that are classified as  unstoppable or they are  untargetable while dashing[1] ( Playful /  Trickster,  Onslaught of Shadows,  Cataclysm,  Fate's Call,  Unstoppable Force,  Twisted Advance,  Paranoia,  Void Rush,  Assault and Battery,  Infinite Duress,  Death Mark).
 Steadfast Presence does not stop  lunging effects.

↑ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u3JOjNR-eFE
W.blurb: Poppy passively gains Armor and Magic Resist. This bonus increases when she is low on Health. Poppy can activate Steadfast Presence to stop enemy dashes around her and gain movement speed.

W.name: Steadfast Presence

effects.description: Passive - Stubborn to a Fault: Poppy's  total armor and  total magic resistance are both increased by 10%, doubled to 20% when she falls  below 40% maximum health.

Active: Poppy gains  40% bonus movement speed for 2 seconds and generates a barrier around herself for the duration, causing all enemies who  dash within to be  knocked down, dealt magic damage, and are both  grounded and  slowed by 25% for 2 seconds.
Steadfast Presence can only block a single dash per enemy per cast.

W.notes:
Steadfast Presence has no cast time and does not interrupt Poppy's previous orders.
 Steadfast Presence does not stop  dashes that are classified as  unstoppable or they are  untargetable while dashing[1] ( Playful /  Trickster,  Onslaught of Shadows,  Cataclysm,  Fate's Call,  Unstoppable Force,  Twisted Advance,  Paranoia,  Void Rush,  Assault and Battery,  Infinite Duress,  Death Mark).
 Steadfast Presence does not stop  lunging effects.

↑ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u3JOjNR-eFE
W.blurb: Poppy passively gains Armor and Magic Resist. This bonus increases when she is low on Health. Poppy can activate Steadfast Presence to stop enemy dashes around her and gain movement speed.

E.name: Heroic Charge

effects.description: Active: Poppy  dashes to the target enemy, dealing physical damage and  carrying them along with her for up to 300 units.
If they collide with terrain, she deals them the same physical damage again and  stuns them.

E.notes:
Heroic Charge applies spell effects twice (once when Poppy hits her target and once she stuns them against a wall).
 Poppy can use Heroic Charge to go through walls provided her target is on the opposite side when she casts.
 Heroic Charge interacts with impassable player-created terrain ( Crystallize,  Emperor's Divide,  Cataclysm,  Pillar of Ice).
E.blurb: Poppy dashes to the target and pushes it back. If the target is pushed into a wall, it is stunned.

R.name: Keeper's Verdict

effects.description: First Cast: Poppy  charges for up to 4 seconds,  slowing herself by 15% for the duration. Keeper's Verdict's  cooldown is set to 30 seconds if canceled.

Second Cast: Poppy smashes the ground, sending out a shockwave that travels in the target direction. When it hits an enemy champion, a massive hammer erupts, dealing physical damage to all enemies around it. Enemies struck by the hammer are  knocked back an incredible distance towards their fountain.
Instantly releasing the ability ends the charge, dealing 50% reduced damage and  knocking up all enemies around Poppy for 0.75 seconds.

Poppy has  sight of enemies she knocks  airborne and they are rendered  untargetable for the duration, with their displacement distance increasing based on how long Keeper's Verdict was charged. An uncharged attack does not render enemies  untargetable.

R.notes: Keeper's Verdict only interacts with  Yasuo's  Last Breath when instantly released due to enemies hit becoming  untargetable for the displacement's duration when charged.
R.blurb: Poppy channels a hammer strike that knocks enemies very far away.

I.name: Gift of the Drowned Ones

effects.description: Innate: Pyke's  maximum health cannot increase except through growth (per level), instead he gains[ 1 bonus attack damage per 14 bonus health ][ (7.143% bonus health) bonus attack damage ].
Pyke also stores 25% − 50% (based on level) of the damage he takes from enemy champions as Grey Health on his health bar, up to 80 (+ 800% bonus AD), with an upper cap of 60% of his maximum health.
When Pyke is unseen by enemies, he rapidly consumes his Grey Health to  heal for the same amount.

I.notes:
Game elements that increase health based on the champion's health (e.g  Cinderhulk,  Gargoyle Stoneplate's,  Overgrowth) will increase the health before getting converted by Gift of the Drowned Ones, thus granting increased bonus AD.
  Spirit Visage and  Grievous Wounds take effect after Gift of the Drowned Ones's healing cap.
Pyke's Grey Health does not have a time limit, and will stay on his health bar until Pyke leaves enemy vision or dies.
 Since Pyke's maximum health cannot be increased, Gift of the Drowned Ones reaches the upper cap of 60% of maximum health at 35 − 149.75 (based on level) bonus attack damage.
