Q.name: Bone Skewer

effects.description: First Cast: Pyke winds up for up to 3 seconds, increasing Bone Skewer's range by up to 700 units while being  slowed by 20%.
Second Cast: Pyke hurls his harpoon, dealing  physical damage to the first enemy struck,  pulling them a fixed 550 units towards him and  slowing them by 90% for 1 second.
Releasing the ability within 0.5 seconds causes Pyke to instead thrust his harpoon, hitting the closest enemy unit, prioritizing enemy champions.
If Pyke  interrupted during the charge, or the charge completes without reactivation, Bone Skewer is cancelled and the ability is put on full  cooldown but refunds  half the mana cost.

Q.notes:
Since the pull is a fixed distance, Pyke will throw enemies behind him if he uses the ability at close range.
  Wind Wall and  Unbreakable will only block the charged ability.

W.name: Ghostwater Dive

effects.description: Active: Pyke enters  camouflage and gains  bonus movement speed that decays over 5 seconds. Enemies are notified if Pyke is within 1500 units of them.
Attacking or casting abilities immediately ends  camouflage.

W.notes:
When Pyke is hidden nearby in his Ghostwater Dive, sharks will circle underneath nearby enemies' feet and a sound will be played, changing based on the amount of health they have left.
 Enemies will hear a disturbing deadly warning tone if their health bar is under the threshold of Death from Below.

E.name: Phantom Undertow

effects.description: Active: Pyke  dashes, leaving behind a drowned phantom.
After 1 second, the phantom returns to Pyke,  stunning enemies it passes through for 1.25 (+ 0.1 per 10 Lethality) seconds. Enemy  champions also take physical damage.

E.notes: The  dash can go through any wall as long as it can reach over half of its width, behaving similarly to a  blink.

R.name: Death from Below

effects.description: Active: Pyke marks the targeted area with an X which he strikes after a 0.75 second delay, executing enemy  champions below 250 − 550 (based on level) (+ 80% bonus AD) (+ 1.5 per 1 Lethality) health while dealing 50% of the amount as physical damage to enemies not within the threshold for execution.
If Death from Below hits an enemy champion or one dies inside it, Pyke will  blink to the center of the X. For the latter case Pyke also gains the ability to recast within 20 seconds at no cost.

Each execution grants one  'Your Cut' to both Pyke and the last assisting ally, instead of its natural assist gold. In addition, each enemy champion killed inside the X by an ally grants Pyke two stacks of  'Your Cut'.

R.notes:
Applies  raw damage to executed targets and  area damage to targets above the threshold.
 Death from Below cannot execute decoys and are always dealt 50% physical damage.
  'Your Cut' is an item that can be consumed to gain gold. If the ally's inventory is full, it's auto-consumed.
 When  'Your Cut' is consumed, it quickly grants  100 stacks until reaching the full gold value.

 Only the target's current health will count as Pyke's damage in post-game statistics and  spell vamp healing if executed.
 If the target's current health is less than 50% of the post-mitigation non-executing damage, Pyke will heal less from spell vamp.

 If a champion dies inside the X before Death from Below performs, Pyke will be shown as having received an assist in the kill feed, but this will not grant him  takedown effects.

I.name: Royal Privilege

effects.description: Innate: Qiyana's next basic attack or damaging ability deals 15 − 83 (based on level) (+ 55% bonus AD) (+ 30% AP)  bonus physical damage to all enemies hit.
This effect cannot occur on the same target more than once every few seconds.
Royal Privilege's cooldown is  reset on all targets upon gathering or changing an  Element.

I.notes: No additional details.

Q.name: Edge of Ixtal

effects.description: Active: Qiyana slashes forward in a line, dealing physical damage, reduced to 75% damage against targets beyond the first.
Upon gathering an  Element, Edge of Ixtal is upgraded to Elemental Wrath and its cooldown is  reset.

Q.notes: No additional details.

Q.name: Elemental Wrath

effects.description: Active: Qiyana consumes her current Element and  hurls her blade, detonating in a line upon colliding with an enemy or reaching maximum range, and applying a bonus effect based on the consumed Element.
Enemies are dealt physical damage, reduced to 75% damage against subsequent units beyond the closest.
Brush: The blade raises a grass trail behind for 3.5 seconds, granting Qiyana  invisibility and  20% bonus movement speed until she attacks or exits.
River:  Roots for 0.5 seconds, then  slows by 20% for 1 second.
Terrain: Enemies below 50% of maximum health are dealt bonus damage.

leveling.attribute: Total Damage to targets beyond the first

Q.notes: No additional details.

W.name: Terrashape

effects.description: Passive: While holding an Element, Qiyana gains  bonus attack speed,  25 bonus range, her basic attacks and basic abilities deal  bonus magic damage, and she gains out-of-combat  bonus movement speed while moving near the Element currently being held.
Active: Qiyana  dashes towards a target location, gathering an Element of the nearest  Brush,  River or  Terrain she targeted.
A target Element is required to cast this ability.

W.notes: Terrain created by champions are not valid target terrain.

E.name: Audacity

effects.description: Active: Qiyana  dashes a fixed distance towards the target unit, dealing physical damage.
Casting  Edge of Ixtal during Audacity will aim at the dash target.

E.notes: Audacity only damages targets if within 250 range at the end of the dash.

R.name: Supreme Display of Talent

effects.description: Active: Qiyana sends a windblast in the target direction that  knocks back enemies. The windblast stops upon hitting terrain.

The windblast then creates a shockwave across any River or Brush it passes through, as well as around the borders of terrain it reaches, dealing physical damage, with the percentage damage capped against monsters, and  stunning enemies for 1 − 0.5 (based on proximity) seconds.

R.notes:
The windblast needs only to reach near terrain to trigger the terrain shockwave.
 Artificial terrain (e.g,  Anivia's  Crystallize,  Taliyah's  Weaver's Wall,  Trundle's  Pillar of Ice) touching map terrain will be treated as a single piece of terrain, even when bridging two pieces of map terrain together; the shockwave will wrap around all connecting terrain.

I.name: Harrier

effects.description: Innate:  Valor periodically marks a nearby visible enemy unit as Vulnerable,  revealing them for 4 seconds. Enemies hit by  Blinding Assault,  Vault and  Skystrike will also be marked as Vulnerable.
Quinn's next basic attack against a Vulnerable target deals 10 − 95 (based on level) (+ 16% − 50% (based on level) AD)  bonus physical damage.
Harrier is disabled while  Behind Enemy Lines is active and for a few seconds after a target's mark ends.

I.notes:
Harrier's targeting priority:
 Last unit hit (if it was a small minion it appears to select a different target).
 Lowest-health enemy champion.
 Lowest-health enemy minion.

 The enhanced attack will apply other on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal.
  Critical strikes do not interact with Harrier's bonus damage.
 As with most on-hit physical damage Harrier's bonus damage will apply  life steal.
 Harrier is consumed but does no damage if the enhanced attack is  dodged,  blocked, or if Quinn is  blinded.
 Harrier's bonus damage will not affect structures even if Quinn is seen using its attack animation against them if the ensuing basic attack was the last one prior.
 Basic attacks that are already in-flight will trigger and consume Harrier mark.
 If a mark was originally applied by  Blinding Assault or  Vault, attacking that Vulnerable target will place Harrier's passive application on a 1 second cooldown instead of its full duration.
I.blurb: Valor periodically marks enemies as Vulnerable. Quinn's first basic attack against Vulnerable targets will deal bonus physical damage.

Q.name: Blinding Assault

effects.description: Active: Quinn signals  Valor to fly forward in a line, stopping when he collides with a enemy unit, dealing physical damage to all nearby enemies and applying  nearsight to the target for 1.5 seconds.
Non-champion targets are  disarmed instead for the same duration.

Q.notes: No additional details.
Q.blurb: Quinn calls Valor to mark an enemy and hinder its vision before damaging all enemies in the immediate area.

W.name: Heightened Senses

effects.description: Passive: Attacking a  Vulnerable target grants Quinn  bonus attack speed and  bonus movement speed for 2 seconds.
Active: Quinn orders  Valor to  reveal the area around her for 2 seconds.

W.notes: No additional details.
W.blurb: Passively grants Quinn Attack Speed and Movement Speed after she attacks a Vulnerable target. Activate to have Valor reveal a large area nearby.

E.name: Vault

effects.description: Active: Quinn  dashes to the target unit,  knocking them back, dealing them physical damage, and  slowing them by 50% which decays over 1.5 seconds, before  leaping back and landing 525 units away from them.

E.notes:
Quinn will automatically attempt to attack the target once she completes Vault.
 Unlike its constant cast range Vault's bounce's can vary to allow Quinn to close or to make a gap between herself and the target (depending on casting position) or even to jump through a wall (if there is enough landing room on the other side).
 Quinn will track and follow the target if they move through  dashes and  blinks.
 This will not occur if the target is travelling to a very far distance (e.g,  Recall,  Teleport,  Stand United).
E.blurb: Quinn dashes to an enemy, dealing physical damage and slowing the target's Movement Speed. Upon reaching the target, she leaps off the target, briefly interrupting it, and lands near her maximum Attack Range away from the target.

R.name: Behind Enemy Lines

effects.description: Active: Quinn  channels for 2 seconds. Upon completing it successfully,  Valor picks her up and they unite, increasing her  total movement speed and gaining the ability to use  Skystrike.
Taking damage from champions, monsters, or  turrets while Behind Enemy Lines is active disables the  bonus movement speed for 3 seconds.
If you have a least one point in Behind Enemy Lines, respawning or returning to the summoning platform will spawn  Valor.

R.notes: If Quinn uses  Vault while Behind Enemy Lines is active,  Skystrike will activate at her target's location after she bounces back.
R.blurb: Quinn and Valor team up to fly around at great speed.

R.name: Skystrike

effects.description: Active: Quinn detaches from  Valor, ending  Behind Enemy Lines' effects, and deals  40% AD  physical damage to all units around her.
Launching a basic attack,  Blinding Assault, or  Vault during  Behind Enemy Lines automatically activates Skystrike.

R.notes: If Quinn uses  Vault while  Behind Enemy Lines is active, Skystrike will activate at her target's location after she bounces back.
R.blurb: Quinn and Valor team up to fly around at great speed.

I.name: Fey Feathers

effects.description: Innate: Rakan periodically generates a 33 − 254 (based on level) (+ 90% AP)  shield that lasts until broken. If the shield is damaged, but not destroyed after being out of combat for 5 seconds, it will regenerate 10% of its maximum value every second.
Basic attacks and abilities reduce Fey Feathers's  cooldown by 1 second for each enemy  champion hit.
Lover's Leap: If either Rakan or  Xayah is  recalling, the other may move nearby and activate their own recall to join them. Both reach base at the time of which the initiator's recall ends.

I.notes: Revitalize will record bonus shielding when a new shield is created, but not when it regenerates. In either case, there is no bonus shielding received.
I.blurb: Rakan periodically gains a shield.

I.name: Fey Feathers

effects.description: Innate: Rakan periodically generates a 33 − 254 (based on level) (+ 90% AP)  shield that lasts until broken. If the shield is damaged, but not destroyed after being out of combat for 5 seconds, it will regenerate 10% of its maximum value every second.
Basic attacks and abilities reduce Fey Feathers's  cooldown by 1 second for each enemy  champion hit.
Lover's Leap: If either Rakan or  Xayah is  recalling, the other may move nearby and activate their own recall to join them. Both reach base at the time of which the initiator's recall ends.

I.notes: Revitalize will record bonus shielding when a new shield is created, but not when it regenerates. In either case, there is no bonus shielding received.
I.blurb: Rakan periodically gains a shield.

Q.name: Gleaming Quill

effects.description: Active: Rakan slings an enchanted feather forward, dealing  magic damage to the first enemy hit.
If that enemy was a champion or epic monster, an area is marked around Rakan.
After 3 seconds or if an ally champion comes within the marked area, Rakan  heals himself and surrounding allies by 18 − 120 (based on level) (+ 70% AP).

Q.notes:
The trigger radius is slightly smaller than the heal radius.
 If the spell is blocked by a  spell shield, the damage will be blocked, but Rakan will still be affected by the heal component.
 The heal can activate immediately after the projectile hits the target, before the healing return animation completes.
Q.blurb: Flings a magical feather that deals magic damage. Striking a champion or epic monster enables Rakan to heal his allies.

W.name: Grand Entrance

effects.description: Active: Rakan  dashes to the target location.
After a 0.35-second delay, he leaps into the air, dealing magic damage and  knocking up surrounding enemies for 1 second.

W.notes: No additional details.
W.blurb: Dashes to a location, knocking up nearby enemies on arrival.

E.name: Battle Dance

effects.description: Active: Rakan  shields the target allied champion for 3 seconds while also  dashing through them.
Battle Dance can be re-cast for 5 seconds at no cost.
If  Xayah is the target, Battle Dance can be cast from an increased range.

E.notes: The shield does not stack when reapplied. Thus, jumping on an ally who's already shielded will only have their shield refreshed.
E.blurb: Flies to an allied champion granting them a shield. Can be re-cast for free for a short duration.

E.name: Battle Dance

effects.description: Active: Rakan  shields the target allied champion for 3 seconds while also  dashing through them.
Battle Dance can be re-cast for 5 seconds at no cost.
If  Xayah is the target, Battle Dance can be cast from an increased range.

E.notes: The shield does not stack when reapplied. Thus, jumping on an ally who's already shielded will only have their shield refreshed.
E.blurb: Flies to an allied champion granting them a shield. Can be re-cast for free for a short duration.

R.name: The Quickness

effects.description: Active: Rakan breaks into a captivating sprint for 4 seconds, gaining  50% bonus movement speed for the duration. During this time he deals magic damage to all enemy units he collides with,  charming and  slowing them by 75%. This may only occur once per unit.
When Rakan collides with his first enemy  champion he gains an additional  100% bonus movement speed, which starts decaying after 0.5 seconds by 20% every 0.5 seconds.
During the first 0.5 seconds of The Quickness, Rakan is in cast time.
During The Quickness, Rakan cannot basic attack enemy champions if he did not charm them.

R.notes:
The spell duration is increased by 0.25 seconds per enemy hit.
  Grand Entrance can be buffered while The Quickness is active.
R.blurb: Gains movement speed, charming and dealing magic damage to enemies touched.

I.name: Spiked Shell

effects.description: Innate: Basic attacks deal 10 (+ 10% armor)  bonus magic damage, increased by 50% to 15 (+ 15% armor) bonus magic damage while  Defensive Ball Curl is active.

I.notes: No additional details.
I.blurb: Rammus' basic attacks deal bonus magic damage, scaling with his Armor.

Q.name: Powerball

effects.description: Active: Rammus tucks into a ball and begins to roll, channeling for up to 6 seconds, gaining 25% − 39.17% (based on level)  bonus movement speed per second over the duration, up to a maximum of 150% − 235% (based on level)  bonus movement speed.
Rammus stops rolling upon colliding with an enemy,  knocking back all nearby enemies 100 units over 0.75 seconds, dealing them magic damage, and  slowing them for 1 second.
Powerball's channel can be ended prematurely by recasting it or by activating  Defensive Ball Curl.

Q.notes:
Powerball will still hit nearby enemies even (including  minions) if Rammus is  ghosted.
 Powerball will trigger Mana Charge twice (upon activation and when ending it prematurely).
Q.blurb: Rammus accelerates in a ball towards his enemies, dealing damage and slowing targets affected by the impact.

W.name: Defensive Ball Curl

effects.description: Active: Rammus drops into a defensive stance for 6 seconds, gaining  bonus armor and  bonus magic resistance, increasing  Spiked Shell's damage by 50%, and applying it to enemies whenever they use basic attacks against him. Rammus is  slowed by 30% for the duration.
Defensive Ball Curl can be canceled instantly by reactivating the ability or by activating  Powerball.

W.notes:
Defensive Ball Curl will return damage from attacks and/or abilities that apply on-hit effects ( Mystic Shot) as well as from  Runaan's Hurricane's Wind's Fury (will not return damage from turrets,  H-28G Evolution Turret, or  Jack in the Box).
 The resistance scaling will factor from all other sources, including Defensive Ball Curl's flat bonus. This will recalculate over the duration.
 The  self-slow can be reduced by  slow resist.
W.blurb: Rammus goes into a defensive formation, vastly increasing his Armor and Magic Resistance, amplifying Spiked Shells' damage, and returning damage to enemies that basic attack him, but he is also slowed during this time.

E.name: Frenzying Taunt

effects.description: Active: Rammus  taunts the target enemy, gaining  bonus attack speed for the duration.
While  Powerball,  Defensive Ball Curl or  Tremors is active, the  bonus attack speed is refreshed.

E.notes: Frenzying Taunt behaves like a  stun when cast right before Rammus enters  stasis.
E.blurb: Rammus taunts an enemy champion or monster into a reckless assault against him. Additionally, he gains increased Attack Speed for a short time, but this bonus is extended by having any of his other spells active.

R.name: Tremors

effects.description: Active: Rammus creates an earthquake around himself for 8 seconds,  slowing and dealing magic damage each second to nearby enemies for the duration. Structures receive double damage.
The  slow persists for 1.5 seconds and stacks up to 8 times.

R.notes:
Tremors has no cast time and does not interrupt Rammus'  previous orders.
  Spell shield only prevents one instance of the  slow.
R.blurb: Rammus creates waves of destruction pulsing through the ground, causing damage to nearby enemies and slowing them. Turrets take double damage from Tremors.

I.name: Fury of the Xer'Sai

effects.description: Innate: Rek'Sai generates  25 Fury upon dealing damage with basic attack,  Prey Seeker,  Unburrow or  Furious Bite, and loses 20 Fury per second if she hasn't generated any in the last 5 seconds.
While  burrowed, Rek'Sai consumes her current Fury over 3 seconds,  healing up to  20 − 190 (based on level) health at 100 Fury, stopping once she consumes it all or returns to  full health.

I.notes: Fury bar changes from Yellow to Red when full.
I.blurb: While unburrowed Rek'Sai generates Fury with her basic attacks and spells. When burrowed Rek'Sai consumes Fury to heal herself.

Q.name: Queen's Wrath

effects.description: Unburrowed - Active: Rek'Sai's next three basic attacks within 5 seconds deal  bonus physical damage to her target and all surrounding enemies. The damage to the primary target is affected by  critical strike modifiers.
Queen's Wrath resets Rek'Sai's basic attack timer.

Q.notes:
Queen's Wrath's bonus damage applies against turrets.
 Queen's Wrath ends and goes on cooldown if Rek'Sai is  burrowed for more than 1 second.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Queen's Wrath has a fixed attack animation forbidding Rek'Sai from attacking faster if she has over 2.0 attack speed.
 Queen's Wrath's enhanced attacks apply other on-hit effects, on-attack effects, and life steal but do not affect structures. The damage to additional targets is not affected by these.
 Does not apply  Hunter's Talisman to surrounding targets.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Queen's Wrath interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects.
Q.blurb: Rek'Sai's next 3 basic attacks deal bonus Physical Damage to nearby enemies.

Q.name: Prey Seeker

effects.description: Burrowed - Active: Rek'Sai fires a void-charged pulse in a target direction, stopping at the first enemy hit, dealing physical damage to enemies in the area and  revealing them for 2.5 seconds.

Q.notes: No additional details.
Q.blurb: While Burrowed, Rek'Sai launches a burst of void-charged earth that deals Physical Damage and reveals enemies hit.

W.name: Burrow

effects.description: Unburrowed - Active: Rek'Sai burrows into the ground,  self-disarming and reducing her sight radius to 250, but gaining 15 / 20 / 25 / 30 (based on level)  bonus movement speed, becoming  ghosted, accessing an alternate set of basic abilities, and activating Tremor Sense.
Tremor Sense: Rek'Sai gains  obscured vision of nearby enemy and neutral units in fog of war every 1.5 seconds if they are moving.

W.notes:
Rek'Sai immediately burrows on respawn once she has at least one point in Burrow.
 Burrow has no cast time and does not interrupt Rek'Sai's previous orders.
 Enemies detected by Tremor Sense are displayed as rings on the ground (champions display much larger ones and play a sound effect audible to both allies and enemies).
 Enemies standing still while Rek'Sai is nearby are insensible to Tremor Sense.

 Burrow briefly  slows  displaced enemies.
 Rek'Sai does not gain  obscured vision while  nearsighted.

    Rek'Sai sensing a nearby enemy with Tremors Sense.
W.blurb: Rek'Sai burrows into the ground, gaining new abilities and increased Movement Speed. Her vision range is reduced and she cannot use basic attacks.

W.name: Unburrow

effects.description: Burrowed - Active: Rek'Sai bursts out of the ground, dealing physical damage to surrounding enemies and  knocking them aside 250 units. The enemy closest to the center is  knocked up for 1 second instead, and cannot be affected again by Unburrow for some time.
Rek'Sai can also trigger Unburrow by issuing an attack command, applying the full  knock up against her target.

W.notes:
Unburrow's per-target  cooldown only applies to targets affected by the full  knock-up, but provides immunity to all effects of the ability.
 Unburrow has no cast time and does not interrupt Rek'Sai's previous orders.
 Unburrow is still considered an ability and is thus stopped by  silence. She can basic attack normally during this time, without leaving unburrow.
W.blurb: While Burrowed, Rek'Sai may cast Un-burrow to knock up and damage nearby enemies.

E.name: Furious Bite

effects.description: Unburrowed - Active: Rek'Sai bites the target enemy, dealing physical damage.
At maximum  Fury the damage is doubled and converted to  true damage.

E.notes: No additional details.
E.blurb: Rek'Sai bites her target, dealing double and True Damage if she has max Fury.

E.name: Tunnel

effects.description: Burrowed - Active: Rek'Sai  dashes in the cursor's direction, leaving behind a Tunnel with two interconnected entrances, lasting up to 10 minutes. The Tunnel can be traversed again if Rek'Sai targets either entrance, shutting down the Tunnel for a few seconds.
Rek'Sai can have up to 8 pairs of entrances active on the map at the same time. Enemy  champions can destroy a Tunnel by standing on either entrance for 1.5 seconds.

E.notes:
Tunnel entrances can be targeted by allied movement abilities ( Leap Strike,  Shunpo,  Safeguard,  Teleport).
 Tunnel entrances are  visible on allied champions' minimaps, while enemies must first gain  sight of one before it becomes visible on theirs (the opposite entrance is not revealed).
 Enemy champions that destroy a Tunnel are each granted  5.
 Destroying a Tunnel while Rek'Sai is traversing it will not prevent her from reaching the opposite entrance.

 Rek'Sai exits a Tunnel the same way she entered (either  Unburrowed or  Burrowed, no switching).
 An  Unburrowed Rek'Sai is considered to be  Burrowed while inside a Tunnel. She will gain her  Burrowed abilities (unusable), suffer from the self  nearsight, and activate Tremor Sense, but will not be  healed by  Fury of the Xer'Sai (unless  Burrowed prior to entering the Tunnel).
 If Rek'Sai enters a Tunnel while unburrowed, Rek'Sai will take longer to enter the tunnel because Rek'Sai will initiate the burrow animation before entering the tunnel. Rek'Sai will unburrow immediately after exiting the Tunnel, knocking up the nearest enemy and applying damage. This does not put  Burrow on cooldown.

 Rek'Sai can Tunnel through terrain if she dashes close to them and the wall is thin enough to allow the opposite entrance to spawn on the other side.
 Rek'Sai can be blocked from using a tunnel entrance if a ward is placed directly over it, because the cursor's target selection prioritizes wards over tunnel entrances.
E.blurb: While Burrowed, Rek'Sai creates a re-usable, long lasting tunnel. Enemies can destroy it by standing on top of either entrance.

R.name: Void Rush

effects.description: Passive: Rek'Sai's applies Mark as Prey to enemy champions she damaged in the last 5 seconds.

Active: Rek'Sai selects an enemy champion with Mark as Prey and  vanishes into the ground. After 1.5 seconds, she emerges from the ground near her target and  pounces  unstoppably a fixed distance in their direction to deal physical damage if she hits them.
The damage can be dodged if the target moves 1500 units away.

R.notes:
Void Rush can be dodged if the target becomes  untargetable.
 Rek'Sai will follow the target even if they  dash or  blink, up to the maximum range.
 Rek'Sai can activate Void Rush while  Burrowed or  Unburrowed.
 She will always emerge as Unburrowed.

 The target champion will glow once Rek'Sai  Burrows to them, followed by a global screech (will be heard by enemies even if they don't have  sight of Rek'Sai and/or her destination).
R.blurb: Rek'Sai dives underground and leaps towards her target, dealing massive damage.

I.name: Reign of Anger

effects.description: Innate: Renekton generates  5 Fury each time he lands a basic attack on an enemy, and loses 4 Fury per second if he hasn't dealt or taken damage in the last 12 seconds.
When at or above 50 Fury, Renekton's next basic ability consumes 50 Fury to enhance its effects. The enhanced ability does not generate Fury.
Reign of Anger: Renekton generates 50% bonus Fury from all sources while  below 50% of his maximum health.

I.notes: Renekton generates Fury by collecting Health Relics on  Howling Abyss (interacts with Reign of Anger's bonus generation).
I.blurb: Renekton gains Fury for every autoattack he makes. This Fury can empower his abilities with bonus effects. Additionally, Renekton gains bonus Fury when he is low on life.

Q.name: Cull the Meek

effects.description: Active: Renekton deals  physical damage to all nearby enemies and  heals himself for each enemy hit, up to a cap.
Renekton also generates  2.5 Fury for each non-champion hit and 10 Fury for each champion hit, with the Fury generated per cast capped at 30.
Against  champions, the healing is increased by 300%.
Reign of Anger: Cull the Meek deals additional damage, increases the total healing by 200%, and the healing cap by 300%.

Q.notes:
Cull the Meek has a 0.25 second cast time and does not interrupt Renekton's previous orders.
 Healing modifiers such as  Spirit Visage and  Grievous Wounds take effect after Cull the Meek's healing cap.
Q.blurb: Renekton swings his blade, dealing moderate physical damage to all targets around him, and heals for a small portion of the damage dealt. If he has more than 50 Fury, his damage and heal are increased.

W.name: Ruthless Predator

effects.description: Active: Renekton's next basic attack within 7 seconds gains  50 bonus range and strikes his target twice dealing  modified physical damage and  stunning them for 0.75 seconds. Each slash applies  on-hit effects and grants  Fury. Hitting an enemy  champion grants 10 bonus Fury.
Reign of Anger: Renekton destroys damage-mitigating shields on the target before striking them 3 times, dealing 50% bonus damage and increasing the  stun duration to 1.5 seconds.
Ruthless Predator resets Renekton's basic attack timer.

W.notes:
Ruthless Predator has a 0.5 second cast time during which Renekton cannot perform any actions (can use summoner spells as well as active items).
 Ruthless Predator's cast time can be dual cast with active ability items that play one of their own ( Tiamat's Crescent).
 Ruthless Predator's cast time can be cancelled with  Dominus'.

 The basic attack can  critically strike as normal (the modified damage cannot).
W.blurb: Renekton slashes his target twice, dealing moderate physical damage and stuns them for 0.75 seconds. If Renekton has more than 50 Fury, he slashes his target three times, dealing high physical damage and stuns them for 1.5 seconds.

E.name: Slice

effects.description: Active - Slice: Renekton  dashes in the target direction, dealing physical damage to all enemies he passes through.
Hitting an enemy allows Renekton to cast Dice within the next 4 seconds.

E.notes: Movement speed has minimal to no impact on the dash speed.
E.blurb: Renekton dashes, dealing damage to units along the way. Empowered, Renekton deals bonus damage and reduces the Armor of units hit.

E.name: Dice

effects.description: Active - Dice: Renekton  dashes in the target direction, dealing the same physical damage to all enemies he passes through.
Both Slice and Dice generate  2 Fury for each non-champion hit, and 10 Fury for each champion hit, with the Fury generated per dash capped at 30.
Reign of Anger: Dice deals additional damage to all enemies and reduces their  armor for 4 seconds.

E.notes: Movement speed has minimal to no impact on the dash speed.
E.blurb: Renekton dashes, dealing damage to units along the way. Empowered, Renekton deals bonus damage and reduces the Armor of units hit.

R.name: Dominus

effects.description: Active: Renekton empowers himself for 15 seconds, gaining  bonus health, increased size,  25 bonus range and  20 Fury.
For the duration, he deals  magic damage each half second to all nearby enemies and generates 5 Fury per second, up to a maximum of 75 Fury.

R.notes:
Dominus' range increase does not stack with  Ruthless Predator.
 Dominus' cooldown starts on-cast (is not refunded if Renekton is dies during the cast animation).
 Dominus' bonus health gain does not interact with  Spirit Visage or  Grievous Wounds.
 Renekton retains Dominus' bonus health (if not over his normal maximum) once the duration ends.
R.blurb: Renekton transforms into the Tyrant form, gaining bonus Health and dealing damage to enemies around him. While in this form, Renekton gains Fury periodically.

I.name: Unseen Predator

effects.description: Innate: While in  brush, Rengar's basic attacks have  725 range and cause him to  leap to enemies beyond his normal  melee range. This effect lingers for 0.25 seconds upon exiting brush. Leaping with 0 Ferocity generates 1 Ferocity.

Ferocity: Rengar generates 1 Ferocity whenever he casts a basic ability. Reaching 4 Ferocity makes his next ability empowered, granting an additional cast along with 30 / 40 / 50% (based on level)  bonus movement speed for 1.5 seconds at the cost of all Ferocity. Reaching 4 Ferocity with  Savagery or  Bola Strike  locks its empowered version for 0.1 seconds before and after casting it. All Ferocity is lost after being out-of-combat for 8 seconds.

Bonetooth Necklace:  Takedowns within 1.5 seconds of being damaged by Rengar grant him a Trophy per unique enemy champion (max 5). An  additional one is made available through the event The Hunt is On!. Trophies grant 1% − 36% (based on  trophies) bonus AD as bonus attack damage.

I.notes:
Unseen Predator occurs regardless of whether or not Rengar's target has  sight of him.
 Rengar will not leap to targets already in his basic attack range.
 He also cannot leap if he's  rooted.

 The enhanced attack will apply other on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal.
 Rengar will only leap to a target if his basic attack timer has been refreshed (if not so he will not automatically attempt to path towards his target, despite them being within leap range).
 Rengar can freely use any ability mid-leap.
 Unseen Predator will be lost immediately if Rengar  blinks outside of the brush.
  Rapid Firecannon's and  Savagery's bonus range are lost after 0.25 second(s) upon gaining Unseen Predator, and are re-gained after 0.25 second(s) upon losing Unseen Predator.
 Bonetooth Necklace uses different icons corresponding to the number of stacks acquired: 
 1 Stack: 
 2 Stacks: 
 3 Stacks: 
 4 Stacks: 
 5 Stacks: 
 6th Stack:  Head of Kha'Zix
I.blurb: While in brush, Rengar leaps at his target with his basic attack. Rengar's abilities build Ferocity. Upon reaching full Ferocity, his next ability becomes empowered and grants him Movement Speed on cast, but he instantly loses all Ferocity if he leaves combat. Killing enemy champions awards trophies on Rengar's Bonetooth Necklace, permanently increasing his Attack Damage.

I.name: Unseen Predator

effects.description: Innate: While in  brush, Rengar's basic attacks have  725 range and cause him to  leap to enemies beyond his normal  melee range. This effect lingers for 0.25 seconds upon exiting brush. Leaping with 0 Ferocity generates 1 Ferocity.

Ferocity: Rengar generates 1 Ferocity whenever he casts a basic ability. Reaching 4 Ferocity makes his next ability empowered, granting an additional cast along with 30 / 40 / 50% (based on level)  bonus movement speed for 1.5 seconds at the cost of all Ferocity. Reaching 4 Ferocity with  Savagery or  Bola Strike  locks its empowered version for 0.1 seconds before and after casting it. All Ferocity is lost after being out-of-combat for 8 seconds.

Bonetooth Necklace:  Takedowns within 1.5 seconds of being damaged by Rengar grant him a Trophy per unique enemy champion (max 5). An  additional one is made available through the event The Hunt is On!. Trophies grant 1% − 36% (based on  trophies) bonus AD as bonus attack damage.

I.notes:
Unseen Predator occurs regardless of whether or not Rengar's target has  sight of him.
 Rengar will not leap to targets already in his basic attack range.
 He also cannot leap if he's  rooted.

 The enhanced attack will apply other on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal.
 Rengar will only leap to a target if his basic attack timer has been refreshed (if not so he will not automatically attempt to path towards his target, despite them being within leap range).
 Rengar can freely use any ability mid-leap.
 Unseen Predator will be lost immediately if Rengar  blinks outside of the brush.
  Rapid Firecannon's and  Savagery's bonus range are lost after 0.25 second(s) upon gaining Unseen Predator, and are re-gained after 0.25 second(s) upon losing Unseen Predator.
 Bonetooth Necklace uses different icons corresponding to the number of stacks acquired: 
 1 Stack: 
 2 Stacks: 
 3 Stacks: 
 4 Stacks: 
 5 Stacks: 
 6th Stack:  Head of Kha'Zix
I.blurb: While in brush, Rengar leaps at his target with his basic attack. Rengar's abilities build Ferocity. Upon reaching full Ferocity, his next ability becomes empowered and grants him Movement Speed on cast, but he instantly loses all Ferocity if he leaves combat. Killing enemy champions awards trophies on Rengar's Bonetooth Necklace, permanently increasing his Attack Damage.

Q.name: Savagery

effects.description: Active: Rengar's next two basic attacks within 3 seconds gain  40% bonus attack speed, with the first also gaining  25 bonus range and dealing  bonus physical damage.
Empowered Active: Savagery's bonus physical damage is modified and grants Rengar 50% − 101% (based on level)  bonus attack speed for 5 seconds.
Savagery resets Rengar's basic attack timer.

Q.notes:
Savagery and Empowered Savagery have no cast time and do not interrupt Rengar's previous orders.
 The enhanced attack applies other  on-hit effects as well as  life steal and can  critically strike as normal (the bonus damage cannot) but does not affect structures.

W.name: Battle Roar

effects.description: Passive: Rengar stores 50% of the damage he's taken in the last 1.5 seconds as Grey Health (75% versus monsters).
Active: Rengar lets out a battle roar, dealing  magic damage to nearby enemies and  healing Rengar for his Grey Health.
Empowered Active: Battle Roar's magic damage is modified and additionally  cleanses Rengar of all  crowd control.

W.notes: Battle Roar has no cast time and does not interrupt Rengar's previous orders.
W.blurb: Rengar lets out a battle roar, damaging enemies and healing for some of the recent damage he has taken. Ferocity effect: additionally breaks crowd control effects.

E.name: Bola Strike

effects.description: Active: Rengar throws a bola in the target direction, dealing physical damage to the first enemy hit and  slowing them for 1.75 seconds.
Empowered Active: Bola Strike's physical damage is modified and  roots its target for 1.75 seconds.

E.notes: If Rengar casts  Savagery and/or  Battle Roar during Bola Strike's cast time, he will buffer them and cast them until Bola Strike completes.
E.blurb: Rengar throws a bola, slowing the first target hit for a short duration. Ferocity effect: roots the target.

R.name: Thrill of the Hunt

effects.description: Active: Rengar  channels his predatory instincts,  revealing the nearest enemy champion and gaining  bonus movement speed for a duration.

After 2 seconds he also becomes  camouflaged and gains  Unseen Predator for the remaining duration. His next basic attack within normal attack range against any unit or with Unseen Predator against the nearest enemy champion deals  50% AD  bonus physical damage and reduces the target's  armor for 4 seconds.
The nearest enemy champion to Rengar alerts all of their allies within 1200 range about his presence. Attacking or casting any spell (excluding  Savagery) ends Thrill of the Hunt immediately.

R.notes:
Alerted allies will hear a   threatening growl following an eerie sound effect.
 The enemy have a vision range of Rengar of 1600 units.
 Enemies revealed by Thrill of the Hunt stay revealed for the spell's duration.
 The true vision lingers on his target until the leap completes.
 Thrill of the Hunt does not grant  sight of the target while under the effects of  Paranoia.

    The nearest detected target is automatically pronounced as the victim. This indicator is visible to both teams and may switch targets under certain circumstances.
R.blurb: Rengar's predatory instincts take over, Camouflaging him and revealing the nearest enemy champion in a large radius around him. During Thrill of the Hunt, Rengar gains Movement Speed and he can leap to the tracked enemy for a guaranteed critical strike, even without being in brush.

I.name: Runic Blade

effects.description: Innate: Riven's blade gains a Charge for 6 seconds every time she uses an ability, stacking up to 3 times. Riven's basic attacks consume a Charge to deal 25% − 50% (based on level) AD  bonus physical damage.
Runic Blade is affected by  critical strike modifiers.

I.notes:
Runic Blade's duration refreshes whenever Riven gains or consumes a stack.
 The bonus damage applies  life steal.
 Runic Blade does not affect structures and  wards (charges are not consumed when attacking them).
 Runic Blade can be  dodged,  blocked, or  missed (charges are not consumed).
I.blurb: Riven's abilities charge her blade, causing her basic attacks to deal bonus physical damage. Riven's blade may be charged up to three times and expends one charge per attack.

Q.name: Broken Wings

effects.description: Active: Riven  dashes towards the target nearest to the cursor or in the direction she is currently facing, dealing physical damage to all enemies in front of her. Broken Wings can then be reactivated twice within the next 4 seconds, with the second cast refreshing the timer.
The third cast  knocks up and damages all enemies around Riven in an expanded radius. The third cast is also the only cast able to dash over terrain, and can do so longer than its normal range.
Each Broken Wings cast causes her next basic attack to occur more quickly. This is not considered a basic attack reset.
Targeted Broken Wings casts grant  sight of an area around Riven to the enemies.

Q.notes:
Each cast triggers Spellblade and counts as a charge for  Force Pulse and  Spellbinder.
 The damage radius is centered 100 units in front of Riven.
 The third cast also  knocks back enemies away from the epicenter by 75 units.
  Spell shield will only block the third cast.
 Since it's not considered a basic attack reset, it does not add additional stacks of  Hail of Blades.
Q.blurb: Riven lashes out in a series of strikes. This ability can be reactivated three times in a short time frame with the third hit knocking back nearby enemies.

W.name: Ki Burst

effects.description: Active: Riven's sword emits a burst of runic energy that shocks nearby enemies, dealing physical damage and applying a  stun for 0.75 seconds.

W.notes: No additional details.
W.blurb: Riven emits a Ki Burst, damaging and stunning nearby enemies.

E.name: Valor

effects.description: Active: Riven  dashes in the direction of the cursor,  shielding herself for 1.5 seconds. If she targets an enemy with Valor, she briefly  reveals herself and the area around her to the enemies.
Other abilities can be cast during the dash and  Broken Wings may be cast during their cast time if they're used at the end or briefly after the dash.

E.notes: Valor can be used to bypass player-created terrain ( Crystallize,  Cataclysm) but not to go through walls.
E.blurb: Riven steps forward a short distance and blocks incoming damage.

R.name: Blade of the Exile

effects.description: Active: Riven empowers her sword for 15 seconds, gaining 20% AD  bonus attack damage,  75 bonus range on her basic attacks, increased range on  Broken Wings and  Ki Burst, and the ability to cast  Wind Slash once for the duration.

R.notes:
There is a 1 second cooldown before Riven can cast Wind Slash after activating Blade of the Exile.
 The bonus AD is gained and determined on cast.
R.blurb: Riven empowers her keepsake weapon with energy, and gains Attack Damage and Range. During this time, she also gains the ability to use Wind Slash, a powerful ranged attack, once.

R.name: Wind Slash

effects.description: Active: Riven unleashes a wave of energy in a cone, dealing physical damage to all enemies hit, increased by 0% − 200% (based on missing health).
If Wind Slash hits an enemy, it will briefly grant  vision of the area around Riven to the enemies.

R.notes: No additional details.
R.blurb: Riven unleashes a powerful ranged attack, which she may do once during Blade of the Exile.

I.name: Junkyard Titan

effects.description: Heat: Rumble gains  Heat each time he uses a basic ability (20 for  Flamespitter, 20 for  Scrap Shield, 10 for  Electro Harpoon) and loses 10  Heat per second after not using any abilities for 4 seconds.
Danger Zone: Rumble's basic abilities are enhanced when cast at/above 50  Heat.

Overheating: At 100  Heat, Rumble becomes Overheated,  silencing himself for 6 seconds. During this time, his basic attacks deal 25 − 110 (based on level) (+ 30% AP)  bonus magic damage while his  Heat rapidly decays by 10 every 0.6 seconds.

I.notes:
The enhanced attacks apply other  on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal (the bonus damage cannot).
 They do not affect structures.

 The self  silence is unaffected by  cleansing effects and  tenacity. 
 Rumble can use summoner spells and/or active items while he is  overheating.
I.blurb: Every spell Rumble casts gives him Heat. When he reaches 50% Heat he reaches Danger Zone, granting all his basic abilities bonus effects. When he reaches 100% Heat, he starts Overheating, granting his basic attacks bonus damage, but making him unable to cast spells for a few seconds.

I.name: Junkyard Titan

Danger Zone: Rumble's basic abilities are enhanced when cast at/above 50  Heat.

Overheating: At 100  Heat, Rumble becomes Overheated,  silencing himself for 6 seconds. During this time, his basic attacks deal 25 − 110 (based on level) (+ 30% AP)  bonus magic damage while his  Heat rapidly decays by 10 every 0.6 seconds.

I.notes:

 They do not affect structures.

Danger Zone: Rumble's basic abilities are enhanced when cast at/above 50  Heat.

Q.name: Flamespitter

effects.description: Active: Rumble activates his flamethrower for 3 seconds, granting 20  Heat and dealing magic damage every 0.25 seconds to all enemies in a cone in front of him. Deals reduced damage to  minions.
Danger Zone: Flamespitter's damage is increased by 50%.

Q.notes:
Flamespitter has no cast time and does not interrupt Rumble's previous orders.
 Rumble will instantly turn to face the cursor if he is not moving when Flamespitter is cast.
 Flamespitter is not canceled by  stasis effects (e.g.  Stopwatch,  Zhonya's Hourglass,  Tempered Fate).
Q.blurb: Rumble torches opponents in front of him, dealing magic damage in a cone for 3 seconds. While in Danger Zone this damage is increased.

W.name: Scrap Shield

effects.description: Active: Rumble gains a  shield for 1.5 seconds.
While shielding himself Rumble gains  bonus movement speed until the duration of the shield ends or if the shield is broken.
Danger Zone: Scrap Shield's effects are increased by 50%.

W.notes: Scrap Shield has no cast time and does not interrupt Rumble's previous orders (basic attack animation is canceled on-cast).
W.blurb: Rumble pulls up a shield, protecting him from damage and granting him a quick burst of speed. While in Danger Zone, the shield strength and speed bonus is increased.

W.name: Scrap Shield

effects.description: Active: Rumble gains a  shield for 1.5 seconds.
While shielding himself Rumble gains  bonus movement speed until the duration of the shield ends or if the shield is broken.
Danger Zone: Scrap Shield's effects are increased by 50%.

W.notes: Scrap Shield has no cast time and does not interrupt Rumble's previous orders (basic attack animation is canceled on-cast).
W.blurb: Rumble pulls up a shield, protecting him from damage and granting him a quick burst of speed. While in Danger Zone, the shield strength and speed bonus is increased.

E.name: Electro Harpoon

effects.description: Passive: Rumble periodically stocks an Electro Harpoon charge, up to a maximum of 2.

Active: Rumble shoots a electrical harpoon, dealing magic damage to the first enemy hit and  slowing them for 2 seconds. Hitting the same target with another harpoon enhances the  slow (stacks additively).
Danger Zone: Electro Harpoon's effects are increased by 50%.

E.notes:
If Rumble casts Electro Harpoon before Overheating, he may still use another charge within three seconds of the initial cast.
 Each Electro Harpoon cast triggers  Sheen (and its upgrades) Spellblade and stacks  Force Pulse.
E.blurb: Rumble launches a taser, electrocuting his target with magic damage and slowing their Movement Speed. Rumble can carry 2 harpoons at a time. While in Danger Zone the damage and slow percentage is increased.

R.name: The Equalizer

effects.description: Active: Rumble deploys a barrage of rockets 1000 units down the target path, landing in a line over 1 second and lasting for 5 seconds.
Enemies within the line of flaming rockets take magic damage every 0.5 seconds and are  slowed by 35%. After leaving the area the damage will  linger for 1 second.

R.notes: The Equalizer is blocked by  Wind Wall and  Unbreakable. The line of rockets placed on the ground before being intercepted are not destroyed.
R.blurb: Rumble fires off a group of rockets, creating a wall of flames that damages and slows enemies.

I.name: Arcane Mastery

effects.description: Innate: Ryze gains (5% per 100 AP)  bonus mana.

I.notes:
Arcane Mastery stacks recursively with  Seraph's Embrace and multiplicatively with other sources of % ability power. Examples on how they calculate below:
 Case 1: With  Rabadon's Deathcap you get a total of (40% AP) bonus ability power and ((7% AP)% mana)) bonus mana.
 Case 2: With  Seraph's Embrace you get a total of ((3 + 0.15% AP)% mana) ÷ (1 - 0.0015% mana) bonus ability power and ((0.15% mana + 5% AP)% mana) ÷ (1 - 0.0015% mana) bonus mana.
 Case 3: With  Rabadon's Deathcap +  Seraph's Embrace you get a total of ((4.2 + 0.21% AP)% mana) ÷ (1 - 0.0021% mana) bonus ability power and ((0.21% mana + 7% AP)% mana) ÷ (1 - 0.0021% mana) bonus mana.
I.blurb: Ryze's spells deal extra damage based on his Bonus Mana, and he gains a percentage increase to his maximum Mana based on his Ability Power.

Q.name: Overload

effects.description: Passive: Ryze's other basic abilities reset  Overload's cooldown and charge a  Rune for 4 seconds, up to 2.
Active: Ryze unleashes a runic blast in the target direction, dealing  magic damage to the first enemy struck and consuming all of his  Runes.
If Ryze consumes 2 Runes, he gains  bonus movement speed for 2 seconds.
Flux: Overload deals 10 / 40 / 70 / 100% (based on  Realm Warp's rank) increased damage, and spreads to all nearby enemies marked with Flux.

Q.notes: Applies  spell damage to the primary target and  area damage to secondary targets affected by  Flux.
Q.blurb: Passively, Ryze's other damaging spells reset Overload and begin to charge a Rune that can be used to empower Overload. On cast, Ryze throws a charge of pure energy in a line, dealing damage to the first enemy struck. If a Rune is fully charged, Ryze also gains Movement Speed.

Active: Ryze unleashes a runic blast in the target direction, dealing  magic damage to the first enemy struck and consuming all of his  Runes.
If Ryze consumes 2 Runes, he gains  bonus movement speed for 2 seconds.
Flux: Overload deals 10 / 40 / 70 / 100% (based on  Realm Warp's rank) increased damage, and spreads to all nearby enemies marked with Flux.

W.name: Rune Prison

effects.description: Active: Ryze instantly deals magic damage and  slows the target enemy by 35% for 1.5 seconds.
Flux: Rune Prison's  slow is converted to a  root for the same duration.

W.notes: No additional details.
W.blurb: Ryze traps a target enemy unit in a cage of runes, damaging them and preventing them from moving.

E.name: Spell Flux

effects.description: Active: Ryze hurls an orb of runic energy at the target enemy, dealing magic damage to his target and marking them and nearby enemies with Flux for 3 seconds, causing his next basic ability against them to consume the mark and gain bonus effects.
Flux: Spell Flux spreads further.

E.notes: Spell Flux's second cast on a target will apply a new Flux debuff as well as triggering the previous one (effectively refreshing the duration).
E.blurb: Ryze releases an orb of pure magical power that damages an enemy and debuffs them. Ryze's spells have additional effects against the debuffed enemy.

R.name: Realm Warp

effects.description: Passive: Increases  Overload's damage against targets marked with  Spell Flux.

Active: Ryze opens a portal on the ground at his current location and begins channeling. If Ryze successfully channels for 2 seconds, all allied units within the portal  blink to the target location and very briefly become  untargetable. Realm Warp can affect untargetable allies.

R.notes:
Realm Warp casts at maximum range if attempting to cast beyond it.
 Realm Warp will try to predict whether an ally is trying to run out of it or not and will not teleport allies that are very near the edge and move click outside of it.
  Untargetable effect lasts approximately 0.75 seconds.
 Teleported units retain the same relative positions to one another upon arrival.
 Ryze will not teleport if he exits the area, but the teleport will still occur for other allies so long as he isn't interrupted.
  Ground will both prevent Ryze from activating, as well as prevent units from being teleported, but will not interrupt the channel.
 Allied  stasis effects will not interrupt Realm Warp's channel - excluding  Zhonya's Hourglass and  Stopwatch - like the passive of  Guardian Angel or an allied  Bard's  Tempered Fate. Other allies untargetable by similar effects will also be teleported.
 A hostile  Bard's  Tempered Fate will interrupt the channel.

 Realm Warp's interaction with (primarely  channelled) abilities seems to be case-by-case:
 The following will prevent the caster from being teleported:  Teleport,  Recall,  Ace in the Hole,  Curtain Call,  Umbral Trespass*,  Bullet Time,  Grand Starfall and  Rite of the Arcane.
 The following do not prevent you getting teleported and are not interrupted:  Crowstorm*,  Requiem,  Absolute Zero,  Decimating Smash and  Unstoppable Onslaught.
 These lists are not complete.

 Ryze can teleport  Zac during his  Cell Division, moving both his bloblets as well as the point where they are attempting to converge.
 If no  champions but one or more  minions are teleported, Realm Warp will not teleport the minion closest to its center, and furthermore shuffle the positions of the other teleported minions.
 If a champion is present, the innermost minion is teleported on top the outermost champion's new position, and the remaining minions are teleported to their proper intended positions.
R.blurb: Ryze creates a portal to a nearby location. After a few seconds, allies standing near the portal are teleported to the target location.

I.name: Fury of the North

effects.description: Frost Armor: Sejuani receives  Frost Armor if she hasn't taken damage from monsters or enemy champions in the last 12 seconds, lingering for 3 seconds after taking damage.
Frost Armor engulfs  Bristle in True Ice, becoming immune to  slows and gains  10 (+ 50% bonus armor) bonus armor and  10 (+ 50% bonus magic resistance) bonus magic resistance.

Icebreaker: Enemies  stunned by Sejuani are Frozen. Sejuani's basic attacks and abilities against Frozen enemies consume the effect to deal 10% of their maximum health  bonus magic damage, capped to 300 against epic monsters.

I.notes: PENDING FOR TEST: Icebreaker's  interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects via basic attack.
I.blurb: After being out of combat, Sejuani gains Frost Armor which grants Armor and Magic Resist and immunity to slows. Frost Armor persists for a short time after Sejuani takes damage. Sejuani can damage a stunned enemy to shatter it, dealing massive magic damage.

Q.name: Arctic Assault

effects.description: Active: Sejuani signals  Bristle to  dash in the target direction, dealing magic damage and  knocking up all enemies hit for 0.5 seconds. The charge will prematurely end upon colliding with an enemy champion.

Q.notes:
Champions will slightly be  knocked back, while minions and monsters will instead be slightly  pulled for a fixed distance.
 Arctic Assault cannot  knock enemies over terrain.
Q.blurb: Sejuani charges forward, knocking enemies into the air. The charge stops after hitting an enemy champion.

W.name: Winter's Wrath

effects.description: Active: After a 0.25-seconds delay, Sejuani swings her flail in a cone in the target direction, dealing  physical damage to all enemies hit and  knocking back  minions and  monsters.
She then lashes out with her flail after 0.75 seconds in a straight line in the same direction, dealing additional physical damage and  slowing all enemies hit by 75% for 0.25 seconds.
Sejuani can move freely during Winter's Wrath. Both swings will strike in the cast direction, but their hitboxes follow Sejuani's movement.

W.notes:
Spell shields will block only a single instance of damage - either the swing or the lash.
 The ability's cooldown starts after both flail attacks are completed.
W.blurb: Sejuani swings her mace twice, dealing damage and applying Frost stacks.

E.name: Permafrost

effects.description: Passive:  Winter's Wrath and both Sejuani's and nearby allied  melee champions' basic attacks apply Frost to enemy champions, epic, large and medium monsters, super minions and siege minions for 5 seconds, stacking up to 4 times.
Active: If the targeted enemy has 4 stacks of Frost, Sejuani consumes all stacks to deal magic damage,  knock them down, and  stun them for 1 second.
Enemy champions  stunned by Sejuani cannot gain Frost for 10 / 9 / 8 (based on level) seconds.
Permafrost resets Sejuani's basic attack timer.

E.notes: No additional details.
E.blurb: Sejuani freezes and stuns an enemy champion that has maximum Frost stacks.

R.name: Glacial Prison

effects.description: Active: Sejuani throws an ice bola in the target direction, stopping at the first enemy champion hit, dealing magic damage,  knocking them down, and  stunning them for 1 second.

The bola deals increased damage,  stuns for 1.5 seconds and shatters upon reaching maximum range or upon colliding with a unit beyond 400 range, creating a storm for 2 seconds that  slows enemies within by 30%.
At the end of the duration, the storm shatters the ground, dealing the same damage and  slowing enemies by 80% for 1 second.
The enemy hit by the bola is not affected by the storm's effects.

R.notes:
Applies  spell damage to the primary target and  area damage to secondary targets in the ice storm.
 Glacial Prison affects minions only if they are within detonation radius.
  Spell shields will block only a single instance of damage.
 The bola is always thrown at maximum range.
 The bola does not collide with terrain.
 The bola applies the freeze immunity of  Permafrost when  stunning a champion.
R.blurb: Sejuani throws her bola that freezes and stuns the first champion hit and creates an ice storm that slows other enemies.

I.name: Absolution

effects.description: Innate - Weakened Soul: Senna's basic attacks and abilities on enemy champions apply Mist for 4 seconds. Senna's next attack collects the Mist and deals 1% − 16% (based on level) of target's current health  bonus physical damage. The same target cannot be collected more than once every few seconds.

Enemy  champions, large  minions and large  monsters that die near Senna spawn a Mist Wraith for 8 seconds. Epic monsters spawn 2 Mist Wraiths instead. Small  minions and lesser  monsters have a 20% chance to spawn Mist Wraiths, reduced to 1.67% chance on those that Senna kills. Senna can basic attack a Mist Wraith to destroy it, gaining  3 and collecting its Mist.

Absolution: Each stack of Mist grants Senna  1 bonus attack damage. For every 20 stacks, Senna also gains  25 bonus range and  15% critical strike chance. Upon exceeding 100% critical strike chance, Senna converts 35% of the excess into  life steal.
Relic Cannon: Senna basic attacks deal 20% AD bonus physical damage on-hit and grant 10 / 15 / 20% of the target's movement speed as  bonus movement speed for 0.5 seconds on-hit.

I.notes:
A Mist Wraith can be hit by  Cosmic Binding and it will interact with it the same way minions or monsters interact with Cosmic Binding but it will not take damage.
 Mist Wraith has a spawn animation, but is targetable immediately.
 Mist Wraith grants a small amount of  sight around itself.
 Excluding the range increase, one stack of Mist values approx.  49 ( +3 from Mist Wraith pickup). The bonuses have a gross value of  59 ( 44 with Lifesteal).
 1 AD is worth  35. Absolution effectively boosts basic attacks with 1.2 AD, making the value  42.
  0.75% Critical strike chance is worth  24. Absolution reduces its efficiency by 70%, making the value ≈ 7.
  0.26% Life steal is worth ≈ 9.
I.blurb: Senna's Relic Cannon is slow to fire, but deals bonus damage. She can power up its range, Attack Damage, and Crit chance over time by absorbing Mist from enemy champions she's attacking or from wraiths that spawn from dead enemies.

Q.name: Piercing Darkness

effects.description: Active: After a brief delay, Senna fires a spectral laser in the direction of the target unit,  healing herself and allied  champions in a line, and dealing physical damage to enemy  minions and  champions in a thinner line.

Upon struck, enemy  Turrets,  Wards,  Mist Wraiths and any other attack-interactive units are considered basic attacked once, while  champions and  Turrets take  on-hit effects (with all turret-specific rules applied).
Basic attacks reduce Piercing Darkness'   cooldown by 1 second on-hit.

Q.notes:
Senna can generally target anything that is not either explicitly  untargetable or herself.
 Valid target include anything that can be targeted by a basic attack from someone.

 As for interactions, there's differences between specific units.
 Powder Keg: dealt 1 damage.
Ward: dealt 1 damage only if visible.

  To enemy  champions struck, Piercing Darkness applies  Relic Cannon, collects  Mist if there's one with relative effects proc.
 Piercing Darkness deals no damage to enemy  turrets itself. The fact that they're struck is considered basic attacked once by Senna was the reason damage came out.
 This may be confirmed by that the damage follows the rule of Ability Power damage conversion
 Also this implements that the damage is not as described in this skill, but is same with a basic attack to  Turrets from Senna.

 On-hit effects are applied in order of struck units' spawn ID. This matters for effects that are consumed on-hit (E.g.  Duskblade of Draktharr, Spellblade), which are applied to the target with the lowest Spawn ID.
 "spawn ID" is an unofficial abbreviation to describe the spawn order for all units at the beginning of games, below are some examples.
 If Senna targets an enemy champion but hits at least one more enemy champion simultaneously,  Press the Attack's first stack will be applied to that target. If no champion was targeted, it will default to the champion with the lowest Spawn ID out of the ones struck by the ability. Whether the effect stacks up on a champion or not when multiple enemy champions are stuck also depends on Spawn ID.
 IF Piercing Darkness struck an enemy champion and turret simultaneously, with  Rapid Firecannon fully charged,  Rapid Firecannon's effect will most likely proc on the turret since turrets are often spawned before champions.
Q.blurb: Senna fires a bolt that heals her allies, and damages her foes. Senna can keep attacking to decrease Piercing Darkness’ cooldown.
Q.castTime: X / X (based on bonus attack speed)

W.name: Last Embrace

effects.description: Active: Senna throws a globule of Black Mist in the target direction, dealing physical damage and sticking onto the first enemy hit.
After a 1 second delay or when the target dies, the Black Mist spreads out of the target,  rooting them and nearby enemies for a few seconds.

W.notes: No additional details
W.blurb: Senna commands the Mist onto the first target hit, damaging them and then rooting that target and surrounding enemies after a brief delay.

E.name: Curse of the Black Mist

effects.description: Active: After a 1 second delay, Senna surrounds herself with an aura of mist and gains  camouflage for a duration. Senna's basic attacks and abilities briefly remove the effects of camouflage.
Allied champions who enter the mist gain Wraith Form for a duration equal to the remaining duration.

Wraith Form: Gain  Camouflage. Enemies will gain  obscured vision of Wraiths moving outside of the mist. Performing a basic attack or casting an ability removes Wraith Form, which cannot be regained for 2 seconds.
Senna and allies camouflaged by Curse of the Black Mist also gain  20% bonus movement speed.

E.notes:
Allies affected by the Curse of the Blast Mist aura receive a buff called Cloak of Mist.
 Obscured targets appear as Wraiths, hence the name. The wraith model does not distinguish which champion is obscured. 
 In-game, the 'Cloak of Mist' buff grants camouflage and the 'Wraith Form' buff obscures you and grants movement speed. However, 'Cloak of Mist' has the unspecified effect of negating the obscuring effects of 'Wraith Form' (i.e. you're not a wraith while inside the mist); you have the bonus movement speed even when you're not a wraith (e.g. inside the mist or an enemy is nearby); and 'Wraith Form' also grants the functionality of camouflage (i.e. you are treated as a camouflaged unit with regards to turret vision and  Control Wards). 
 Given this overly complex interaction between the two buffs granted as well as the overlapping effects, it is easier to describe the effects as a single buff that is modified in specific circumstances rather than trying to establish a new game mechanic. 
 Senna likewise has her aura buff and the 'Wraith Form' buff, but her 'Wraith Form' does not share gameplay functionality with other allies benefiting from Wraith Form. For Senna, the appearance of being a wraith is a form-swap while camouflaged (similar to  Evelynn's  Demon Shade). Senna will remain in her wraith form when she is detected so long as the camouflage effect isn't broken, and her wraith's appearance is very distinct from other wraiths.

  Oracle's Extract has no effect on champions with the Cloak of Mist buff, even though Oracle's Extract has a range of 500, while the camouflage radius is only 280 or 400 in the case of Senna herself.
E.blurb: Senna dissolves into a cloud of mist, gaining movement speed and camouflaging her and her nearby allies. Teammates who emerge from the mist appear as unclickable wraiths to enemies until they either attack or get close.

R.name: Dawning Shadow

effects.description: Active: Senna fires two beams of spectral light in the target direction, the center beam deals physical damage to enemy  champions hit and afflicts them with Mist.
The broad beam  shields Senna and allied champions hit for 3 seconds.

R.notes: Dawning Shadow grants a brief area of  sight along its path, this is negated while under the effects of  Nocturne's  Paranoia.
R.blurb: Senna fires a global beam. Allies in the beam are shielded and enemies caught in the center of it take damage.

I.name: Pit Grit

effects.description: Innate - Heavy Hands: Sett's basic attacks alternate between a left punch a right punch on-attack. Sett begins attacking with a left punch, and will reset back to it after 2 seconds of not performing a right punch.
Sett's right punch gains  50 bonus range, attacks at 8 times the left punch's attack speed, and deals 5 − 90 (based on level) (+  15% AD)  bonus physical damage.
Innate - Heart of the Half-Beast: Sett gains  0.25 / 0.5 / 1 / 2 (based on level) health regeneration per second for every 5% of his missing  health.

I.notes: The right punch does not grant  bonus attack speed, rather is fixed at 800% of the left punch  total attack speed and it is unaffected by  cripples and attack speed buffs (i.e  Hail of Blades) for the duration.

Q.name: Knuckle Down

effects.description: Active: For the first 1.5 seconds, Sett gains  30% bonus movement speed while moving towards an enemy  champion.
Sett's next two basic attacks within 5 seconds each deal bonus physical damage. Consuming an attack will refresh the timer.

units: % (+ 1% per 100 AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 1% per 100 AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 1% per 100 AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 1% per 100 AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 1% per 100 AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 2% per 100 AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 2% per 100 AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 2% per 100 AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 2% per 100 AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 2% per 100 AD) of target's maximum health

effects.description: Knuckle Down resets Sett's basic attack timer and  Pit Grit's punch cadence. The second attack will be a right punch.

Q.notes: PENDING FOR TEST: Knuckle Down's  interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects.

W.name: Haymaker

effects.description: Passive: Sett stores 100% of post-mitigation damage taken as Grit on his secondary resource bar, up to 50% of his maximum health. Each instance of stored Grit decays by 30% every second after 4 seconds.
Active: Sett blasts an area in the target direction, dealing  physical damage to enemies hit. Enemies hit through the center take  true damage instead.

units: % (+ 10% per 100 bonus AD) of expended Grit
% (+ 10% per 100 bonus AD) of expended Grit
% (+ 10% per 100 bonus AD) of expended Grit
% (+ 10% per 100 bonus AD) of expended Grit
% (+ 10% per 100 bonus AD) of expended Grit

effects.description: Down but not out: Sett also gains a rapidly decaying  shield for 3 seconds equal to the Grit expended.

W.notes:
The shield is created immediately and will decay after the blast delay.
 Sett will glow when attaining 90% Grit.

E.name: Facebreaker

effects.description: Active: Sett  pulls in enemies at his front and back, dealing physical damage and  slowing them by 50% for 0.5 seconds.
If Facebreaker affects at least one enemy on each side, all enemies are  stunned for 1 second upon landing.

E.notes:
Sett will attempt to basic attack the closest target.
 A target will rebound to Sett's attack range.
 There is a smaller affected area at Sett's sides, the indicator does not illustrate this for practical reasons.
 PENDING FOR TEST: If the single target on either opposite side is protected by a  spell shield, Facebreaker will not  stun.

R.name: The Show Stopper

effects.description: Active: Sett  suppresses the target enemy  champion and then  dashes  unstoppably at a fixed distance toward them,  carrying the target for 1.5 seconds before slamming them into the ground.
Enemies within the impact area take physical damage, reduced by up to 40% at the edge, and are  slowed by 99% for 1.5 seconds.
The dash will prematurely end upon reaching a wall that cannot be dashed through.

R.notes:
Sett lands 200 units farther from the impact, the damage is applied after the time it takes to reposition.
  Spell shields,  untargetability,  unstoppability as well as  cleansing the suppression prevent Sett from carrying his target but will not interrupt The Show Stopper.
 Getting forced to perform an action (i.e  Charm,  Fear,  Taunt) will prevent The Show Stopper from dealing damage.

I.name: Backstab

effects.description: Innate: Shaco's basic attacks deal an additional 10 − 25 (based on level) (+ 15% bonus AD) bonus physical damage when striking an enemy from behind. This damage can  critically strike.
Deceive and  Two-Shiv Poison also have additional effects when striking an enemy from behind.

I.notes: Backstab does not affect structures (turrets, inhibitors, Nexus).
I.blurb: Shaco's basic attack critically strikes for extra damage when striking a unit from behind. Units can't be Backstabbed more than once every few seconds, modified by Shaco's cooldown reduction.

Q.name: Deceive

effects.description: Active: After a 0.125-second delay, Shaco  blinks  to the target location, temporarily becoming  invisible for a few seconds.
After exiting invisibility, his next basic attack within 0.25 seconds deals bonus physical damage. This damage can  critically strike.
Deceive's  invisibility is not removed when Shaco casts  Hallucinate, while casting  Jack in the Box causes him to shimmer without removing it.
Backstab: Guarantees the basic attack to  critically strike for (30% +  25%) bonus physical damage.

Q.notes:
Deceive's cast animation (an orange puff of smoke) can be seen by both teams through fog of war.
  Teleport can be used during the invisibility without cancelling it. However  Recall cannot.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Enhanced attack's interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects.
Q.blurb: Shaco becomes Invisible and teleports to target location.

W.name: Jack in the Box

effects.description: Active: Shaco summons a Jack in the Box at the target location, lasting for up to 40 (+ 5% AP) seconds. The box arms after a 2 second delay, becoming  stealthed and  untargetable to enemies.

Triggering the box will  startle nearby enemies for 0.5 seconds as well as cause them to turn and  flee for 2 seconds, reduced against champions. While fleeing,  minions and  monsters have a static 60  movement speed and  champions have a static 100  movement speed.

Once triggered, the box will also become targetable and automatically starts firing every 0.5 seconds at all nearby  visible enemies, dealing  magic damage with each attack, reduced by 50% against  structures. If the box attacks only one unit, it deals increased damage.
The box can attack up to 10 times and stays active for 5 seconds or until destroyed, independently from its remaining inactive duration.

W.notes:
The box applies  persistent damage to enemies in an  area of effect range.
 The flee starts at the same time as the startle, but since the target cannot move while startled the effective duration of the flee is reduced by the startle's.
 Static movement speed cannot be modified (e.g. with  slow resist or  Ghost).
 This effect is negated only if the target is fully slow immune.

 Upon becoming  stealthed, the box creates a puff of smoke and a distinct sound that can be detected through the fog of war.
W.blurb: Shaco creates a hidden animated Jack-in-the-Box. When triggered, it will fear and attack nearby enemies.

E.name: Two-Shiv Poison

effects.description: Passive: Shaco's basic attacks  slow enemies for 2 seconds while Two-Shiv Poison is off cooldown.
Active: Shaco throws a dagger at the target enemy,  slowing them for 3 seconds and dealing magic damage, increased by 50% against targets below 30% of their maximum health.
Backstab: Deals an additional 15 − 50 (based on level) (+ 10% AP) bonus magic damage, increased to 22.5 − 75 (based on level) (+ 15% AP) when the target is below 30% of their maximum health.

E.blurb: Shaco's Shivs passively poison targets on hit, slowing their movement speed. He can throw his Shivs to deal damage and poison the target. The thrown Shiv deals bonus damage based on the target's missing Health.

R.name: Hallucinate

effects.description: First Cast: Shaco  vanishes for 0.5 seconds and then  blinks in the target direction while creating a clone of himself that blinks in the opposite direction, remaining within tether range of him as a controllable  pet for up to 18 seconds.
Second Cast: While the Hallucination is active, Hallucinate can be used to move it to the target location.

When the Hallucination dies or expires, it explodes, dealing magic damage to enemy units around it and leaving three  mini-boxes behind which activate instantly, causing nearby enemies to  flee for 1 second.
The three boxes possess Jack in the Box's effects, except they have a doubled, but shared  health, and deal modified magic damage with each attack, increased if attacking a single unit.

R.notes:
Shaco and the Hallucination will face each other the moment of their appearance.
 The clone uses  pet damage.
 The Hallucination's  explosion applies  area damage.
 The summoned boxes deal  persistent damage in an  area of effect range.
R.blurb: Shaco creates an illusion of himself near him, which can attack nearby enemies (Deals reduced damage to turrets). Upon death, it explodes, spawning three mini Jack in the Boxes and dealing damage to nearby enemies.

I.name: Ki Barrier

effects.description: Innate: After completing an ability's effects, Shen  shields himself from 50 − 101 (based on level) (+ 14% bonus health) damage for 2.5 seconds. If the triggering ability successfully affected at least one  champion, Ki Barrier's  cooldown is reduced by 4 − 7.5 (based on level) seconds.
Shen's power manifests as a Spirit Blade that he can control with his abilities.

I.notes:
The Spirit Blade spawns with Shen, teleports closer to him if he gets too far away, and instantly blinks to him if he uses any global  blink ( Teleport,  Recall,  Abyssal Voyage, or  Stand United).
 Enemies see an arrow pointing from Shen to the location of his Spirit Blade even if it is not visible.
  Twilight Assault will grant no shield if the Spirit Blade is stopped before it reaches Shen.
  Spirit's Refuge will give the shield after the protective zone disappears.
  Shadow Dash will give the shield when the dash ends.
 If the  dash is  knocked down, the shield will instead be received the moment it is applied, before damage calculation (if any).

  Stand United will grant the shield if its  channel finishes.
I.blurb: After casting a spell, Shen gets a shield. Affecting other champions reduces the cooldown of this effect.

Q.name: Twilight Assault

effects.description: Active: Shen recalls his Spirit Blade to his location. Enemies the blade collides with are  slowed for the next 2 seconds when moving away from Shen.
Once it arrives, Shen empowers his next 3 basic attacks within 8 seconds to gain  75 bonus range and deal  bonus magic damage.

units: % (+ 1.5% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 1.5% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 1.5% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 1.5% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health

% (+ 4.5% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health

% (+ 4.5% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health

effects.description: If the Spirit Blade collides with an enemy  champion, the empowerment is enhanced, dealing increased bonus magic damage and gaining  50% bonus attack speed.

units: % (+ 2% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 2% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health

effects.description: Empowered attacks against  monsters instead deal 100% bonus damage, but their total damage is capped.

Q.notes:
The Spirit Blade is  knocked down if colliding with  Wind Wall or  Unbreakable.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Twilight Assault's  interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects.
Q.blurb: Shen recalls his spirit blade to attack with it, dealing damage based on the target's max health. The attacks are greatly empowered if it collides with an enemy champion, and all collided enemies are slowed while running away from Shen.

Once it arrives, Shen empowers his next 3 basic attacks within 8 seconds to gain  75 bonus range and deal  bonus magic damage.
