 However, gaining  Presence of Mind's effect during Unstoppable Onslaught does result in a lowered cooldown.
R.blurb: Sion charges in a direction, ramping up speed over time. He can steer his charge slightly with the mouse cursor location. When he collides with an enemy he deals damage and knocks them up based on the distance he has charged.

I.name: Fleet of Foot

effects.description: Innate: Sivir gains  30 − 50 (based on level) bonus movement speed for 2 seconds when she damages an enemy champion with an ability or a basic attack.

I.blurb: Sivir gains a short burst of Movement Speed when she attacks an enemy champion.

Q.name: Boomerang Blade

effects.description: Active: Sivir hurls her crossblade in the target direction. Enemies in its path take  physical damage, reduced to 100% − 40% (based on non-champions hit). Upon reaching maximum range the crossblade returns to her, dealing the same damage.
Each unit can be damaged only once per pass.

Q.notes:
The damage reduction per unit hit does not reset back to full damage upon changing direction.
 Boomerang Blade will still return to Sivir even if she dies before it changes direction.
  Spell shield only blocks one instance of damage.
Q.blurb: Sivir hurls her crossblade like a boomerang, dealing damage each way.

W.name: Ricochet

effects.description: Active: Sivir's next 3 basic attacks within 4 seconds bounce to nearby unaffected units, dealing them physical damage, until none remain in range.
If Sivir  critically strikes her target, the bounces do so as well.
Ricochet resets Sivir's autoattack timer.

W.notes:
Ricochet-enhanced basic attacks can bounce from structures onto secondary targets but not from nearby units onto structures.
 Potential targets do not need to be  visible for Ricochet to bounce to them.
 Attacks on the primary target will apply other  on-hit effects normally but secondary targets will not be affected by any at all.
 On-hit effects on the primary target will not modify damage dealt to secondary ones.

 Since  The Black Cleaver's armor reduction is not an on-hit effect, Ricochet will apply it on each secondary target.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Ricochet's  interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects.
W.blurb: Sivir's next few basic attacks will bounce to nearby targets, dealing reduced damage to secondary targets.

E.name: Spell Shield

effects.description: Active: After a brief delay, Sivir gains a  spell shield for 1.5 seconds.
If Sivir blocks an ability with this shield, she restores  mana.

E.notes: See Spell shield for more details.
E.blurb: Creates a magical barrier that blocks a single enemy ability cast on Sivir. She receives Mana back if a spell is blocked.

R.name: On the Hunt

effects.description: Passive: Sivir gains  bonus attack speed while  Ricochet is active.
Active: Sivir rallies all nearby allies for 8 seconds, granting them and herself  bonus movement speed that decays to 20% after a few seconds.

R.notes:
The movement speed buff applies to  minions as well.
 PENDING FOR TEST: On The Hunt affects allied  pets.

 Allies who were not in range when On the Hunt was cast can still gain the bonus movement speed by approaching Sivir.
 The bonus will persist for the full duration even if affected allies leave Sivir's aura range.
R.blurb: Sivir leads her allies in battle, granting them a surge Movement Speed for a period of time. Additionally passively grants Sivir bonus Attack Speed while Ricochet is active.

I.name: Crystal Spires

effects.description: Crystal Spires: Skarner's presence causes a number of Crystal Spires to appear at set points on the battlefield, which can be captured by  champions who stand near them for 2 seconds. Once captured, Crystal Spires are owned until contested and the defending team can stand on the spire to prevent the opposing team from capturing it.

Crystal Spires grant  30 gold split among its captors upon being captured, or  15 gold if only a single champion participated in its capture, and provide  sight around them for 1.5 seconds upon being captured, becoming unable to be recaptured for 15 seconds.

Crystal Charge: While within range of a Crystal Spire controlled by his team, or while an enemy is  stunned with  Fracture or  suppressed with  Impale, Skarner gains 70 − 120 (based on level)  bonus movement speed, 43% − 160% (based on level)  bonus attack speed and restores  2% maximum mana every second.

I.notes:
Crystal Spire distribution is as follows:
 Six in Summoner's Rift
 One beside  Baron Nashor's pit
 One beside  Dragon's pit
 One nearby each  Red Brambleback
 One nearby each  Blue Sentinel

 Five in Howling Abyss
 One in each brush
 One in each team's base (below each inhibitor)


 The Crystal Spires near  Baron Nashor,  Dragon,  Vilemaw, and the central brush in Howling Abyss begin the game as neutral and can only be captured after  minions spawn (1:30) and onwards.
 All other spires begin as either allied or enemy (depending on position) but can be captured as soon as the game starts.

 No additional Crystal Spires are spawned in One for All or mirrored matches.
 Every ally Skarner will receive the bonuses so long as the Crystal Spires are in allied control.
I.blurb: Skarner's presence causes crystals to spawn in set locations around the map. While near crystals his team owns, Skarner gains tremendous movement speed, attack speed, and mana regeneration.

Q.name: Crystal Slash

effects.description: Active: Skarner deals  physical damage to all enemies in range.
If an enemy is hit, subsequent uses of Crystal Slash within 4 seconds deal  bonus magic damage.
Basic attacks against non-structures reduce Crystal Slash's  cooldown by 0.25 seconds, quadrupled to 1 against enemy champions.

Q.notes:
Crystal Slash has no cast time and does not interrupt Skarner's previous orders.
  Spell shield will block the damage but will not prevent Skarner from triggering the bonus effect.
Q.blurb: Skarner lashes out with his claws, dealing physical damage to all nearby enemies and charging himself with Crystal Energy for several seconds if a unit is struck. If he casts Crystal Slash again while powered by Crystal Energy, he deals bonus magic damage.

W.name: Crystalline Exoskeleton

effects.description: Active: Skarner crystallizes himself, gaining a  shield for up to 6 seconds and initial  bonus movement speed that accelerates by 100% over 3 seconds while the shield holds.

W.notes: Crystalline Exoskeleton has no cast time and does not interrupt  previous orders.
W.blurb: Skarner gains a shield and has increased Movement Speed while the shield persists.

E.name: Fracture

effects.description: Active: Skarner launches a blast of crystalline energy in the target direction, dealing magic damage to all enemies struck and  slowing them for 2.5 seconds, as well as marking them with  Crystal Venom for 5 seconds. The blast's speed slows down each time it passes through an enemy unit.
Skarner's next basic attack against a target marked with  Crystal Venom consumes the mark to deal them bonus physical damage and  stun them for 1.25 seconds.
Every time he  stuns a target with Fracture or  suppresses an enemy with  Impale, Fracture's  cooldown is reduced by the corresponding duration of the disable.

E.notes:
The blast applies  area damage and the triggering basic attack deals  proc damage.
 Fracture is disabled during  Impale.
 The attack is consumed if it is  blocked,  dodged, or  missed.
E.blurb: Skarner summons a blast of crystalline energy which deals damage to enemies struck and slows them. Basic attacking these enemies within a short window will stun them.

E.name: Fracture

effects.description: Active: Skarner launches a blast of crystalline energy in the target direction, dealing magic damage to all enemies struck and  slowing them for 2.5 seconds, as well as marking them with  Crystal Venom for 5 seconds. The blast's speed slows down each time it passes through an enemy unit.
Skarner's next basic attack against a target marked with  Crystal Venom consumes the mark to deal them bonus physical damage and  stun them for 1.25 seconds.
Every time he  stuns a target with Fracture or  suppresses an enemy with  Impale, Fracture's  cooldown is reduced by the corresponding duration of the disable.

E.notes:
The blast applies  area damage and the triggering basic attack deals  proc damage.
 Fracture is disabled during  Impale.
 The attack is consumed if it is  blocked,  dodged, or  missed.
E.blurb: Skarner summons a blast of crystalline energy which deals damage to enemies struck and slows them. Basic attacking these enemies within a short window will stun them.

R.name: Impale

effects.description: Active: Skarner  roots the target enemy for 0.25 seconds, during which he rears his stinger and brings it down, dealing them magic damage,  60% AD physical damage and being able to  drag them for 1.75 seconds. At the end of the duration, the target takes the same damage again.

R.notes:
The suppression will break if the target becomes  untargetable ( Tempered Fate,  Realm Warp, Devour).
 The target will not take Impale's secondary damage if the suppression is removed ( Quicksilver,  Remove Scurvy).
 Impale is canceled (but does not go on cooldown) if Skarner loses  sight of his target or if they move 800 units away from him (whether by being mid-dash, removing the  root and backing away, or Skarner being  displaced) during the cast time.
 Skarner's  target will always be rebound to the tether placed on them no matter how much movement occurs between them.
 While Impale's suppression is active, and for the purposes of direction-conditioned abilities ( Petrifying Gaze,  Mocking Shout) Skarner is considered to be facing in the direction he is moving and not the one his model is facing.
R.blurb: Skarner suppresses an enemy champion and deals damage to it. During this time, Skarner can move freely and will drag his helpless victim around with him. When the effect ends, the target will be dealt additional damage.

I.name: Power Chord

effects.description: Aura: Sona's basic abilities each generate a unique aura for 3 seconds that empowers her and all allied champions who enter its radius, also incurring a 0.5 seconds period during which she cannot cast her other basic abilities.

Power Chord: After casting 3 basic abilities, Sona's next basic attack deals 20 −  240 (based on level) (+ 20% AP)  bonus magic damage, with an additional effect depending on the last basic ability cast.
Power Chord resets Sona's basic attack timer.

I.notes:
Sona has a stack counter under her health-bar that is not visible to other champions.
 When Power Chord is ready, Sona gains a ring around her. This ring will have a different color depending on the last ability used ( blue,  green or  purple).
 The effect does not change if abilities are used while the projectile is in motion.

 The triggering attack will apply other on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal.
I.blurb: After casting 3 spells, Sona's next attack deals bonus magic damage in addition to a bonus effect depending on what song Sona last activated.

Q.name: Hymn of Valor

effects.description: Active: Sona sends out two bolts of sound that deal magic damage to the two nearest  visible enemies, prioritizing champions.
Aura: Sona and tagged allied champions deal bonus magic damage on their next basic attack within 3 seconds.
Granting an ally (other than herself) the aura refunds 30 mana per cast.
Power Chord – Staccato: Power Chord deals[ 28 −  336 (based on level) (+ 28% AP) total magic damage. ][ 40% bonus magic damage. ]

Q.notes:
Hymn of Valor deals  default damage in an  area of effect range. The granted aura buff applies  proc damage.
 The bolts do not apply spell effects.

 Bolts hitting the same target twice only receive damage from one bolt.
Q.blurb: Sona plays the Hymn of Valor, sends out bolts of sound, dealing magic damage to two nearby enemies, prioritizing champions and monsters. Sona gains a temporary aura that grants allies tagged by the zone bonus damage on their next attack against enemies.

W.name: Aria of Perseverance

effects.description: Active: Sona  heals herself and the most wounded nearby allied champion.
Aura: Sona and tagged allied champions receive a  shield lasting up to 1.5 seconds.
Granting an ally (other than herself) the aura refunds 30 mana per cast.
Power Chord – Diminuendo: Power Chord reduces its target's size and damage output by 25% (+ 4% per 100 AP) for 3 seconds.

W.notes:
If no one is injured, Aria of Perseverance will target the closest allied champion.
 PENDING FOR TEST: While  Power Chord is activated, the damage reduction via basic attack is blocked by  spell shields.
W.blurb: Sona plays the Aria of Perseverance, sending out protective melodies, healing Sona and a nearby wounded ally. Sona gains a temporary aura that grants allies tagged by the zone a temporary shield.

E.name: Song of Celerity

effects.description: Active: Sona gains 20% (+ 3% per 100 AP)  bonus movement speed for 3 seconds, extended to up to 7 seconds if she doesn't take damage.
Aura: Tagged allied champions gain  bonus movement speed for 3 seconds.
Granting an ally (other than herself) the aura refunds 30 mana per cast.
Power Chord – Tempo: Power Chord  slows its target by 40% (+ 4% per 100 AP) for 2 seconds.

E.notes: PENDING FOR TEST: While  Power Chord is activated, the  slow via basic attack is negated by  spell shields.
E.blurb: Sona plays the Song of Celerity, granting nearby allies bonus Movement Speed. Sona gains a temporary aura that grants allied champions tagged by the zone bonus Movement Speed on their next attack.

R.name: Crescendo

effects.description: Passive: Reduces the base  cooldown of Sona's basic abilities.
Active: After a 0.2-second delay, Sona plays an irresistible chord in the target direction, dealing magic damage to all enemy champions struck and  stunning them for 1.5 seconds.

R.notes: Aesthetic: Enemies  stunned by Crescendo are forced to dance and perform their moves 50% faster for its duration.
R.blurb: Sona plays her ultimate chord, stunning enemy champions and forcing them to dance and dealing magic damage to them. Each rank reduces the base cooldown of Sona's basic abilities.

I.name: Salvation

effects.description: Innate: Soraka gains  70% bonus movement speed when moving towards allied champions below  40% of their maximum health.

I.notes:
Soraka will be able to recognize champions under the health threshold for the sake of both Salvation and  Wish.
 The movement speed of Salvation only applies when Soraka is facing in the direction of her low-health ally, even if her line of  sight is obstructed by terrain. Merely pathing towards their location will not necessarily grant her the buff.
 A line of arrows points to allied targets, similar to that displayed by  Thresh's  Dark Passage or  Yasuo's  Last Breath, indicating the direction in which she can gain the bonus movement speed.
I.blurb: Soraka runs faster towards nearby low health allies.

Q.name: Starcall

effects.description: Active: Soraka calls down a star at the target area, landing after 0.25 − 1 (based on target range) seconds, dealing  magic damage and  slowing enemies hit by 30% for 2 seconds.

Hitting at least one enemy champion returns the star dust toward Soraka, granting her Rejuvenation for 2.5 seconds,  healing her every 0.5 seconds and granting her  bonus movement speed, decaying over the duration.
While Soraka is Rejuvenated she can Rejuvenate other allies with  Astral Infusion, granting them the same effects for the same duration.

Q.notes:
Starcall grants  sight of the target area before it lands.
 Rejuvenation heals over 12 ticks, with the first 4 each healing for about 15% of the heal, the next 4 ticks for about 5.5% each, and the last 4 for about 4.5% each.
Q.blurb: A star falls from the sky at the target location dealing magic damage and slowing enemies. If an enemy champion is hit by Starcall, Soraka recovers health and gains movement speed when moving away from enemy champions.

W.name: Astral Infusion

effects.description: Active: Soraka  heals the target ally champion.
If cast while  Rejuvenated, the health cost with be reduced by a percentage.
Astral Infusion cannot be self-cast, nor can it be cast if Soraka is  below 5% maximum health.

W.notes:
PENDING FOR TEST: Astral Infusion can also be targeted on allied  pets.
 If Soraka is below 10% of her maximum health, Astral Infusion will only bring her down to 1 HP, similar to abilities with health costs.
  Spirit Visage will only increase the health donated to allies if the target ally possesses it, although owning it will boost the heal that Soraka receives from  Starcall.
W.blurb: Soraka sacrifices a portion of her own health to heal another friendly champion.

E.name: Equinox

effects.description: Active: Soraka deals magic damage to all enemy champions in an area and creates a zone within that  silences enemy champions standing on it.
After 1.5 seconds the zone detonates, dealing the same magic damage to all enemy champions within and briefly  rooting them.

E.notes: The silence is applied once every 0.25 seconds.
E.blurb: Creates a zone at a location that silences all enemies inside. When the zone expires, all enemies still inside are rooted.

R.name: Wish

effects.description: Active: Soraka calls upon the stars, instantly  healing all allied champions, and herself, which is increased by 50% on targets below  40% of their maximum health.

R.notes:
Untargetability does not invalidate the targeting of the  heal.
 Wish will not credit Soraka for assisting in a champion kill if the target ally is at full health.
R.blurb: Soraka fills her allies with hope, instantly restoring health to herself and all friendly champions.

I.name: Ravenous Flock

effects.description: Innate - Ravenous: Swain can periodically target a nearby  immobilized enemy  champion to rip out a Soul Fragment from them, dealing 20 − 105 (based on level) (+ 30% AP)  magic damage and  pulling them 290-units towards him. If the target would be brought past Swain, they are instead  knocked back the excess distance.
Enemy champions also leave behind a Soul Fragment for 16 seconds upon death, which can be harvested after 1 second if Swain is near them.

Innate - Flock: Swain's ravens bring nearby Soul Fragments to him,  healing him for 4 / 5.5 / 7% (based on level) of his maximum health and restoring 4 / 5.5 / 7% (based on level) of his maximum mana. Each Soul Fragment collected permanently increases his maximum health by 5.

I.notes:
The crows carrying the souls will only be seen by the enemies if they have  vision of Swain.
 The pull will  interrupt  channels at the very beginning, but does not keep the target stunned for the rest of the movement.
  Channels can be started successfully during the pull, provided the previous crowd control does not prevent them still.

 Decoys count as champions for dropping Soul Fragments.
 PENDING FOR TEST:  Spell shield prevents the  pull.
I.blurb: Swain stocks the fragments of souls of his enemies to grant himself permanent health. He can target disabled enemies by clicking on them, damaging and pulling them towards him, as well as receiving a Soul Fragment. Additionally, enemy champions leave behind a harvestable Soul Fragment on their corpse whenever they die, which can be obtained if Swain is near them.

Q.name: Death's Hand

effects.description: Active: Swain unleashes five bolts of eldritch power in the target direction, dealing magic damage to all enemies in a cone. Enemies can be hit by multiple bolts, taking bonus damage.
Bolts stop on impact with enemy champions.

Q.blurb: Swain fires powerful bolts of demonic energy in front of him, dealing damage to all enemies and stopping upon hitting enemy champions.

W.name: Vision of Empire

effects.description: Active: Swain summons a demonic eye at the target area,  revealing it for 2 seconds, which explodes after 1.5 seconds, dealing magic damage to all enemies hit, halved against minions, and  slowing them for 2.5 seconds.
Enemy champions are  revealed for an additional duration and have a Soul Fragment ripped from them.

W.notes:
Even if blocked by a  spell shield, Swain will still acquire the Soul Fragments.
 Vision of Empire is visible and audible to enemies through the fog of war.

E.name: Nevermove

effects.description: Active: Swain launches a demonic wave in the target direction, dealing magic damage to enemies it passes through.
Upon reaching its maximum distance, the wave returns to Swain, detonating at the first enemy hit, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies and  rooting them for 1.5 seconds.

E.notes: The detonation applies  spell damage and enemies passing through take  area damage.
E.blurb: Swain launches a demonic hand towards him, dealing magic damage to enemies along the way. The hand then returns back to Swain, rooting the first enemy who collides with it.

R.name: Demonic Ascension

effects.description: Active: Swain frees the demon within for 12 seconds, gaining   bonus health and doubling the health gained from Soul Fragments.
While Demonic Ascension is active, Swain drains all nearby enemies, dealing magic damage to them each second, and  healing himself for each enemy hit, reduced by 90% against  minions and  monsters.
After draining any amount of health with Demonic Ascension, Swain can end its effects early to cast  Demonflare, and automatically does so at the end of its duration.
If Swain dies during the brief  channel time of Demonic Ascension, the  cooldown is fully refunded.

R.notes:
Demonic Ascension can drain hidden enemies (i.e -  stealth) but will not  reveal them.
 Demonic Ascension persists through  stasis and  resurrection effects.
R.blurb: Swain unleashes his true form, becoming a demon, gaining bonus health and draining the health of all nearby enemies for a duration.

R.name: Demonflare

effects.description: Active: Swain releases a nova of energy, dealing a base amount of magic damage to all nearby enemies plus 37.5% of the health drained during  Demonic Ascension, with the total damage capped.

R.notes: Demon Flare passes through champions. Effects like  Yasuo's  Wind Wall and  Braum's  Unbreakable will block the portion of the nova they intercept.
R.blurb: Swain releases a burst of energy around him, dealing damage to all surrounding enemies, and returning back to his normal form.

I.name: Petricite Burst

effects.description: Innate: Casting an ability grants an Unshackled stack for 4 seconds, up to maximum of 3. While Sylas has stacks of Unshackled, he gains  80% bonus attack speed.

Unshackled: Sylas' next basic attack is modified to whirl his chains around him, dealing 130% AD (+ 25% AP)  magic damage to his primary target, and 40% AD (+ 20% AP) magic damage to nearby secondary targets. This attack consumes a stack.
Damage to secondary targets executes  minions below 25 health.
The empowered attack applies on-hit effects to the primary target but disables Sylas'  critical strikes' bonus damage. Spell effects only apply to secondary targets.

I.notes:
Spellblade damage will get converted to magic damage but will deal its damage only to the primary target.
 Hitting a target multiple times with Petricite Burst will not add additional stacks of  Electrocute or  Phase Rush.
 Petricite Burst does not add stacks of  Press the Attack to the target.

Q.name: Chain Lash

effects.description: Active: Sylas lashes out two lines that converge to the target location and extend beyond it up to a maximum range, dealing magic damage and  slowing enemies hit for 1.5 seconds.
After a 0.6-second delay, the chains' intersection detonates, dealing magic damage. Against  minions and  monsters the detonation deals 60% reduced damage.

Q.notes: Chain Lash will fire from the original location even if Sylas is  displaced.

W.name: Kingslayer

effects.description: Active: Sylas  lunges at a target enemy with a powerful strike, dealing magic damage.
Against enemy  champions, Sylas is also  healed, increased by 0% − 100% (based on Sylas' missing health).

W.notes:
Kingslayer is able to make allied  Illaoi  Tentacles slam (including those spawned by a hijacked  Leap of Faith).
 The tentacle attacks will regenerate Sylas's health and give him the  Gold for its kills.
 Kingslayer is unable to queue up tentacle attacks (commanding them to attack while they're already attacking will not make them attack a second time).

  Spell shield does not prevent Kingslayer from  healing Sylas.

E.name: Abscond

effects.description: Active - Abscond: Sylas  dashes forward to the target location.
For the next 3.5 seconds, Sylas may cast  Abduct.

E.notes: No additional details.

E.name: Abduct

effects.description: Active - Abduct: Sylas whips out his chains in the target direction, dealing magic damage and  stunning the first enemy hit,  pulling himself towards them, and  knocking them up for 0.35 seconds upon arrival.
Sylas may still move, basic attack and cast  Kingslayer or  Hijack before the chains reach his target.
Sylas is locked-out for 0.05 seconds after dashing.

E.notes: Sylas will not dash to his target if the chains are  spell shielded.

R.name: Hijack

effects.description: First Cast: Sylas selects a nearby target enemy champion to gain a copy of their ultimate ability. Sylas cannot select the same champion again for a set duration, and can hold the hijacked ultimate for 90 seconds.
Second Cast: Sylas can cast his hijacked ultimate ability without cost, scaling based on Hijack's rank and his own statistics.

All Hijacked ultimates and abilities that do not scale with  ability power have their  attack damage ratios converted to  ability power ratios, scaling with 0.6% AP per 1% total AD, and 0.4% AP per 1% bonus AD.

R.notes:
If Sylas casts Hijack on a decoy, no ultimate is stolen and the ability will be placed on a full cooldown.
 If the stolen ability is on-target and it loses its target during the cast time (i.e  untargetability, loss of  vision) the ability will cancel and go on cooldown.
 Since the copied ability scales based on Hijack's rank, abilities can be copied regardless of their rank.
 Hijack will copy all components of the ability: passives and actives as well as recast effects. Hijack will not trigger the effects of other abilities unless absolutely necessary. 
 Shape-shifting ultimates will transform Sylas into the target's alternate form, replacing his basic abilities and base stats. Namely:  Cougar Form,  Spider Form,  Cannon Form and  Dragon Form.
 Dragon's Descent refreshes Sylas's mana, depleting it and regenerating it at the same rate Shyvana's  fury would. Other sources of mana restoration will extend the duration as well. At the end of the effect, Sylas gains his previous mana. 
 Permanent transformations last for ~5 minutes or until toggled off. 
 The alternate abilities of transforming champions will cost mana and scale with the ranks as appropriate for the ability (e.g. ranks in R for Nidalee and ranks in Q/W/E for Jayce/Elise).
 Upon transforming, a  Petricite Burst stack will be deducted.
  Petricite Burst stacks will still be gained from abilities cast in alternate forms, but the stacks are gained independently from the normal ones. Each transformed stack applies an additional on-hit effect.
 If Sylas has both normal and transformed stacks, Petricite Burst will prioritize consuming Sylas stacks before the transformed ones.


 Ultimates comply with One For All rules if an ally is playing the hijacked champion. For example, an allied  Darius'  Hemorrhage stacks will increase the damage of the hijacked Noxian Guillotine; or an allied  Syndra's  Dark Sphere will add extra damage to hijacked Unleashed Power as well as producing 3 spheres that she can use.

Interactions

  Amumu's  Curse of the Sad Mummy - Does not apply  Cursed Touch.
  Aphelios'  Moonlight Vigil - Based on the  main weapon at the moment of steal.  Crescendum empowers his basic attacks temporarily.
  Calibrum does not apply marks.

  Brand's  Pyroclasm - Does not apply stacks of  Blaze.
  Cho'Gath's  Feast - Gains permanent Feast charges on-kill.
  Corki's  Missile Barrage - Gains max charges. 
  Darius'  Noxian Guillotine - Deals minimal damage and does not apply stacks of  Hemorrhage.
  Fiora's  Grand Challenge - Gains movement speed in the effect and can trigger the area healing, but  Vitals do not deal bonus damage.
  Gangplank's  Cannon Barrage - Does not steal cannon upgrades.
  Gnar's  GNAR! - Gains a usable ultimate regardless of cast on  Mini Gnar or  Mega Gnar.
  Heimerdinger's  UPGRADE!!! - Sylas's basic abilities are replaced with Heimerdinger's empowered abilities.
  Illaoi's  Leap of Faith - Does not reduce  cooldown of  Kingslayer.
  Kassadin's  Riftwalk - Only provides one use.
  Kai'Sa's  Killer Instinct - Sylas' basic attacks,  Abduct and nearby allies'  immobilizations apply stacks of  Plasma, up to 4. Sylas is unable to apply the 5th stack necessary to expunge the stacks.
  Kalista's  Fate's Call - Only castable with a  link (purchasable in the Shop for  0 gold).
  Karma's  Mantra - Sylas's basic abilities are replaced with Karma's empowered abilities.
  Kayn's  Umbral Trespass - Based on current form ( Shadow Assassin/ Rhaast).
  Kha'Zix's  Void Assault - Can steal the ability's  evolution bonus effects.
  Kennen's  Slicing Maelstrom - Does not apply  Mark of the Storm, targets are not  stunned.
  Kled's  Chaaaaaaaarge!!! - Does not need  mount to cast.
  Kog'Maw's  Living Artillery - Only provides one use.
  LeBlanc's  Mimic - Uses the empowered version of  LeBlanc's last cast basic ability. If she has not cast any spells,  Mimic Sigil of Malice is copied.
  Leona's  Solar Flare - Does not apply  Sunlight.
  Master Yi's  Highlander - Kills do not reduce basic ability cooldowns.
  Mordekaiser's  Realm of Death - Can join the dimension of outgoing realms if cast in the proper range (does not extend their duration).
  Nasus'  Fury of the Sands - Does not reduce  cooldown of  Chain Lash.
  Orianna's  Command: Shockwave - Cast on self without a  ball.
  Rengar's  Thrill of the Hunt - Sylas will gain  Unseen Predator on his next attack.
  Sylas'  Hijack - Steals the ability that the enemy Sylas has stolen. Cannot be targeted if no ability has been stolen.
  Rek'Sai's  Void Rush - Sylas's attacks against enemy champions will apply a  mark which can be used to cast Void Rush.
  Syndra's  Unleashed Power - Throws a minimum of 3  spheres, which are left on the ground afterwards and vanish after 6 seconds.
  Talon's  Shadow Assault - Does not apply  Blade's End.
  Teemo's  Noxious Trap - Gains max charges.
  Twitch's  Spray and Pray - Gains 300 attack range and his attacks produce missiles that travel 850 range. These attacks are classified as  melee, and so will trigger effects such as  Tiamat versus all hit targets.
  Udyr - Steals  Phoenix Stance. Lasts for 2 empowered attacks. 
  Varus'  Chain of Corruption - Does not apply stacks of  Blight.
  Vayne's  Final Hour - Gains the AD and MS bonuses. Additionally, Sylas gains  invisibility when he casts  Chain Lash. 
  Vel'Koz's  Life Form Disintegration Ray - Does not apply  Organic Deconstruction.
  Viktor's  Chaos Storm - Can steal the ability's  evolution bonus effects.
  Xayah's  Featherstorm -  Feathers do not interact with an ally or enemy  Xayah.
  Zed's  Death Mark -  Shadow does not mimic spells but can be reactivated to  swap places.
  Zoe's  Portal Jump - Sylas can use his spells for the 1 second at the target location, but not during the jump.

I.name: Transcendent

effects.description: Innate: Each of Syndra's abilities gain an additional effect at maximum rank.

I.notes:
The earliest possible champion level required for Transcendent to take effect is level 9, as this is the lowest level at which a basic ability can reach rank 5.
 Syndra's abilities gain additional visual effects when they reach rank 5. Her spells will also gain a red colored tint outlining the VFX.
  Dark Sphere will cause fractures to appear in the earth when it is used.
  Scatter the Weak gains a wider cone.
I.blurb: Spells gain extra effects at max rank. Dark Sphere: Sphere's lifetime is increased to 8 seconds. Force of Will: Deals 20% bonus true damage. Scatter the Weak: Spell width increased by 50%. Unleashed Power: Range increased by 75.

Q.name: Dark Sphere

effects.description: Active: After 0.6 seconds, Syndra conjures a Dark Sphere at the target location, dealing  magic damage to all enemies hit, which then remains for 6 seconds.
Transcendent Bonus: Dark Spheres deal 25% bonus damage against champions.

Q.notes:
Dark Sphere has no cast time and does not interrupt Syndra's previous orders.
 Dark Sphere can be conjured inside terrain, but can't be thrown there with  Force of Will.
Q.blurb: Syndra conjures a Dark Sphere dealing magic damage. The sphere remains and can be manipulated by her other powers.

W.name: Force of Will

effects.description: First Active: Syndra telekinetically grabs the nearest  Dark Sphere, enemy  minion or non-epic  monster within 400 range from the target location for 5 seconds, or if not found it grabs the nearest Dark Sphere. If a Dark Sphere is grabbed, its duration is refreshed. If a minion or monster is grabbed, it is put in  stasis.

Second Active: Syndra throws the grabbed target to the designated area, granting  sight of the projectile's surroundings as they fall. Enemies struck take magic damage and are  slowed for 1.5 seconds.
Transcendent Bonus: Force of Will deals  20% bonus true damage.

W.notes:
Force of Will has no cast time and does not interrupt Syndra's previous orders.
 Syndra cannot grab any of the following units:
  Baron Nashor
  Dragon
  Champions
  Traps
  Jack in the Box is the only exception.

 Decoys

 Casting  Teleport will cause Syndra to cancel Force of Will and drop anything she is holding.
 Enemy  pets that passively have an effect on their surroundings will continue to affect the area around them while they are being held. For example,  Tibbers will continue to inflict  burn damage on surrounding units while in  stasis.
 Force of Will has unique interactions when targeting the  Blue Sentinel and  Red Brambleback. Throwing the Blue Sentinel will refund  10 mana to Syndra upon cast and will reduce the  cooldown of Force of Will by 1 second, while throwing Red Brambleback will apply the  Crest of Cinders burn to any affected units in the  area of effect.
 Thrown  spheres will be  knocked down upon colliding with  Wind Wall.
 This does not occur to other thrown enemy units.
W.blurb: Syndra picks up and throws a Dark Sphere or enemy minion dealing magic damage and slowing the Movement Speed of enemies.

E.name: Scatter the Weak

effects.description: Active: Syndra  knocks back all enemy units for 400 units and up to 800 units away from Syndra, dealing magic damage.

Dark Spheres can also be knocked back for 1000 units and up to 1300 units away from Syndra, knocking back all enemy units they collide with for 100 units and  stunning them for 1.5 seconds, dealing Scatter the Weak's damage to enemies who weren't affected by the initial cast.
Transcendent Bonus: Scatter the Weak's area of effect is 50% wider.

E.notes:
Launched  Dark Spheres that successfully strike an enemy will grant  sight of that enemy for the duration of the  stun.
 Spheres are  knocked down upon colliding with  Wind Wall.
E.blurb: Syndra knocks enemies and Dark Spheres back dealing magic damage. Enemies hit by Dark Spheres become stunned.

R.name: Unleashed Power

effects.description: Active: After a short delay, Syndra grabs up to 4 nearby  Dark Spheres and the three orbiting around her and hurls them at the target enemy  champion, dealing magic damage per sphere.
The  Dark Spheres will then remain on the ground for 6 seconds.
Transcendent Bonus: Unleashed Power's cast range is increased.

R.notes:
Unleashed Power has a brief cast time before it activates, but Syndra does not have to remain in place while the spheres apply their damage. She can walk away as soon as the casting has completed, as the spheres only begin dealing their damage after the casting time.
 Each one of the sphere hits is considered a  single target spell, triggering  Muramana each time.
 Casting Unleashed Power on a target that becomes  untargetable while the spheres are in flight will cause all spheres to deal no damage and be destroyed.
 Spheres already in flight will still travel if Syndra's target dies, but any remaining sphere will not. However their duration will still get reset.
 A Dark Sphere summoned very shortly before Unleashed Power will be used as one of the spheres that get thrown. 
 Depending on how many spheres are on the map and how far away the enemy is upon casting Unleashed Power it is possible that Syndra would conjure the sphere behind her as if she was going to throw it, but she won't.

  Spell shield will only block the damage of a single sphere.
 Spheres are  knocked down upon  interception.
R.blurb: Syndra bombards an enemy Champion with all of her Dark Spheres.

I.name: An Acquired Taste

effects.description: Innate: Tahm Kench's basic attacks deal 4% of his maximum health  bonus magic damage. Against enemy  champions they also apply An Acquired Taste stack for 5 seconds, stacking up to 3 times. The stacks decay once every 0.67 seconds after the stacks reach the full duration.
Tongue Lash and  Devour gain additional effects against enemies with three stacks.

I.notes: By calculating An Acquired Taste's base damage, using Tahm Kench's base health, An Acquired Taste's damage can be acquired in a different way: 24 − 92 (based on level) (+ 4% bonus health).
I.blurb: Tahm Kench puts the heft of his immense body behind his attacks and abilities, gaining extra damage based on his total health. Damaging enemy champions builds stacks of An Acquired Taste. At three stacks, he can use Devour on an enemy champion.

Q.name: Tongue Lash

effects.description: Active: After a brief delay, Tahm Kench lashes his tongue in the target direction, dealing magic damage to the first enemy hit and  slowing them for 3 seconds.
If an enemy champion is struck while at three  An Acquired Taste stacks, they're also  stunned for 2 seconds, consuming all stacks.

During Tongue Lash,  Devour can be cast for no  mana expenditure to devour the  minion or non-epic  monster struck at the cost of no longer dealing Tongue Lash's damage. Devour's  mana refund does not apply in this case.

Q.notes: Devour can be 'queued' at any point during Tongue Lash (including the wind-up animation) and will not go on cooldown if Tahm Kench fails to hit a valid target with Tongue Lash.
Q.blurb: Tahm Kench lashes out with his tongue, damaging and slowing the first unit hit. This ability gains a stun after three stacks of An Acquired Taste.

W.name: Devour

effects.description: Active – Devour: Tahm Kench swallows an enemy minion, non-epic monster or allied champion, making them  untargetable and unable to take any actions for 4 seconds.

Tahm Kench can swallow an enemy champion if they have three  An Acquired Taste stacks. If Tahm Kench swallows an allied or enemy champion, he is  grounded and  slowed by 95% for the duration. Swallowing a targeted enemy champion only lasts for half the duration, down to 2 seconds, consumes all their An Acquired Taste stacks,  suppresses and makes them  untargetable.
Swallowing an enemy refunds  50% of the cooldown and  50% of the mana cost.
After 1 second, Devour can be recast into  Regurgitate while Tahm Kench's belly is full. Allied champions can exit at will after the same delay, unless they're  immobilized.

W.notes:
The  self-slow is affected by  slow resist.
 Devour will prioritize champions (cannot be used on those who are  channeling an ability) over minions.
 If champions stay on top of each other it will prioritize those who stay beneath.

 Tahm Kench cannot use  Teleport,  Flash, or  Dark Passage while holding an enemy champion in his belly (he can when holding an allied champion or minion).
 Devour cannot be used on epic monsters ( Rift Herald,  Dragon,  Baron Nashor) and on  Sion during his  Glory in Death.
 Devour will not interrupt persistent area-of-effect abilities ( Glacial Storm, Slicing Maelstrom,  Burnout) non-channeled ones ( The Culling,  Center of the Universe,  Celestial Expansion) damage over time ( Ignite) or delayed single-target damage ( Death Mark) but will interrupt the delayed area-of-effect kind ( Explosive Charge).
  Quicksilver Sash will cleanse Devour's  suppression but the damage will still be dealt.
W.blurb: Tahm Kench devours a target, dealing a percentage of their maximum health as magic damage. He can spit devoured minions and monsters out as a skillshot that deals magic damage in an area upon impact.

W.name: Regurgitate

effects.description: Active – Regurgitate: Tahm Kench regurgitates the swallowed target. If they are an enemy they also take magic damage, capped at 500 against monsters.

units: % (+ 2% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 2% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 2% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 2% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 2% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health

effects.description: Minions and non-epic monsters that are spat forth can collide with an enemy or terrain to deal magic damage to all enemies around them and themselves before taking Regurgitate's stun damage.

W.notes:
Quicksilver Sash will cleanse Devour's  suppression but the damage will still be dealt.
 Regurgitate can send allies to the other side of small walls.
W.blurb: Tahm Kench devours a target, dealing a percentage of their maximum health as magic damage. He can spit devoured minions and monsters out as a skillshot that deals magic damage in an area upon impact.

E.name: Thick Skin

effects.description: Passive: Tahm Kench stores a percentage of the damage he takes as Grey Health on his health bar, up to a maximum of 100% of his missing health.
While Thick Skin is available, and after taking no damage for 2.5 seconds, Tahm Kench rapidly  heals for 30% − 100% (based on level) of his Grey Health over time.
Active: Tahm Kench converts his current Grey Health into a  shield that lasts for 2 seconds.

E.notes:
Thick Skin shield value and Grey Health percentage heal are both boosted by effects that increase  heal and shield power. This means he can technically  heal more than the normal amount of Grey Health and get a shield bigger than his maximum health.
 At level 18 Tahm Kench would need 53.8%  heal power to heal for 100% of the damage he takes, reduced to 39.9% with  Revitalize, 18.3% with  Spirit Visage, and 7.6% with both.

 Grey Health converts all post-mitigation damage, Thick Skin effectively grants Tahm Kench a form of true damage mitigation.
 Grey Health can temporarily exceed 100% of his missing health when Tahm Kench heals through other means with a Grey Health bar at 100%. In that case he will keep the higher Grey Health value for a few moments until it updates and removes the amount that he healed.
E.blurb: Tahm Kench turns incoming damage into gray health. As gray health decays, Tahm Kench is healed for a percentage of the gray health amount. When activated, this ability turns all gray health into a shield.

R.name: Abyssal Voyage

effects.description: Active: Tahm Kench  channels for up to 6 seconds, highlighting the path to his intended destination to allied champions while opening his maw to offer up to one of them the chance to come with him. If an ally has climbed in, Tahm Kench automatically begins a 1 second channel.

After a 0.25-second delay, Tahm Kench can reactivate  Abyssal Voyage to begin the channel without an ally. Once the channel is completed, Tahm Kench and the ally that has climbed in will  blink to the target location, arriving after a 0.5-second delay.
Taking damage or cancelling the channel  interrupts Abyssal Voyage, putting it on a  10 second cooldown. Abyssal Voyage cannot be activated while Tahm Kench has a  full belly.

R.notes:
Allies may still join Tahm Kench by clicking him while he performs Abyssal Voyage's second cast's animation.
 Allies in combat with enemy champions cannot jump into Abyssal Voyage.
 Abyssal Voyage, upon recast, will alert Tahm Kench's arrival to nearby enemies and allies with a on the way ping.
R.blurb: Tahm Kench teleports across the map, and he may bring one ally champion with him.

R.name: Abyssal Voyage

effects.description: Active: Tahm Kench  channels for up to 6 seconds, highlighting the path to his intended destination to allied champions while opening his maw to offer up to one of them the chance to come with him. If an ally has climbed in, Tahm Kench automatically begins a 1 second channel.

After a 0.25-second delay, Tahm Kench can reactivate  Abyssal Voyage to begin the channel without an ally. Once the channel is completed, Tahm Kench and the ally that has climbed in will  blink to the target location, arriving after a 0.5-second delay.
Taking damage or cancelling the channel  interrupts Abyssal Voyage, putting it on a  10 second cooldown. Abyssal Voyage cannot be activated while Tahm Kench has a  full belly.

R.notes:
Allies may still join Tahm Kench by clicking him while he performs Abyssal Voyage's second cast's animation.
 Allies in combat with enemy champions cannot jump into Abyssal Voyage.
 Abyssal Voyage, upon recast, will alert Tahm Kench's arrival to nearby enemies and allies with a on the way ping.
R.blurb: Tahm Kench teleports across the map, and he may bring one ally champion with him.

I.name: Rock Surfing

effects.description: Innate: Taliyah gains up to 20% − 45% (based on level)  bonus movement speed, which builds up over 1 second if she had been near terrain or structures for at least 0.4 seconds and decays by the same amount if out of range for at least 0.8 seconds.
Entering combat or casting an ability puts Rock Surfing on a 2 second  cooldown that is continuously refreshed while remaining in combat.

I.notes:
Taliyah's basic attack disables Rock Surfing on-hit. If the target dies before the projectile connects, Rock Surfing will not go on cooldown.
 The build up and decay changes by the same amount in the same interval, which is 25% of the maximum value every 0.25 seconds.
I.blurb: Taliyah gains movement speed near walls.

Q.name: Threaded Volley

effects.description: Active: After 0.25 seconds, Taliyah unleashes 5 Stone Shards in quick succession in the target direction over 1.5 seconds, dealing  magic damage to the first target hit. Units hit by multiple Stone Shards take 50% damage beyond the first.
Taliyah can move and cast other abilities while launching Stone Shards. After launching the third Stone Shard she's also able to basic attack.

Casting Threaded Volley creates an area of Worked Ground 450 units radius wide around Taliyah that lasts 45 seconds. While on Worked Ground, Taliyah only hurls one Stone Shard upon casting Threaded Volley and reduces its  mana cost to 1.

Q.notes:
The first Stone Shard hit on each target is considered  single target  spell damage and triggers effects such as Shock from  Muramana, while additional ones of the same cast are considered  persistent damage.
 The first Stone Shard is launched instantly after the cast time. After 0.5 seconds is then launched the second and after the same delay is then launched the third. After another 0.25 seconds is launched the fourth and after the same delay is then launched the fifth.
  Spell shield only prevents one instance of damage.
Q.blurb: Taliyah throws a volley of missiles in a target direction, moving freely as she does. This works the ground below her. If Taliyah casts Threaded Volley on worked ground, she only throws one missile.

Q.name: Threaded Volley

effects.description: Active: After 0.25 seconds, Taliyah unleashes 5 Stone Shards in quick succession in the target direction over 1.5 seconds, dealing  magic damage to the first target hit. Units hit by multiple Stone Shards take 50% damage beyond the first.
Taliyah can move and cast other abilities while launching Stone Shards. After launching the third Stone Shard she's also able to basic attack.

Casting Threaded Volley creates an area of Worked Ground 450 units radius wide around Taliyah that lasts 45 seconds. While on Worked Ground, Taliyah only hurls one Stone Shard upon casting Threaded Volley and reduces its  mana cost to 1.

Q.notes:
The first Stone Shard hit on each target is considered  single target  spell damage and triggers effects such as Shock from  Muramana, while additional ones of the same cast are considered  persistent damage.
 The first Stone Shard is launched instantly after the cast time. After 0.5 seconds is then launched the second and after the same delay is then launched the third. After another 0.25 seconds is launched the fourth and after the same delay is then launched the fifth.
  Spell shield only prevents one instance of damage.
Q.blurb: Taliyah throws a volley of missiles in a target direction, moving freely as she does. This works the ground below her. If Taliyah casts Threaded Volley on worked ground, she only throws one missile.

W.name: Seismic Shove

effects.description: Active: After 0.25 seconds, Taliyah marks the target location and selects a direction. After 1 second, the ground erupts, dealing magic damage to all enemies hit and  knocking them in the chosen direction for 1 second.

W.notes: Seismic Shove can knock targets over walls.
W.blurb: Taliyah causes an area of ground to erupt and throws enemies within in a direction of her choosing.

E.name: Unraveled Earth

effects.description: Active: After 0.25 seconds, Taliyah scatters 18 boulders over the ground in a cone before her, dealing magic damage to all enemies hit.

The boulders then remain for 4 seconds,  slowing all enemies within the area by 20% (+ 4% per 100 AP). At the end of their duration, all remaining boulders explode, dealing Unraveled Earth's initial damage once more.

Enemies who  dash over or are  knocked through the boulders will detonate them instantly, each dealing magic damage. Enemies can detonate multiple boulders, but they will only take damage from a maximum of 4, reduced by 0% − 45% (based on boulder hit).

E.notes: Triggering a boulder deals damage only to the enemy that detonated it.
E.blurb: Taliyah creates a slowing minefield that explodes if enemies dash through it or are pushed/pulled through it.

R.name: Weaver's Wall

effects.description: Active: Taliyah channels for 1 second before summoning a massive wall of spiraling rock that tears through the battlefield in the target direction, creating impassable terrain for 5 seconds and  knocking aside allied and enemy champions it passes through as it emerges.

Taliyah can reactivate Weaver's Wall while channeling to  ride atop the wall at 1500 speed as it emerges. Taking damage during or after the cast time will force her off the wall, which will continue along its path normally. After 0.75 seconds she can input a movement command to manually jump off the wall.
Weaver's Wall can be reactivated after it reaches its maximum range to destroy it instantly.

R.notes:
The  knockup on allied champions can be used by an enemy  Yasuo to trigger  Last Breath.
 If Weaver's Wall is allowed to expire normally, the wall collapses with the same progression as it was formed.
 She's more likely to jump off to the left side of Weaver's Wall.
R.blurb: Stone Weaver creates a very long wall and then surfs it.

R.name: Weaver's Wall

effects.description: Active: Taliyah channels for 1 second before summoning a massive wall of spiraling rock that tears through the battlefield in the target direction, creating impassable terrain for 5 seconds and  knocking aside allied and enemy champions it passes through as it emerges.

Taliyah can reactivate Weaver's Wall while channeling to  ride atop the wall at 1500 speed as it emerges. Taking damage during or after the cast time will force her off the wall, which will continue along its path normally. After 0.75 seconds she can input a movement command to manually jump off the wall.
Weaver's Wall can be reactivated after it reaches its maximum range to destroy it instantly.

R.notes:
The  knockup on allied champions can be used by an enemy  Yasuo to trigger  Last Breath.
 If Weaver's Wall is allowed to expire normally, the wall collapses with the same progression as it was formed.
 She's more likely to jump off to the left side of Weaver's Wall.
R.blurb: Stone Weaver creates a very long wall and then surfs it.

I.name: Blade's End

effects.description: Innate: Talon's abilities wound enemy  champions and epic  monsters every time they deal damage, lasting 6 seconds and stacking up to 3 times. Basic attacks refresh the duration on-hit.

Talon's next basic attack against a target with 3 wounds will consume them, causing the target to bleed for 75 − 245 (based on level) (+ 200% bonus AD)  physical damage over 2 seconds, with each tick occurring every 0.125 seconds.

I.notes: Spell shields prevent at least one wound stack from affecting the target. The triggering bleed cannot be mitigated by them.
I.blurb: Talon's spells Wound champions and epic monsters, stacking up to 3 times. When Talon attacks a champion with 3 stacks of Wound, they bleed for heavy damage over time.

Q.name: Noxian Diplomacy

effects.description: Active: Noxian Diplomacy has a different effect depending on the  range with the target.
Standard - Outside 170 units: Talon  dashes onto his target, dealing physical damage on-arrival.
Melee - Within 170 units: Talon skewers his target, causing Noxian Diplomacy to  critically strike for (50% +  25%) bonus physical damage.
If Noxian Diplomacy kills its target, Talon  heals for  20 − 71 (based on level) and 50% of its  cooldown is refunded.
The melee version of Noxian Diplomacy resets Talon's autoattack timer.

Q.notes:
While  grounded or  rooted only the melee version of this ability may be used.
 Talon will stop at the target's last location if they  blink long distances (i.e  Recall,  Teleport).
Q.blurb: Talon stabs the target unit. If they are within melee range, this attack deals critical damage. If they are outside melee range, Talon will leap at his target before stabbing them. Talon refunds some health and cooldown if this ability kills the target.

W.name: Rake

effects.description: Active: Talon sends out a volley of blades, dealing physical damage to all enemies they pass through.
The blades linger for 0.75 seconds before flying back to Talon, dealing physical damage to all enemies they pass through and  slowing them for 1 second.

W.notes: If Talon dies while Rake is mid-air, the projectiles will still complete their travel.
W.blurb: Talon sends out a volley of daggers that then return back to him, dealing physical damage every time it passes through an enemy. The returning blades deal bonus damage and slow units hit.

E.name: Assassin's Path

effects.description: Active: Talon  dashes a maximum of 800 units over the target structure or piece of terrain, with the dash's speed based on his own  movement speed.
Talon cannot cast Assassin's Path on the same area of terrain for a set duration.

E.notes: Assassin's Path can be cast on player-made terrain ( Crystallize,  Pillar of Ice,  Weaver's Wall).
E.blurb: Talon vaults over any terrain or structure, up to a max distance. This ability has a low cooldown, but puts the used terrain on a long cooldown.

R.name: Shadow Assault

effects.description: Active: Talon disperses a ring of blades, dealing physical damage to all enemies hit, while gaining  invisibility and  bonus movement speed for up to 2.5 seconds.

When Talon emerges from  invisibility, the blades converge to his location, dealing the same physical damage to all enemies they pass through. Breaking  invisibility with a basic attack or  Noxian Diplomacy causes the blades to converge to his target instead.

R.notes: Spell shield will only block one instance of damage.
R.blurb: Talon disperses a ring of blades and becomes Invisible while gaining additional Movement Speed. When Talon emerges from Invisibility, the blades converge on his location. Each time the blades move, Shadow Assault deals physical damage to enemies hit by at least one blade.

I.name: Bravado

effects.description: Innate: After casting an ability, Taric's next two basic attacks within 4 seconds gain  100% total attack speed, each dealing 25 − 93 (based on level) (+ 15% bonus armor)  bonus magic damage and reducing the  cooldowns of his basic abilities by 1 second.

I.notes:
The attacks will apply  on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal.
  Critical strikes do not interact with Bravado's bonus damage.

 The empowered attacks will not apply the bonus damage against structures but will reduce Taric's cooldowns.
 The empowered basic attacks can be  dodged or  blocked but will still reduce Taric's cooldowns.
 Being  blinded does not block Bravado's bonus magic damage or the  cooldown reduction.
I.blurb: Spellcasts empower Taric's next 2 basic attacks to deal bonus magic damage, reduce his spell cooldowns, and attack in quick succession.

Q.name: Starlight's Touch

effects.description: Passive: Taric stores a charge of Starlight's Touch periodically, up to a maximum at once.  Bravado empowered attacks grant one charge.

Active: Taric  heals himself and all nearby allied champions for 30 (+ 20% AP) (+ 1% of Taric's maximum health) per stored charge at the time of cast, up to a maximum of 150 (+ 100% AP) (+ 5% of Taric's maximum health) at 5 charges.

Q.notes: No additional details.
Q.blurb: Heals nearby allied champions based on charges stored. Bravado-empowered attacks grant a charge of Starlight's Touch.

W.name: Bastion

effects.description: Passive: Taric gains  bonus armor and links to his ally. While tethered, the bonus armor and Taric's abilities are replicated on the ally, though the effects do not stack.
Active: Taric  shields himself and the target allied champion for 2.5 seconds, blessing them with the Bastion link.
Taric can self-cast Bastion to shield himself, or to the nearest unlinked ally in range. Only one champion can be marked at a time, and selecting a new ally clears the previous mark.

W.notes: Linked allies will keep continuing  Bastion,  Dazzle, and  Cosmic Radiance even if Taric is not in range.
W.blurb: Passively increase the Armor of Taric and any allied champion with Bastion. Actively shields an ally and grants them Bastion for as long as they remain near Taric. Taric's spells also cast off the ally with Bastion.

W.name: Bastion

effects.description: Passive: Taric gains  bonus armor and links to his ally. While tethered, the bonus armor and Taric's abilities are replicated on the ally, though the effects do not stack.
Active: Taric  shields himself and the target allied champion for 2.5 seconds, blessing them with the Bastion link.
Taric can self-cast Bastion to shield himself, or to the nearest unlinked ally in range. Only one champion can be marked at a time, and selecting a new ally clears the previous mark.

W.notes: Linked allies will keep continuing  Bastion,  Dazzle, and  Cosmic Radiance even if Taric is not in range.
W.blurb: Passively increase the Armor of Taric and any allied champion with Bastion. Actively shields an ally and grants them Bastion for as long as they remain near Taric. Taric's spells also cast off the ally with Bastion.

E.name: Dazzle

effects.description: Active: Taric projects a beam of starlight towards the target location, erupting after a 1 second delay, dealing magic damage to all enemies hit and  stunning them for 1.25 seconds.

E.notes: Dazzle will aim toward Taric's cursor on-cast when firing from both his and his  Bastion's positions.
E.blurb: Taric readies a beam of starlight that, after a brief delay, deals magic damage and stuns enemies.

R.name: Cosmic Radiance

effects.description: Active: After a 2.5-second delay, cosmic energy descends upon Taric and all nearby allied champions, rendering them  invulnerable for 2.5 seconds.

R.notes: No additional details.
R.blurb: Pulses cosmic energy onto nearby allied champions after a delay, making them invulnerable for a short duration.

I.name: Guerrilla Warfare

effects.description: Innate: Teemo gains  invisibility if he stands still for 1.5 seconds without acting or being acted upon. He will remain stealthed so long as he does not move or act, and is not  displaced. If within  brush, Teemo gains stealth after 1.5 seconds even while moving and may move freely within its boundaries without breaking stealth.
Element of Surprise: When Teemo breaks stealth, he gains the Element of Surprise for 3 seconds, granting him  20 / 40 / 60 / 80% (based on level) bonus attack speed.

I.notes:
Guerrilla Warfare will not grant Teemo stealth as long as he is taking damage (damage taken once stealthed will not reveal Teemo).
 Teemo will break Guerrilla Warfare's stealth by using certain summoner spells ( Clarity,  Dash,  Exhaust,  Heal,  Ignite,  Mark,  Recall,  Smite,  Teleport) and certain trinkets ( Oracle Lens) but not when placing wards, when using consumable items, or when using  Flash to get within a brush (while already stealthed beforehand).
 If Teemo triggers Element of Surprise twice in less than 3 seconds he will only refresh the bonus attack speed's duration (it will not stack with itself).
I.blurb: If Teemo stands still and takes no actions for a short duration, he becomes Invisible indefinitely. If he's in brush, Teemo can enter and maintain his Invisibility while moving. After leaving Invisibility, Teemo gains the Element of Surprise, increasing his Attack Speed for 3 seconds.

Q.name: Blinding Dart

effects.description: Active: Teemo shoots a dart at the target enemy, dealing them  magic damage and  blinding them for a short duration.

Q.notes:
Blinding Dart will not make abilities that can trigger on-hit effects ( Parrrley,  Mystic Shot) miss.
 When blinded, enemies have a green tint on their screen.
Q.blurb: Obscures an enemy's vision with a powerful venom, dealing damage to the target unit and blinding it for the duration.

W.name: Move Quick

effects.description: Passive: Teemo gains  bonus movement speed if he hasn't taken damage from enemy champions or turrets for 5 seconds.
Active: Teemo doubles his  bonus movement speed for 3 seconds and prevents it from being disabled by damage for the duration.

W.notes:
Move Quick's active's cooldown starts when the ability is first cast and not when the duration ends.
 When Move Quick's active bonus movement speed ends Teemo will not regain the passive one if he was damaged during the active's duration.
Move Quick's passive will be disabled even if the damage is blocked with a spell shield.
W.blurb: Teemo scampers around, passively increasing his Movement Speed until he is struck by an enemy champion or turret. Teemo can sprint to gain bonus Movement Speed that isn't stopped by being struck for a short time.

E.name: Toxic Shot

effects.description: Passive: Teemo's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage and  poison his target.
Poisoned targets suffer magic damage for 4 seconds, with subsequent attacks refreshing the  poison's duration.

leveling.attribute: Total Magic Damage in a Single Hit

E.notes:
Toxic Shot's poison will trigger  Twin Fang's bonus effects for  Cassiopeia.
 Each tick of damage from Toxic Shot can apply  Hunter Talisman's  damage over time to  monsters.
E.blurb: Each of Teemo's attacks will poison the target, dealing damage on impact and each second after for 4 seconds.

R.name: Noxious Trap

effects.description: Passive: Teemo stores a Noxious Trap charge periodically, up to a maximum amount at once.

Active: Teemo tosses a  mushroom trap on the ground, which stealths and arms after 1 second, lasting up to 5 minutes. While armed, mushrooms grant  sight around them. Mushrooms bounce forward if they land on top of another mushroom. This can happen an infinite amount of times while Teemo is alive. If Teemo dies before the mushroom lands on another mushroom, the mushroom will disappear.
If an enemy steps on a mushroom, it detonates,  poisoning all nearby enemies,  slowing them, granting  sight of them, and dealing them magic damage over 4 seconds.
Noxious Trap have  6 maximum health and can only be damaged by champion basic attacks (2 damage from  ranged and 3 from  melee).

R.notes:
Rift Scuttler will not trigger Noxious Trap's explosion if it is not being attacked.
 Noxious Trap's poison will trigger  Twin Fang's bonus effects for  Cassiopeia.
 Enemies who step on multiple Noxious Traps will only refresh the poison's duration (their damage does not stack).
 Noxious Trap's damage is determined when it detonates and not when planted, meaning if Teemo's  ability power changes, the scaling is also altered to affect all active mushrooms' damage so long as they do not explode.
 Noxious Trap can be targeted by any allied  Teleport. The mushroom will not become invulnerable and its detonation (if the teleportation is already  channeling when so) will not be canceled.
  Spell shield will only block the  poison (self and allied) and the  slow but will not prevent the detonation itself.
 A thrown Noxious Trap will be destroyed when colliding with  Wind Wall /  Unbreakable.
R.blurb: Teemo throws an explosive poisonous trap using one of the mushrooms stored in his pack. If an enemy steps on the trap, it will release a poisonous cloud, slowing enemies and damaging them over time. If Teemo throws a mushroom onto another mushroom it will bounce, gaining additional range.

I.name: Damnation

effects.description: Innate: Enemy  champions, large  minions and large  monsters that die near Thresh drop a Soul for 8 seconds. Epic monsters drop 2 Souls instead. Small minions and lesser monsters have a 33.33% chance to drop a Soul.
Thresh autonomously collects Souls near him or his  lantern. Souls are visible to allies and only become visible to enemies if their team has  sight of Thresh.
Each collected Soul grants Thresh  0.75 bonus ability power and  0.75 bonus armor.

I.notes:
Souls grants a small amount of  sight around itself.
 The probability for souls dropping from small minions and monster on  Summoner's Rift starts at 33% but adjusts dynamically to match the expected quota of souls dropped (lowers if above, rises if below, remains if even). Souls collected are not considered when adjusting the probability.
 The maximum amount of souls Thresh can collect is 999,999, granting him 749,999 bonus ability power and 749,999 bonus armor (99.99% damage reduction, reduced to 99.98% when hit by  Last Whisper).
  Nunu & Willump drop a soul each (sometimes the icy ghosts from  Twin Shadows' active will drop one each after reaching their targets).
I.blurb: Thresh can harvest the souls of enemies that die near him, permanently granting him Armor and Ability Power.

Q.name: Death Sentence

effects.description: First Cast - Death Sentence: Thresh throws out his scythe in the target direction. Thresh is  entangled while the scythe is in flight.

The scythe stops with the first enemy it hits, dealing magic damage and  stunning them for 1.5 seconds, while also forming a tether between Thresh and them for the duration. Hitting an enemy reduces Death Sentence's  cooldown by 3 seconds.

While the tether persists, Thresh is  disarmed and periodically tugs at his scythe's chain,  pulling the target a short distance towards himself. After 0.5 seconds, or instantly upon hitting a minion or monster, Thresh can cast  Death Leap.
Second Cast - Death Leap: Thresh  dashes to the tethered enemy, removing the  stun but becoming able to attack again.

Q.notes:
Thresh will not face in the target direction during Death Sentence's cast animation (only after the projectile starts traveling).
 While  grounded only the second cast is disabled.
 Death Sentence's  stun duration is reduced by  tenacity while the tether will persist for the full duration (unless broken by Quicksilver,  Mikael's Crucible,  Cleanse, or certain abilities).
 Targets affected by  Black Shield will not be  stunned or  pulled at when hit (Thresh will not tug at his target even if  Black Shield wears off before Death Sentence ends).
 Death Sentence's tether will not be broken by becoming  untargetable.
 Death Sentence's effects will persist if Thresh dies before the duration ends.
Q.blurb: Thresh binds an enemy in chains and pulls them toward him. Activating this ability a second time pulls Thresh to the enemy.

Q.name: Death Sentence

effects.description: First Cast - Death Sentence: Thresh throws out his scythe in the target direction. Thresh is  entangled while the scythe is in flight.

The scythe stops with the first enemy it hits, dealing magic damage and  stunning them for 1.5 seconds, while also forming a tether between Thresh and them for the duration. Hitting an enemy reduces Death Sentence's  cooldown by 3 seconds.

While the tether persists, Thresh is  disarmed and periodically tugs at his scythe's chain,  pulling the target a short distance towards himself. After 0.5 seconds, or instantly upon hitting a minion or monster, Thresh can cast  Death Leap.
Second Cast - Death Leap: Thresh  dashes to the tethered enemy, removing the  stun but becoming able to attack again.

Q.notes:
Thresh will not face in the target direction during Death Sentence's cast animation (only after the projectile starts traveling).

 Death Sentence's tether will not be broken by becoming  untargetable.
 Death Sentence's effects will persist if Thresh dies before the duration ends.
Q.blurb: Thresh binds an enemy in chains and pulls them toward him. Activating this ability a second time pulls Thresh to the enemy.

W.name: Dark Passage

effects.description: Active: Thresh throws his lantern to the target location for 6 seconds or until he moves too far away from it,  revealing its surroundings.

Thresh and the first allied champion to come near the lantern is  shielded for 4 seconds. An ally can select the lantern while in proximity of it,  dashing to Thresh's current location and gaining the shield.
An ally cannot select the lantern while  silenced,  grounded or  immobilized.

W.notes:
Allies can pick up the lantern through small walls if its grab radius allows it.
 Thresh cannot grab the lantern but can shield himself if he walks near it.
 The lantern is considered a unit and can be targeted by  Teleport,  Leap Strike,  Shunpo, and  Safeguard.
 The lantern's duration and maximum leash range are each displayed as a circle on the ground.
W.blurb: Thresh throws out a lantern that shields nearby allied Champions from damage. Allies can click the lantern to dash to Thresh.

E.name: Flay

effects.description: Passive: Thresh's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage, with the  AD ratio increasing based on the time spent not attacking enemy or neutral units.

Active: Thresh sweeps his chain around him and in a broad line towards the target direction, dealing magic damage to enemies hit,  knocking them in the chain's direction, and  slowing them afterwards for 1 second.

E.notes:
Applies  area damage on the ability and deals  proc damage on the enhanced basic attack.
Flay's passive's buff icon changes colors depending on charge level:
  0 - 25%
  25 - 50%
  50 - 75%
  75 - 100%
 At 100%, Thresh's scythe will glow green and a sound effect will play.

  Runaan's Hurricane's Wind's Fury will apply Flay's passive to each enemy hit, with the secondary targets taking minimum damage (charge resets upon hitting the primary target).
 The enhanced attack applies other on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal (the bonus damage cannot) but does not affect structures or wards (hitting them does not consume the bonus damage or reset the charge).
 Flay's passive can be  dodged (the enhanced attack is not consumed and the charge is not reset).
 PENDING FOR TEST: Enhanced attack's interactions with  blocking and  blinding effects (regarding both bonus damage and charge reset).
E.blurb: Thresh's attacks wind up, dealing more damage the longer he waits between attacks. When activated, Thresh sweeps his chain, knocking all enemies hit in the direction of the blow.

Active: Thresh sweeps his chain around him and in a broad line towards the target direction, dealing magic damage to enemies hit,  knocking them in the chain's direction, and  slowing them afterwards for 1 second.

R.name: The Box

effects.description: Active: Thresh surrounds himself with 5 spectral walls, each lasting for up to 5 seconds. Walls break upon contact with an enemy champion, dealing magic damage and  slowing by 99% for 2 seconds.
Enemy champions hitting any wall beyond the first take no damage and are  slowed for only 1 second.

R.notes: No additional details.
R.blurb: A prison of walls that slow and deal damage if broken.

I.name: Draw a Bead

effects.description: Innate: The  range of Tristana's basic attacks,  Explosive Charge and  Buster Shot is increased by 0 − 136 (based on level) for a total of 525 − 661 (based on level) range.

I.notes: Tristana can attack  Baron Nashor over the back wall once she hits level 15, a feature shared by  Caitlyn.
I.blurb: Increases Tristana's Attack Range as she levels.

Q.name: Rapid Fire

effects.description: Active: Tristana gains  bonus attack speed for 7 seconds.

Q.notes: Rapid Fire is a non-refreshing buff that will not update on rank-up.
Q.blurb: Tristana fires her weapon rapidly, increasing her Attack Speed for a short time.

W.name: Rocket Jump

effects.description: Active: Tristana  jumps to the target location, dealing  magic damage to all nearby enemies on impact and  slowing them by 60%.
On enemy champion  takedowns or upon detonating  Explosive Charge at maximum stacks on an enemy champion, Rocket Jump's  cooldown is reset.

W.notes:
Tristana can still use basic attacks, abilities, summoner spells and item actives while in the air.
 Rocket Jump's speed depends on the distance of the jump.  Melee range jumps are much shorter while long range jumps leave Tristana in the air significantly longer.
 Tristana is still targetable while jumping and can be hit by skillshots such as  Ashe's  Enchanted Crystal Arrow and  Ezreal's  Mystic Shot.
 Non- airborne crowd control effects, such as  stuns and  roots, will take effect upon landing and will 'not  interrupt the jump, with the exception of  knockdowns.
 All  airborne crowd control effects, such as  knockups,  knockbacks and  pulls, will cancel the jump and then complete their effects as normal.
W.blurb: Tristana fires at the ground to propel her to a distant location, dealing damage and slowing surrounding units for a brief period where she lands.

E.name: Explosive Charge

effects.description: Passive: Enemies explode when killed by Tristana's basic attacks, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies.

Active: Tristana places an explosive charge on the target enemy or enemy turret. After 4 seconds the charge explodes, dealing  physical damage to nearby enemies. The explosion radius is increased when used on a  turret.

Tristana's basic attacks and abilities against the target increase Explosive Charge's damage by 30%, stacking up to 4 times for a maximum 120% increase, upon which the charge also detonates instantly.

E.notes:
Explosive Charge's cast time is reduced with  attack speed.
 Tristana will automatically be ordered to attack the target of Explosive Charge.
E.blurb: When Tristana kills a unit, her cannonballs burst into shrapnel, dealing damage to surrounding enemies. Can be activated to place a bomb on a target enemy that explodes after a short duration dealing damage to surrounding units.

R.name: Buster Shot

effects.description: Active: Tristana fires a massive cannonball at the target enemy, dealing magic damage and  knocking back the target and all enemies around them.

R.notes:
Applies  spell damage to the primary target and deals  area damage to secondary targets.
 Tristana will automatically be ordered to attack the target of Buster Shot.
R.blurb: Tristana loads a massive cannonball into her weapon and fires it at an enemy unit. This deals Magic Damage and knocks the target back. If the target is carrying the Explosive Charge bomb, the bomb detonation radius is doubled.

I.name: King's Tribute

effects.description: Innate: Whenever an enemy dies near Trundle, he  heals for  2 / 3 / 4 / 5 / 6% (based on level) of their maximum health.

I.notes:
Neutral monster deaths will trigger King's Tribute, even if their killer was an enemy.
 King's Tribute does not trigger when an enemy structure is destroyed.
I.blurb: When an enemy unit dies near Trundle, he  heals for a percent of its maximum Health.

Q.name: Chomp

effects.description: Active: Trundle's next basic attack deals  bonus physical damage and  slows his target by 75% for 0.1 seconds.
After biting his target, Trundle gains bonus attack damage for 5 seconds and reduces his target's attack damage by half that amount for the same duration.
Chomp resets Trundle's autoattack timer.

Q.notes:
The triggering attack will apply other  on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal.
 As with most on-hit physical damage, the bonus damage from Chomp will apply  life steal.
  Critical strikes will not interact with the bonus damage from Chomp.
 The bonus damage will affect  turrets.
 Chomp will still incur the attack damage increase for Trundle if the attack is  dodged,  blocked or  missed.
Q.blurb: Trundle bites his opponent, dealing damage, briefly slowing and sapping some of their Attack Damage.

W.name: Frozen Domain

effects.description: Active: Trundle coats the target area in ice for 8 seconds. While inside, he gains  bonus attack speed,  bonus movement speed, and 25% increased health restoration from all sources.

W.notes: Frozen Domain has no cast time and does not interrupt Trundle's previous orders.
W.blurb: Trundle turns target location into his domain, gaining Attack Speed, Movement Speed, and increased healing from all sources while on it.

E.name: Pillar of Ice

effects.description: Active: Trundle projects a pillar of ice at the target location for 6 seconds,  knocking back everyone directly over it 225 units on cast, acting as impassable terrain for the duration and  slowing enemies around it.

E.notes:
Pillar of Ice can knock back allied units.
 Allied  channels (e.g.  Recall,  Teleport) will be  interrupted.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Allies can be targeted by  Last Breath.

 Pillar of Ice cannot be placed inside impassable terrain. Attempting to do so will cause the pillar to spawn in the nearest available spot of accessible terrain, similar to  wards and traps such as  Caitlyn's  Yordle Snap Trap.
 Pillar Of Ice triggers in-combat effects such as drawing turret aggro, applying  Elixir of Sorcery and  Sudden Impact.
E.blurb: Trundle creates an ice pillar at target location, becoming impassable terrain and slowing all nearby enemy units.

R.name: Subjugate

effects.description: Active: After 0.5 seconds, Trundle starts draining the life force out of the target enemy champion,  healing for a percentage of the target's maximum health, dealing the same amount as  magic damage and stealing  40% of their armor and  magic resistance. Half of the total damage and stealing is applied instantly, and the other half is applied over the next 4 seconds.
The armor and magic resist will remain stolen for 4 seconds after the drain has ended.

R.notes:
Applies  spell damage on initial cast and deals  persistent damage afterwards.
 The total value of armor, magic resist and damage that will be dealt is determined at the point of cast.
