Temporary boosts/reductions in resistances or health (e.g,  Wild Growth,  Aftershock,  Black Cleaver) will affect those values if they are active before cast, but will not affect those values if they come into effect afterwards.
R.blurb: Trundle immediately steals a percent of his target's Health, Armor and Magic Resistance. Over the next 4 seconds the amount of Health, Armor, and Magic Resistance stolen is doubled.

I.name: Battle Fury

effects.description: Fury: Tryndamere gains  5 Fury each time he lands a basic attack, and 10 Fury on  critical strikes and each time he kills an enemy. After not dealing or receiving damage for 8 seconds, Tryndamere loses 5 Fury per second.
Battle Fury: Tryndamere gains 0.35% − 0.5% (based on level) critical strike chance per point of Fury, up to a maximum of 35% − 50% (based on level) critical strike chance.

I.notes: Attacks against structures will not grant bonus Fury, but will still reset the timer on Fury decay.
I.blurb: Tryndamere gains Fury for each attack, critical strike, and killing blow he makes. Fury passively increases his Critical Strike Chance and can be consumed with his Bloodlust spell.

Q.name: Bloodlust

effects.description: Passive: Tryndamere permanently has bonus attack damage, and gains additional bonus attack damage per  1% of his missing health.
Active: Tryndamere consumes all of his  Fury and heals himself, increased for every point of Fury consumed.

Q.notes: Bloodlust has no cast time and does not interrupt Tryndamere's previous orders.
Q.blurb: Tryndamere thrives on the thrills of combat, increasing his Attack Damage as he is more and more wounded. He can cast Bloodlust to consume his Fury and heal himself.

W.name: Mocking Shout

effects.description: Active: Tryndamere reduces the attack damage of all nearby enemies for 4 seconds.
Targets who have their backs turned to him are also  slowed for the duration.

W.notes:
Mocking Shout cannot be activated unless an enemy is within range of Tryndamere.
 This can be utilized to scout for nearby enemy champions that are not  visible because of Tall Grass or the Fog of War, and provide pseudo stealth detection of enemy champions.

Mocking Shout will provide the enemy with a moment of  sight of Tryndamere if he uses it in the Fog of War.
W.blurb: Tryndamere lets out an insulting cry, decreasing surrounding champions' Attack Damage. Enemies with their backs turned to Tryndamere also have their Movement Speed reduced.

E.name: Spinning Slash

effects.description: Active: Tryndamere  dashes to a target location, dealing  physical damage to enemies in his path and gaining  2 Fury per enemy hit.
Spinning Slash's  cooldown is reduced by 1 second whenever Tryndamere  critically strikes, increased to 2 seconds against enemy champions.

E.notes: The  cooldown reduction on crit is doubled with a phantom hit from  Guinsoo's Rageblade.
E.blurb: Tryndamere slices toward a target unit, dealing damage to enemies in his path.

R.name: Undying Rage

effects.description: Active: Tryndamere instantly gains  Fury and becomes immune to death for 5 seconds, during which his health cannot fall below a certain amount.
Undying Rage can be used even when affected by crowd control.

R.notes:
Undying Rage has no cast time and does not interrupt Tryndamere's previous orders.
 Drain-type effects such as life steal and spell vamp are applied before the damage reduction of Undying Rage takes place. As such, these attacks will heal as if the full damage was dealt, despite being unable to bring Tryndamere below 30 / 50 / 70 (based on Undying Rage level) health.
 Undying Rage will negate  raw damage but not the damage from  Nexus Obelisk.
R.blurb: Tryndamere's lust for battle becomes so strong that he is unable to die, no matter how wounded he becomes.

I.name: Loaded Dice

effects.description: Innate: Twisted Fate rolls his dice every time he kills an enemy, randomly gaining 1 − 6 (based on probability).

I.notes: Total average of gold gained is  4.
I.blurb: Upon killing a unit, Twisted Fate rolls his 'lucky' dice receiving anywhere between 1 and 6 bonus gold.

Q.name: Wild Cards

effects.description: Active: Twisted Fate throws three cards in a cone, dealing  magic damage to all enemies they pass through.
Enemies can only be damaged once by Wild Cards.

Q.notes: No additional details.
Q.blurb: Twisted Fate throws three cards, dealing damage to each enemy unit they pass through.

W.name: Pick a Card

effects.description: First Cast - Pick a Card: Twisted Fate cycles through  three cards for 6 seconds. Choosing one by reactivating Pick a Card converts Twisted Fate's next basic attack within 6 seconds to instead deal magic damage and a bonus effect based on the card selected. The basic attack applies on-hit and spell effects but cannot  critical strike.
Second Cast -  Blue Card: Restores  mana.
Second Cast -  Red Card: Deals magic damage around the target and  slows all enemies hit for 2.5 seconds.
Second Cast -  Gold Card:  Stuns the target.
The card may be chosen while  crowd controlled.

W.notes:
Pick a Card will stack and can trigger  Stacked Deck.
 The first card shown is random but the order always remains the same ( Blue Card,  Red Card,  Gold Card, repeat).
W.blurb: Twisted Fate chooses a magic card from his deck, and uses that for his next attack, causing bonus effects.

W.name: Pick a Card

effects.description: First Cast - Pick a Card: Twisted Fate cycles through  three cards for 6 seconds. Choosing one by reactivating Pick a Card converts Twisted Fate's next basic attack within 6 seconds to instead deal magic damage and a bonus effect based on the card selected. The basic attack applies on-hit and spell effects but cannot  critical strike.
Second Cast -  Blue Card: Restores  mana.
Second Cast -  Red Card: Deals magic damage around the target and  slows all enemies hit for 2.5 seconds.
Second Cast -  Gold Card:  Stuns the target.
The card may be chosen while  crowd controlled.

W.notes:
Pick a Card will stack and can trigger  Stacked Deck.
 The first card shown is random but the order always remains the same ( Blue Card,  Red Card,  Gold Card, repeat).
W.blurb: Twisted Fate chooses a magic card from his deck, and uses that for his next attack, causing bonus effects.

W.name: Pick a Card

effects.description: First Cast - Pick a Card: Twisted Fate cycles through  three cards for 6 seconds. Choosing one by reactivating Pick a Card converts Twisted Fate's next basic attack within 6 seconds to instead deal magic damage and a bonus effect based on the card selected. The basic attack applies on-hit and spell effects but cannot  critical strike.
Second Cast -  Blue Card: Restores  mana.
Second Cast -  Red Card: Deals magic damage around the target and  slows all enemies hit for 2.5 seconds.
Second Cast -  Gold Card:  Stuns the target.
The card may be chosen while  crowd controlled.

W.notes:
Pick a Card will stack and can trigger  Stacked Deck.
 The first card shown is random but the order always remains the same ( Blue Card,  Red Card,  Gold Card, repeat).
W.blurb: Twisted Fate chooses a magic card from his deck, and uses that for his next attack, causing bonus effects.

W.name: Pick a Card

effects.description: First Cast - Pick a Card: Twisted Fate cycles through  three cards for 6 seconds. Choosing one by reactivating Pick a Card converts Twisted Fate's next basic attack within 6 seconds to instead deal magic damage and a bonus effect based on the card selected. The basic attack applies on-hit and spell effects but cannot  critical strike.
Second Cast -  Blue Card: Restores  mana.
Second Cast -  Red Card: Deals magic damage around the target and  slows all enemies hit for 2.5 seconds.
Second Cast -  Gold Card:  Stuns the target.
The card may be chosen while  crowd controlled.

W.notes:
Pick a Card will stack and can trigger  Stacked Deck.
 The first card shown is random but the order always remains the same ( Blue Card,  Red Card,  Gold Card, repeat).
W.blurb: Twisted Fate chooses a magic card from his deck, and uses that for his next attack, causing bonus effects.

E.name: Stacked Deck

effects.description: Passive: Twisted Fate gains  bonus attack speed.
Passive: Twisted Fate gains a Stacked Deck stack for every basic attack on-hit, up to a maximum of three.
At 3 stacks, his next basic attack against  non-structures consumes the stacks on-attack to deal bonus magic damage.

E.notes: Stacked Deck can be  dodged or negated if Twisted Fate is  blinded (the enhanced attack is not consumed in either case) but can only be mitigated if  blocked (the enhanced attack is consumed but the bonus damage is still applied).
E.blurb: Every 4 attacks, Twisted Fate deals bonus damage. In addition, his Attack Speed is increased.

R.name: Destiny

effects.description: First Cast - Destiny: Twisted Fate and his allies gain  true sight of all  enemy champions for a few seconds. After a 0.5 second delay, Twisted Fate can use  Gate once for the duration.
Second Cast - Gate: Twisted Fate channels for 1.5 seconds,  blinking to the target location upon completion.

R.notes:
Destiny will reveal  wards and  stealthed traps if they are within  sight range of a revealed enemy champion.
 Gate will be interrupted if Twisted Fate enters  stasis ( Zhonya's Hourglass,  Tempered Fate) while channeling.
  Paranoia will prevent Destiny's  true sight regardless of which one was cast first (enemy champions can still be revealed by Destiny after Paranoia ends if durations permit).
 Gate will destroy any  unit-targeted  projectiles attacking Twisted Fate when the channel ends.
R.blurb: Twisted Fate predicts the fortunes of his foes, revealing all enemy champions and enabling the use of Gate, which teleports Twisted Fate to any target location in 1.5 seconds.

R.name: Destiny

effects.description: First Cast - Destiny: Twisted Fate and his allies gain  true sight of all  enemy champions for a few seconds. After a 0.5 second delay, Twisted Fate can use  Gate once for the duration.
Second Cast - Gate: Twisted Fate channels for 1.5 seconds,  blinking to the target location upon completion.

R.notes:
Destiny will reveal  wards and  stealthed traps if they are within  sight range of a revealed enemy champion.
 Gate will be interrupted if Twisted Fate enters  stasis ( Zhonya's Hourglass,  Tempered Fate) while channeling.
  Paranoia will prevent Destiny's  true sight regardless of which one was cast first (enemy champions can still be revealed by Destiny after Paranoia ends if durations permit).
 Gate will destroy any  unit-targeted  projectiles attacking Twisted Fate when the channel ends.
R.blurb: Twisted Fate predicts the fortunes of his foes, revealing all enemy champions and enabling the use of Gate, which teleports Twisted Fate to any target location in 1.5 seconds.

I.name: Deadly Venom

effects.description: Innate: Twitch's basic attacks  poison his target with Deadly Venom, each attack adding one stack on-hit.

Each Deadly Venom stack deals 1 / 2 / 3 / 4 / 5 (based on level)  true damage per second over 6 seconds, stacking up to 6 times for a maximum 6 / 12 / 18 / 24 / 30 (based on level)  true damage per second.
Each application of Deadly Venom resets the duration.

I.notes:
The enhanced attacks will apply other  on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal (the bonus damage cannot).
 Deadly Venom does not affect  structures.
 Deadly Venom's application via basic attack cannot be  parried or  blocked but can be  dodged or negated if Twitch is  blinded.
 Deadly Venom interacts with  Twin Fang (thus granting  Cassiopeia its bonus effects).
I.blurb: Twitch's basic attacks infect the target, dealing true damage each second.

Q.name: Ambush

effects.description: Active: After a 1 second delay, Twitch becomes  camouflaged for a duration. Entering stealth cancels Twitch's current basic attack. Basic attacks and abilities break the stealth on-cast.
While stealthed he gains  10% bonus movement speed, increased to 30% when he moves toward enemy champions within a 1000-range radius who cannot see him.
Upon breaking stealth he gains  bonus attack speed for 5 seconds.
Ambush's  cooldown is reset if an enemy champion dies while affected by  Deadly Venom.

Q.notes:
Ambush has no cast time and does not interrupt Twitch's previous orders.
 Twitch will not break stealth if he uses consumable items.
 Twitch will break stealth if he uses  Recall or  Teleport while Ambush is active or if he uses active ability items ( Blade of the Ruined King). Twitch can perform actions as normal during the 1 second delay. Activating recall during the delay will allow Twitch to recall while camouflaged.
Q.blurb: Twitch becomes Camouflaged for a short duration and gains Movement Speed. When leaving Camouflage, Twitch gains Attack Speed for a short duration. When an enemy champion with Deadly Venom dies, Ambush's cooldown is reset.

Q.name: Ambush

effects.description: Active: After a 1 second delay, Twitch becomes  camouflaged for a duration. Entering stealth cancels Twitch's current basic attack. Basic attacks and abilities break the stealth on-cast.
While stealthed he gains  10% bonus movement speed, increased to 30% when he moves toward enemy champions within a 1000-range radius who cannot see him.
Upon breaking stealth he gains  bonus attack speed for 5 seconds.
Ambush's  cooldown is reset if an enemy champion dies while affected by  Deadly Venom.

Q.notes:
Ambush has no cast time and does not interrupt Twitch's previous orders.
 Twitch will not break stealth if he uses consumable items.
 Twitch will break stealth if he uses  Recall or  Teleport while Ambush is active or if he uses active ability items ( Blade of the Ruined King). Twitch can perform actions as normal during the 1 second delay. Activating recall during the delay will allow Twitch to recall while camouflaged.
Q.blurb: Twitch becomes Camouflaged for a short duration and gains Movement Speed. When leaving Camouflage, Twitch gains Attack Speed for a short duration. When an enemy champion with Deadly Venom dies, Ambush's cooldown is reset.

Q.name: Ambush

effects.description: Active: After a 1 second delay, Twitch becomes  camouflaged for a duration. Entering stealth cancels Twitch's current basic attack. Basic attacks and abilities break the stealth on-cast.
While stealthed he gains  10% bonus movement speed, increased to 30% when he moves toward enemy champions within a 1000-range radius who cannot see him.
Upon breaking stealth he gains  bonus attack speed for 5 seconds.
Ambush's  cooldown is reset if an enemy champion dies while affected by  Deadly Venom.

Q.notes:
Ambush has no cast time and does not interrupt Twitch's previous orders.
 Twitch will not break stealth if he uses consumable items.
 Twitch will break stealth if he uses  Recall or  Teleport while Ambush is active or if he uses active ability items ( Blade of the Ruined King). Twitch can perform actions as normal during the 1 second delay. Activating recall during the delay will allow Twitch to recall while camouflaged.
Q.blurb: Twitch becomes Camouflaged for a short duration and gains Movement Speed. When leaving Camouflage, Twitch gains Attack Speed for a short duration. When an enemy champion with Deadly Venom dies, Ambush's cooldown is reset.

W.name: Venom Cask

effects.description: Active: Twitch hurls a cask of venom at the target area, infecting all enemies hit with a  Deadly Venom stack.
The target area becomes contaminated for 3 seconds, applying a  Deadly Venom stack each second and  slowing all enemies inside it.

W.notes:
Venom Cask can apply a maximum of 4  Deadly Venom stacks per enemy.
  Spell shield will only block the  slow.
W.blurb: Twitch hurls a cask of venom that explodes in an area, slowing targets and applying deadly venom to the target.

E.name: Contaminate

effects.description: Active: Twitch deals  physical damage to all nearby enemies afflicted by  Deadly Venom, with each stack granting bonus damage.

E.notes:
Twitch is given a range indicator for Contaminate's radius upon infecting an enemy champion with  Deadly Venom (actual range is slightly larger than shown in-game).
 Contaminate will not damage enemy targets whose  Deadly Venom stacks wear off or if they move out of Contaminate's range before Twitch can cast.
E.blurb: Twitch wreaks further havoc on poisoned enemies with a blast of his vile diseases.

R.name: Spray and Pray

effects.description: Active: Twitch gains bonus attack damage and his basic attacks gain  300 bonus range for 5 seconds.

Additionally, Twitch's basic attacks travel across their full range and skewer every enemy they pass through for the duration, dealing 100% − 40% (based on enemy hit) damage. These attacks apply  on-hit effects to all affected enemies and can  critically strike against each individual target.

R.notes:
Spray and Pray has no cast time and does not interrupt Twitch's previous orders.
 Spray and Pray allows Twitch to outrange  turrets by 50 units, allowing him to hit them without them returning fire. This is intended.
 Twitch's enhanced attacks will pass through terrain and enemy structures (the latter will be damaged even if they are not directly targeted while Spray and Pray is active).
  Runaan's Hurricane's Wind's Fury interacts with Spray and Pray's bonus attack range but not with the enhanced attacks (the secondary bolts will not have peas-through effects).
R.blurb: Twitch unleashes the full power of his crossbow, shooting bolts over a great distance that pierce all enemies caught in their path.

I.name: Monkey's Agility

effects.description: Innate: Udyr gains  5 bonus movement speed and  10% bonus attack speed for 5 seconds every time he uses an ability, stacking up to 3 times, up to a maximum of  15 bonus movement speed and  30% bonus attack speed.

Four Stances: Udyr has no ultimate ability and instead has 4 basic abilities. Each of his abilities provides a passive effect that lasts until he activates a different ability, called his current Stance. Activating any of his abilities will prevent his previous Stance from triggering any more on-hit effects, and will prevent him from activating another ability for 2 seconds.
Starting at level 16, all abilities can gain a 6th rank.

I.notes:
Further stance activations at maximum stacks of Monkey's Agility will refresh the timer.
 Despite having 4 abilities each with 6 ranks, Udyr is not able to level beyond the usual limit under normal circumstances - meaning he must choose how to allocate his points and will not be able to reach maximum rank on each of his abilities, except in the featured game mode,  Ultra Rapid Fire.
I.blurb: Entering a stance grants Udyr bonus Attack Speed and Movement Speed for a short duration. This effect can stack multiple times.

Q.name: Tiger Stance

effects.description: Stance: Udyr's basic attacks generate Tiger stacks on-hit, up to 3. At 3 stacks, Udyr's next basic attack is a Tiger Strike, which deals  bonus physical damage over 2 seconds as well as instantly dealing any remaining damage from any previous Tiger Strikes.
Active - Tiger Speed: Udyr gains  bonus attack speed for 5 seconds, and instantly generates 3 Tiger stacks.

Q.notes:
The  DoT deals  persistent damage and applies  ability damage effects.
 The triggering attack will generate the first stack toward the next, meaning the effect will always trigger on every 3rd attack.  Guinsoo's Rageblade will reduce this number to every 2nd attack, with Udyr's attack animations coded to "look ahead" and trigger the empowered-attack animation if he attacks a target while at 1 stack while Guinsoo's Rage is active. 
 Tiger Stance's primed  damage over time does not persist through stance changes.
 The triggering attacks will apply other on-hit effects and can critically strike as normal.
 Unlike most on-hit physical damage, the bonus damage from Tiger Stance will not apply  life steal.
 Critical strikes do not interact with the bonus damage from Tiger Stance.
 The on-hit application of the DoT cannot be  dodged nor  blocked.
 If it  misses, neither the DoT nor the active damage will be applied, and it will consume the empowered attack of the active.
Q.blurb: Tiger Stance: Activation - Udyr's Attack Speed is increased for a few seconds. Persistent Effect - Udyr's first attack and every third attack after will deal a high amount of damage over 2 seconds.

W.name: Turtle Stance

effects.description: Stance: Udyr's basic attacks generate Turtle stacks on-hit, up to 3. At 3 stacks, Udyr's next basic attack  heals him for  2.5% − 5% (based on missing health) of his maximum health.
Active - Spiritual Shell: Udyr  shields himself for up to 5 seconds, and instantly generates 3 Turtle stacks.

W.notes: The triggering attack will generate the first stack toward the next, meaning the effect will always trigger on every 3rd attack.  Guinsoo's Rageblade will reduce this number to every 2nd attack, with Udyr's attack animations coded to "look ahead" and trigger the empowered-attack animation if he attacks a target while at 1 stack while Guinsoo's Rage is active.
W.blurb: Turtle Stance: Activation - Udyr gains a temporary shield that absorbs damage. Persistent Effect - Udyr's first attack and every third attack after heals him for 2.5% of his maximum health.

E.name: Bear Stance

effects.description: Stance: Udyr's basic attacks  stun his target for 1 second. This effect cannot occur on the same target more than once every few seconds.
Active - Primal Charge: Udyr gains  bonus movement speed and is  ghosted for the next few seconds. Additionally, his next basic attack gains  50 bonus range and causes him to  lunge to his target.

E.notes:
Bear Stance's self-displacement does not count as a  dash for the purposes of  Sudden Impact.
 The triggering attack will apply other  on-hit effects and can critically strike as normal.
  Spell shield will consume the attack, meaning the on-target stun immunity is also incurred in the process.
E.blurb: Bear Stance: Activation - Udyr increases Movement Speed for a short duration. Persistent Effect - Udyr's basic attacks stun his target for 1 second. This effect cannot occur on the same target for several seconds.

R.name: Phoenix Stance

effects.description: Stance: Udyr's basic attacks generate Phoenix stacks on-hit, up to 3. At 3 stacks, Udyr's next basic attack unleashes fire in a cone in front of him that deals  magic damage to all enemies hit.

Active - Phoenix Flame: Udyr unleashes pulsing waves of fire around himself for 4 seconds, dealing magic damage each second to all nearby enemies for the duration, as well as instantly generating 3 Phoenix stacks.

R.notes: The triggering attack will generate the first stack toward the next, meaning the effect will always trigger on every 3rd attack.  Guinsoo's Rageblade will reduce this number to every 2nd attack, with Udyr's attack animations coded to "look ahead" and trigger the empowered-attack animation if he attacks a target while at 1 stack while Guinsoo's Rage is active.
R.blurb: Phoenix Stance: Activation - Udyr unleashes pulsing waves of fire, dealing damage to nearby enemies. Persistent Effect - Udyr's first attack and every third attack after engulfs enemies in front of him with flames.

I.name: Echoing Flames

effects.description: Innate: Urgot's six legs each conceal a shotgun that covers an arc, together forming a full circle of cover around him. Each shotgun has one shell and an individual reload timer.

The next basic attack  on-hit in the direction and range of a loaded shotgun causes it to fire, instantly dealing 40% − 100% (based on level) AD (+ 2% − 6% (based on level) of target's maximum health) physical damage to enemies in a cone, up to 60 − 360 (based on level) against  monsters.

I.notes:
Echoing Flames:
 Will not trigger while  blinded or if the basic attack is blocked by  Yasuo's  Wind Wall.
 It bypasses  blocking and  dodging effects.

 Will not trigger versus  wards.
 Will trigger from  Runaan's Hurricane's additional bolts.
 Will not apply  life steal, but does apply on  spell vamp at 33% effectiveness.
 Will apply spell effects.
 When basic attacking certain units (e.g  Shaco's  Jack in the Box), Echoing Flames does not trigger, however it will trigger when attacking them with  Purge.

 Urgot's legs never change in orientation, with his body instead rotating on top of them - i.e. the leg that faces north will always face north. This does not affect Urgot's facing direction for the purposes of abilities such as  Petrifying Gaze.
I.blurb: Urgot's basic attacks and Purge periodically trigger blasts of flame from his legs, dealing physical damage.

Q.name: Corrosive Charge

effects.description: Active: Urgot launches a canister at the target location that explodes after 0.6 seconds, dealing physical damage and  slowing all enemies hit for 1 second.

Q.notes: No additional details.
Q.blurb: Fires an explosive charge at the target location, dealing physical damage and slowing enemies caught in the explosion.

W.name: Purge

effects.description: Passive: Urgot's other abilities apply Purge to enemy champions for 5 seconds. Only one enemy champion can be marked at a time.

Active: For 4 seconds, Urgot is  ghosted, gains 40%  slow resist and autonomously basic attacks the nearest enemy at  3.0 attack speed, prioritizing  marked with Purge, refreshing the mark with every attack. Urgot can keep attacking without  interrupting his movement, but while firing his base movement speed is reduced by 125.
Attacks deal modified damage, down to a minimum of 50 damage against  minions, with only 50%  on-hit damage and cannot  critically strike.
After 0.5 seconds, Urgot can reactivate Purge to end all effects.
At maximum rank, Purge lasts indefinitely and becomes a toggled ability.

W.notes:
Purge can be cast during other abilities.
 At maximum rank, Purge still has a static cooldown of 0.5 seconds between 2 activation, even though the cooldown is marked at 0 seconds.
 Before maximum rank, if continuously attacking without interrupting or canceling the cast, Urgot will shoot 13 attacks.
 The bolts are considered basic attacks and thus apply  life steal at full efficiency.
 Urgot's attack commands during Purge instead issue movement commands.
 The reduction in base movement speed by Purge is not affected by slow resistance.
 Percentage  slows apply after the flat movement reduction.
 Urgot will not attack while  disarmed or during the cast time of his other abilities.
 The duration of Purge is extended briefly to compensate for the animation time.

 Purge will apply  Runaan's Hurricane on every shot at 100% of the listed damage.
 However, on-hit effects applied by the bolts are reduced to 50% damage.

 PENDING FOR TEST: Purge's  interactions with  projectile-intercepting effects.
W.blurb: Urgot shields himself, slowing himself while he unloads his weapon on nearby enemies. Prioritizes enemy champions Urgot has recently struck with other abilities and triggers Echoing Flames.

E.name: Disdain

effects.description: Active: Urgot  shields himself for 4 seconds.
After 0.25 seconds, Urgot  dashes in the target direction, though not through terrain, dealing physical damage to all enemies in the way and  knocking them aside.
Urgot comes to a stop upon colliding with an enemy champion,  flinging them over himself and  stunning them for 0.75 seconds after they land.

E.notes: No additional details.
E.blurb: Urgot charges in a direction, trampling non-champion enemies. If he catches an enemy champion, he will stop and hurl them out of his way.

R.name: Fear Beyond Death

effects.description: First Cast: After a 0.5-second delay, Urgot fires a chem-drill forward that impales the first enemy champion struck, dealing physical damage, leashing them for 4 seconds and  slowing them by 0% − 75% (based on target's missing health).
If the target is below  25% of their maximum health, Fear Beyond Death can be re-activated, and automatically does so after 4 seconds if the target is within the threshold.

Second Cast: Urgot begins  channeling as he launches chains at the target,  suppressing them and pushing them up to 1000 units away, after which they're reeled in over 1.5 seconds, during which they are  untargetable.
If the channel is successful, the target is executed and surrounding enemies are  feared for 1.5 seconds,  slowing them by 75%.

R.notes:
Applies  spell damage on first cast and  raw damage on second cast.
 Urgot can move while  channeling and while executing his target.
 Reactivating the ability early will reel the target as soon as they reach the 25% maximum health threshold.
 The ability will reactivate and execute regardless of Urgot being crowd controlled or not, including self or enemy-imposed  stasis.

 The second cast's chains are classified as a  projectile and can be stopped if:
 Urgot dies.
 The target becomes  untargetable.
 The target is CC-immune.

  Spell shields will not block the chains.
  Unstoppability, while preventing being dragged, does not remove the  suppression, which can last for longer than the usual execution time. Once the target inevitably loses their unstoppability, they are executed within 1.5 seconds. The target is untargetable for the whole duration of the suppression, even while unstoppable.
 When the chains start reeling in and suppressing a player's champion, chains will also cover the sides of their screen.
 The target will die regardless of their current health once the second cast's chains hit, even if they are  healed.
 If the target has  invulnerability that persists the duration of the channel, it will protect them from the execution.
  Undying Rage can be activated during the suppression and does not execute  Tryndamere.
 The effect will also not prevent the activation of revival effects, such as  Guardian Angel or  Anivia's  Rebirth.
 Despite being untargetable,  Kalista can still  pull her Oathsworn out of the chains.
 Death-triggered passives ( Karthus'  Death Defied,  Kog'Maw's  Icathian Surprise, and  Sion's  Glory in Death) will be triggered.
 Only the target's current health will count as Urgot's damage in post-game statistics and  spell vamp healing.
R.blurb: Urgot fires a chem-drill that impales the first enemy champion hit. If that champion falls below a health threshold, Urgot judges them weak and can execute them.

I.name: Living Vengeance

effects.description: Innate: Varus gains 40% (+ 30% bonus attack speed)  bonus attack speed for 5 seconds upon an enemy champion  takedown, and 20% (+ 15% bonus attack speed) bonus attack speed on non-champion kills.

I.notes: No additional details.
I.blurb: On kill or assist, Varus temporarily gains Attack Speed. This bonus is larger if the enemy is a champion.

Q.name: Piercing Arrow

effects.description: First Cast: Varus  charges for up to 4 seconds to gradually increase Piercing Arrow's  range and damage over the next 2 seconds, during which he is  pacified and  slowed by 20%.
Piercing Arrow is canceled when the charge ends, refunding  half of the mana cost.

Second Cast: Varus fires a piercing arrow dealing  physical damage to all enemies struck, which is increased by 0% − 50% (based on Channel time). The arrow's damage is reduced to 100% − 33% (based on enemy hit).
Detonating  Blight stacks on an enemy champion reduces Piercing Arrow's  cooldown by 3 seconds.

Q.notes:
Despite being  pacified, Varus can still  Flash (and cast all other summoner spells except  Teleport) during Piercing Arrow's channel.
 The range of the spell will always be displayed, even as it increases.
 Using  Recall while charging Piercing Arrow will also cancel the cast.
 The self  slow is reduced by  slow resist.
Q.blurb: Varus readies and then fires a powerful shot that gains extra range and damage the longer he spends preparing to fire.

W.name: Blighted Quiver

effects.description: Passive: Varus' basic attacks deal  bonus magic damage and apply Blight for 6 seconds, stacking up to 3 times.
Varus' other abilities detonate Blight on enemies upon damaging them, dealing magic damage for each stack. This damage is capped at 360 against monsters.

Active: Varus' next  Piercing Arrow deals 6% − 14% (based on level) of the target's missing health bonus magic damage, increased by 0% − 50% (based on Piercing Arrow channel time), for a maximum of 9% − 21% (based on level) of the target's missing health. This damage is capped at 360 against monsters.

Blighted Quiver can be cast during the first 0.25 seconds of  Piercing Arrow. If the arrow is not fired within 5 seconds, Blighted Quiver is placed on a 1 second cooldown, or on full cooldown if the charge is canceled.

W.notes:
Spell shield will not block the  on-hit damage but will block the consuming damage if the target is hit by his abilities.
 Blighted Quiver's active damage is dealt after the damage of  Piercing Arrow.
W.blurb: Varus' basic attacks deal bonus magic damage and apply Blight. Varus' other abilities detonate Blight, dealing magic damage based on the target's maximum Health.

E.name: Hail of Arrows

effects.description: Active: Varus fires a hail of arrows that deals physical damage on impact to all enemies in the target area.
The area is desecrated for 4 seconds,  slowing all enemies within and applying  Grievous Wounds.

E.notes: Slows will linger for 0.25 seconds after leaving the marked area.
E.blurb: Varus fires a hail of arrows that deal physical damage and desecrate the ground. Desecrated ground slows enemies' Movement Speed and reduces their self healing and regeneration.

R.name: Chain of Corruption

effects.description: Active: Varus flings out a tendril of corruption that infects the first enemy champion hit, dealing magic damage and  rooting them for 2 seconds while inflicting them with full stacks of  Blight over 1.5 seconds.

On impact, the tendril seeks out nearby enemy champions for 2 seconds, after which they are also infected. Tendrils will continue to spread until there are no champions in range that have not already been affected.
Chain of Corruption will attempt to spread even if the first target dies or becomes free of the snare.

R.notes:
Enemy champions can be targeted again by the corruption if they were not affected the previous time, even if they were targeted and got out of range.
 Consuming the  Blight's stacks applied by Chain of Corruption will deal bonus magic damage based on  Blighted Quiver's rank. If  Blighted Quiver hasn't been ranked yet, the three  Blight's stacks will still be applied but they will be considered to be at rank 0, dealing 1.25% (+ 2% per 100 AP) of the target's maximum health per stack.
R.blurb: Varus flings out a damaging tendril of corruption that immobilizes the first enemy champion hit and then spreads towards nearby uninfected champions, immobilizing them too on contact.

I.name: Night Hunter

effects.description: Innate: Vayne gains  30 bonus movement speed when moving towards a nearby  visible enemy champion.
Final Hour: Night Hunter's bonus movement speed is tripled to 90.

I.notes:
The movement speed buff is not lost if Vayne stops moving when near an enemy champion.
 Night Hunter's bonus movement speed persists for 2 seconds after Vayne loses  sight of an enemy champion.
 Night Hunter interacts with movement speed modifiers.
I.blurb: Vayne ruthlessly hunts evil-doers, gaining 30 movement speed when moving toward nearby enemy champions.

Q.name: Tumble

effects.description: Active: Vayne  dashes forward, though not through terrain, and her next basic attack within 7 seconds deals  bonus physical damage.
Tumble resets Vayne's basic attack timer.

Q.notes:
The enhanced attack applies  on-hit effects,  life steal, affects  turrets and can  critically strike as normal. The bonus damage however cannot.
 Although Tumble will reset the basic attack timer, Vayne cannot attack until the animation is complete.
Q.blurb: Vayne tumbles, maneuvering to carefully place her next shot. Her next attack critically strikes.

W.name: Silver Bolts

effects.description: Passive: Vayne's basic attacks and  Condemn apply a Silver Bolts stack for 3.5 seconds, up to 3 times. Attacking a new enemy removes all stacks from the previous target.
The third stack consumes them all to deal  bonus true damage, with a minimum threshold, and capped at 200 against  monsters.

W.notes:
Stacks are not removed if Vayne switches to attacking a target immune to Silver Bolts ( structures,  wards).
 Silver Bolts do not apply to additional targets with  Runaan's Hurricane.
 The third attack consumes all stacks even if the target is  untargetable.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Silver Bolts'  interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects via basic attack.
W.blurb: Vayne tips her bolts with a rare metal, toxic to evil things. The third consecutive attack or ability against the same target deals a percentage of the target's maximum Health as bonus true damage. (Max: 200 damage vs. Monsters)

E.name: Condemn

effects.description: Active: Vayne fires a heavy bolt at the target unit, dealing physical damage,  knocking them back 475 units, and applying a  Silver Bolts stack.
If the target collides with terrain, they take bonus physical damage and are  stunned for 1.5 seconds.

E.notes:
Condemn uses  edge range (same as Vayne's basic attacks).
 Condemn's  displacement direction is determined when the  projectile hits (will follow the line both Vayne and her target draw at that specific moment).
 Condemn's  stun duration starts when Vayne's target collides with a wall (they can be  immobilized for up to 2 seconds depending on  displacement duration based on distance traveled).
 Possible Bug: Condemn will not always  interrupt enemy  suppression on Vayne's allies (sometimes they remain affected even if the enemy champion responsible is displaced as far as outside ability range).
 Condemn interacts with artificial terrain ( Crystallize,  Emperor's Divide,  Jarvan IV's  Cataclysm,  Pillar of Ice).
E.blurb: Vayne draws a heavy crossbow from her back, and fires a huge bolt at her target, knocking them back and dealing damage. If they collide with terrain, they are impaled, dealing bonus damage and stunning them.

R.name: Final Hour

effects.description: Active: For a duration, Vayne gains bonus attack damage and triples  Night Hunter's bonus.
Additionally,  Tumble gains  cooldown reduction, and casting it grants  invisibility for 1 second.
While active, whenever an enemy  champion damaged by Vayne dies within 3 seconds, Final Hour's duration is extended by 4 seconds, up to a maximum of the original duration.

R.notes:
Final Hour has no cast time and does not interrupt Vayne's previous orders.
 Vayne's animations and basic attack projectiles change slightly during Final Hour.
 Tumble's  invisibility during  Final Hour will end prematurely if Vayne performs any action other than movement while in stealth.
R.blurb: Readying herself for an epic confrontation, Vayne gains increased Attack Damage, Invisibility during Tumble, and triple the bonus Movement Speed from Night Hunter.

I.name: Phenomenal Evil Power

effects.description: Innate: Veigar gains a stack of Phenomenal Evil whenever he hits an enemy  champion with an ability, and 5 stacks whenever he scores a champion  takedown.
Veigar gains  1 ability power for every stack of Phenomenal Evil.

I.notes:
Stacks are gained for landing the ability, not dealing damage, and so is triggered by  Event Horizon and even versus  spell shielded or  invulnerable targets.
 The two effects stack, granting 6 stacks for each enemy champion takedowned by an ability, 7 with  Baleful Strike.
I.blurb: Veigar is the greatest Evil to ever strike at the hearts of Runeterra - and he's only getting bigger! Striking an enemy Champion with a spell or scoring a takedown grants Veigar permanently increased Ability Power.

Q.name: Baleful Strike

effects.description: Passive: Killing a unit with Baleful Strike grants 1 stack of  Phenomenal Evil, doubled against large  minions and  monsters.
Active: Veigar unleashes a bolt of dark energy in the target direction, dealing  magic damage to the first two enemies hit.

Q.notes:
Killing two enemy champions with Baleful Strike grants +14 AP.
 Units killed by  Luden's Echo's passive bolts cannot grant extra ability power.
Q.blurb: Veigar unleashes a bolt of dark energy that deals magic damage to the first two enemies hit. Units killed by this bolt grant Veigar some ability power permanently.

W.name: Dark Matter

effects.description: Active: Veigar calls a mass of dark matter to fall from the sky which lands after a 1.25 second delay to the target location, dealing magic damage to all enemies hit.
Dark Matter's  cooldown is reduced by a percentage, scaling with  Phenomenal Evil.

W.notes: Dark Matter grants a short instance of  sight around its cast location.
W.blurb: Veigar calls a great mass of dark matter to fall from the sky to the target location, dealing magic damage when it lands. Stacks of Phenomenal Evil reduce Dark Matter's cooldown.

E.name: Event Horizon

effects.description: Active: Veigar forms a cage around the target location which materializes after a 0.5 second delay and lasts for 3 seconds,  knocking down and  stunning all enemies who pass through its edges for the first time.

E.notes:
Event Horizon can only  stun a unit once per cast. A unit will not be  stunned twice if they walk through the perimeter again after recovering from an initial  stun.
 A champion that spell shields the stun will be immune to it even if they walk through the perimeter again.
  Glory in Death allows an Event Horizon to stun Sion twice.

  Blinks and  untargetabilities (i.e  Kassadin's  Riftwalk,  Fizz's  Playful) are not stopped by Event Horizon.
 Forced movement of a unit by  knockbacks or  pulls such as  Rocket Grab through Event Horizon's perimeter will be stopped.
E.blurb: After a brief delay Veigar twists the edges of space around the target location for 3 seconds, stunning enemies who pass through the perimeter.

R.name: Primordial Burst

effects.description: Active: Veigar blasts the target enemy champion with primordial energy, dealing magic damage to them, increased by 0% − 100% (based on target's missing health).

R.notes: No additional details.
R.blurb: Blasts target enemy champion, dealing a large amount of magic damage, increasing based on the target's missing health.

I.name: Organic Deconstruction

effects.description: Innate: Vel'Koz's abilities apply a Deconstruction stack for 7 seconds, stacking up to 3 times. Basic attacks refresh the duration on-hit.
The third stack consumes them all, dealing 33 − 169 (based on level) (+ 50% AP)  bonus true damage.

I.blurb: Vel'Koz's abilities apply Organic Deconstruction to enemies on hit. If 3 stacks are accumulated, the enemy will take a burst of true damage.

Q.name: Plasma Fission

effects.description: Active: Vel'Koz fires an energy bolt that collides with the first enemy hit to deal  magic damage and  slow by 70% for a few seconds, decaying over the duration.

At the end of its range, upon re-activation after 0.25 seconds, or upon colliding with an enemy, the bolt splits in half, each part firing in opposite directions perpendicular to the primary bolt's trajectory.
Plasma Fission restores  mana per target killed.

Q.notes:
An enemy cannot be hit by multiple bolts even when having blocked one with a  spell shield.
 Plasma Fission can travel a maximum ~1521 units diagonally.
Q.blurb: Vel'Koz shoots a bolt of plasma that splits in two on reactivation or upon hitting an enemy. The bolt slows and damages on hit.

Q.name: Plasma Fission

effects.description: Active: Vel'Koz fires an energy bolt that collides with the first enemy hit to deal  magic damage and  slow by 70% for a few seconds, decaying over the duration.

At the end of its range, upon re-activation after 0.25 seconds, or upon colliding with an enemy, the bolt splits in half, each part firing in opposite directions perpendicular to the primary bolt's trajectory.
Plasma Fission restores  mana per target killed.

Q.notes:
An enemy cannot be hit by multiple bolts even when having blocked one with a  spell shield.
 Plasma Fission can travel a maximum ~1521 units diagonally.
Q.blurb: Vel'Koz shoots a bolt of plasma that splits in two on reactivation or upon hitting an enemy. The bolt slows and damages on hit.

W.name: Void Rift

effects.description: Passive: Vel'Koz periodically stocks a Void Rift charge, up to a maximum of 2.

Active: Vel'Koz opens a rift to the void that cuts through the ground in a line, dealing magic damage and leaving behind a trail. After a 0.25 seconds delay, the trail detonates, dealing magic damage.

W.notes:
Vel'Koz can cast Void Rift while moving but not while attacking.
  Unbreakable and  Wind Wall will block the rift from forming over them, but they will not destroy the trail that was created before it.
 Void Rift must finish before another can be cast.
  Spell shield only blocks one instance of damage.
W.blurb: Vel'Koz opens a rift to the void that deals an initial burst of damage, then explodes for a second burst of damage after a delay.

E.name: Tectonic Disruption

effects.description: Active: Vel'Koz hurls a disruptive anomaly that reaches the target location after 0.55 seconds, briefly providing  sight, dealing magic damage and  suspending enemies in the area for 0.75 seconds. If the area is created close to Vel'Koz, enemies hit are also slightly  knocked back in the direction of the cast.

E.notes:
The required proximity for  displacement is relative to Vel'Koz's position when casting and not his current one.
 There is a brief ~0.1 second cast time before the projectile begins to travel.
 Although considered to be a projectile,  Unbreakable and  Wind Wall will block Tectonic Disruption, but will not destroy it visually.
E.blurb: Vel'Koz causes an area to explode, knocking up enemies, and knocking close enemies slightly away.

R.name: Life Form Disintegration Ray

effects.description: Passive - Researched:  Deconstructing enemy champions marks them as  Researched for 7 seconds. Basic attacks and ability damage refresh the duration on-hit.

Active: Vel'Koz channels for 2.5 seconds to project an energy beam in a line. The ray's trajectory updates itself over the duration to face the target direction. Reactivating Life Form Disintegration Ray ends the channel.
The ray deals magic damage in 0.25 seconds intervals, and  slows by 20% for 1 second.  Deconstruction is applied every 0.7 seconds to enemies hit.  Researched enemies take  true damage instead.

R.notes:
Life Form Disintegration Ray's trajectory updates gradually (moving the cursor from one side of Vel'Koz to the other will not make him rotate instantly).
 The beam covers Vel'Koz's hitbox, damaging enemies standing close.
R.blurb: Vel'Koz unleashes a channelled beam that follows the cursor for 2.5 seconds that deals magic damage. Organic Deconstruction Researches enemy champions causing them to take true damage instead.

R.name: Life Form Disintegration Ray

effects.description: Passive - Researched:  Deconstructing enemy champions marks them as  Researched for 7 seconds. Basic attacks and ability damage refresh the duration on-hit.

Active: Vel'Koz channels for 2.5 seconds to project an energy beam in a line. The ray's trajectory updates itself over the duration to face the target direction. Reactivating Life Form Disintegration Ray ends the channel.
The ray deals magic damage in 0.25 seconds intervals, and  slows by 20% for 1 second.  Deconstruction is applied every 0.7 seconds to enemies hit.  Researched enemies take  true damage instead.

R.notes:
Life Form Disintegration Ray's trajectory updates gradually (moving the cursor from one side of Vel'Koz to the other will not make him rotate instantly).
 The beam covers Vel'Koz's hitbox, damaging enemies standing close.
R.blurb: Vel'Koz unleashes a channelled beam that follows the cursor for 2.5 seconds that deals magic damage. Organic Deconstruction Researches enemy champions causing them to take true damage instead.

I.name: Blast Shield

effects.description: Innate: Hitting an enemy with an ability grants Vi a  15% maximum health shield for up to 3 seconds.
Blast Shield's  cooldown is reduced by 3 seconds for every trigger of  Denting Blows.

I.notes: Triggering  Denting Blows will not activate Blast Shield.
I.blurb: Vi charges a shield over time. The shield can be activated by hitting an enemy with an ability.

Q.name: Vault Breaker

effects.description: First Cast: Vi  charges for up to 4 seconds to increase Vault Breaker's  range, speed, and damage over 1.25 seconds. While charging, Vi is  pacified and  slowed by 15%.
Second Cast: Vi  dashes in the target direction, dealing  physical damage to all enemies she passes through, increased by 0% − 100% (based on channel time).
Vi stops upon colliding with an enemy champion,  knocking them back while other units are instead  pulled towards her.
Vault Breaker will go on a 3 second cooldown and refund  50% of its mana cost if Vi is  interrupted during the channeling.

Q.notes:
Despite being  pacified, Vi can still  Flash (and cast all other summoner spells except  Teleport) during Vault Breaker's channel.
 The self  slow is reduced by  slow resist.
  Spell shield will block the damage (will not prevent  Denting Blows' application).
 PENDING FOR TEST: Vault Breaker's  interaction with  grounding effects.
Q.blurb: Vi charges her gauntlets and unleashes a vault shattering punch, carrying her forward. Enemies she hits are knocked back and receive a stack of Denting Blows.

W.name: Denting Blows

effects.description: Passive: Vi's basic attacks and  Vault Breaker apply Denting Blows to enemies hit, stacking up to 3 times. At 3 Denting Blows, Vi consumes them to deal bonus physical damage, capped at 300 against non-champions.
For the next 4 seconds, Vi gains  bonus attack speed and the target has 20% reduced  armor.

W.notes:
Denting Blows stacks will not reset when Vi switches targets.
 Denting Blows bonus attack speed will not stack with itself when Vi gains Denting Blows bonuses from the same target repeatedly or from multiple enemies in quick succession.
 The enhanced attack applies other  on-hit effects and can both  critically strike as normal as well as apply  life steal (the bonus damage cannot do either) but does not affect structures.
 Denting Blows can be  blocked but cannot be parried by  dodging and  blinding effects via basic attack.
W.blurb: Vi's punches break her opponent's Armor, dealing bonus damage and granting her Attack Speed.

W.name: Denting Blows

effects.description: Passive: Vi's basic attacks and  Vault Breaker apply Denting Blows to enemies hit, stacking up to 3 times. At 3 Denting Blows, Vi consumes them to deal bonus physical damage, capped at 300 against non-champions.
For the next 4 seconds, Vi gains  bonus attack speed and the target has 20% reduced  armor.

W.notes:
Denting Blows stacks will not reset when Vi switches targets.
 Denting Blows bonus attack speed will not stack with itself when Vi gains Denting Blows bonuses from the same target repeatedly or from multiple enemies in quick succession.
 The enhanced attack applies other  on-hit effects and can both  critically strike as normal as well as apply  life steal (the bonus damage cannot do either) but does not affect structures.
 Denting Blows can be  blocked but cannot be parried by  dodging and  blinding effects via basic attack.
W.blurb: Vi's punches break her opponent's Armor, dealing bonus damage and granting her Attack Speed.

E.name: Excessive Force

effects.description: Passive: Vi periodically stores up to 2 Excessive Force charges.
Active: Vi's next basic attack gains  50 bonus range and deals physical damage to all enemies in a cone in front of her. The damage can  critically strike for (100% +  25%) AD bonus physical damage.
Excessive Force resets Vi's basic attack timer.

E.notes:
Excessive Force has no cast time and does not interrupt Vi's previous orders.
  Denting Blows will only apply a stack on Excessive Force's primary target (does not interact with the cone's damage).
 The enhanced attack applies other on-hit effects, can  critically strike as normal (the cone damage will also crit), apply  life steal, and affect structures if they are the primary target (the cone's damage does not affect them).
E.blurb: Vi's next attack blasts through her target, dealing damage to enemies behind it.

E.name: Excessive Force

effects.description: Passive: Vi periodically stores up to 2 Excessive Force charges.
Active: Vi's next basic attack gains  50 bonus range and deals physical damage to all enemies in a cone in front of her. The damage can  critically strike for (100% +  25%) AD bonus physical damage.
Excessive Force resets Vi's basic attack timer.

E.notes:
Excessive Force has no cast time and does not interrupt Vi's previous orders.
  Denting Blows will only apply a stack on Excessive Force's primary target (does not interact with the cone's damage).
 The enhanced attack applies other on-hit effects, can  critically strike as normal (the cone damage will also crit), apply  life steal, and affect structures if they are the primary target (the cone's damage does not affect them).
E.blurb: Vi's next attack blasts through her target, dealing damage to enemies behind it.

R.name: Assault and Battery

effects.description: Active: Vi rushes  unstoppably to the target enemy  champion dealing physical damage upon arrival and  knocking them up for 1.25 seconds.
Enemies along the way are  knocked aside by 350 units for 0.75 seconds and dealt the same damage.

R.notes:
Vi will track targets that change locations, whether by  dashing,  blinking, or simple movement.
 Assault and Battery has a maximum tether range, meaning it does not extensively follow targets that move too far away ( Teleport,  Recall).

 If the target becomes  untargetable during Assault and Battery, the ability is cancelled prematurely.
R.blurb: Vi runs down an enemy, knocking aside anyone in the way. When she reaches her target she knocks it into the air, jumps after it, and slams it back into the ground.

I.name: Glorious Evolution

effects.description:
Innate: Viktor starts each game with an exclusive  Prototype Hex Core, which permanently occupies one of his item slots. For some additional gold, Viktor can upgrade his Hex Core to increase its bonuses and grant him one Evolution point, which he can use to augment one of his basic abilities. Once he augments all of his basic abilities, Viktor automatically augments his ultimate ability,  Chaos Storm.
  Prototype Hex Core: Grants 1 − 18 (based on level) ability power and 10 − 180 (based on level) mana.
  Hex Core mk-1: Grants 3 − 54 (based on level) ability power and 15 − 270 (based on level) mana. And one Evolution Point.
  Hex Core mk-2: Grants 6 − 108 (based on level) ability power and  20 − 360 (based on level) mana. And one Evolution Point.
  Perfect Hex Core: Grants 10 − 180 (based on level) ability power and 25 − 450 (based on level) mana. And one Evolution Point.

I.blurb: Viktor starts with the Prototype Hex Core that can be upgraded three times in the store to augment his abilities.

Q.name: Siphon Power

effects.description: Active: Viktor  shields himself for 30 − 115 (based on level) (+ 15% AP) for 2.5 seconds, deals  magic damage to the target enemy, and gains  Discharge for 3.5 seconds.
Discharge: Viktor's next basic attack won't use a  projectile and is modified to deal magic damage.

Augment: Turbocharge: Viktor instantly gains  30% bonus movement speed for 2.5 seconds after using Siphon Power, while also increasing the shield's value by 60%, up to 48 − 184 (based on level) (+ 24% AP).

Q.notes:
Applies  spell damage to the ability and  default damage to the enhanced attack.
 The enhanced attack will apply other  on-hit and can  critically strike (the bonus damage does not) as normal.
 The enhanced attack will not trigger on  structures.
 All damage dealt by Spellblade on the enhanced attack is converted into magic damage.

  Spell shield will block the damage, but will not cancel the  shield nor the enhanced attack and movement speed buffs.
Q.blurb: Viktor blasts an enemy unit dealing magic damage, gaining a shield and empowering his next basic attack. Augment: Viktor gains bonus Movement Speed after casting.

W.name: Gravity Field

effects.description: Active: Viktor deploys a gravitational imprisonment device at the target location which arms after a brief delay. For 4 seconds, the trap  slows all enemies that pass through its field, persisting for 0.25 seconds after leaving.
Whilst under the trap's effects, enemies generate a stack every 0.5 seconds. At 3 stacks, enemies are  knocked down and  stunned for 1.5 seconds.
Augment: Magnetize: Viktor's abilities, excluding  Chaos Storm ticks,  slow enemies hit by 20% for 1 second.

W.notes:
An enemy can only be stunned by the field once per cast, after which they will not be slowed or accumulate stacks again.
 Gravity Field will remain active if Viktor dies.
 Gravity Field's animation can be seen by both teams through fog of war.
W.blurb: Viktor conjures a heavy gravitational field that slows enemies in its radius. Enemies who stay within the device for too long are stunned. Augment: Enemies stunned by Gravity Field are dragged to the center.

E.name: Death Ray

effects.description: Active: Viktor uses his synthetic arm to fire an energy beam 500 units down the target path, dealing magic damage to every enemy it hits. The arm can fire in any direction from any point within range, and does not interrupt Viktor's previous orders.
Augment: Aftershock: An explosion follows Death Ray's wake after 1 second, dealing additional magic damage.

E.notes:
Death Ray has no cast time and Viktor may freely act while the ray is travelling.
 The effected area is set upon casting, no matter how far away Viktor moves. Unlike a leash, Death Ray will not break off its own effect.

 The laser grants a moderate area of  sight around where the beam strikes the ground.
 If Death Ray is  intercepted, the initial ray is not destroyed.
 However, the capability to be blocked only applies to the laser as it hits the ground. Viktor can cast the ability over the wall and it will not be destroyed or intercepted.

 If Viktor dies while he is firing the beam it will become  interrupted and stops traveling.
E.blurb: Viktor uses his robotic arm to fire a chaos beam that cuts across the field in a line, dealing damage to all enemies in its path. Augment: An explosion follows the Death Ray's wake, dealing magic damage.

R.name: Chaos Storm

effects.description: First Cast: Viktor conjures an arcane singularity at the target location, dealing magic damage to every enemy it hits and  interrupting  channeled abilities. The singularity remains active for 6.5 seconds afterwards, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies every second.

Second Cast: Viktor directs the singularity to the target location. Once the singularity damages an enemy  champion, it automatically follows them until the target dies or escapes it. The singularity moves faster depending on its proximity to Viktor.
Augment: Perfect Storm: Chaos Storm moves 25% faster.

R.notes:
If Viktor dies, Chaos Storm will remain active and follow the targeted enemy champion.
 Chaos Storm reaches its maximum speed at 300 units and minimum speed at 900 units away from Viktor.
 Including the initial damage, Chaos Storm deals 7 instance of damage.
 Chaos Storm can be controlled by alt + right click or by pressing the R button (default hotkeys). It can be commanded to move toward locations or enemy champions (it will continue to follow the chosen enemy champion unless commanded otherwise).
 If Viktor is affected by  immobilizes, he cannot issue new commands to the singularity.
 If the champion the storm is currently following enters stealth, the singularity will continue to follow them, effectively giving away their position. 
 The singularity grants  sight around its position for the full duration..
 Chaos Storm is not obstructed by terrain.
R.blurb: Viktor conjures a singularity on the field which deals magic damage and interrupts enemy channels. The singularity then periodically does magic damage to all nearby enemies. Viktor can redirect the singularity. Augment: The Chaos Storm moves faster.

R.name: Chaos Storm

effects.description: First Cast: Viktor conjures an arcane singularity at the target location, dealing magic damage to every enemy it hits and  interrupting  channeled abilities. The singularity remains active for 6.5 seconds afterwards, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies every second.

Second Cast: Viktor directs the singularity to the target location. Once the singularity damages an enemy  champion, it automatically follows them until the target dies or escapes it. The singularity moves faster depending on its proximity to Viktor.
Augment: Perfect Storm: Chaos Storm moves 25% faster.

R.notes:
If Viktor dies, Chaos Storm will remain active and follow the targeted enemy champion.
 Chaos Storm reaches its maximum speed at 300 units and minimum speed at 900 units away from Viktor.
 Including the initial damage, Chaos Storm deals 7 instance of damage.
 Chaos Storm can be controlled by alt + right click or by pressing the R button (default hotkeys). It can be commanded to move toward locations or enemy champions (it will continue to follow the chosen enemy champion unless commanded otherwise).
 If Viktor is affected by  immobilizes, he cannot issue new commands to the singularity.
 If the champion the storm is currently following enters stealth, the singularity will continue to follow them, effectively giving away their position. 
 The singularity grants  sight around its position for the full duration..
 Chaos Storm is not obstructed by terrain.
R.blurb: Viktor conjures a singularity on the field which deals magic damage and interrupts enemy channels. The singularity then periodically does magic damage to all nearby enemies. Viktor can redirect the singularity. Augment: The Chaos Storm moves faster.

I.name: Crimson Pact

effects.description: Innate: Vladimir gains (2.5% bonus health)  bonus ability power and (140% AP)  bonus health. These two bonuses do not stack with each other.

I.notes:
Crimson Pact's bonus ability power stacks multiplicatively with other sources of % ability power but its bonus health stacks additively with other sources of bonus health. Examples on how they calculate below:
Case 1: With  Rabadon's Deathcap you get a total of (40% AP + 3.5% bonus health) bonus ability power and (196% AP + 1.4% bonus health) bonus health.
Case 2: With  Cinderhulk you get a total of (2.875% bonus health) bonus ability power and (140% AP + 15% bonus health) bonus health.
Case 3: With  Rabadon's Deathcap +  Cinderhulk you get a total of (40% AP + 4.025% bonus health) bonus ability power and (196% AP + 16.61% bonus health) bonus health.
I.blurb: Every 40 points of bonus Health gives Vladimir 1 Ability Power and every 1 point of Ability Power gives Vladimir 1.4 bonus Health (does not stack with itself).

Q.name: Transfusion

effects.description: Active: Vladimir drains the lifeforce of the target enemy, dealing  magic damage and  healing himself.

Each cast of Transfusion generates a stack of  Bloodthirst over its  cooldown, which is displayed in his secondary resource bar. At 2 stacks, Vladimir gains Crimson Rush for 2.5 seconds and  10% bonus movement speed for 0.5 seconds.
Crimson Rush: The next Transfusion deals 85% increased damage and heals for an additional 30 − 200 (based on level) (+ 5% (+ 4% per 100 AP) missing health), reduced to 35% against minions.

Q.notes:
Even thought the healing effect is visualized as a projectile, the healing itself triggers instantly.
 Vladimir's resource bar changes colors depending on Bloodthirst's charge-up.
 White while generating the first stack and while at 1 stack (there is no time-out period).
 Orange while generating the second stack.
 Red while Crimson Rush is active (Bloodthirst will deplete over 2.5 seconds once triggered).

 Each stack generates over-time (Transfusion's cooldown).

 During  Tides of Blood or  Sanguine Pool, Crimson Rush is maintained for the duration of the ability.
  Bloodthirst is slowly depleted during this time.
Q.blurb: Vladimir steals life from the target enemy. When Vladimir's resource is full, Transfusion will benefit from massively increased damage and healing for a brief time.

Q.name: Transfusion

effects.description: Active: Vladimir drains the lifeforce of the target enemy, dealing  magic damage and  healing himself.

Each cast of Transfusion generates a stack of  Bloodthirst over its  cooldown, which is displayed in his secondary resource bar. At 2 stacks, Vladimir gains Crimson Rush for 2.5 seconds and  10% bonus movement speed for 0.5 seconds.
Crimson Rush: The next Transfusion deals 85% increased damage and heals for an additional 30 − 200 (based on level) (+ 5% (+ 4% per 100 AP) missing health), reduced to 35% against minions.

Q.notes:
Even thought the healing effect is visualized as a projectile, the healing itself triggers instantly.
 Vladimir's resource bar changes colors depending on Bloodthirst's charge-up.
 White while generating the first stack and while at 1 stack (there is no time-out period).
 Orange while generating the second stack.
 Red while Crimson Rush is active (Bloodthirst will deplete over 2.5 seconds once triggered).

 Each stack generates over-time (Transfusion's cooldown).

 During  Tides of Blood or  Sanguine Pool, Crimson Rush is maintained for the duration of the ability.
  Bloodthirst is slowly depleted during this time.
Q.blurb: Vladimir steals life from the target enemy. When Vladimir's resource is full, Transfusion will benefit from massively increased damage and healing for a brief time.

W.name: Sanguine Pool

effects.description: Active: Vladimir sinks into a pool of blood, gaining  37.5% bonus movement speed which decays exponentially over 1 second and becoming  untargetable and  ghosted for 2 seconds.
Enemies who stand upon the pool are  slowed by 40% and dealt magic damage every half second, while Vladimir  heals himself for 15% of Sanguine Pool's damage dealt.
Vladimir cannot use basic attacks or abilities during Sanguine Pool.

W.notes:
The first tick damages immediately so the final one occurs 0.5 seconds before Vladimir becomes targetable again.
 The  slow ends immediately once affected enemies get out of range.
 Sanguine Pool has no  cast time.
 Vladimir may still use summoner spells and active items during Sanguine Pool.
W.blurb: Vladimir sinks into a pool of blood, becoming untargetable for 2 seconds. Additionally, enemies on the pool are slowed and Vladimir siphons life from them.

E.name: Tides of Blood

effects.description: First Cast: Vladimir winds up for up to 1.5 seconds,  slowing himself by 20% over the last 0.5 seconds. If Vladimir finishes charging or is  interrupted, he automatically initiates the second cast.

Second Cast: Vladimir unleashes a nova of blood bolts, each of which collide with the first enemy they hit, dealing them magic damage that is increased the longer Tides of Blood was charged, up to the first second.
If Tides of Blood was charged for at least 1 second, affected enemies are also  slowed for 0.5 seconds.
Enemies can intercept multiple bolts, but may only be damaged once.

E.blurb: Vladimir pays his own health to charge up a reservoir of blood which, when released, deals damage in the area around him but can be blocked by enemy units.

R.name: Hemoplague

effects.description: Active: Vladimir infects all enemies in the target area with a virulent plague, increasing the damage they take from all sources by 10% for 4 seconds, after which all infected enemies take magic damage.
The detonation brings the blood from  enemy champions hit to Vladimir,  healing him for the pre-mitigation damage dealt against them once the blood reaches him, reduced to 50% after the first.

R.notes:
Hemoplague has no cast time and doesn't affect Vladimir's previous orders.
 Hemoplague will amplify almost all sources and types of damage (including damage from neutral monsters but excluding  true damage, with percent modifiers stacking multiplicatively).
 Hemoplague amplifies itself for an actual 165 / 220 / 275 / 330 / 385 (+ 77% AP) damage.
R.blurb: Vladimir infects an area with a virulent plague. Affected enemies take increased damage for the duration. After a few seconds, Hemoplague deals magic damage to infected enemies and heals Vladimir for each enemy Champion hit.

I.name: Chosen of the Storm

effects.description: Innate: When Volibear's health drops  below 30% of his maximum health he regenerates [  30% of his maximum health over 6 seconds ][  2.5% of his maximum health every 0.5 seconds ].

I.notes:
Chosen of the Storm's cooldown starts as soon as it activates.
 If the cooldown ends while Volibear is under 30% health Chosen of the Storm will not trigger unless he takes damage.
 If Volibear is killed directly from anywhere higher than 30% health Chosen of the Storm will not activate and therefore will not go on cooldown.
I.blurb: Volibear heals rapidly for a few seconds when his Health drops to a critical level.

Q.name: Rolling Thunder

effects.description: Active: Volibear drops on all fours and gains  bonus movement speed for the next 4 seconds, increased when moving towards a nearby  visible enemy champion within 1800 units of him.
For the duration, Volibear's next basic attack deals  bonus physical damage and  flings his target over and behind himself.
Rolling Thunder resets Volibear's autoattack timer.

Q.notes:
Rolling Thunder's bonus damage affects structures.
 Enemy can be flinged through very thin walls.
 Volibear will retain the bonus movement speed for Rolling Thunder's full duration even if he flings his target before it expires.
 When Volibear changes direction (from "towards champions" to any other direction), his bonus movement speed decays over 1 second.
 Rolling Thunder can be  blocked and  dodged but the  displacement cannot be negated by  blinding effects.
Q.blurb: Volibear drops to all fours and runs faster. This bonus speed increases when chasing enemy champions. The first enemy he attacks is thrown backwards over Volibear.

W.name: Frenzy

effects.description: Passive: Volibear's basic attacks grant  bonus attack speed for 4 seconds, stacking up to 3 times. At 3 stacks, Volibear gains the ability to cast Frenzy.
Active: Volibear bites the target enemy, dealing physical damage, increasing by 0% − 100% (based on target's missing health).
Frenzy's  cooldown is halved if it is used on a  minion or  monster.

W.notes: PENDING FOR TEST: Frenzy's  stack gain interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects.
W.blurb: Volibear's repeated attacks grant him additional Attack Speed. Once Volibear has repeatedly attacked three times, he can perform a vicious bite on his target which deals increased damage based on the target's missing Health.

E.name: Majestic Roar

effects.description: Active: Volibear roars with might, dealing  magic damage to all nearby enemies, slightly  knocking them back and  slowing them for 3 seconds.  Minions and  monsters are instead  feared and slowed by 100% for the same duration.
Enemies who are  dashing or are  airborne during Majestic Roar are dealt an additional 8% of their maximum health as magic damage.

E.notes: Majestic Roar will  fear decoys.
E.blurb: Volibear lets out a powerful roar that damages and slows enemies. Minions and monsters are feared as well.

R.name: Thunder Claws

effects.description: Active: After a 0.1 second delay, Volibear erupts with thunder, increasing in size and striking to up to 8 nearby enemies with chain lightning, dealing them  magic damage.

Afterwards, for 12 seconds, Volibear's basic attacks are empowered with the lightning, dealing  the same damage as bonus magic damage  on-hit that also instantly bounces to up to 7 nearby unaffected enemies.

R.notes:
PENDING FOR TEST: Thunder Claw's  interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects via basic attack.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Thunder Claw's  interaction with  spell shield.
R.blurb: Volibear erupts with chain lightning, damaging a number nearby enemies. The power of the storm causes Volibear's attacks to blast his targets with lightning that bounces to other nearby enemies.

I.name: Eternal Hunger

effects.description: Innate: Warwick's basic attacks deal 10 − 44 (based on level)  bonus magic damage on-hit.

While  below 50% maximum health he is also  healed by the amount of post-mitigation damage Eternal Hunger deals. This healing is increased[ by 150% ][ to 25 − 110 (based on level) ]while  below 25% maximum health.

I.notes:
The enhanced attack will apply other on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal (the bonus damage cannot).
 Eternal Hunger does not affect structures.
I.blurb: Warwick's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage. If Warwick is below 50% health, he heals the same amount. If Warwick is below 25% health, this healing triples.

Q.name: Jaws of the Beast

effects.description: Active: Warwick  dashes  unstoppably to the target enemy and bites them, dealing magic damage, applying  on-hit effects and  healing himself for a portion of the post-mitigation damage dealt. The on-hits apply after the healing is calculated.

If Jaws of the Beast is held, Warwick will lock his teeth into his target and use them to swing himself around to their far side. Warwick is  unable to act while swinging around his target, and will move wherever they move until he jumps off. Warwick is unstoppable while attached to an enemy.

Q.notes:
The ability will not cancel if the target dies during its cast time.
 Warwick cannot be  displaced while attached to an enemy, but can be  knocked down prior to reaching them.
 The button must be held until Warwick reaches his target to trigger the second effect. 
 While Jaws of the Beast does not use Quick Casting by default, click-and-hold is comparable to the input required to use  Piercing Arrow or  Decimating Smash while using Quick Casting. It does not accept two-click input (e.g. First Cast and Second Cast) that Standard Casters will be used to on the aforementioned abilities.
 The distance traveled past the target depends on how long the ability was held after Warwick reached the target.
Q.blurb: Warwick lunges forward and bites his target, dealing damage based on their maximum health and healing for damage dealt.

W.name: Blood Hunt

effects.description: Passive: Warwick senses all enemy  champions below  below 50% of their maximum health, marking them as Blood Hunted as well as highlighting their position to his team.
Warwick additionally sees a blood trail, highlighting the shortest path to the Blood Hunted target, and gains  bonus movement speed while following it.
Warwick also gains  bonus attack speed upon attacking a Blood Hunted target or an enemy unit  below 50% of their maximum health.
The bonus movement and attack speed is increased by 150% against enemies  below 20% maximum health.

Active: Warwick briefly senses all enemies and then Blood Hunts the nearest enemy champion within a large radius for 8 seconds, regardless of their  current health. After being in combat with a champion, Blood Hunt may only be activated passively for 3 seconds. Its bonus movement speed will also be lost for 0.5 seconds, but will build up again every 0.25 seconds over the next 3.5 seconds.

W.notes:
Enemies who are Blood Hunted will display a red wolf mark on their heads while ominous music will replace their Summoner's Rift default chosen song until they are no longer Blood Hunted, with a small delay.
 Blood Hunt can detect and target decoys.
 The blood trail, altough described as a trail, does not indicate where the target has been - only the quickest route to their current location, and it will update as you and/or the target move.
 Warwick will lose his movement speed bonus if enemies that are not Blood Hunted stay exactly between him and the Blood Hunted target.
 Blood Hunt's passive only senses enemies that go below the health threshold while Warwick is alive. A unit that went below 50% health while Warwick was dead and has not taken damage while he is alive will not be detected by Blood Hunt until it falls low again.
 Same applies to enemy champions that went under the threshold by taking  Nexus Obelisk's damage or to units that spawn with their current health below the threshold (i.e  Hallucinate,  Mirror Image).

 The detection from Blood Hunt is more similar to  Tremor Sense than a form of  sight - it grants positional information only. It does not explicitly inform Warwick about who is low health or if they are alone.
W.blurb: Warwick senses enemies below 50% health, gaining movement speed toward and attack speed against them. When they fall below 20% health, he frenzies and these bonuses triple.

E.name: Primal Howl

effects.description: First Cast: Warwick reduces all incoming damage received for 2.5 seconds. After 1 second, Primal Howl can be re-activated, and automatically does so after 2.5 seconds.
Second Cast: Warwick unleashes a howl, ending the damage reduction in the process, and causes all nearby enemies to  flee for 1 second as well as  slowing them by 90%.
Landing  Infinite Duress will instantly reactivate Primal Howl without prematurely ending the damage reduction buff.

E.notes:
The second activation will cancel Warwick's basic attack.
 Warwick cannot attack during the animation.
E.blurb: Warwick gains damage reduction for 2.5 seconds. At the end, or if re-activated, he howls, causing nearby enemies to flee for 1 second.

R.name: Infinite Duress

effects.description: Active: Warwick  leaps  unstoppably in the target direction,  suppressing the first enemy  champion he collides with for 1.5 seconds.

Warwick  channels while the target is  suppressed, dealing magic damage by hitting the target up to 6 times while also applying  on-hit effects up to 3 times. Infinite Duress  heals Warwick for all the damage dealt.

R.notes:
There is a brief delay before the leap and the target suppression can begin.
 The dash will be  interrupted instantly if an enemy  blinks in front of Warwick.
 The minimum range of the ability is 275 units, based on the minimum movement speed that a champion can have (110) while still being able to move. The "base" range of this ability is 837.5 because of his 335 base movement speed.
 Considering movement speed soft caps, with  Blood Hunt, this range increases to 1112 / 1145.5 / 1179 / 1203.125 / 1224.0625, further increased to 1360.15625 / 1412.5 / 1464.84375 / 1517.1875 / 1569.53125 against enemy champions below 20% health.

 The 6 hits are done in cycles of 2 hits every 0.5 seconds. The first hit deals 2/9 of the total damage and triggers the on-hit effects once while the second hit deals 1/9 of it.
 The healing is increased by  life steal.
 If Warwick does not collide with a champion, he will slide a fixed distance past the maximum range during which he is  disarmed and unable to cast movement abilities, including  Flash, but being able to cast  Jaws of the Beast and  Blood Hunt, with the former also interrupting the slide.
 Warwick is able to cast  Primal Howl at any time during the leap.
R.blurb: Warwick leaps in a direction (scaling with his bonus movement speed), suppressing the first champion he collides with for 1.5 seconds.

I.name: Stone Skin

effects.description: Innate: Wukong gains 4 / 6 / 8 (based on level) bonus  armor and  magic resistance for each  visible enemy  champion nearby.

I.notes: Decoys are considered champions for Stone Skin.
I.blurb: Increases Wukong's Armor and Magic Resist for each nearby enemy champion.

Q.name: Crushing Blow
