effects.description: Active: Wukong empowers his staff, causing his next basic attack within 5 seconds to gain  125 bonus range, deal  modified physical damage and reduce  his target's armor for 3 seconds.
Crushing Blow resets Wukong's autoattack timer.

Q.notes:
Crushing Blow has no cast time.
 Crushing Blow triggers on  structures and  wards but the armor reduction is not applied.
 The enhanced attack as well as the armor debuff is negated by  blocking and  dodging effects.
 It is not consumed if it is  missed.
Q.blurb: Wukong's next attack deals additional physical damage, gains range, and reduces the enemy's Armor for a short duration.

W.name: Decoy

effects.description: Active: Wukong is  pushed 100 units away, entering  invisibility for 1.5 seconds and leaving behind a decoy of himself.
After 1.5 seconds, the decoy performs a circular attack around itself for 0.5 seconds, dealing  magic damage to all nearby enemies before disappearing.

W.notes:
Decoy has no cast time.
 If the decoy is killed before it vanishes, it will not deal any damage.
 The Decoy cannot be targeted by allies, unless it's from an  auto-targeted effect (i.e  Heal,  Divine Judgement).
 Killing it rewards  25 gold and  44 experience.
W.blurb: Wukong becomes Invisible for a short duration, leaving behind a decoy that will deal Magic Damage to enemies near it when Wukong's stealth expires.

E.name: Nimbus Strike

effects.description: Active: Wukong  dashes on a cloud to the target enemy and sends out  untargetable clones to attack up to two additional enemies near the primary target, dealing physical damage to each enemy struck. The clones can block non-targeted attacks or abilities for 0.25 seconds after hitting their targets.
Upon hitting his target, Wukong gains  bonus attack speed for 4 seconds.

E.notes:
The ability applies a stack of  Electrocute /  Phase Rush even if the target is  untargetable.
 The created clones are considered champions for  Turret Plating's  gold sharing.
E.blurb: Wukong dashes to target enemy and sends out images to attack up to 2 additional enemies near his target, dealing physical damage to each enemy struck.

R.name: Cyclone

effects.description: Active: Wukong spins his staff around for up to 4 seconds, becomes  pacified and gains  5% − 40% (based on time active) bonus movement speed. Reactivating Cyclone cancels it immediately.
The spin deals physical damage to nearby enemies every 0.5 seconds. Enemies affected by Cyclone for the first time are briefly  knocked up.

R.notes:
While spinning, summoner spells and item actives can still be used, with the exception of Crescent, the active portion of  Tiamat,  Ravenous Hydra and  Titanic Hydra.
  Spell shield will block one instance of damage.
R.blurb: Wukong's staff grows outward and he spins it around, dealing damage and knocking up enemies. Wukong gains Movement Speed over the duration of the spell.

I.name: Clean Cuts

effects.description: Innate: After casting an ability, Xayah's next 3 basic attacks penetrate through all enemies along a 900 range line, dealing 100% damage to her main target and 30 / 40 / 50% (based on level) pass-through damage to other enemies.  At the end of their path, a Feather will be left in the ground for 6 seconds.
Xayah can store up to 5 empowered attacks for 8 seconds, refreshed with further ability use or upon attacking structures.
Lover's Leap: If either Xayah or  Rakan is  recalling, the other may move nearby and activate their own recall to join them. Both reach base at the time of which the initiator's recall ends.

I.notes:
On-hit effects are only applied to her selected attack target.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Feathers'  interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects via basic attack.
I.blurb: After using an ability, Xayah's next few basic attacks will hit all enemies along their path and dropping Feathers she can recall.

I.name: Clean Cuts

effects.description: Innate: After casting an ability, Xayah's next 3 basic attacks penetrate through all enemies along a 900 range line, dealing 100% damage to her main target and 30 / 40 / 50% (based on level) pass-through damage to other enemies.  At the end of their path, a Feather will be left in the ground for 6 seconds.
Xayah can store up to 5 empowered attacks for 8 seconds, refreshed with further ability use or upon attacking structures.
Lover's Leap: If either Xayah or  Rakan is  recalling, the other may move nearby and activate their own recall to join them. Both reach base at the time of which the initiator's recall ends.

I.notes:
On-hit effects are only applied to her selected attack target.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Feathers'  interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects via basic attack.
I.blurb: After using an ability, Xayah's next few basic attacks will hit all enemies along their path and dropping Feathers she can recall.

Q.name: Double Daggers

effects.description: Active: Xayah throws two feather-blades, dealing  physical damage to all enemies hit and leaving two Feathers on the ground.
Targets hit after the first take 50% damage.

Q.notes:
Xayah is  disarmed for a set duration during the cast time of Double Daggers. The lock out duration is reduced by [ 0.007 seconds per every 1% bonus attack speed ][ 1 second per every 140% bonus attack speed ].
 As the feathers are forming, they will deal damage in a small area around Xayah's feet before firing.
  Spell shield will only block a single instance of damage.
Q.blurb: Xayah throws two damaging daggers that also drop Feathers she can recall.

W.name: Deadly Plumage

effects.description: Active: Xayah creates a storm of blades for 4 seconds that grants her  bonus attack speed and cause her basic attacks to strike an additional time for 20% damage.
If Deadly Plumage strikes an enemy champion, Xayah gains  30% bonus movement speed for 1.5 seconds.
If  Rakan is nearby he will also gain the effects of Deadly Plumage, while also gaining the bonus movement speed when Xayah strikes an enemy champion.

W.notes:
The lesser bolts count as additional sources of single target physical damage, and will apply bonus stacks of  The Black Cleaver and  Electrocute.
 The lesser bolts from  Runaan's Hurricane will also deal 20% increased damage, which is represented with additional lesser bolts. The damage of each bolt is based off of 20% of its own damage, not of the initial basic attack.
W.blurb: Xayah creates a storm of blades that increase her basic attack speed and damage while granting her movement speed if she attacks a champion.

E.name: Bladecaller

effects.description: Active: Xayah calls all Feathers back to her, dealing physical damage to enemies they pass through, increased by 0% − 50% (based on critical chance).  Minions take 50% damage.
Enemies take 100% − 10% (based on feathers hit) damage from a Feather.
Enemies hit by at least 3 Feathers are  rooted for 1.25 seconds.

E.notes:
Spell shield will only block a single instance of damage.
 This ability cannot be ranked at Level 1.
 The damage dealt by Bladecaller follows a diminishing returns formula not mentioned in the ability's description, successively reducing extra damage from feathers beyond the first.
 This formula is: 
 For feathers <=10: Damage of one feather × (n − 0.1 × (n − 1) ÷ 2 × n) where n stands for the number of feathers hit.
 For feathers >=11: Damage of one feather × (5.5 + 0.1 × (n − 10)) where n stands for the number of feathers hit.

 For example, at rank 1 Bladecaller deals 55 − 302.5 (based on feathers hit).
E.blurb: Xayah calls back all her dropped Feathers dealing damage and rooting enemies.

R.name: Featherstorm

effects.description: Active: Xayah leaps into the air, becoming  untargetable for 1.5 seconds, during which she is still able to move, then rains down daggers which deal physical damage and leave behind a line of 5 Feathers.

R.notes: No additional details.
R.blurb: Xayah leaps into the air, becoming untargetable and throwing out a fan of daggers, dropping Feathers she can recall.

I.name: Mana Surge

effects.description: Innate: Xerath periodically empowers his next basic attack to restore 30 − 195 (based on level)  mana, doubled to 60 − 390 (based on level) against enemy champions.

I.notes:
Manasurge does not occur if it would restore beyond Xerath's  maximum mana.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Manasurge's  interactions with  turrets,  wards,  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects.
I.blurb: Xerath's basic attacks periodically restore Mana.

Q.name: Arcanopulse

effects.description: First Cast: Xerath  charges for up to 3 seconds to increase Arcanopulse's  range over 1.5 seconds, gradually  slowing himself for the duration by up to 50%.
Arcanopulse is canceled when the charge ends, refunding  half of the mana cost.
Second Cast: After a brief delay, Xerath fires a beam of energy in the target direction, dealing  magic damage to all enemies hit.

Q.notes: If Xerath changes locations by any means (i.e -  displacements), the beam will fire from the original point of casting.
Q.blurb: Fires a long-range beam of energy, dealing magic damage to all targets hit.

W.name: Eye of Destruction

effects.description: Active: Xerath calls down a blast of arcane energy upon the target area which strikes after a 0.5-second delay,  revealing it, and  dealing magic damage to all enemies within and  slowing them by 25% for 2.5 seconds.
Enemies in the center of the blast take 50% increased damage and are  slowed by a greater amount, decaying down to 25% over the duration.

W.notes: The  sight granted persists for a short duration after the blast has finished.
W.blurb: Calls down a barrage of arcane energy, slowing and dealing magic damage to all enemies in an area. Targets in the middle receive additional damage and a stronger slow.

E.name: Shocking Orb

effects.description: Active: Xerath fires an orb of energy in the target direction, dealing magic damage to the first enemy hit and  stunning them for 0.5 − 2 (based on distance the orb traveled) seconds.

E.notes: No additional details.
E.blurb: Deals magic damage to an enemy and stuns them.

R.name: Rite of the Arcane

effects.description: Active: Xerath  entangles himself to his current location for up to 10 seconds, gaining the ability to cast  Arcane Barrage multiple times, but losing access to cast his basic abilities.

Arcane Barrage - Active: Xerath launches a blast of arcane energy to the target area which strikes after 0.5 seconds, dealing magic damage and briefly granting  sight of it. Each cast has a static cooldown of 0.8 seconds.

Rite of the Arcane can be canceled early by moving or attacking. If Arcane Barrage ends without any usage, half the  cooldown is refunded. Rite of the Arcane is canceled and put on full  cooldown is  interrupted.

R.notes:
Rite of the Arcane has a brief delay. During this time, Arcane Barrage cannot be activated and a circle indicating the ability's maximum range appears (starting small and rapidly expanding to the maximum range over the cast time).
 The maximum-range indicator is visible to both allies and enemies. 

 Arcane Barrage uses a barrage system so that it can be cast multiple times within a given period at no additional cost.
 Each cast is classified as an activation for the purposes of effects such as  Tear and Spellblade.
 Xerath can use  Dark Passage while self  rooted.
R.blurb: Xerath immobilizes himself and gains numerous long-range barrages.

I.name: Determination

effects.description: Innate: Xin Zhao gains a Determination I and Determination II stack for every  Wind Becomes Lightning strike or basic attack on-hit, up to a maximum of two.
At two Determination I stacks, Xin Zhao's next  Wind Becomes Lightning strike or basic attack on-hit consumes the stacks to  heal him for  10 − 78 (based on level) (+ 10% AD) (+ 40% AP) health.
At two Determination II stacks, Xin Zhao's next  Wind Becomes Lightning strike or basic attack on-attack consumes the stacks to deal 15 / 25 / 35 / 45% (based on level) AD  bonus physical damage.

I.notes:
The Determination II stacks are not visible on the champion's buff bar in-game.
 Hitting one or more enemies with  Wind Becomes Lightning applies one stack per strike. The bonus damage applies to all enemies of one strike, but the healing only once.
 If  Guinsoo's Rageblade would trigger when the Determination II stacks are at maximum, the bonus stack will instead overstack, and be consumed on the next Determination II usage.
I.blurb: Every third attack deals bonus damage and heals Xin Zhao.

Q.name: Three Talon Strike

effects.description: Active: For the next 5 seconds, Xin Zhao's next 3 basic attacks each deal bonus physical damage and reduce his other ability  cooldowns by 1 second each.
Talon Strike is affected by  critical strike modifiers.
The third basic attack  knocks up the target for 0.75 seconds.
Three Talon Strike resets Xin Zhao's basic attack timer.

Q.notes:
Three Talon Strike has no cast time and does not interrupt Xin Zhao's previous orders.
  Spell shield will only block the third attack.
 The enhanced attacks present input buffering during their wind-up animation (they are  unstoppable and Xin Zhao cannot be issued any commands until after it ends).
Q.blurb: Xin Zhao's next 3 standard attacks deal increased damage with the third attack knocking an opponent into the air.

W.name: Wind Becomes Lightning

effects.description: Active: Xin Zhao performs two strikes over 0.5 / 0.4 (based on bonus attack speed) seconds.
The first deals physical damage to all enemies in an arc, and the second deals physical damage in a line,  slowing all enemies hit by 50% for 1.5 seconds.
Both strikes deal 50% reduced damage against minions, benefit from 33.3% of Xin Zhao's  life steal and the duration of his other abilities is paused during the effect.

W.notes: Spell shield will block only a single instance of damage - either the thrust or the slash.
W.blurb: Xin Zhao slashes in front of himself with his spear, then thrusts it forward.

E.name: Audacious Charge

effects.description: Active: Xin Zhao  dashes to the target enemy, dealing  magic damage to all nearby units and  slowing them by 30% for 0.5 seconds.
Xin Zhao then gains  bonus attack speed for 5 seconds.

E.notes: No additional effect.
E.blurb: Xin Zhao charges to an enemy, dealing damage to all enemies in the area and slowing them briefly.

R.name: Crescent Guard

effects.description: Passive - Challenge: The last enemy champion targeted by Xin Zhao's basic attacks or  Audacious Charge is  Challenged for 3 seconds.

Active - Awareness: After 0.35 seconds, Xin Zhao sweeps around him, dealing physical damage to enemies hit, capped at 600 (+ 100% bonus AD) against monsters, while also  knocking back all non- Challenged enemies hit.
For the next 3 seconds, Xin Zhao is  invulnerable against enemy  champions more than 450-units away from him. His basic attacks and other spell casts extend the duration by 0.3 seconds.

R.notes:
Pets do not deal damage to Xin Xhao during Crescent Strike if the enemy champion controlling them is not within the circle.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Champion clones will deal damage to Xin Zhao if they attack in the circle.
R.blurb: Xin Zhao deals damage to nearby enemies based on their current Health and knocks non-challenged targets back. Xin Zhao is impervious to damage dealt by champions outside of the circle created.

I.name: Way of the Wanderer

effects.description: Intent: Yasuo doubles his  total critical strike chance from all other sources, but his  critical strikes deal only (80% +  22.5%) AD  bonus physical damage.

Resolve: Yasuo generates  Flow for every 59 / 52.5 / 46 (based on level) units he travels by any means. At [ 100 stacks ][ 5900 / 5250 / 4600 (based on level) units traveled ] and upon taking champion or monster damage, Yasuo consumes  all Flow to  shield himself for 100 − 510 (based on level) for up to 1 second.

I.blurb: Yasuo's Critical Strike Chance is doubled. Additionally, Yasuo builds toward a shield whenever he is moving. The shield triggers when he takes damage from a champion or monster.

Q.name: Steel Tempest

effects.description: First Cast - Steel Tempest: Yasuo thrusts his sword in the target direction, dealing physical damage to enemies hit and applying  on-hit effects to the first enemy hit. The ability can  critically strike for (60% +  20%) AD bonus physical damage.
If Steel Tempest hits an enemy, he gains a Gathering Storm stack for 6 seconds to which he's able to cast Steel Wind Rising.
Second Cast - Steel Wind Rising: Yasuo casts Steel Tempest. If it hits an enemy, Yasuo gains another Gathering Storm stack to which he can cast Gathering Storm.
Third Cast - Gathering Storm: Yasuo consumes his stacks to unleash a whirlwind that travels in the target direction, dealing the same damage and  knocking up all enemies hit.

Casting Steel Tempest, Steel Wind Rising or Gathering Storm during  Sweeping Blade will instead affect enemies around Yasuo at the end of the dash, or doing so immediately at his landing location after  blinking while ending the dash prematurely. Gathering Storm's whirlwind is not released when cast during  Sweeping Blade, but instead  knocks up all enemies hit around Yasuo for the same duration.

Q.notes:
Applies  spell damage to the first target hit and  area damage to secondary targets.
 Only Gathering Storm can be  intercepted. 
  Ravenous Hunter will only heal from the damage dealt to secondary targets.

 Each parry has different interactions with this ability, whether it's the first target of Steel Tempest or the secondary one. In either case Yasuo still gets a stack of Gathering Storm and his whirlwind knockup cannot be negated:
  Counter Strike: both first target and secondary target do not deal damage.
  Spirit's Refuge: first target does not deal damage, secondary target does deal damage.
  Blinding Dart: both first target and secondary target do deal damage.

  Spell shield does not prevent Steel Tempest from gaining a stack.
 Steel Tempest's damage is calculated individually for every enemy hit when  critically striking.
 Steel Tempest is not considered a basic attack for effects like  Guinsoo's Rageblade and stacking  Energizing attacks.
 It's been however special cased to be considered a basic attack for  Hail of Blades.

 Unlike other abilities, the first two Steel Tempests will cancel and reset their cooldown if Yasuo is  immobilized during their cast time.
 The third Steel Tempest will continue its cast through immobilization.
 If Yasuo, however, buffers Steel Tempest after  Sweeping Blade, a disable will cause Steel Tempest to cancel and go on full cooldown but does not consume the stacks.
Q.blurb: A skillshot basic attack. After two successful Steel Tempests, the next fires a tornado that knocks enemies Airborne.

Q.name: Steel Tempest

effects.description: First Cast - Steel Tempest: Yasuo thrusts his sword in the target direction, dealing physical damage to enemies hit and applying  on-hit effects to the first enemy hit. The ability can  critically strike for (60% +  20%) AD bonus physical damage.
If Steel Tempest hits an enemy, he gains a Gathering Storm stack for 6 seconds to which he's able to cast Steel Wind Rising.
Second Cast - Steel Wind Rising: Yasuo casts Steel Tempest. If it hits an enemy, Yasuo gains another Gathering Storm stack to which he can cast Gathering Storm.
Third Cast - Gathering Storm: Yasuo consumes his stacks to unleash a whirlwind that travels in the target direction, dealing the same damage and  knocking up all enemies hit.

Casting Steel Tempest, Steel Wind Rising or Gathering Storm during  Sweeping Blade will instead affect enemies around Yasuo at the end of the dash, or doing so immediately at his landing location after  blinking while ending the dash prematurely. Gathering Storm's whirlwind is not released when cast during  Sweeping Blade, but instead  knocks up all enemies hit around Yasuo for the same duration.

  Blinding Dart: both first target and secondary target do deal damage.

  Spell shield does not prevent Steel Tempest from gaining a stack.

 Unlike other abilities, the first two Steel Tempests will cancel and reset their cooldown if Yasuo is  immobilized during their cast time.
 The third Steel Tempest will continue its cast through immobilization.
 If Yasuo, however, buffers Steel Tempest after  Sweeping Blade, a disable will cause Steel Tempest to cancel and go on full cooldown but does not consume the stacks.
Q.blurb: A skillshot basic attack. After two successful Steel Tempests, the next fires a tornado that knocks enemies Airborne.

W.name: Wind Wall

effects.description: Active: Yasuo creates a gust of wind that travels in the target direction over 0.25 seconds to form a wall in front of him. The wall slowly drifts forward 50 units over 3.75 seconds, blocking all hostile non- turret  projectiles.

W.notes:
Wind Wall starts blocking projectiles on-cast (despite not being fully formed) and grants  sight over a small area.
 Wind Wall is  knocked down if it collides with another.
W.blurb: Creates a moving wall that blocks enemy projectiles.

E.name: Sweeping Blade

effects.description: Active: Yasuo  dashes a fixed distance toward a target enemy, dealing  magic damage.
Each Sweeping Blade cast increases the next dash's base damage by 25% for 5 seconds, up to 50%.
Yasuo cannot dash to the same target more than once every few seconds.
Yasuo will be  knocked down by any  immobilizing crowd control during Sweeping Blade.

E.notes:
Sweeping Blade's dash speed is affected by  slows.
 Sweeping Blade will generate 7.5  Flow stacks per cast.
 Yasuo can use Sweeping Blade's fixed dash distance to cross walls both before and after hitting his target (provided his proximity to the wall and/or target allows it).
E.blurb: Dashes through a unit, dealing escalating Magic Damage with each cast.

R.name: Last Breath

effects.description: Active: Yasuo  blinks to the other side of a  visible  airborne enemy champion nearest to the cursor, instantly generating maximum  Flow while resetting  Steel Tempest's stacks.
Upon arrival, he  suspends all nearby  airborne enemies around the target for 1 second, dealing  physical damage thereafter.
For the next 15 seconds, Yasuo's  critical strikes gain  50% armor penetration versus  bonus armor.
If Yasuo would be placed inside a turret's attack range upon blinking, he will instead attempt to position himself outside it (does not apply to Nexus Obelisk).

R.notes:
Last Breath's area of effect when suspending enemies increases per rank.
 Last Breath's damage and bonus armor penetration do not interact with each other.
 Suspended enemies are immune to further displacements during Last Breath's animation time.
 Casting right after the triggering displacement(s) will overwrite the latter's duration (whether shorter/longer) to Last Breath's animation time (durations will not stack).

 The targets will remain suspended and the damage will be applied even if Yasuo dies during it.
 Displacement abilities (e.g.  Weaver's Wall,  Pillar of Ice,  Volcanic Rupture) that affect enemy champions are considered  Airborne, and will therefore interact with Last Breath.
 Self-applied displacements cannot be targeted by Last Breath:
 Enemies displaced by neutral monsters (e.g.  Dragon's initial knock-back) can be targeted.

 While blinking, Yasuo creates an  untargetable clone of himself that instead dashes to the target location. This clone is considered a champion for  Turret Plating's  gold sharing.
R.blurb: Moves to a unit and strikes them repeatedly for heavy damage. Can only be cast on Airborne targets.

I.name: Shepherd of Souls

effects.description: Final Service: Yorick raises a grave for every enemy champion and 12th / 6th / 2nd (based on level) non-champion enemy that dies near him, as well as for every enemy he kills with  Last Rites. Only 4 graves can exist at the same time, with the furthest ones being replaced by the newest.
Yorick can use  Awakening to raise a Mist Walker from a grave.
The Horde: There can only exist 4 Mist Walkers at the same time, with the closest ones being replaced by the newest.

I.notes: Units dying to  Last Rites don't lower Shepherd of Souls' counter.
I.blurb: Yorick can raise Mist Walkers with his abilities. Enemies that die near Yorick will sometimes leave a grave.

Q.name: Last Rites

effects.description: Active - Last Rites: Yorick curses his shovel, causing his next basic attack within 6 seconds to have  50 bonus range, deal  bonus physical damage, and  heal him for  12 − 82 (based on level) health, doubled to  24 − 164 (based on level) health if he is  below 50% maximum health.

If there are at least 3 graves nearby and Last Rites has been cast or is on  cooldown, Yorick is granted the ability to cast  Awakening. Awakening will remain cast-able until there're no graves nearby.
Last Rites resets Yorick's basic attack timer.

Q.notes: Last Rites procs on  structures.
Q.blurb: Yorick deals bonus damage on his next attack and heals himself. If the target dies a grave will be dug.

Q.name: Awakening

effects.description: Active – Awakening: Yorick exhumes a Mist Walker under his command from each nearby grave.

Q.notes: Mist Walkers update their statistics correspondingly to Yorick's .
Q.blurb: Yorick summons Mist Walkers from the graves around him.

W.name: Dark Procession

effects.description: Active: After a 1-second delay, Yorick summons a circular wall of spirits around the target area that lasts up to 4 seconds and acts as impassable terrain for enemies, while allowing allies to walk through.
Dark Procession can only be targeted by enemy  champion basic attacks and takes 1 damage per attack, dissolving after taking enough damage.  Turret shots instantly dissolve the wall.

W.notes: Dark Procession will  knock up enemies away from it on-cast and trigger in-combat effects such as drawing turret aggro, applying  Elixir of Sorcery and  Sudden Impact.
W.blurb: Yorick summons a destructible wall at target location that will block enemy movement.

E.name: Mourning Mist

effects.description: Active: Yorick hurls a globule of Black Mist that splashes across an off-centered area, dealing 15% of target's current health  magic damage to all enemies hit, down to a minimum threshold.

Affected enemy  champions and  monsters are  slowed by 30% for 2 seconds, and are marked for 4 seconds, during which Yorick, Mist Walkers and the The Maiden gain  20% bonus movement speed when moving towards them.
Mist Walkers will  leap to enemy champions affected by the mark.

E.blurb: Yorick throws a globule of Black Mist that damages, slows and marks enemies.

R.name: Eulogy of the Isles

effects.description: Active: Yorick summons the Maiden of the Mist along with Mist Walkers, which remain on the battlefield until she or Yorick dies.
While the Maiden of the Mist is alive, Eulogy of the Isles can be reactivated to set the Maiden free, letting her push the nearest lane until she dies.

R.notes:
See the Pets section below for more details about Maiden of the Mist and Mist Walkers.
 The Maiden updates its stats when Yorick's stats change.
R.blurb: Yorick summons the Maiden of the Mist that causes Yorick's attacks against the Maiden's target to deal bonus damage. The Maiden will also automatically raise Walkers from dead enemies.

I.name: Bop 'n' Block

effects.description: Innate: Periodically, Yuumi's next basic attack against an enemy  champion gains  50 bonus range and won't use a  projectile. This attack restores 50 − 160 (based on level) mana and grants her a 60 −  400 (based on level) (+ 30% AP)  shield that lasts until it is broken.
While  Attached, the shield transfers to her Anchor.

I.notes: No additional details.
I.blurb: Every so often, Yuumi's next attack against an opponent restores mana and generates a shield. If Yuumi is Attached, the shield protects her ally. The shield protects Yuumi or her ally until it's broken.

Q.name: Prowling Projectile

effects.description: Active: Yuumi fires an errant missile that deals  magic damage to the first enemy hit.
If the missile is in flight for 1 second, it deals increased magic damage, and  slows enemy  champions struck by 20% for 1 second.
While  Attached, Yuumi directs the trajectory of the missile instead for up to 2 seconds before fizzling, during which she and the Anchor can see the effective range.

Q.notes: Prowling Projectile does not interrupt Yuumi's previous orders.

W.name: You and Me!

effects.description: Passive: Yuumi and her Anchor gain flat  adaptive force plus a percentage of the Anchor's  adaptive force and a percentage of its bonus attack damage or ability power, whichever is higher, as  adaptive force. Additionally, Yuumi starts with a point in You and Me! and  Prowling Projectile instead has 6 ranks.

Active: After a 0.25-second channel, Yuumi  dashes to an allied champion and attaches to them. While Attached, Yuumi is  disarmed,  untargetable (except from  turrets and in-flight projectiles targeting her) and follows her Anchor's movement, and retains the ability to cast (except movement spells).

Active - Change of Plan: Yuumi can switch her Anchor at no cooldown, and will detach automatically if her Anchor dies. If re-activated without a valid target, Yuumi will detach from her Anchor and dash up to 250 units in the target direction, triggering the cooldown. The cooldown starts ticking down when attaching to the first ally.
Immobilizing effects on Yuumi places You and Me! on a 5-second cooldown.

W.notes:
If Yuumi is attached to an ally that  Teleports, she will detach before the  Teleport completes.
 Her  monster aggression transfers to the Anchor.
 Enemies gain an assist on Yuumi if they damage an attached ally.
 You and Me! gives assists on  champion  takedowns from her teammates when she first attaches to a participating ally.
 You and Me! will follow an Anchor under  stealth, becoming herself stealthed as well. She can cast her abilities without breaking stealth.
 If the Anchor  recalls, Yuumi will detach automatically when they arrive at the fountain.
 If Yuumi is on the blue team, she will remain attached on the southwest side, and if Yuumi is on the red team, she will attach to the northeast.
 Yuumi can dash to zombie state targets (i.e  Sion's  Glory in Death), but she cannot stay attached. 
 Yuumi detaches when going into  resurrection.

E.name: Zoomies

effects.description: Active: Yuumi  heals herself and gains 15% (+ 10% per 100 AP)  bonus movement speed and bonus attack speed for 3 seconds.
While  Attached, the Anchor is targeted by the ability instead.

E.notes: No additional details.

R.name: Final Chapter

effects.description: Active: Yuumi  recoils X units in the opposite direction, after which Book channels to launch 7 waves over 3.5 seconds, each dealing magic damage. Enemy  champions hit take only 50% damage from subsequent waves, and when struck with three waves, they are  rooted for 1.75 seconds.
Yuumi can move and cast both  You and Me! and  Zoomies during Final Chapter.

R.notes:
The  root can only occur once per target.
 While  attached,  Cloud Dragon Soul will not activate until Yuumi detaches.
  Spell shield will only block a single instance of damage.

I.name: Cell Division

effects.description: The Secret Weapon: Zac's size scales with  his current health, getting larger when it exceeds  his base health and getting smaller the higher  his missing health.

Innate - Goo: Every time Zac damages at least one enemy with an ability, he sheds, depending on the ability, a number of chunks of himself to a nearby location, landing towards visible nearby enemy champions and lasting for 6 seconds.

Both Zac and his enemies can interact with these chunks by being within 50 units of them: Zac can move over them to consume them, restoring  4 / 5 / 6 / 7% (based on  Let's Bounce!'s rank) of his maximum health; enemies can move over them to destroy them.

Periodically, upon taking fatal damage, Zac splits into 4 uncontrollable bloblets that move to his final location over 8 / 7 / 6 / 5 / 4 (based on level) seconds. If any of these bloblets remain at the end of the duration, Zac  recombines and returns at  10 - 50% maximum health.
Upon splitting, the bloblets stop upon colliding with terrain.

I.notes:
Cell Division's chunks spawn in two versions.
 Contestable: They will fall to the ground between Zac and the nearest  visible enemy champion within 1000 range of him (dropping slightly in Zac's favor). Cannot be interacted with for the first 0.25 seconds (except during  Let's Bounce!).
 Uncontestable: They will fall to the ground near Zac and can be picked up immediately (version used by default).

  Guardian Angel and  Chronoshift will take precedence over Cell Division.
  Spirit Visage increases the healing of both chunks and bloblets.
  Ryze's  Realm Warp is able to individually teleport Zac or his boblets during Cell Division.
 Cell Division's bloblets can be targeted by  teleport and are treated as if they were a  minion, becoming  invulnerable and  immobilized.
 Concurrent bloblets are not  interrupted and will continue to  recombine instinctively.
I.blurb: Each time Zac hits an enemy with an ability, he sheds a chunk of himself that can be reabsorbed to restore Health. Upon taking fatal damage, Zac splits into 4 bloblets that attempt to recombine. If any bloblets remain, he will revive with an amount of Health depending on the Health of the surviving bloblets. Each bloblet has a percentage of Zac's maximum Health, Armor and Magic Resistance. This ability has a 5 minute cooldown.

I.name: Cell Division

Innate - Goo: Every time Zac damages at least one enemy with an ability, he sheds, depending on the ability, a number of chunks of himself to a nearby location, landing towards visible nearby enemy champions and lasting for 6 seconds.

Both Zac and his enemies can interact with these chunks by being within 50 units of them: Zac can move over them to consume them, restoring  4 / 5 / 6 / 7% (based on  Let's Bounce!'s rank) of his maximum health; enemies can move over them to destroy them.

Each bloblet has a percentage of Zac's maximum Health, Armor and Magic Resistance. This ability has a 5 minute cooldown.

Q.name: Stretching Strikes

effects.description: Active: Zac stretches his left arm in the target direction, dealing  magic damage and  slowing the first enemy hit by 40% for 0.5 seconds, and attaching it to the target for 2 seconds.
While his arm is attached, his next basic attack has  200 range and is replaced by a second Stretching Strike, dealing the same magic damage and  slow.
If the two Stretching Strikes affect different targets, he  roots both targets for 0.5 seconds and then  flings them towards each other for 300 range.
If the two targets are near each other, they're instead slammed against each other, both taking the initial magic damage and applied the  slow again.

Q.notes: Spell shields will block only one instance of damage.
Q.blurb: Zac stretches an arm, grabbing an enemy. Attacking a different enemy will cause him to throw both targets towards each other.

W.name: Unstable Matter

effects.description: Active: Zac's body explodes outward, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies, capped against  minions and  monsters, and becoming  ghosted for 5 seconds against monsters hit.

units: % (+ 2% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health
% (+ 2% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health

% (+ 2% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health

effects.description: Unstable Matter's  cooldown is reduced by 1 second every time Zac picks up a  Cell Division chunk.

W.notes: Unstable Matter has no cast time and does not interrupt Zac's previous orders.
W.blurb: Zac's body erupts, damaging nearby enemies.

E.name: Elastic Slingshot

effects.description: Active: Zac channels up to 4.5 seconds, increasing Elastic Slingshot's  range over a cone in the target direction.
Moving during the channel automatically cancels it, refunding 50% of the cost and  cooldown.
Second Cast: Zac  dashes to the target location, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies on impact and  knocking them up for 0.5 − 1 (based on duration of the charge) seconds.

E.notes: Quick casting: Elastic Slingshot's channel begins when the key is pressed and held, launching Zac towards the cursor when released.
E.blurb: Zac attaches his arms to the ground and stretches back, launching himself forward.

R.name: Let's Bounce!

effects.description: Passive: Increases  Cell Division's healing from chunks.

Active: After a small delay, Zac bounces 4 times over 3 seconds, gaining 20% − 50% (based on duration) bonus movement speed, but becoming  disarmed and unable to use  Stretching Strikes and  Elastic Slingshot for the duration. There is a 1-second delay between each bounce.
Each bounce deals magic damage to all nearby enemies,  knocking them back for 1 second and subsequently  slowing them by 20% for the same duration.
Enemies can be damaged by multiple bounces, with each beyond the first dealing 50% damage but not  displacing them.

R.notes: Spell shield only blocks a single instance of damage.

I.name: Contempt for the Weak

effects.description: Innate: Zed's basic attacks against targets  below 50% maximum health deal 6 / 8 / 10% (based on level) of target's maximum health as  bonus magic damage. Against monsters, the damage is increased by 100%, but is capped at 200 / 350 / 500 (based on level).
Contempt for the Weak can only affect the same target once every few seconds.

I.notes:
The enhanced attack applies other on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal but does not affect structures.
 Contempt for the Weak is not consumed when  dodged,  parried, or when Zed is  blinded, but it is consumed when  blocked.
I.blurb: Zed's basic attacks against targets below 50% Health deal 6-10% of the target's maximum Health as bonus Magic Damage. This effect can only occur once every 10 seconds on the same target.

Q.name: Razor Shuriken

effects.description: Active: Zed and his  Shadows throw their spinning blades toward the target location. Each blade deals  physical damage to all enemies struck, reduced to 60% against units beyond the first.

Q.notes:
Razor Shuriken has been special cased to apply a stack of  Electrocute for each Shuriken hit.
 A  spell shield may block multiple Razor Shurikens if they strike at the same time.
Q.blurb: Zed and his shadow both throw their spinning blades forward, dealing damage to any targets they pass through.

W.name: Living Shadow

effects.description: First Cast: Zed's  Shadow dashes in the target direction, remaining in place for 5 seconds and being able to mimic  Razor Shuriken and  Shadow Slash while in range of each other.
Zed restores  energy whenever a  Shadow lands a mimicked ability on the same target he does. This may only happen once per cast ability.
Second Cast - Shadow Swap: While in range of each other, Zed and his  Shadow  blink to their respective locations, swapping places.

W.notes:
While  grounded Zed can cast Living Shadow but may not swap places with it.
 The  Shadow grants  sight of its surroundings and is  untargetable.
 Zed always has an arrow next to him pointing in the direction of his  Shadows. It has three different colors, each one symbolizes important information about the specific Shadow. They are only visible to Zed.

    Two arrows point toward their corresponding  Shadows.  

    A green arrow (blue in colorblind mode) means the  Shadow can be swapped places with.  

    A yellow arrow signifies the  Shadow is about to disappear.  

    A red arrow (orange in colorblind mode) indicates the  Shadow is unable to be swapped places with.
W.blurb: Zed's shadow dashes forward, remaining in place for 5 seconds, and mimicking his spell casts. Zed can reactivate to swap places with the shadow.

W.name: Living Shadow

effects.description: First Cast: Zed's  Shadow dashes in the target direction, remaining in place for 5 seconds and being able to mimic  Razor Shuriken and  Shadow Slash while in range of each other.
Zed restores  energy whenever a  Shadow lands a mimicked ability on the same target he does. This may only happen once per cast ability.
Second Cast - Shadow Swap: While in range of each other, Zed and his  Shadow  blink to their respective locations, swapping places.

W.notes:
While  grounded Zed can cast Living Shadow but may not swap places with it.
 The  Shadow grants  sight of its surroundings and is  untargetable.
 Zed always has an arrow next to him pointing in the direction of his  Shadows. It has three different colors, each one symbolizes important information about the specific Shadow. They are only visible to Zed.

    Two arrows point toward their corresponding  Shadows.  

    A green arrow (blue in colorblind mode) means the  Shadow can be swapped places with.  

    A yellow arrow signifies the  Shadow is about to disappear.  

    A red arrow (orange in colorblind mode) indicates the  Shadow is unable to be swapped places with.
W.blurb: Zed's shadow dashes forward, remaining in place for 5 seconds, and mimicking his spell casts. Zed can reactivate to swap places with the shadow.

E.name: Shadow Slash

effects.description: Active: Zed and his  Shadows slash, dealing  physical damage to surrounding enemies.
Enemies hit by a  Shadow's Shadow Slash are  slowed for 1.5 seconds. Enemies hit by multiple slashes take no additional damage but the slow's potency is increased by 50%.
Each enemy champion hit by Zed's slash reduces  Living Shadow's  cooldown by 2 seconds.

E.notes: Shadow Slash has no cast time and does not interrupt Zed's previous orders.
E.blurb: Zed and his shadow spin their blades, creating a burst of shadow energy. The shadow's spin slows.

R.name: Death Mark

effects.description: First Cast: Zed becomes  untargetable for 0.6 seconds after which he  dashes through the target enemy  champion over 0.4 seconds, marking them, becoming  ghosted for 3 seconds, and spawning a  Shadow at the cast location which lasts for 6.5 seconds. After 0.5 seconds of his reappearance, he can activate  Death Mark Shadow.

For the next 3 seconds, the mark stores a percentage of all pre-mitigation  physical damage and  magical damage Zed and his  Shadows deal to the target, detonating at the end of the duration to deal  physical damage.
Second Cast - Death Mark Shadow: Regardless of distance between each other, Zed and the Death Mark  Shadow  blink to their respective locations, swapping places.
If the target dies or is 1950 units away before the dash begins, Death Mark is canceled, goes on a 5 second  cooldown, and Zed reappears at the cast location.

R.notes:
The mark can be prevented by becoming  untargetable before it is applied (untargetability after application will not prevent the mark's detonation).
 Death Mark's  Shadow is functionally the same as a regular one, but it lasts longer and can be recast regardless of range.
 The range at which they mimic Zed's abilities do not change.

 Death Mark's stored damage derives from all abilities, items, and buffs.
  Spell shields will only block the mark's application. They will not block the detonation from a mark that is already applied.
 If the mark is strong enough to kill the target, a spinning shuriken will appear above the victim to indicate their death. This does not however consider  shields or forms of damage modifiers.

    The indicator shown in-game (base skin).
R.blurb: Zed becomes untargetable and dashes to an enemy champion, marking them. After 3 seconds the mark triggers, repeating a portion of all the damage Zed dealt to the target while they were marked.

R.name: Death Mark

effects.description: First Cast: Zed becomes  untargetable for 0.6 seconds after which he  dashes through the target enemy  champion over 0.4 seconds, marking them, becoming  ghosted for 3 seconds, and spawning a  Shadow at the cast location which lasts for 6.5 seconds. After 0.5 seconds of his reappearance, he can activate  Death Mark Shadow.

For the next 3 seconds, the mark stores a percentage of all pre-mitigation  physical damage and  magical damage Zed and his  Shadows deal to the target, detonating at the end of the duration to deal  physical damage.
Second Cast - Death Mark Shadow: Regardless of distance between each other, Zed and the Death Mark  Shadow  blink to their respective locations, swapping places.
If the target dies or is 1950 units away before the dash begins, Death Mark is canceled, goes on a 5 second  cooldown, and Zed reappears at the cast location.

R.notes:
The mark can be prevented by becoming  untargetable before it is applied (untargetability after application will not prevent the mark's detonation).
 Death Mark's  Shadow is functionally the same as a regular one, but it lasts longer and can be recast regardless of range.
 The range at which they mimic Zed's abilities do not change.

 Death Mark's stored damage derives from all abilities, items, and buffs.
  Spell shields will only block the mark's application. They will not block the detonation from a mark that is already applied.
 If the mark is strong enough to kill the target, a spinning shuriken will appear above the victim to indicate their death. This does not however consider  shields or forms of damage modifiers.

    The indicator shown in-game (base skin).
R.blurb: Zed becomes untargetable and dashes to an enemy champion, marking them. After 3 seconds the mark triggers, repeating a portion of all the damage Zed dealt to the target while they were marked.

I.name: Short Fuse

effects.description: Innate: Ziggs's basic attacks periodically deal 20 − 160 (based on level) (+ 30 / 40 / 50% (based on level) AP)  bonus magic damage, doubled to 40 − 320 (based on level) (+ 60 / 80 / 100% (based on level) AP) against structures.
Ziggs reduces Short Fuse's  cooldown by 4 / 5 / 6 (based on level) seconds whenever he uses an ability.

I.notes: PENDING FOR TEST: Short Fuse's interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects.
I.blurb: Every 12 seconds, Ziggs' next basic attack deals bonus magic damage. This cooldown is reduced whenever Ziggs uses an ability.

Q.name: Bouncing Bomb

effects.description: Active: Ziggs throws a bouncing bomb to the target area, exploding upon hitting an enemy, colliding with terrain, or reaching the end of its trajectory. The bomb can bounce up to two times, the distance traveled each time based on how far it was originally thrown.
When exploding, the Bouncing Bomb deals magic damage to all nearby enemies.

Q.notes:
Bouncing Bomb obeys game physics (can be thrown or bounce over units/terrain if there is sufficient air time).
 Bouncing Bomb may go over enemies without exploding (will do so if it lands against walls).
  Spell shield can block both the bomb's impact and its explosion (blocking the former will not prevent the latter).
Q.blurb: Ziggs throws a bouncing bomb that deals magic damage.

W.name: Satchel Charge

effects.description: Active: Ziggs flings an explosive charge towards the target area,  revealing its surroundings, and exploding after 4 seconds or upon reactivation.

When exploding, the Satchel Charge deals magic damage and  knocks back all surrounding enemies by 250 units. If Ziggs is within the explosion radius, he instead  flies up to 500 units away while taking no damage in the process.
Turret Explosion: Satchel Charge's explosion can demolish  turrets below a  percentile health threshold.

W.notes:
Satchel Charge will explode immediately after landing if reactivated mid-flight.
 Satchel Charge's distance increases with proximity to the charge, resulting in being knocked straight up when aligned directly on top of it.
 Ziggs will not be displaced by Satchel Charge while  teleporting but he will while  recalling.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Satchel Charge cannot be reactivated while  grounded.
W.blurb: Ziggs flings an explosive charge that detonates after 4 seconds, or when this ability is activated again. The explosion deals magic damage to enemies, knocking them away. Ziggs is also knocked away, but takes no damage. Ziggs can use the Satchel to hexplode vulnerable enemy turrets.

E.name: Hexplosive Minefield

effects.description: Active: Ziggs scatters a cluster of 11 proximity mines over the target area, lasting for up to 10 seconds.
Mines explode on contact with an enemy,  slowing them for 1.5 seconds and dealing magic damage. Targets detonating more than one mine take 40% damage from subsequent mines.

E.notes:
Hexplosive Minefield grants  sight of the target area for a short duration (on-cast and when each mine explodes).
  Spell shield will block a single instance of damage.
E.blurb: Ziggs scatters proximity mines that detonate on enemy contact, dealing magic damage and slowing.

R.name: Mega Inferno Bomb

effects.description: Active: Ziggs deploys his ultimate creation, the  Mega Inferno Bomb, hurling it to the target area, granting  sight within a 350 unit radius as it travels.
Upon reaching the target area, it explodes, dealing magic damage to all enemies caught in the blast, increased by 50% in the epicenter.

R.notes:
Allies cannot see Mega Inferno Bomb's area indicator until shortly before the blast.
 Mega Inferno Bomb takes 3.5 seconds to land when Ziggs casts from maximum range (reduced to 2 seconds when casting point blank).
 PENDING FOR TEST: Mega Inferno Bomb can be blocked by  Wind Wall or  Unbreakable only at cast or at a certain angle upon landing.
R.blurb: Ziggs deploys his ultimate creation, the Mega Inferno Bomb, hurling it an enormous distance. Enemies in the primary blast zone take more damage than those farther away.

I.name: Time in a Bottle

effects.description: Innate: Zilean generates  2 / 3.5 / 5 / 6 / 12 (based on level) experience (does not count towards level up) every 5 seconds. Time in a Bottle is on cooldown when the game starts.

When the amount stored is enough to level up an allied champion and Zilean has been out of combat for the last 10 seconds, he can right-click the target ally to initiate a 1 second  channel (if interrupted, Time in a Bottle goes on a 2 second  cooldown).
A successful channel levels up the target and grants Zilean the stored amount as  experience of his own.

I.notes:
Time in a Bottle marks allies with two circles around their feet; the inner one represents how close they are to leveling up, turning golden when able to activate Time in a Bottle on them.
 The target ally is not required to be out of combat to be leveled up by Time in a Bottle - only Zilean is.
 Zilean only consumes the amount of  experience required to level up an ally. He retains the excess for later use.
I.blurb: Zilean stores time as Experience. When he has enough Experience to finish an ally's level, he can right-click them to impart it. Zilean receives as much Experience as he gives. Cannot be used in combat.

Q.name: Time Bomb

effects.description: Active: Zilean throws a ticking time bomb to the target location that detonates after 3 seconds, dealing  magic damage to all surrounding enemies.
Time Bomb will attach itself to units hit directly, or those who move within a small radius of its center while it is on the ground, detonating at their location when the duration ends.
Time Bomb detonates immediately if another one attaches itself to the same unit, briefly  stunning all affected enemies.

Q.notes:
Time Bombs landing directly on top of multiple units follow a priority order for whom to attach themselves to.
 Units already carrying a bomb
 Enemy champions
 Allied champions
 Enemy  minions
 Allied minions

 Time Bombs will detonate immediately if their holder dies.
 Time Bombs enter  stealth if the ally they attach themselves to does so.
 Placing the Time Bomb triggers in-combat effects such as drawing turret aggro and applying  Elixir of Sorcery and  Sudden Impact.
 One For All: Zilean can detonate an enemy counterpart's Time Bomb by placing his own on the same unit (the first bomb still deals damage).
 Time Bomb will be removed if the holder dies or goes into  resurrection before it explodes.
 Time Bomb can deal damage to the holder through  untargetablility.
Q.blurb: Tosses a bomb to target area that sticks to units that come near it (prioritizes Champions). It detonates after 3 seconds, dealing area of effect damage. If a Time Bomb is detonated early by another Time Bomb, it also stuns enemies.

W.name: Rewind

effects.description: Active: Zilean reduces  Time Bomb's and  Time Warp's  cooldowns by 10 seconds each.

W.notes:
Rewind cannot be ranked up at Level 1.
 Rewind can only be cast when either of his basic abilities is on  cooldown.
W.blurb: Zilean can prepare himself for future confrontations, reducing the cooldowns of his other basic abilities.

E.name: Time Warp

effects.description: Active: Zilean bends time around the target champion,  slowing enemies for 2.5 seconds or granting allies or himself  bonus movement speed for the same duration.

E.blurb: Zilean bends time around any unit, decreasing an enemy's Movement Speed or increasing an ally's Movement Speed for a short time.

R.name: Chronoshift

effects.description: Active: Zilean places a protective time rune on the target ally champion or himself, lasting for 5 seconds.
If the target takes fatal damage during that time, they are put in  stasis for 3 seconds and then  revived, regaining a set amount of  health.

R.notes: Chronoshift takes precedence over all other revive effects ( Guardian Angel,  Rebirth).
R.blurb: Zilean places a protective time rune on an allied champion, teleporting the champion back in time if they take lethal damage.

I.name: More Sparkles!

effects.description: Innate: After casting an ability, Zoe's next basic attack or  Spell Thief bubble within 5 seconds won't use a  projectile and deals 16 − 130 (based on level) (+ 20% AP)  bonus magic damage.

I.notes: No additional details.
I.blurb: Zoe's next basic attack after casting a spell deals bonus magic damage.

Q.name: Paddle Star

effects.description: First Cast: Zoe shoots a star in the target direction that collides with the first enemy hit, dealing magic damage in a small area, reduced to 80% to enemies hit beyond the first. The total damage is increased by 0% − 150% (based on distance traveled).
If the star does not hit an enemy, it lingers at maximum range for 1 second.

Second Cast: While the star is out, Zoe can reactivate Paddle Star to redirect it to a new location near her, resetting its damage modifier on cast. The redirected star can travel beyond the new target location, continuing forward until it moves more than 800 units from Zoe.

Q.notes:
At max rank and max level, the ability deals between 200 (+ 60% AP) and 500 (+ 150% AP) magic damage, based on distance.
 The secondary radius matches the initial maximum range of the ability, but Zoe can move any amount of distance away from the projectile before reactivating.
Q.blurb: Zoe fires a missile that she can redirect in flight, which deals more damage the longer it flies in a straight line.

Q.name: Paddle Star

effects.description: First Cast: Zoe shoots a star in the target direction that collides with the first enemy hit, dealing magic damage in a small area, reduced to 80% to enemies hit beyond the first. The total damage is increased by 0% − 150% (based on distance traveled).
If the star does not hit an enemy, it lingers at maximum range for 1 second.

Second Cast: While the star is out, Zoe can reactivate Paddle Star to redirect it to a new location near her, resetting its damage modifier on cast. The redirected star can travel beyond the new target location, continuing forward until it moves more than 800 units from Zoe.

Q.notes:
At max rank and max level, the ability deals between 200 (+ 60% AP) and 500 (+ 150% AP) magic damage, based on distance.
 The secondary radius matches the initial maximum range of the ability, but Zoe can move any amount of distance away from the projectile before reactivating.
Q.blurb: Zoe fires a missile that she can redirect in flight, which deals more damage the longer it flies in a straight line.

W.name: Spell Thief

effects.description: Passive - Spell Thief: Whenever enemy champions cast a  summoner spell or  item active, they drop the corresponding  Spell Shard onto the ground that grants  sight over a 100-radius area and remains for 40 seconds. Some enemy  minions spawn with random Spell Shards that only drop to the ground for 20 seconds if killed by Zoe.
Collecting a Spell Shard allows Zoe to activate Spell Thief within the next 60 seconds. She can replace her current Spell Thief active by moving directly onto another Spell Shard.
Active: Zoe mimics the active of the collected Spell Shard.
Passive - Wheeeee: Casting Spell Thief or one of her own summoner spells grants Zoe  bonus movement speed for the next few seconds, and summons three bubbles that orbit her for the next 10 seconds.
If Zoe is not  immobilized she hurls one bubble at a time at the nearest enemy in range, prioritizing her attack target, dealing magic damage.

W.notes:
Mimics the details of the mimicked active.
 Minions that can drop Spell Shards are marked with a tied cosmic balloon that floats above them.
 Minions do not drop a shard for  Hextech Gunblade or  Teleport.

 Zoe utilizes an attack-like animation whenever one of the bubbles hurls itself at an enemy, making it look as if she can attack while moving. 
 Zoe cannot steal Consumable items, Trinkets, component items, or items that create deployable or persistent effects. Some actives are excluded for balance purposes. The following list was last checked November 8th.[2]:

W.blurb: Zoe can pick up the remnants of enemy summoner spell and active item casts and cast them once herself. Whenever she casts a summoner spell, she gains 3 missiles that fire at the nearest target.

E.name: Sleepy Trouble Bubble

effects.description: Active: Zoe kicks a bubble in the target direction that bursts on the first enemy hit, else forming a trap at maximum range for 5 seconds that arms after 0.8 seconds. The bubble can only move through terrain once but may do so indefinitely, can only move up to 650 units once outside terrain, and will fall short if it would enter terrain again.
The bubble deals magic damage on contact with an enemy and renders them  drowsy for 1.4 seconds, which gradually  slows them, after which they fall  asleep for 2.25 seconds.

The next  non-dot champion or turret damage taken by the  sleeping target deals  bonus true damage equal to the post-mitigation damage dealt, capped at Sleepy Trouble Bubble's damage. The bonus damage is dealt before the triggering damage.

E.notes:
Activating a spell shield while being drowsy will not block the falling asleep debuff.
 Removing the  Drowsy effect prevents the target from falling  asleep.
 If exceptionally close to terrain, the ball will pass through without detection and will still be able to pass through a second piece of terrain - although it sacrifices any range its already used going through the first piece.
E.blurb: Causes the target to become drowsy, then fall asleep. The first source of damage that breaks the sleep is doubled, up to a cap.

R.name: Portal Jump

effects.description: Active: After a brief delay, Zoe dives into a portal that she opens beneath her,  blinking to the target location.
Zoe remains able to attack and cast abilities during Portal Jump, and can  see over walls, but is unable to move. After 1 second, she blinks back to her cast location.

R.notes:
Zoe will always blink back to her original location, even if she is  immobilized or killed.
 Zoe's movement speed is set to 0 during the duration of the portal, but she is not considered  rooted, which allows her to use movement spells and items such as  Flash or  Hextech Protobelt-01.
 Upon reaching her destination, Zoe will either raspberry at the nearest enemy champion, or lick an ice cream cone when there are no enemy champions in sight.
R.blurb: Blink to a nearby position for 1 second. Then blink back.

I.name: Garden of Thorns

effects.description: Innate: Zyra periodically spawns one or two Seeds nearby that last for 30 seconds, briefly granting  sight over the surrounding area.
After at least 1 second, enemy champions can destroy Seeds by stepping on them.
Zyra can only have a total of 8 Seeds planted at a time, preserving placed Seeds over those spawned by Garden of Thorns.

I.notes:
Zyra tries to plant Seeds in brush and not on top of walls.
 Zyra tries not to plant Seeds too close together and at different angles.
 Zyra does not plant any Seeds if she is concealed within a brush (unless there is an enemy ward in it, in which case it takes her a little longer to plant the Seed) or when there is no room for additional ones.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Zyra tries to plant Seeds close to an enemy near her.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Zyra tries to plant Seeds under enemy structures only if she is in basic attack range of them.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Zyra tries to plant Seeds on the other side of the wall she is facing and/or standing right next to.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Zyra tries to plant Seeds in the direction she is facing and/or moving.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Zyra tries to plant Seeds near jungle path entrances.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Zyra tries to plant Seeds behind herself when she is walking through the river and there are no jungle path entrances near her.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Zyra tries to plant SeedsSeeds between herself and the enemy champion she has vision of (or is heading towards her) in a 45° angle to the left or to the right depending on where on lane she is standing.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Zyra tries to plant Seeds against the inner walls of epic monster pits ( Dragon,  Rift Herald,  Baron Nashor)
I.blurb: Seeds spawn around Zyra periodically, becoming faster with level and lasting 30 seconds. If an enemy Champion steps on a seed, it dies. Zyra can cast spells near seeds to grow plants. Extra plants striking the same target deal reduced damage.

Q.name: Deadly Spines

effects.description: Active: Zyra sprouts thorny spines at the target location that appear after a 0.625-seconds delay, dealing  magic damage to all enemies they hit.
If Deadly Spines hits a Seed, it sprouts into a  Thorn Spitter, which remains on the battlefield for 8 seconds.

Q.notes: No additional details.
Q.blurb: Thick vines spread through the ground and explode into spines, dealing magic damage to enemies within the area. If cast near a seed, Deadly Spines grows a Thorn Spitter plant, which fires at enemies from afar.

W.name: Rampant Growth

effects.description: Passive: Zyra periodically stores a Seed, up to 2. Unit kills grant 20% charge toward a Seed, increased to 100% for large units killed and enemy  champion  takedowns.
Active: Zyra plants a Seed at the target location, which lasts for 60 seconds and briefly grants  sight of the spot Zyra planted it in.
After 1.5 seconds, enemy champions can destroy Seeds by stepping on them, but doing so  reveals them for 2 seconds.

W.notes:
Seeds are  untargetable to enemies.
 They can be targeted by allied abilities ( Teleport,  Leap Strike,  Shunpo,  Safeguard).

 Decoys count as champions for the takedown effect.
 A Seed's  true sight can be removed by  Quicksilver.
W.blurb: Zyra plants a seed, lasting up to 60 seconds. Deadly Spines and Grasping Roots cast near seeds will turn them into plants who fight for Zyra. Additionally, Rampant Growth passively grants her plants improved maximum Health.

E.name: Grasping Roots

effects.description: Active: Zyra sends a surge of vines in the target direction, dealing magic damage to all enemies hit and  rooting them for a short duration.
If Grasping Roots hits a Seed, it sprouts into a  Vine Lasher, which remains on the battlefield for 8 seconds.

E.notes: No additional details.
E.blurb: Zyra sends forth vines through the ground to ensnare her target, dealing damage and rooting enemies they come across. If cast near a seed, Grasping Roots grows a Vine Lasher, whose short range attacks reduce enemy Movement Speed.

R.name: Stranglethorns

effects.description: Active: Zyra summons a monstrous thicket at the target location, dealing magic damage to all enemies in the area as it expands.
After 2 seconds, the vines snap upward,  knocking up all enemies caught in the thicket for 1 second.

Plants hit by the thicket are enraged, restoring  50% of their current health, increasing their  maximum health by 50%, and resetting their duration for the full duration of the thicket, for a maximum bonus duration of 2 seconds. Additionally they attack in a flurry, launching two shots per attack, dealing [ 150% damage per flurry ][ 75% damage per shot ].

R.notes:
Plants grown during the 2 seconds prior to the displacement will also be enraged.
  Plants already grown before Stranglethorns is cast will have their duration refreshed if they are inside the area of effect.
R.blurb: Zyra summons a twisted thicket at her target location, dealing damage to enemies as it expands and knocking them airborne as it contracts.
